bills.title: Higher Education Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of higher education agencies and institutions;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>provides an estimate of the total budgets for higher education institutions; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Public Education Budget Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of public education for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024, and ending June 30, 2025, and appropriates funds for the support an operation of public education for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases an educator salary adjustment;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a salary bonus for certain education support professionals;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions regarding programs for which funding is eliminated, including:<hr><ltbullet1>Technology-Life-Careers;<hr><ltbullet1>student leadership organizations;<hr><ltbullet1>professional staff weighted pupil units;<hr><ltbullet1>the Capital Outlay Enrollment Growth Program; and<hr><ltbullet1>a pilot grant for professional learning;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a statutory increase for the legacy iteration of the Carson Smith Scholarship Program;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of school districts, charter schools and state education agencies;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts the number of weighted pupil units for Career and Technical Education (CTE) -Add-on, Professional Staff, and Special Education-Impact Aid WPU programs to reflect increased student weightings approved by the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>makes certain statutory changes to adjust programmatic formulas with funding changes;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language;<hr><ltbullet>provides a coordination clause to adopt and supersede S.B. 321, Public Education Funding Amendments, regarding the state guarantee for local property tax levies; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Current Fiscal Year Supplemental Appropriations
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of higher education and certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes full time employment levels for certain internal service funds;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Economic and Community Development Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: General Government Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>approves employment levels for internal service funds; and<hr><ltbullet>approves capital acquisition amounts for internal service funds.

bills.title: Transportation and Infrastructure Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies; <hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: National Guard, Veterans Affairs, and Legislature Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: State Agency and Higher Education Compensation Appropriations
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for a 2.5% labor market increase for state agency employees and discretionary pay increases equal to 2.5% for elected official, judiciary, and higher education employees;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for a 1% one-time pay for performance increase for state employees and discretionary bonuses equal to 1% one-time for employees of elected officials and the judiciary;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for health and dental benefit cost changes as recommended by the Public Employees Health Programs;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for retirement rate changes for certain state employees as recommended by the Utah Retirement Systems;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for an up-to $26 per pay period match for qualifying state employees enrolled in a defined contribution plan; and<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for other compensation adjustments as authorized.

bills.title: Fund and Account Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state funds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the amount that the Division of Finance annually transfers from the Liquor Control Fund to the General Fund;<hr><ltbullet>changes the Opioid Litigation Proceeds Restricted Account from a restricted account to a permanent fund called the Opioid Litigation Proceeds Fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the investment of the Opioid Litigation Proceeds Fund's principal;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes spending from the Opioid Litigation Proceeds Fund only from earnings derived from the fund's principal and for specified purposes;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the State Treasurer Investment Management Account and provides for the account's uses and funding; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Native American Remains Review Committee Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends the sunset for the Native American Remains Review Committee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset for the Native American Remains Review Committee for five years; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Division of Purchasing and General Services Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Procurement Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates the limiting option of the Purchasing from Persons with Disabilities Advisory Board (PPDAB) to form an association to assist the PPDAB with its functions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the PPDAB to contract with a person to assist the PPDAB with its functions;<hr><ltbullet>codifies that awarding a contract to a vendor is not the creation of a contract with the vendor;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the inclusion of certain contractual provisions in a procurement contract, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet>codifies that the state and a procurement unit may not be held liable for certain types of damages; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Clarifies the process and rules under which the state can contract with a community rehabilitation provider for a product or service.

bills.title: Sexual Extortion Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the crime of sexual extortion.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the crime of sexual extortion to include the act of threatening to distribute a counterfeit intimate image; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Emergency Services Personnel Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows licensed emergency medical service personnel to provide non-911 emergency medical services in certain circumstances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>allows a licensed emergency medical service personnel to provide non-911 emergency medical services to individuals consistent with the personnel's medical expertise.

bills.title: Murdered and Missing Indigenous Relatives Task Force Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill reestablishes the Missing and Murdered Indigenous Relatives Task Force.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>reestablishes the Murdered and Missing Indigenous Relatives Task Force, with the membership consisting of nine members from government and community organizations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that any vacancy in the task force be filled in the same manner as the original appointment;<hr><ltbullet>designates the appointees from the Senate and House of Representatives as the cochairs of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>establishes that a quorum of the task force consists of five members and that majority action of the quorum is required for task force decisions;<hr><ltbullet>establishes compensation requirements for both legislator members and non-legislator members of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel provide staff support to the task force;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the responsibilities of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the task force must report its findings to the Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for the repeal of the task force.

bills.title: Health Facility Administrator Act Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends the sunset repeal date of the Health Facility Administrator Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset repeal date of the Health Facility Administrator Act to July 1, 2035.

bills.title: Limitations on the Use of Polygraphs
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill limits the use of a polygraph on a victim of a sexual offense.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>limits the use of a polygraph on a victim of a sexual offense; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Petroleum Storage Tank Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the regulation of petroleum storage tanks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>changes terms "underground" and "petroleum" as appropriate;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Petroleum Storage Tank Restricted Account earns interest to be deposited into that account;<hr><ltbullet>addresses registration of underground storage tanks and aboveground petroleum storage tanks;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the Petroleum Storage Tank Fund, including authorization to request certain legislative appropriations;<hr><ltbullet>modifies assessment of an environmental assurance fee based on the cash balance of the Petroleum Storage Tank Fund;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the petroleum storage tank fee provisions;<hr><ltbullet>provides for certificates of compliance;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies restrictions on petroleum storage tank installation companies;<hr><ltbullet>directs certain monies be deposited into the Petroleum Storage Tank Cleanup Fund;<hr><ltbullet>addresses claims not covered by the Petroleum Storage Tank Fund; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies language regarding liability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses eligibility for participation in the Petroleum Storage Tank Fund; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Child Labor Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the employment of minors.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>classifies child-labor related acts as different crimes;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the Labor Commission report a suspected criminal act to the State Bureau of Investigation under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>permits the State Bureau of Investigation to investigate or forward a suspected criminal act to law enforcement or a state agency with jurisdiction over the reported criminal act;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to share information with law enforcement under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Code Recodification
bills.general_provisions: This bill recodifies provisions related to relief granted through property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>recodifies:<hr><ltbullet1>Title 59, Chapter 2, Part 12, Property Tax Relief;<hr><ltbullet1>Title 59, Chapter 2, Part 18, Tax Deferral and Tax Abatement; and<hr><ltbullet1>Title 59, Chapter 2, Part 19, Armed Forces Exemptions;<hr><ltbullet>creates a General Provisions part that clarifies the procedures and rights available for each type of tax relief; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies criminal provisions in Title 76, Utah Criminal Code, by redrafting offense statutes into a new structure, reorganizing criminal statutes into a new format, and clarifying existing law.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reorders language into a standardized format and clarifies existing law, including the offenses in Title 76, Chapter 9, Offenses Against Public Order and Decency, and Chapter 10, Offenses Against Public Health, Safety, Welfare, and Morals;<hr><ltbullet>reorganizes Title 76, Chapters 9 and 10 into a new organization to better align with the contents of the statutes;<hr><ltbullet>reorganizes offenses to enact an embedded offense as a stand-alone statute or statutes, including offenses concerning:<hr><ltbullet1>emergency reporting, interference, and false reports;<hr><ltbullet1>prohibited use of a party line or public pay telephone;<hr><ltbullet1>commercial obstruction;<hr><ltbullet1>electronic communication harassment and disclosure of personal information;<hr><ltbullet1>cruelty to animals, dog fighting, and police service canines, including aligning exemptions and defenses based on the elements of each offense;<hr><ltbullet1>voyeurism;<hr><ltbullet1>abuse or desecration of a dead human body;<hr><ltbullet1>criminal street gang activities;<hr><ltbullet1>tobacco sales and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>gambling and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>bus hijacking and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>money laundering and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>the use of a laser pointer;<hr><ltbullet1>unlawful littering and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>unlawful possession, use, or control of a vehicle with a contraband compartment;<hr><ltbullet1>unlawful tattooing or piercing of a minor;<hr><ltbullet1>labeling of explosives and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet1>weapons offenses and related statutes;<hr><ltbullet1>corporate fraud and related offenses, including unlawful acts by a director, officer, or agent;<hr><ltbullet1>nuisances;<hr><ltbullet1>pornography and related offenses, including placing the definition of pornography in the relevant definition section;<hr><ltbullet1>prostitution, sexual solicitation, and related offenses; and<hr><ltbullet1>kickbacks and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, places contents of Title 76, Chapter 9, Part 5, Libel, into Title 45, Chapter 2, Libel;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, places certain contents of Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 5, Weapons, into Title 53, Public Safety Code;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, places certain law enforcement requirements concerning gang loitering from Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 9, Prohibition of Gang Activity, into Title 53, Chapter 25, Law Enforcement Requirements;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, defines a minor as an individual younger than 21 years old for the offense concerning public intoxication;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, provides a more detailed description of an actor for purposes of offenses involving providing a weapon to a minor;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, technically revises language concerning vicious animal offense;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, removes definition of image in offense concerning failure to report child sexual abuse material by a computer technician;<hr><ltbullet>adds penalty provisions to offenses concerning high explosives that had been inadvertently omitted;<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain statutes concerning the Utah Trade Commission, which entity no longer exists;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, provides which prostitution-related offenses do not apply to a minor;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections to certain statutes resulting from inadvertent omissions in the 2024 criminal code recodification, including:<hr><ltbullet1>reinserting a provision guaranteeing Native American rights in the statute concerning establishment of a prohibited item policy in a correctional or mental health facility;<hr><ltbullet1>reinserting the penalty to the offense of alteration of proposed legislative bill or resolution; and<hr><ltbullet1>providing clarifying language regarding the identity of the actor in the offense concerning trafficking in warrants; <hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause to explain that amendments to certain sections in this bill will be superseded or amended by amendments to those sections in H.B. 133, Dangerous Weapons Amendments, if both bills pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Prostitution Offense Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill reorganizes and amends provisions concerning prostitution and related offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>reorganizes provisions concerning prostitution and related offenses;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, revises names of certain prostitution-related offenses;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, provides that a child may not be prosecuted for engaging in sexual solicitation or prostitution;<hr><ltbullet>separates existing prostitution-related offenses into separate offenses based on the ages of the individuals involved;<hr><ltbullet>provides new penalties for child offenders of certain prostitution-related offenses that are based on the age of the child offender; <hr><ltbullet>for clarity, revises the offense of engaging in prostitution or sexual solicitation as an HIV positive offender; <hr><ltbullet>adds several prostitution-related offenses to the list of offenses for which a minor may not receive a nonjudicial adjustment; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to explain that amendments to certain sections in this bill will supersede amendments to those sections in H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, if both bills pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Insurance Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to insurance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the circumstances under which a public agency insurance mutual or a reserve fund is exempt from the Insurance Code;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to dual licensing;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to money appropriated from the Captive Insurance Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an insurer does not need to file a certification that a non-English policy is in compliance with relevant laws;<hr><ltbullet>aligns state law with federal rules relating to preexisting condition limitations;<hr><ltbullet>limits the scope by which the Insurance Department can issue a waiver for a license;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the commissioner may take an action against a licensee if the licensee fails to pay a final judgment within 60 days;<hr><ltbullet>adds additional reporting requirements for a licensee against whom a judgment has been entered;<hr><ltbullet>changes the reporting period for agency title insurance producers;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to captive insurance companies;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the minimum capital requirement for an association captive insurance company;<hr><ltbullet>allows a captive insurance company to be formed as a not-for-profit organization;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that officers of a captive insurance company must be separate individuals;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to insurance investments;<hr><ltbullet>amends requirements relating to a sponsored captive insurance company's business;<hr><ltbullet>amends the grounds under which the commissioner may revoke the certificate of authority of a captive insurance company; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for a small employer stop-loss insurance contract;<hr><ltbullet>regulates with which small employers a stop-loss insurer or reinsurer may enter stop-loss insurance contracts;<hr><ltbullet>provides a transition period for existing small employer stop-loss insurance contracts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Limitations on Liability Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the limitation on the liability of an employer for an employee convicted of an offense.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset date for a statute addressing the liability of an employer for an employee convicted of an offense.

bills.title: Retirement Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Utah State Retirement and Insurance Benefit Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies record retention requirements for a participating employer in the Utah Retirement Systems;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to an entity eligible to withdraw from participation in the Utah Retirement Systems; and<hr><ltbullet>repeals a section that allows PEHP Health and Benefits to implement a prescribing policy for certain opioid prescriptions.

bills.title: Road Jurisdiction Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Designation of State Highways Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes certain roads as state highways; and<hr><ltbullet>modifies the description of certain state highways.

bills.title: Voting Precinct Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses voting precincts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a county legislative body to establish a voting precinct consisting of two or more noncontiguous geographic areas in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires the name of a voting precinct to be distinguishable from any other voting precinct;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the county clerk to adjust the boundaries of a voting precinct in order to:<hr><ltbullet1>match the current boundaries of a local political subdivision; or<hr><ltbullet1>match the resulting boundaries of a local subdivision that expands, divides, alters, or changes the local political subdivision's boundaries;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county clerk who adjusts the boundaries of a voting precinct to:<hr><ltbullet1>file a notice with the Utah Geospatial Resource Center at least 65 days before the date of an election; and<hr><ltbullet1>provide a copy of the notice to the county legislative body; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: On Premise Sign Installation Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions of licensure for on premise sign installation contractors.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of licensure for on premise sign installation contractors; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Visitation Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to custody and visitation for individuals other than a parent.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies a standard required to support an award of non-parental custody or visitation;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a court that has received a petition seeking non-parent custody or visitation may, as part of the adjudication of the petition, make findings relating to a parent's ability to exercise primary physical custody, and make findings relating to a claim of parental abuse or neglect of a minor child; and<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the time period that is applicable to a court's findings.

bills.title: Indian Family Preservation Act Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the preservation of Indian families.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts the Indian Family Preservation Act (state act), including:<hr><ltbullet1>defining terms;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing effective date and severability;<hr><ltbullet1>requiring inquiry into Indian status;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for what constitutes best interests of an Indian child;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing jurisdiction over child custody proceedings;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for actions related to pending court proceedings;<hr><ltbullet1>stating parental rights;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for voluntary termination of rights;<hr><ltbullet1>establishing how consent or other actions are invalidated;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing placement of Indian children;<hr><ltbullet1>creating a process to return custody of an Indian child;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing information related to tribal affiliation and protection of rights;<hr><ltbullet1>authorizing agreements between the state and Indian tribes under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing improper removal of an Indian child;<hr><ltbullet1>explaining the application of state or federal standards;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for emergency removal or placement of an Indian child; and<hr><ltbullet1>addressing recordkeeping and information availability;<hr><ltbullet>replaces cites to the federal Indian Child Welfare Act with cites to the state act;<hr><ltbullet>addresses right to counsel;<hr><ltbullet>addresses sharing of information by agreement;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain time frame preferences under the state act; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Offender Information Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns electronic access to personal and financial information for an offender.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Technology Services to make a version of the single sign-on citizen portal available for certain individuals who are or were offenders that contains:<hr><ltbullet1> if possible, an electronic copy of, or link to, the individual's digital verifiable credentials and records; and<hr><ltbullet1>if available, information on certain debts the individual may have; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Borgstrom Brothers Memorial Highway Designation
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to the name of Route 102.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the name of Route 102 as the Borgstrom Brothers Memorial Highway.

bills.title: Child Welfare Reporting Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions concerning false reports of child abuse or neglect.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Child and Family Services to notify law enforcement when the division determines that a person knowingly made a false report of child abuse or neglect; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Campgrounds Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the designation of state campgrounds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the procedure for designating a state campground;<hr><ltbullet>addresses management of state campgrounds; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes rulemaking by the Division of State Parks to:<hr><ltbullet1>establish the process for completing and submitting an application; and<hr><ltbullet1>administer management of a state campground.

bills.title: Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Department of Corrections is the agency that supervises sex offenders who are placed on probation;<hr><ltbullet>amends when the Department of Corrections or a county sheriff is required to register an offender on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to conduct a risk assessment for every individual convicted of a sex offense that would require the individual to register on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections, until January 1, 2030, to submit the results of risk assessments for sex offenders to the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Provo Canyon Resource Management Plan Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Provo Canyon resource management plan.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset date for the section related to the Provo Canyon resource management plan.

bills.title: Utah Housing Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with housing development and housing policy.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the minimum population for incorporation of a new town;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality or county to authorize additional housing density in exchange for certain requirements;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality or county to offer incentives in an area approved for single-family or multi-family residential units to promote owner-occupied, affordable housing;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for a moderate income housing plan and a moderate income housing report;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a special district to provide the operation of a propane system within its boundaries; <hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Division of Housing and Community Development to make rules regarding the content and form of a moderate income housing report;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget (GOPB) to develop a state housing plan by December 31, 2025;<hr><ltbullet>requires GOPB to submit an annual written report on the implementation of the state housing plan to the Political Subdivisions Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Offenses Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses changes related to certain criminal offenses and enhancements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the enhancement for offenses committed in concert with three or more persons or in relation to a criminal street gang;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain theft, retail theft, and prostitution sentencing enhancements to include prior convictions in other state, federal, or military courts;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that in sentencing for an offense related to retail theft, the value of the stolen item is determined by the item's retail value;<hr><ltbullet>amends the offense of sexual extortion;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "financial transaction card" in Section 76-6-506;<hr><ltbullet>adds offenses that may be charged as part of a pattern of unlawful activity;  <hr><ltbullet>increases the fine for an individual who is convicted of the offense of patronizing a prostitute;<hr><ltbullet>increases penalties for an individual who:<hr><ltbullet1>acts to bring a minor into a criminal street gang in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet1>acts to intimidate a minor into remaining in a criminal street gang in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>includes coordination clauses to coordinate changes between this bill, H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, and H.B. 22, Prostitution Offense Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Correctional Health Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses health care for individuals who are involved with the criminal justice system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to contract with a telehealth psychiatric consultation provider to provide consultation services to staff responsible for inmates' psychiatric care;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to convene a working group to study the department's needs regarding an electronic health record system for inmate health care and provide recommendations to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to contract with psychiatrists to meet staffing needs for correctional health services, except under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to provide an annual report to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee concerning the provision of comprehensive health care to inmates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections and a local mental health authority to cooperate to have certain offenders assessed for available community-based services, and to take steps to connect an offender to appropriate community-based services based on the results of the assessment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a review and recommendations for improving the Department of Corrections' electronic medical records system. Also requires a report on new offenders who did not receive a health assessment wi

bills.title: School Safety Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies school safety provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies communication device requirements for new construction to post-completion determination;<hr><ltbullet>revises screening and training requirements for school safety personnel;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts school safety personnel provisions;<hr><ltbullet>changes safety assessment deadlines and frequency;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a school safety foundation for certain purposes;<hr><ltbullet>creates compliance supports; <hr><ltbullet>modifies certain administrative structures within the school safety program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: State Water Policy Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the state water policy.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses water quality in groundwater;<hr><ltbullet>references saved water;<hr><ltbullet>encourages monitoring of watersheds in consultation with watershed councils;<hr><ltbullet>promotes state water planning;<hr><ltbullet>accounts for regionally appropriate water reuse; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: English Learner Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides emergency funding to schools experiencing a significant increase in English language learner enrollment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>provides a local education agency (LEA) with emergency funding if enrollment of students learning English meets or exceeds a threshold;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to oversee an application process and distribute emergency funds; and<hr><ltbullet>instructs an LEA on the use of emergency funds.

bills.title: Education Program Sunset Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends certain sunset dates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends sunset dates related to public education programs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Private Airport Notice Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to notice of private airports.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to private airports;<hr><ltbullet>requires local governments to provide and record notice of the certain information about the name and location of certain private airports; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Irrigation Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses duties of owners or operators of ditches and canals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>addresses failure by an owner or operator of a ditch or canal to exercise reasonable and ordinary care;<hr><ltbullet>provides under certain circumstances for a person to recover money paid to a third party for damage or injury if caused by the failure of an owner or operator to exercise reasonable and ordinary care; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Water Rights Applications Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses applications before the state engineer.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses time frames related to reinstatement of a lapsed application; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Public Lands Watering Rights Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses livestock watering rights on public lands.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition provision;<hr><ltbullet>repeals language regarding livestock water use certificates;<hr><ltbullet>addresses when a federal land management agency reduces livestock grazing animal unit month (AUMs);<hr><ltbullet>addresses a claim under Public Water Reserve No. 107; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Wildland Urban Interface Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses efforts to oversee wildfire risks associated with wildland urban interface property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to take certain actions related to wildland urban interface property, including assessing a fee;<hr><ltbullet>directs the fee to be retained by a county and deposited into the Wildland-urban Interface Prevention, Preparedness, and Mitigation Fund;<hr><ltbullet>addresses insuring wildland urban interface property;<hr><ltbullet>imposes notice requirements related to insuring wildland urban interface property;<hr><ltbullet>requires counties and municipalities to adopt the wildland urban interface building code standards;<hr><ltbullet>permits the Division of Forestry, Fire, and State Lands (division) to choose not to cover costs of local governments under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>directs the division to establish a program for wildland urban interface coordinators to evaluate, using a triage scale, high risk wildland urban interface property;<hr><ltbullet>addresses actions related to evaluating the high risk wildland urban interface property;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a database to be accessed by certain insurers related to evaluating high risk wildland urban interface property;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes rulemaking;<hr><ltbullet>addresses liability; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Juror Eligibility Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses juror eligibility.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses juror eligibility of an individual who has been convicted of a felony; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Occupational Safety and Health Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends civil penalties related to occupational health and safety.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases certain Utah Occupational Health and Safety civil penalties.

bills.title: Higher Education Reporting Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill eliminates several reporting requirements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>eliminates several reporting requirements relating to higher education; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Health Insurance Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to health insurance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires an insurer to calculate drug or device discount coupons on behalf of an individual towards the individual's cost sharing requirement unless certain circumstances are met;<hr><ltbullet>requires a entity that provides a drug or device discount coupon to allow the full amount of the coupon amount to be used for the drug or device; and<hr><ltbullet>provides an exception to the requirements for a qualifying health benefit plan.

bills.title: Litter Cleanup Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses unsecured loads, litter, and landfills.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Litter Abatement Expendable Special Revenue Fund;<hr><ltbullet>modifies penalties for certain offenses;<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting for certain entities;<hr><ltbullet>imposes a landfill fine for an unsecured load; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Cannabinoid Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to hemp and medical cannabis regulation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain cannabinoids from being used in cannabinoid products;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Agriculture and Food to limit certain types of cannabinoids that are found in a cannabinoid product;<hr><ltbullet>amends background check requirements for cannabinoid processor licenses;<hr><ltbullet>amends qualifications for obtaining a cannabinoid processor license;<hr><ltbullet>requires industrial hemp retailers to maintain a video surveillance system;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to cannabinoid product enforcement;<hr><ltbullet>requires a person to have a cannabis processor license to transport hemp concentrate;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that certain cannabinoid products be in a medicinal dosage form; <hr><ltbullet>allows for additional medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>creates a new medical cannabis pharmacy license for independent medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>creates ownership restrictions for independent medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts fees for certain medical cannabis pharmacy licenses;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding cannabis production and sanitation;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to enforcement and appeals;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to closed-door medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>allows a cannabis processing facility to have a website that includes product information;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding when the department may seize products and test products;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to information a medical cannabis pharmacy must have available to a patient purchasing medical cannabis;<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement for the department;<hr><ltbullet>repeals sections related to the state central patient portal; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: County Office Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies how county officers and county legislative bodies maintain office space and hold meetings.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a county legislative body may authorize the elected county officers of the county to maintain additional office space at a location within the county that is not at the county seat;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a county legislative body may have a regular meeting of the county legislative body at the county seat or another location within the county that is established by ordinance; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Civil Commitment Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to civil commitment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends notification requirements for when a patient is discharged from temporary, involuntary commitment;<hr><ltbullet>amends the information that must be included in discharge instructions that are given to an individual who is discharged from a local mental health authority's custody and allows discharge instructions to be provided in paper or electronic form depending on the individual's preference;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain requirements related to civil commitment may be performed by a local mental health authority's designee;<hr><ltbullet>addresses when a local mental health authority is required to follow up with certain individuals discharged from civil commitment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Clarifies that an individual discharged from an impatient psychiatric facility will be given discharge instructions on paper or in electronic format and provided with the information about how to requ

bills.title: Residential Solar Panel Consumer Protection Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes additional protections for residential solar panel customers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>creates additional disclosure language; <hr><ltbullet>mandates that a solar retailer's good faith estimate of energy production be within a specified percentage of the actual energy production;<hr><ltbullet>requires the solar retailer repair the solar panels if the actual energy production is not within a specified percentage of the good faith estimate of energy production;<hr><ltbullet>creates a registration and security requirement for a solar retailer to do business in Utah; <hr><ltbullet>provides an exception to the background check for a publicly traded corporation registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires a solar retailer sales representative be employed by the solar retailer as a W-2 employee;<hr><ltbullet>delays a customer's financial obligation on a residential solar energy system until the system is active and producing usable energy; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Building Inspector Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to building inspectors.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Uniform Building Code Commission to: <hr><ltbullet1>collect data pertaining to building inspectors;<hr><ltbullet1>publish gathered data on an annual basis; and<hr><ltbullet1>report the data annually to the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>expands the scope for the Division of Professional Licensing to spend money from surcharges; <hr><ltbullet>adds unlawful and unprofessional conduct provisions for licensed building inspectors acting as qualified building officials;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local regulator to hire or contract with a qualified building official; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires the Uniform Building Code Commission to collect information on building code interpretation and enforcement and use it to develop guidelines for education; send letters to those improperly in

bills.title: Fireworks Modifications
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to fireworks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>replaces incorrect terms related to fireworks; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to the tax code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals obsolete language;<hr><ltbullet>provides the scope of the State Tax Commission's authority to share income tax return information with the Department of Workforce Services to determine eligibility for public assistance;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which there is an annual limit on the total amount of interest that the commission pays;<hr><ltbullet>requires a payment settlement entity, such as a marketplace facilitator, to file certain federal forms with the State Tax Commission; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies what is a commercial unit for purposes of claiming a commercial energy system tax credit;<hr><ltbullet>updates the circumstances under which an individual is exempt from individual income tax;<hr><ltbullet>creates a deduction for individuals who have to repay social security that is subject to income tax; <hr><ltbullet>provides for the repeal of the enterprise zone tax credit, which, by statute, automatically expired; <hr><ltbullet>extends the carry forward period for a tax credit available to a pass-through entity taxpayer who receives income from a pass-through entity that paid the income tax on the income;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances for the automatic removal of refundable individual income tax credits from the income tax return; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Tax Withholding Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies requirements for tax withholding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> provides penalty provisions that apply if a producer fails to file a Form 1099 for mineral production tax withholding or fails to file the Form 1099 on time;<hr><ltbullet>amends the percentage of the mineral production tax a producer withholds to align with the income tax rate;<hr><ltbullet>amends the information a producer is required to provide on a withholding return;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a producer to file a form 1099 with the State Tax Commission; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Act Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Property Tax Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes an application deadline for the residential property tax exemption;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the contents of the residential property declaration signed by an owner of residential property;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the circumstances under which land that is less than five acres in area may qualify for agricultural property tax assessment;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies a taxpayer's ability to appeal decisions related to tax deferral and tax abatement to the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to report to the Legislature if certain rules are promulgated; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Justice and Mental Health Coordination Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses situations where an individual experiencing a mental health crisis may interact with the criminal justice system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires local mental health authorities to provide consultation and education services concerning certain options for individuals experiencing mental health crises;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Committee to prepare a proposal for a pilot program designed to improve outcomes for individuals experiencing a mental health crisis; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a local mental health authority to offer information on emergency, guardianship and alternatives. Also directs the crisis response committee to. propose a pilot program to improve outcomes fo

bills.title: Public Official Bonding Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to bonds required for public officials and employees to protect against malfeasance or misfeasance in office and replaces the requirement to post a bond with a requirement to obtain crime insurance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>replaces requirements for bonds that a public official or employee is required to post in relation to the performance of duties with a requirement to obtain crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>removes provisions relating to bonds that do not apply when replaced with crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>removes provisions that make it difficult or impossible to obtain crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>modifies, in certain circumstances, the scope of the coverage that relates to a bond that will be replaced with crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements relating to crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>addresses liability relating to certain public officials;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the setting of rates and record keeping for crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the failure to obtain crime insurance;<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain provisions relating to actions on bonds; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Firefighter Cancer Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Occupational Disease Act by expanding the rebuttable presumption for a firefighter diagnosed with cancer.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>expands the list of cancers that presumptively arise from service as a firefighter;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for the rebuttable presumption;<hr><ltbullet> excludes respiratory cancers related to the use of cigarettes, electronic cigarettes, tobacco products, or marijuana from the rebuttable presumption;<hr><ltbullet>provides a cancer screening to the firefighter;<hr><ltbullet>requires the fire department where a firefighter is working to cover the out-of-pocket cost of the cancer screening; and <hr><ltbullet>provides for the management of the cancer screening program.

bills.title: Ritual Abuse Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses ritual abuse.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires current sexual assault and sexual abuse training for law enforcement officers to include training on sexual assault committed during a ritual and the impact of that conduct on the victim; <hr><ltbullet>creates an aggravating factor for certain offenses committed against an individual under 18 years old if the offense was committed as part of a ritual;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate a substantive change between this bill and S.B. 24, Child Abuse and Torture Amendments, by adding the crime of child torture, which is newly created in S.B. 24, to the list of offenses that qualify for the aggravating factor created in this bill; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Precious Metals Investment and Administration Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the state treasurer to deduct administrative costs for investing in precious metals from earnings generated by the investments in certain funds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the state treasurer to deduct administrative costs for investing in precious metals from earnings generated by the investments in certain funds; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Insurance Funds Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to insurance funds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the circumstances under which a public agency insurance mutual or a reserve fund is exempt from the Insurance Code;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a public agency insurance mutual from the State Money Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a public agency insurance mutual or reserve fund to create one or more captive insurance companies;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for the state treasurer handling a public agency insurance mutual's or reserve fund's investments;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the state treasurer shall invest the funds of a reserve fund; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Government Records and Information Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to government records and information.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the disclosure of voter history information;<hr><ltbullet>classifies as private a record or information regarding whether a voter returned a ballot with postage attached;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a government officer from accessing or using government records or information in a manner that is not related to a duty of the government officer;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a government officer from accessing or using government records or information for a primarily personal purpose, unless the government officer gains access to the records or information in the same manner as a member of the public;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a crime to intentionally violate the provisions described in the preceding paragraph;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to the award of attorney fees; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Decommissioned Asset Disposition Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the requirements related to the decommissioning and disposal of electrical generation facilities and equipment by a project entity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a project entity from:<hr><ltbullet1>altering facilities that provide power to station service;<hr><ltbullet1>disconnecting from or modifying existing interconnections and critical switchyard equipment; and<hr><ltbullet1>taking actions that would require a new plant owner to make an interconnection request; and<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah Energy Council (council);<hr><ltbullet>establishes council membership and duties;<hr><ltbullet>provides authority for the council to manage decommissioned electrical generation facilities;<hr><ltbullet>requires the council to select facility operators through a competitive process;<hr><ltbullet>establishes minimum qualifications and criteria for facility operators;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions related to the Decommissioned Asset Disposition Authority; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Committee of Consumer Services Sunset Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Committee of Consumer Services and extends the committee's sunset date.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset date for the Committee of Consumer Services from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2035.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Committee of Consumer Services Sunset Amendments

bills.title: Electricity Rate Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to public utility regulation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for the Public Service Commission to prioritize Utah ratepayer interests when allocating utility costs;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits cost recovery from Utah ratepayers for facilities and programs primarily benefiting other states;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates electrical corporation energy balancing account cost recovery for costs incurred after December 31, 2024; and<hr><ltbullet>maintains existing energy balancing account provisions for costs incurred before December 31, 2024.

bills.title: Administrative Procedures Act Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Administrative Procedures Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides cross references;<hr><ltbullet>describes when an order or decree constitutes a final agency action; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Foreign Judgment Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Utah Foreign Judgment Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the postjudgment interest rate for foreign judgments filed in the state shall be set at the rate established under Utah law.

bills.title: Reauthorization of Administrative Rules
bills.general_provisions: This bill reauthorizes administrative rules.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reauthorizes administrative rules.

bills.title: Public Education Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions and programs regarding the operation of the public education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes duplicative language regarding a college and career readiness plan;<hr><ltbullet>amends the Teacher Salary Supplement Program and the upcoming replacement Salary Supplement for Highly Needed Educators program to allow a local education agency (LEA) that experiences a carry forward or leftover balance to increase the amount the LEA provides to teachers under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>adds the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind as an LEA that may participate in the Salary Supplement for Highly Needed Educators program;<hr><ltbullet>increases the portion of appropriated funding the State Board of Education (state board) is statutorily authorized to expend for administrative costs for early literacy software, including the cost of an independent software evaluator;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding kindergarten to:<hr><ltbullet1>allow a child to enroll in kindergarten if the child moves to Utah after having enrolled in kindergarten in another state with different age requirements for enrollment; and<hr><ltbullet1>repeal a requirement for the state board to create a process for an LEA to follow when an enrolled student in kindergarten is not toilet-trained;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding early learning plans to:<hr><ltbullet1>reduce requirements for the plans that LEAs submit to the state board; and<hr><ltbullet1>repeal a requirement for the state board to use a digital platform to communicate with LEAs regarding early learning;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to school fees to ensure that a school is not prohibited from charging a fee for a fine arts course; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, allows the Utah Schools for the Deaf and Blind to participate in the Salary Supplement for Highly Needed Educators Program.

bills.title: Flag Display Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the display of certain flags on government property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a government entity or employee of a government entity from displaying a flag in or on the grounds of government property except certain exempted flags;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to ensure compliance, including by imposing fines;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a cause of action for an alleged violation within the public education system;<hr><ltbullet>requires the attorney general to defend and the state to hold harmless an individual acting under color of state law to enforce the flag display statute within the public education system; and<hr><ltbullet>provides severability.

bills.title: Criminal Offenses Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses sentencing and criminal procedures for certain criminal offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a prosecutor, when reducing the level of certain crimes in an information or as part of plea deal, to explain on the record why the prosecutor is seeking the reduction;<hr><ltbullet>requires an indeterminate prison term to be imposed, with exceptions, for certain attempt convictions;<hr><ltbullet>increases penalties for the crime of aggravated child abuse; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Adaptive Driving Equipment Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts sales and use tax exemptions for purchases of adaptive driving equipment for motor vehicles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates sales and use tax exemptions for sales of adaptive driving equipment installed in a motor vehicle.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Creates a tax exemption for things like hand controls, a lift, or a swivel seat.

bills.title: Disorderly Conduct Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses disorderly conduct.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offense aggravated disorderly conduct on a street or highway.

bills.title: Fluoride Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to water fluoridation and prescription fluoride supplements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits adding fluoride to public water systems;<hr><ltbullet> allows a pharmacist to prescribe fluoride; and<hr><ltbullet>directs the Division of Professional Licensing to establish guidelines for prescribing fluoride.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses due process rights for peace officers in certain circumstances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses the procedures a prosecution agency is required to follow when the prosecution agency creates a system for tracking past peace officer misconduct that the agency has to disclose to a defendant in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet> makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Welfare Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses search warrants and investigative warrants relating to child welfare.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the issuance of warrants by a juvenile court;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a juvenile court to issue an investigative warrant related to the health, safety, or welfare of a child;<hr><ltbullet>states that a peace officer or child welfare caseworker who is executing a search warrant or an investigative warrant may request assistance in executing the warrant; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vaccine Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses vaccines or vaccine material.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>designates food intended for human consumption that intentionally contains a vaccine or vaccine material as a drug; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical amendments.

bills.title: Environmental Permitting Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to environmental permitting.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Air Quality (division) to:<hr><ltbullet1>develop and publish guidance and rules related to federal plantwide applicability limitations;<hr><ltbullet1>review the division's rules related to permit by rule registration;<hr><ltbullet1> include at least five new categories of sources in the division's permit by rule program; and<hr><ltbullet1>report to the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee the results of the division's review of the permit by rule program;<hr><ltbullet>adds a repeal date for the sections related to plantwide applicability limitations and permit by rule registration; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeowners' Association Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to homeowners' associations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the monetary amount a unit or lot owner may request if an association fails to properly make records available for examination;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a declarant from using association funds in a legal action brought by a homeowner against the declarant before the end of the period of administrative control;<hr><ltbullet>defines "development right";<hr><ltbullet>amends the conditions for the termination of a period of administrative control for an association of lot owners;<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for a declarant of a association of lot owners during the period of administrative control; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Drug Trafficking Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the trafficking of certain controlled substances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense of trafficking of fentanyl or a fentanyl-related substance; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming and technical changes.

bills.title: Housing Policy Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to moderate income housing reports and municipal zoning.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the required frequency of a moderate income housing progress report;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an accessory dwelling unit, internal or external, on a lot containing a detached single family dwelling is a permitted use in a residential zone of an urban municipality;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an urban municipality may not prohibit the use of a modular unit in a residential zone; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Transfer Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to probate transfer of personal property by affidavit.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the transfer of water shares via small estate probate procedures involving an affidavit; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and grammatical changes.

bills.title: Zoning Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies zoning authority in an urban municipality.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term "urban municipality"; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a detached single family dwelling that is built on a lot of at least 6,000 square feet is a permitted use in a residential zone of an urban municipality; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Technical College Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to capital development projects for technical colleges.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to construction plan approval for technical colleges.

bills.title: Private Individual Force and Detention Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns the ability of a private individual to use force or detain another individual.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the circumstances under which a private individual may use force in defense of personal property;<hr><ltbullet>amends the circumstances under which a private individual may lawfully detain another individual, including removing the use of the term "arrest";<hr><ltbullet>provides a limitation on civil and criminal liability for a private individual who temporarily detains another individual under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>amends the force in arrest statute to provide that the statute applies to law enforcement officers and creates a new statute for when force can be used by a private individual when making a temporary detention; <hr><ltbullet>amends procedures that govern the subsequent arrest and transportation of an individual who has been temporarily detained by another private individual; <hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause between this bill and S.B. 79, Technical Code Amendments, to provide that the changes to Section 77-7-3 will supersede the changes to that section in S.B. 79; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Rehabilitation Services Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Fund and Advisory Committee.
