bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows money in the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Fund to be used for nervous system research under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the membership of the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Advisory Committee (committee);<hr><ltbullet>requires the committee to meet quarterly;<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Advisory Committee to meet at least quarterly and submit an annual report to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee. Also allows the committee to gra

bills.title: Exemptions from Dangerous Weapons Provisions
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the discharge of a dangerous weapon.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain individuals performing official duties;<hr><ltbullet>exempts farm custom slaughter licensees when acting pursuant to statute; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Financial Disclosure Revisions
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions of the Election Code relating to financial disclosures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> requires the lieutenant governor to provide, on the website relating to political financial disclosures, the ability to search across all disclosures made by filing entities to identify contributions or expenditures made by a particular person.

bills.title: Fraud Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the criminal offense of defrauding of creditors.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the criminal offense of defrauding of creditors to increase the penalty for the offense based on the value of the fraud; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Private Postsecondary Education Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to a postsecondary school's required disclosures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a reasonable deposit from the amount a postsecondary school must refund a student under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Landowner Liability Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the definition of "recreational purpose" in the context of landowner liability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds new activities to the definition of "recreational purpose" in the context of landowner liability; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Residential Mortgage Loan Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Residential Mortgage Practices and Licensing Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides conditions where the use of information derived from a consumer report to solicit a consumer is prohibited; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Food Security Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a program to provide lunch at no cost to an eligible student.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides certain students access to lunch at no charge;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to reimburse each local education agency (LEA) for certain reduced price lunches;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an LEA from stigmatizing students who cannot afford meals;<hr><ltbullet>encourages an LEA to reduce food waste; and<hr><ltbullet>requires communications regarding a student's meal debt to be directed only to the student's parent.

bills.title: Ballot Proposition Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Election Code relating to certain ballot propositions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel to prepare:<hr><ltbullet1>an impartial ballot title and analysis for a proposed constitutional amendment or another question submitted by the Legislature; and<hr><ltbullet1>an impartial analysis of a statewide initiative or referendum.

bills.title: Class Size Reduction Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the allocation of an existing appropriation for class size reduction.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>ensures that funds are directed to local education agencies (LEAs) with the highest need;<hr><ltbullet>requires an LEA that receives funding to provide a report; <hr><ltbullet>adjusts which grades the funds may be used for; and<hr><ltbullet>permits an adjustment for inflation.

bills.title: State Land Access Road Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires certain state entities to identify and record notice of roads that traverse certain lands owned by the state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Public Lands Policy Coordinating Office (PLPCO) and the School and Institutional Trust Lands Administration (SITLA) to identify certain roads located on school and institutional trust lands and state lands, with initial focus within certain counties;<hr><ltbullet>requires PLPCO and SITLA to record with the relevant county recorder's office notice of the roads relevant to state lands and school and institutional trust lands;<hr><ltbullet>exempts class A, class B, and class C roads from the notice requirements; <hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for the Division of Wildlife Resources to identify roads within wildlife management areas;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Division of Wildlife Resources may not permanently close a road without consent of the legislative body of the county in which the road is located; and<hr><ltbullet>codifies a provision to ensure that title to a class D road abandoned by a county remains with the state, and provides a process for abandonment of a class D road or R.S. 2477 right-of-way.

bills.title: Firearm Safety in Schools Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses firearm safety instruction in public schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency to provide firearm safety instruction to students; <hr><ltbullet>provides guidelines on how a local education agency may provide the firearm safety instruction;<hr><ltbullet>requires that individuals providing instruction with an actual firearm have certain authority to possess a firearm; and<hr><ltbullet>includes an opt-out provision.

bills.title: Criminal Code Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to criminal offenses in Title 76, Utah Criminal Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the penalty for attempted murder;<hr><ltbullet>amends the crime of interference with a public servant;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a crime for an individual occupying a position of special trust in a high school to engage in certain sexual conduct with an adult high school student;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a crime for an individual to remove the clothing of another individual without the individual's consent in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>repeals Title 76, Chapter 8, Part 8, Sabotage Prevention;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Income Tax Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends income tax provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the corporate franchise and income tax rates; <hr><ltbullet>amends the individual income tax rate; <hr><ltbullet>enacts nonrefundable corporate and individual income tax credits for employer-provided child care; <hr><ltbullet>allows a taxpayer to claim the nonrefundable child tax credit for child dependents under one year old and up to five years old; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes.

bills.title: University Facilities Financing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to higher education capital projects.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>repurposes the Higher Education Capital Projects Fund into a loan program; <hr><ltbullet>provides for the terms of the loan; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Fraudulent Deed Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Fraudulent Deeds Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>excludes governing documents or a reinvestment fee covenant from the definition of a deed.

bills.title: Municipal Election Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies a municipal council's power to dismiss a municipal manager.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that, beginning on the day on which a municipal general election is held and ending on the day on which a council member-elect begins the council member's term of office, a six-member or five-member municipal council may not adopt an ordinance that establishes a more restrictive procedure for the dismissal of a municipal manager; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Combined Basic Tax Rate Reduction
bills.general_provisions: This bill repeals the weighted pupil unit (WPU) value rate from the combination of property tax rates that fund public education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the WPU value rate from the combination of property tax rates that fund public education;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the repeal of the WPU value rate does not affect the amount of ongoing appropriations to the Teacher and Student Success Program;<hr><ltbullet>includes a clause to coordinate the effect of the repeal of the WPU value rate with language that S.B. 37, Minimum Basic Tax Rate Amendments, enacts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Workers' Compensation Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Workers' Compensation Act related to home and community based services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the circumstances under which an individual with a disability is the employer of an individual providing home and community based services; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: For purposes of workers' compensation, clarifies that an agency or an organization is not an employer simply because it connected a person or family with an individual willing to provide home and comm

bills.title: Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Modifications
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to window tinting.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a peace officer from requesting the revocation or suspension of an individual's vehicle registration or driver license for a window tinting violation.

bills.title: Certificate of Death Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the collection of information related to firefighter service on a certificate of death.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the collection of information related to firefighter service on a certificate of death; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Architects Licensing Act Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Architects Licensing Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>narrows the scope of unlawful conduct for individuals engaging in architecture; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: State Park Funding Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies funding provisions related to the Division of State Parks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows interest earned on the money in the State Park Fees Restricted Account to remain in the account; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Safety Answering Point Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the Department of Public Safety to fund public safety answering points operated by the department in certain counties.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety to pay the ongoing operational costs of public safety answering points operated by the department in a county of the fourth, fifth, and sixth class.

bills.title: Sexual Abuse Statutes of Limitation Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses civil statutes of limitation for certain sexual crimes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses civil statutes of limitation for certain sexual crimes; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homelessness Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the annual local contribution formula that local governments provide to the Homeless Shelter Cities Mitigation Restricted Account.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the annual local contribution formula that local governments provide to the Homeless Shelter Cities Mitigation Restricted Account; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Solar Panel Restrictions in Homeowners Associations Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Community Association Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>stops a homeowners association from prohibiting solar panel installation; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a homeowners association to restrict solar panel installation.

bills.title: Time Change Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the time observed in Utah.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that Utah will observe mountain standard time year-round until federal law allows Utah to observe mountain daylight time year-round, after which Utah will observe mountain daylight time year-round.

bills.title: Health Education Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to establish curriculum requirements that include instruction in:<hr><ltbullet1>sexual assault resource strategies;<hr><ltbullet1>sexual violence behavior prevention; and<hr><ltbullet1>the legal implications of electronically distributing sexually explicit images;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to when a student receives health education instruction; <hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency (LEA) to:<hr><ltbullet1>review data, including data on sexual assault, for each county in which the LEA is located;<hr><ltbullet1>use the reviewed data to inform the LEA's policies on health education; and<hr><ltbullet1>as appropriate, incorporate the data into health education; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Military Affairs Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the code addressing military affairs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends resident student status eligibility for veterans who use veteran benefits to pay for tuition;<hr><ltbullet>amends how much money the Interstate Commission on Educational Opportunity for Military Children may assess, levy, or collect from Utah legislative appropriations;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs:<hr><ltbullet1>is required to provide service benefits to service members, veterans, and the families of service members and veterans; and<hr><ltbullet1>serves as the State Approving Agency for Utah under United States Code, Title 38, Veterans Benefits;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to receive gifts, contributions, and donations to support service members, veterans, and the families of service members and veterans;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to enter into an intergovernmental support agreement with a military installation or entity, including the National Guard, to provide support services to the military installation or entity;<hr><ltbullet>repeals Title 63M, Chapter 6, Military Base Easements Act, and enacts sections in Title 71A, Veterans and Military Affairs, related to easements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Pharmacy Accessibility Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses prescription drug labeling.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a pharmacy to use an accessible prescription label for prescriptions dispensed to a patient who identifies as visually impaired and requests an accessible prescription label.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a pharmacy to make its best effort to provide a prescription label in an accessible format if requested by a customer who is blind or visually impaired.

bills.title: Education Industry Employee Privacy
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for the personal privacy of local education agency employees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts restrictions on a local education agency (LEA) selling or transferring certain contact information without consent;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits requiring use of certain technologies on personal devices;<hr><ltbullet>requires an LEA to provide accommodations for mandatory technology use under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>allows an employee to file written complaints with the State Board of Education about violations;<hr><ltbullet>permits the State Board of Education to investigate complaints; and <hr><ltbullet>allows for consequences for violations.

bills.title: Murdered and Missing Indigenous Relatives Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill reestablishes the Missing and Murdered Indigenous Relatives Task Force.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>reestablishes the Murdered and Missing Indigenous Relatives Task Force, with the membership consisting of nine members from government and community organizations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that any vacancy in the task force be filled in the same manner as the original appointment;<hr><ltbullet>designates the appointees from the Senate and House of Representatives as the cochairs of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>establishes that a quorum of the task force consists of five members and that majority action of the quorum is required for task force decisions;<hr><ltbullet>establishes compensation requirements for both legislator members and non-legislator members of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel provide staff support to the task force;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the responsibilities of the task force;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the task force must report its findings to the Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for the repeal of the task force.

bills.title: Unauthorized Use of Residential Real Property Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the consequences of unauthorized use of residential real property by providing a limited alternative remedy to remove a trespasser from a residential dwelling and providing a criminal penalty for the fraudulent sale or rental of residential real property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes property owners or their agents to request assistance from the sheriff for the immediate removal of a trespasser from a residential dwelling under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>requires an owner seeking removal of a trespasser, or the owner's authorized agent, to submit a complaint;<hr><ltbullet>specifies requirements for the complaint;<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for the sheriff;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a sheriff to arrest a trespasser for legal cause;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a sheriff is entitled to a specified fee for service of notice to vacate;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the owner or agent to request that the sheriff stand by while the owner or agent takes possession of the property; <hr><ltbullet>authorizes the sheriff to charge a reasonable hourly rate;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the sheriff is not liable to any party for loss, destruction, or damage;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the property owner or agent is not liable to any party for the loss or destruction of, or damage to, personal property unless it was wrongfully removed;<hr><ltbullet>provides civil remedies;<hr><ltbullet>imposes criminal penalties for unlawfully detaining, occupying, or trespassing of, a residential dwelling intentionally and causing a specified amount of damage; imposes criminal penalties for any person who knowingly and willfully presents a false document purporting to be a valid lease agreement, deed, or other instrument conveying real property rights;<hr><ltbullet>imposes criminal penalties for fraudulently listing or advertising for sale, or renting or leasing, residential real property under certain circumstances; and provides criminal penalties for committing perjury.

bills.title: Sexual Crime Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the sentence length for the crimes of rape, object rape, and forcible sodomy.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the length of a sentence for the crimes of rape, object rape, and forcible sodomy if the actor committed the crime against an incapacitated individual; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Makes intercourse with a person over 14 who has a disease or disability and can't understand, resist, or report the act a first-degree felony.

bills.title: Dangerous Weapons Recodification and Cross References
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Utah Code addressing dangerous weapons by redrafting statutes into a new structure, reorganizing applicable criminal statutes into a new standardized format, and clarifying existing law.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>restructures and makes technical changes to sections in the Utah Code dealing with dangerous weapons to bring the sections into a standardized format;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions detailing the current law surrounding the carrying of firearms;<hr><ltbullet>for clarity, places certain contents of Title 76, Chapter 10, Part 5, Weapons, into Title 53, Public Safety Code;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies criminal provisions regarding who is required to have a concealed carry permit in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>includes coordination clauses coordinating technical changes between this bill and H.B. 183, Noncitizen Restricted Person Amendments, H.B. 227, Restricted Person Amendments, H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, and S.B. 14, Private Sale of a Firearm Sunset Review Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Adoption Records Access Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses access to adoption records.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual who is adopted as a minor child to access records associated with the individual's adoption if the individual is 18 years old or older;<hr><ltbullet>amends the jurisdiction of the juvenile court;<hr><ltbullet>allows a pre-existing parent to petition a court to keep the records associated with an individual's adoption sealed;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address substantive and technical conflicts if this bill and S.B. 119, Domestic Relations Recodification, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Social Security Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the individual income tax credit for social security benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands eligibility for the social security benefits tax credit by increasing the thresholds for the income-based phaseout; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Increases the income level at which a retirement or SSDI beneficiary can claim the state tax credit.

bills.title: Talent Ready Utah Program Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill clarifies the allowed membership of an advisory council and types of talent initiatives.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the allowed membership of an advisory council and types of talent initiatives.

bills.title: Firearm Storage Requirements
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the storage of firearms.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>sets a criminal penalty in certain circumstances when an individual fails to lawfully store the individual's firearms and the firearm is then accessed by a minor in an unlawful manner.

bills.title: Dangerous Weapons Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses statutes throughout the Utah Code dealing with dangerous weapons.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>restructures and makes technical changes to sections in the Utah Code dealing with dangerous weapons to bring the sections into a standardized format as part of a larger effort to recodify the criminal code;<hr><ltbullet>makes amendments to existing statutes dealing with firearms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an individual who may otherwise lawfully possess a firearm may:<hr><ltbullet1>possess a firearm at the individual's residence;<hr><ltbullet1>openly possess a firearm in most public locations; and<hr><ltbullet1>conceal a firearm in most public locations without a concealed carry permit;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies criminal provisions regarding who is required to have a concealed carry permit in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>removes the criminal provision for law-abiding citizens to possess a loaded rifle, shotgun, or muzzle-loading rifle in a vehicle;<hr><ltbullet>removes the crime of carrying a loaded firearm on a public street;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause coordinating technical changes with this bill and S.B. 14, Private Sale of a Firearm Sunset Review Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Food Cart Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill clarifies that a food cart may be moved with an electric assisted bicycle.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a food cart may be moved with an electric assisted bicycle.

bills.title: Real Estate Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses requirements for real estate transactions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the issuance of an attorney opinion letter in lieu of title insurance for purposes of conducting escrow on real property transactions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Alternative Incarceration Program Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to alternative incarceration programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a county sheriff may implement a sheriff's work program in which inmates participate in supervised public works projects instead of serving time in jail;<hr><ltbullet>amends and establishes eligibility requirements for alternative incarceration programs and sheriff's work programs;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain convictions are not eligible for participation in a sheriff's work program;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies provisions related to credit for good behavior against a jail sentence; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Human Trafficking Expungement Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the expungement of offenses for human trafficking victims.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual to file a petition for expungement, without a certificate of eligibility, if the individual is seeking an expungement of records for prostitution, aiding prostitution, or sexual solicitation and the individual was subject to force, fraud, or coercion at the time of the conduct;<hr><ltbullet>addresses an order for expungement when the individual is seeking an expungement of records for prostitution, aiding prostitution, or sexual solicitation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Food Labeling Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses labeling of meat type products.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires labeling of food containing cultivated meat products;<hr><ltbullet>requires labeling of food containing plant or insect based meat substitutes; <hr><ltbullet>provides for notification, inspections, and the payment of a fee related to cultivated meat products and plant or insect based meat substitutes; <hr><ltbullet>addresses rulemaking; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Governmental Accounting Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a political subdivision's annual financial report.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to develop a form; <hr><ltbullet>requires a political subdivision's chief financial officer and chief administrative officer to include the state auditor's form with the political subdivision's annual financial report; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes.

bills.title: Assault Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns an assault or threat of violence committed against a referee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates an aggravating factor for an assault or a threat of violence offense committed against a referee.

bills.title: Adoption Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding adoptive evaluations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates exceptions to the requirement of a preplacement adoptive evaluation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Service Member and Veteran Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses in-state tuition at a state institution of higher education for certain individuals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the residency requirement for in-state tuition at a state institution of higher education for:<hr><ltbullet1>active military members;<hr><ltbullet1>military veterans;<hr><ltbullet1>family members of active military members; and<hr><ltbullet1>family members of military veterans; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Firearm Safety Incentives
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes an annual sales tax holiday for firearm safety and storage devices.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a sales tax holiday for firearm safety devices and firearm storage devices applicable for one week each year;<hr><ltbullet>provides for general administration of sales tax holidays;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a state commemorative period known as Firearm Safety Week, occurring during the same week as the sales tax holiday for firearm safety devices and firearm storage devices; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: School District Contracting Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to federal contracts and settlement agreements with a local education agency.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a local education agency from contracting with the United States Department of Justice unless the attorney general's office reviews the contract or settlement agreement;<hr><ltbullet>requires the attorney general's office to review each proposed contract or settlement agreement; and<hr><ltbullet>allows the Utah State Board of Education and the attorney general's office to make recommendations regarding the contract or settlement agreement.

bills.title: Rehabilitation Services Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Advisory Committee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the appointment process for members of the Brain and Spinal Cord Injury Advisory Committee.

bills.title: Mammography Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the authority and duties of the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the women's cancer screening notification requirement under state law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Aquatic Invasive Species Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses requirements to operate or launch a vessel.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>exempts an owner or operator of certain vessels from requirements related to invasive species and launching or operating the vessel on waters of the state;<hr><ltbullet>addresses vessels owned by government agencies;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to collection of annual aquatic invasive species fees, including repealing outdated language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Child Sexual Abuse Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses an aggravating factor to certain sexual offenses that are committed against children.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates an aggravating factor for certain sexual offenses that are committed against a child if the actor:<hr><ltbullet1>traveled more than 45 miles from the actor's residence to commit the offense; or<hr><ltbullet1>paid a child to travel more than 45 miles from the child's residence for the actor to commit the offense.

bills.title: Single Family Homes Ownership Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill restricts an institutional investor's ability to purchase single family homes in this state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an institutional investor from purchasing a single family home in this state; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that an institutional investor that does purchase a single family home in this state must alienate that home within one year of purchasing the home.

bills.title: Emergency Communications Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to public safety answering point qualifications for proportionate share funding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits nonvoting board members from attending closed portions of board meetings;<hr><ltbullet>changes the comprehensive strategic plan review cycle from annual to every three years;<hr><ltbullet>requires periodic review and updates of the statewide CAD-to-CAD protocol;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that all public safety answering points in a county must qualify for a proportionate share of remaining funds for any public safety answering point in that county to receive funds; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Home Sales Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes restrictions related to single-family homes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a purchaser to sign an affidavit of intent to occupy when buying a single-family home within the first 30 days the single-family home is on the market, unless the seller incurs an exigent circumstance;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a purchaser record an affidavit of intent to occupy with a county recorder; and <hr><ltbullet>prohibits the bulk sale of foreclosed single-family homes.

bills.title: Health Care Facilities Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses satellite emergency departments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for certain satellite emergency departments; and<hr><ltbullet>limits the number of satellite emergency departments that a health care organization may operate.

bills.title: Hunting Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the taking of wildlife through the use of a guide, outfitter, or spotter.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Guide, Outfitter, and Spotter Fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides when the use of a guide, outfitter, or spotter is unlawful; <hr><ltbullet>requires registration with the Division of Wildlife Resources (division);<hr><ltbullet>provides for rulemaking;<hr><ltbullet>permits the division to take action related to an applicant or registrant;<hr><ltbullet>outlines prohibited activities and penalties for violations;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the operations of a guide, outfitter, or spotter;<hr><ltbullet>repeals regulation by the Division of Professional Licensing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Punitive Damages Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to punitive damages.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions of the Victim Services Restricted Account; and<hr><ltbullet>requires, after a set date, that the state's portion of punitive damage payments that are received in certain driving under the influence cases are deposited into the Victims Services Restricted Account.

bills.title: Personal Property Tax Exemption Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to exemption of personal property from property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the qualifications for tangible personal property tax to be exempt from property tax.

bills.title: Education Board Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding governance of the public education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the appointment, authority, and duties of the state superintendent of public instruction;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the scope of authority and duties of employees of the State Board of Education (state board);<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions to describe the level of autonomy of local education agencies relative to the state superintendent and state board employees; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Energy Education Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Office of Energy Development.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Energy Development (office) to:<hr><ltbullet1>develop and maintain energy education programs and curricula for grades K-12;<hr><ltbullet1>develop and provide professional development training for educators; <hr><ltbullet1>develop energy related workforce development programs; and<hr><ltbullet1>establish the Energy Education and Workforce Development Advisory Group (advisory group); <hr><ltbullet>outlines the responsibilities and duties of the advisory group; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to report annually to the Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Interim Committee.

bills.title: State Sovereignty Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses state sovereignty.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>declares that an international organization does not have any power, jurisdiction, or legal authority in this state;<hr><ltbullet>provides that, if an international organization issues a rule, resolution, tax, policy, or mandate that purports to have the force and effect of law, then the state, or a political subdivision of the state, may not implement or enforce the rule, resolution, tax, policy, or mandate;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the governor or the chief executive officer of a political subdivision from declaring a state of emergency exclusively in response to an international organization's proclamation declaring a state of emergency; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Protection Order Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Uniform Recognition of Canadian Domestic Violence Protection Orders Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts the Uniform Recognition of Canadian Domestic Violence Protection Orders Act;<hr><ltbullet>provides a severability clause; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Professional License Degree Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies licensure requirements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the board to maintain multiple pathways to licensure for architects;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain processes and procedures related to licensing requirements for:<hr><ltbullet1>architects;<hr><ltbullet1>environmental health scientists;<hr><ltbullet1>land surveyors;<hr><ltbullet1>substance use disorder counselors; and<hr><ltbullet1>geologists; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Bus Route Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends student eligibility for state-supported transportation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends student eligibility for state-supported transportation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Transportation Funding Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill limits certain uses of local option sales and use taxes for transportation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the allowed uses of certain local option sales and uses taxes for public safety purposes to:<hr><ltbullet1>allow funds to be used for infrastructure and buildings; and<hr><ltbullet1>prohibit the use of funds for salaries, vehicles, or operations and maintenance; and<hr><ltbullet>provides an exception for certain counties that have budgeted or spent revenue for salaries of law enforcement or public safety personnel to continue to use the funds for a certain period of time; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Adult Probation and Parole Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Division of Adult Probation and Parole within the Department of Corrections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Division of Adult Probation and Parole in the code;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions throughout the code regarding the responsibility of the Department of Corrections to supervise individuals on probation or parole; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Accident Liability Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill clarifies that a vehicle operator intending to turn left is not required to yield the right-of-way to a vehicle operator approaching from the opposite direction that fails to stop when required by a stop sign or steady red signal.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a vehicle operator intending to turn left is not required to yield the right-of-way to a vehicle operator approaching from the opposite direction that fails to stop when required by a stop sign or steady red signal at the intersection; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Process for Submitting Nonbinding Opinion Question
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Election Code to establish a procedure for the Legislature to submit a nonbinding opinion question to the voters of Utah.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a procedure for the Legislature to submit a nonbinding opinion question to the voters of Utah;<hr><ltbullet>describes the duties of the lieutenant governor and county clerks in submitting the nonbinding opinion question to voters; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes procedures for the ballot form, voter information pamphlet, public notice, manner of voting, and canvass of returns in relation to the nonbinding opinion question.

bills.title: Trailer Registration and Uniform Fee Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the owner of certain types of trailers to obtain a lifetime registration and pay a one-time uniform fee in lieu of ad valorem tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an owner of certain types of trailers to register a trailer for the life of the trailer and pay a one-time uniform fee in lieu of ad valorem tax or a uniform statewide fee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Trailer Registration and Uniform Fee Amendments

bills.title: Offender Reintegration Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns the reentry and reintegration of offenders and former offenders into the general public.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a local mental health authority shall, to the extent feasible, coordinate with the Department of Corrections (department) to ensure the continuity of mental health services for county residents on probation or parole;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a criminal justice coordinating council shall identify strategies for connecting county residents on probation, parole, or leaving jail or prison, with certain county-based services; <hr><ltbullet>adds an expunged conviction and an arrest that occurred as a juvenile to the circumstances when a public employer may not exclude an applicant from an initial interview;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the amount of time following an individual's incarceration for purposes of defining unprofessional conduct in certain circumstances and expands the exceptions under which a conviction would not qualify;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the department may procure or adopt technology to coordinate services with outside organizations involved in supporting individuals on probation or parole;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Rehabilitation and Reentry Services Special Revenue Fund, which:<hr><ltbullet1> allows the department to accept donations and other funds; and<hr><ltbullet1>restricts funds for specified purposes relating to the successful reintegration of offenders and former offenders into the general public; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, requires a county criminal justice advisory council to create a strategy for connecting individuals returning to the community from jail or prison to services and requires a local

bills.title: Artificial Intelligence in Education
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a task force to guide the implementation and use of artificial intelligence in Utah's education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Artificial Intelligence in Education Task Force (task force);<hr><ltbullet>establishes the task force membership;<hr><ltbullet>establishes task force duties focused on artificial intelligence in education;<hr><ltbullet>requires quarterly meetings and annual reporting;<hr><ltbullet>mandates coordination with the Office of Artificial Intelligence Policy; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a sunset clause.

bills.title: State Board of Education Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes ethics standards for members of the State Board of Education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes ethics standards for members of the State Board of Education; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Initiatives and Referenda Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to statewide initiatives and statewide referenda.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel to draft an impartial petition summary of:<hr><ltbullet1>a law proposed by a statewide initiative; or<hr><ltbullet1>a law that a statewide referendum seeks to overturn;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements and procedures for drafting and for challenging a petition summary;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the petition summary is included with the signature packets for a statewide initiative or a statewide referendum and provides that a petition signer may read the petition summary rather than the entire text of the law that is the subject of the petition;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an individual who signs an initiative packet or a referendum packet must read the entire statement included with the packet;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the attestation relating to reading a statement provided with an initiative packet or a referendum packet or reading the law to which the initiative or referendum relates, does not require an attestation that the individual understands the statement or law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Victim Privacy Changes
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the privacy of a victim in a criminal investigation or action.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>addresses access by a defendant and a defendant's attorney to nonpublic electronic data related to a victim; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a victim in a criminal proceeding with a right to privacy in any nonpublic electronic data related to the victim that is collected during the course of the criminal investigation or action.

bills.title: Unpaid Wage Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to wages.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that an employee make a demand in writing 15 days before bringing a suit for wages; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Controlled Substances Act Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill adds substances to the list of controlled substances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds tianeptine and phenibut to Schedule I of the list of controlled substances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Rights Restricted Account
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions creating the Water Rights Restricted Account.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses money for obtaining legal support; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Housing Construction Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the state construction code related to housing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends adopted language from Section R101.2 of the International Residential Code to include three- and four-family dwellings.

bills.title: County Classification Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the population requirements for county classification.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the population requirements for county classification; <hr><ltbullet>modifies a sales and use tax exemption applicable to airports in certain counties; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Glass Recycling Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill relates to the recycling of glass.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Waste Management and Radiation Control (division) to study how to increase the amount of used glass for recycling;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to report findings and recommendations to the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a repeal date for the study.

bills.title: Noncitizen Health Insurance Policies Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to health insurance for certain noncitizens.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>removes alternative eligibility for otherwise ineligible children under the Children's Health Insurance Program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Eliminates the state-funded program providing Children's Health Insurance Program coverage to non-citizen immigrant kids.

bills.title: Social Security Tax Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the individual income tax credit for social security benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the income limitations on eligibility for the social security benefits tax credit; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Employee Compensation Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies requirements related to compensation of executive branch employees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires that compensation be based on the relative ability, knowledge, and skills of an employee; and<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an executive branch employer from inquiring regarding an employee's or prospective employee's current or previous compensation.

bills.title: School Week Schedule Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to requesting a waiver to implement a four-day school week.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the process for a local education agency or individual public school to obtain a waiver from the State Board of Education to implement a four-day school week; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Rental Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to rent increases.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a period of time by which a landlord must provide a notice of rent increase to a tenant; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a landlord to give a tenant a 60-day notice of a rent increase, unless the building is a Section 8 or tax credit property. Exempts fee increases from the notice requirement.

bills.title: Noncitizen Restricted Person Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill clarifies when a non-citizen is a restricted person.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that aliens who have applications pending for asylum or temporary protected status are restricted persons not allowed to possess, purchase, transfer, or own dangerous weapons;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and H.B. 133, Dangerous Weapons Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Trust Land Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill streamlines the School LAND Trust Program by shifting responsibilities and improving transparency.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies action plans and the implementation of action plans;<hr><ltbullet>adds a requirement to train on the Open and Public Meetings Act;<hr><ltbullet>expands the list of entities to receive training on the School LAND Trust Program; <hr><ltbullet>refines the process for reviewing school compliance with the program;<hr><ltbullet>adds new responsibilities for the state superintendent; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Railroad Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses emissions from railroad locomotives.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Air Quality (division) to conduct an inventory related to emissions from railyards in certain counties in the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to propose an emissions reduction plan for emissions from certain railroad locomotives to be implemented by December 31, 2027;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to recommend state action for implementing the emissions reduction plan; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to report on the inventory, plan, and recommendations.

bills.title: Wage Payment Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the payment of wages provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes references that require an employee separating from an employer to provide a written demand for payment; <hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that an employee make a demand in writing 15 days before bringing a suit for wages; <hr><ltbullet>requires that an employee, who disputes the amount an employer pays to the employee upon separation, provide notice to the employer before initiating a legal action; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Imitation Firearm Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses imitation firearms that have been altered to have the appearance of a firearm.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates an infraction for a minor, after receiving a previous written warning, to possess an altered toy, look-alike, or imitation firearm that has the appearance of an actual firearm.

bills.title: Dry Needling Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides requirements for dry needling by a physical therapist or an occupational therapist.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>moves the registration requirement for a physical therapist using dry needling from an exception to unlawful and unprofessional conduct to a requirement for licensing;<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of both physical therapy and occupational therapy to include dry needling; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies that no referral is needed for physical therapy or occupational therapy;<hr><ltbullet>creates a registration requirement for an occupational therapist to engage in dry needling; <hr><ltbullet>allows occupational therapists to assist with mental wellness; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Public Education Course Grade Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill prohibits a local education agency (LEA) from requiring student attendance at an off-campus event.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an LEA from requiring a student to attend an off-campus event as a condition for grades or academic credit;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits adverse effects on a student's grades or academic standing due to non-attendance at an off-campus event; and<hr><ltbullet>requires an LEA to provide optional transportation, a fee waiver, and alternative options for students to meet academic requirements.

bills.title: Motorcycle Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill defines terms and prohibits certain maneuvers related to the operation of a motorcycle.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for location and visibility of a license plate on a motorcycle;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to a motorcycle;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits lane splitting;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the performance of a wheelie by a motorcycle operator on a highway; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Driver License Division to suspend an individual's motorcycle endorsement or driver license for certain violations;<hr><ltbullet>allows law enforcement to impound a motorcycle for certain violations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: High School Credit Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of an instructional packet to receive credit in public high schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency to award a high school student credit for a course completed through the packet method if the packet meets certain requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to review and approve packets;<hr><ltbullet>creates a sunset for a certain report;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement.

bills.title: Public Education Scholarship Program Use Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill prohibits certain expenses from being scholarship expenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain expenses from being scholarship expenses; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Ballot Signature Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the signature-gathering process for an individual seeking the nomination of a political party.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for an individual running for elective office who is:<hr><ltbullet1>seeking the nomination of a qualified political party under the signature-gathering process, reduces the number of signatures that the individual must collect to obtain the nomination; or<hr><ltbullet1>seeking the nomination of a registered political party that is not a qualified political party, enables the individual to obtain the nomination by gathering the same number of signatures as an individual seeking the nomination of a qualified political party for the same office; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Beekeeping and Veterinary Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses veterinarian-client-patient relationship and bees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides for the veterinarian-client-patient relationship with regard to bees; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Firearm Retention Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill address the retention in evidence of seized firearms.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a plea in abeyance from allowing a condition of the plea that the defendant forfeits the defendant's firearms in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires firearms seized by law enforcement from an individual as a result of the individual committing a criminal offense to be returned to the individual if the individual may lawfully possess the firearm and is not charged with a crime that would make the individual a restricted person;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill, H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, and H.B. 133, Dangerous Weapons Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Traction Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a highway authority's ability to regulate a controlled-access highway.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a highway authority may limit traffic under certain conditions; and<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority.

bills.title: Criminal Conduct Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the crime of enticing a minor and provisions related to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the crime of enticing a minor;<hr><ltbullet>adds factors that a sentencing court must consider in making a determination regarding whether an individual under 21 years old used force or coercion when committing a registrable offense for purposes of determining registration length on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies which prosecuting agency is required to receive a petition from an offender petitioning to be removed from the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry and the responsibilities of that agency in notifying the victim regarding the petition; <hr><ltbullet>requires an offender on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry who is required to register on the registry because of an offense committed in another jurisdiction to be removed from the other jurisdiction's registry in order to be removed from the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Highway Expansion Impacts on Signage Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the relocation of a billboard due to road construction or other highway changes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the relocation of a billboard if the billboard was obstructed or impacted by the widening, construction, reconstruction, or other improvements appurtenant to the relevant highway.

bills.title: Substance Use Treatment and Enforcement Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses treatment and enforcement issues related to substance use.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local substance abuse authority to include in the authority's annual plan a list of available substance use service providers, in a form and format usable by first responders; <hr><ltbullet>requires a local mental health authority to include in the authority's annual plan a list of available mental health service providers, in a form and format usable by first responders;<hr><ltbullet>allows and encourages first responders to offer a referral to substance use or mental health services to an individual who experiences an intentional or accidental overdose;<hr><ltbullet>addresses requirements for syringe exchange programs and information collected relating to syringe exchange programs;<hr><ltbullet>allows an opioid treatment program to operate a mobile unit to provide medication to treat substance use withdrawal symptoms or an opioid use disorder, and provides certain requirements for operation of a mobile unit;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the Department of Health and Human Services regarding the requirements for operating a mobile unit to provide medication to treat substance use withdrawal symptoms or an opioid use disorder; <hr><ltbullet>amends criminal provisions of the Utah Controlled Substances Act;<hr><ltbullet>creates the crime of maintenance of a drug-involved premises;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding civil nuisance actions, including provisions that relate to a nuisance caused by unlawful actions related to a controlled substance;<hr><ltbullet>repeals intent language;<hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause between this bill and H.B. 355, Critical Infrastructure Materials Amendments, to provide that changes made to Section 76B-6-1101 in H.B. 355 are incorporated into changes this bill makes to that section; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Encourages first responders to use a list from local authorities to connect or refer individuals to mental health or substance use treatment providers. Allows mobile medication-assisted treatment for

bills.title: Outdoor Recreation Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Division of Outdoor Recreation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the lands that the governor may keep open and operational during a fiscal emergency;<hr><ltbullet>changes the reporting subcommittee for the Division of Outdoor Recreation report on recreation restoration infrastructure grants; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Energy Resource Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the evaluation of integrated resource plans by the Public Service Commission.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires full cost attribution for supplemental resources in integrated resource plans;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for calculating generation capacity;<hr><ltbullet>requires an affected electrical utility to include certain designations in the utility's action plan;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain involuntary demand management programs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Private Landowner Big Game Revisions
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the hunting of big game.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the criteria for a landowner draw;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures to become an applicant for a landowner draw;<hr><ltbullet>addresses receipt of other vouchers;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the redeeming of a voucher;<hr><ltbullet>requires compliance with other laws; <hr><ltbullet>addresses rulemaking; and<hr><ltbullet>addresses landowners associations.

bills.title: Cannabis Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to medical cannabis.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows for additional medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>creates a new medical cannabis pharmacy license for independent medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>creates ownership restrictions for independent medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts fees for certain medical cannabis pharmacy licenses;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding cannabis production and sanitation;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to enforcement and appeals;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to closed-door medical cannabis pharmacies;<hr><ltbullet>allows a cannabis processing facility to have a website that includes product information;<hr><ltbullet>limits the number of licenses that the Department of Agriculture and Food (department) may issue for cannabis processing facilities;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding when the department may seize products and test products;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to information a medical cannabis pharmacy must have available to a patient purchasing medical cannabis;<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement for the department;<hr><ltbullet>repeals sections related to the state central patient portal;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the creation of patient product information inserts;<hr><ltbullet>moves the repeal date for the Cannabis Research Review Board earlier one year;<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date for the Medical Cannabis Governance Structure Working Group; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Stipends for Future Educators Grant Program Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding the Stipends for Future Educators Grant Program (program).
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a student teacher is eligible for the program regardless of the institution at which the student teacher is enrolled;<hr><ltbullet>limits the availability of program funds if the student teacher receives funding from another state program;<hr><ltbullet>provides for one-time funding from a certain account in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to annually report the anticipated cost of certain one-time appropriations to the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Ballot Counting and Ballot Drop Box Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to mailed ballots and ballot drop boxes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that, for a ballot that is mailed to be valid, the election officer must receive the ballot before the polls close on election day;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer to ensure that at least one ballot drop box is located no more than a 60-minute drive from 95% of registered voters in the election officer's jurisdiction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires that a county clerk receive a mail-in ballot by the time the polls close on election day and that a ballot drop box be located within 60 miles of 95% of a county's voters.

bills.title: Chronic Absenteeism Pilot Program
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Attendance Advantage - my529 Initiative Pilot Program.
