bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education (state board) to make rules establishing the Attendance Advantage - my529 Initiative Pilot Program (program);<hr><ltbullet>requires coordination between the state board and the Utah Educational Savings Plan;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for program design and implementation;<hr><ltbullet>requires participating local education agencies to follow state board attendance data standards;<hr><ltbullet>requires analysis of program effectiveness; and<hr><ltbullet>makes program records containing individual student data protected.

bills.title: Sexual Offense Revisions
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill changes certain sexual offenses and sentencing for sexual offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends sentencing provisions concerning repeat and habitual sex offenders, including requiring mandatory imprisonment;<hr><ltbullet>provides a definition of a female breast for purposes of certain sexual and sexual exploitation offenses that includes a breast that is undeveloped or partially developed;<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of "child sexual abuse material" to include a minor observing or being used for sexually explicit conduct;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "sexual explicit conduct" concerning certain bodily functions;<hr><ltbullet>changes the mental state necessary to commit the offense of sexual exploitation of a minor;<hr><ltbullet>expands the offense of sexual exploitation of a minor to include when an actor accesses child sexual abuse material with the intent to view;<hr><ltbullet>provides a safe harbor provision for certain employees and independent contractors who are required to access or view child sexual abuse material within the scope of employment;<hr><ltbullet>changes the mental state necessary to commit the offense of aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor;<hr><ltbullet>amends the offense of aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor to remove a lesser penalty for circumstances when the child sexual abuse material depicts an individual who is 14 years old or older and pubescent; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to merge the changes to Section 76-3-406 if both this bill and H.B. 78, Criminal Offenses Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Urban Farming Assessment Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the application for assessment under the Urban Farming Assessment Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the requirement for an owner of land eligible for assessment under the Urban Farming Assessment Act to submit an annual renewal application;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which the county assessor may ask for additional information from an owner; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeschool Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to home school affidavits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when a letter of intent to homeschool is required from parents;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement for parents to submit an affidavit for students who begin homeschooling at the start of an academic year;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement for parents to attest to criminal background history;<hr><ltbullet>establishes procedures for local school boards to process letters of intent;<hr><ltbullet>removes liability from local school boards after student unenrollment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Higher Education Board of Trustees Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the requirements for appointment to the board of trustees of a degree-granting institution.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>requires a member of the board of trustees of a degree-granting institution to be a Utah resident;<hr><ltbullet>amends the requirements for appointed members of the board of trustees for a degree-granting institution and technical college; and<hr><ltbullet>requires applicants to provide additional application information.

bills.title: Enhanced Penalties Following Unlawful Reentry Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates enhanced penalties for a felony offense committed by an individual who previously has been convicted of a federal unlawful reentry criminal offense.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates enhanced penalties for a felony offense committed by an individual who previously has been convicted of a federal unlawful reentry criminal offense.

bills.title: Advanced Transmission Technologies
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the Energy Resource Procurement Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>outlines cost-effectiveness analyses and approval procedures when a large-scale electric utility (utility) proposes advanced transmission technology deployment; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that a utility may recover approved costs.

bills.title: Voting Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to elections and voting.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that, beginning in 2026:<hr><ltbullet1>elections will be conducted both in person and by mail, rather than primarily by mail; and<hr><ltbullet1>a ballot will only be mailed to a voter who requests mailing or who is covered by the Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a voter may request to receive a ballot by mail in 2026 and beyond by making the request to a poll worker at the time the voter votes in person, making the request in a voter registration form, or making the request by submitting a separate form;<hr><ltbullet>modifies voter registration forms, and temporarily modifies a ballot return envelope, to permit a voter to request a mailed ballot in future elections using those documents;<hr><ltbullet>provides that, beginning in 2026, a ballot will not be mailed to a voter if the voter:<hr><ltbullet1>requests that a ballot not be mailed;<hr><ltbullet1>does not indicate a desire to receive a ballot when asked in person or via a form; or<hr><ltbullet1>fails to vote in a regular general election;<hr><ltbullet>subject to certain exceptions relating to military and overseas voters, provides that, for a ballot to be valid, the ballot must be received before the close of polls on the day of the election;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for notifying active voters of the requirement to request a mailed ballot for future elections;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a request to receive a mailed ballot must be remade if a voter fails to vote in a regular general election; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a voter to vote in person unless they request to vote by mail at least 60 days before an election. Also requires a county clerk to remove a voter from their vote by mail list if the voter did

bills.title: Employer Verification Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to employer verification of employees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Private Employer Verification Act, impacting a private employer who employs 15 or more employees; <hr><ltbullet>cites criminal penalties that may be applicable to the use of fraudulent identification documentation or another person's identification documentation for purposes of obtaining employment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Office of Legislative Auditor General Provisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions governing the duties and powers of the legislative auditor general.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>restates the legislative auditor general's constitutional authority;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions governing information that maybe subject to federal law and is requested by the legislative auditor general from an entity, including the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the legislative auditor general to provide certain information to an audited entity;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions governing criminal interference with a legislative audit;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "chief officer" for purposes of an entity responding to a legislative audit;<hr><ltbullet>permits the legislative auditor general to identify an individual other than a chief officer to respond to a legislative audit; <hr><ltbullet>amends provisions governing an audit response plan and an update to a plan;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the legislative auditor general to review and monitor the Utah System of Higher Education; and<hr><ltbullet>makes other technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Income Tax Revenue Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to state income tax revenue.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission, the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst, and the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget to annually determine by consensus whether federal tax law changes will likely result in a material increase in state income tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to submit a report to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee if a determination is made by consensus that federal tax law changes will likely result in a material increase in state income tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee, upon receiving a report, to recommend legislative action for the next general session to negate the material increase in state income tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to submit a report to the Division of Finance following the general session if a determination is made by consensus that a material increase in state income tax revenue is still expected;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Income Tax Surplus Restricted Account (account);<hr><ltbullet>specifies purposes for which revenue deposited into the account may be used; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Finance, upon receiving a report, to deposit the estimated amount of the material increase in state income tax revenue into the account.

bills.title: Homeowners' Association Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to homeowners' associations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Office of the Homeowners' Association Ombudsman;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the duties, jurisdiction, and functions of the Office of the Homeowners' Association Ombudsman;<hr><ltbullet>requires that Office of the Homeowners' Association Ombudsman issue an advisory opinion under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which an advisory opinion of the Office of the Homeowners' Association Ombudsman is admissible in a subsequent proceeding;<hr><ltbullet>makes void and unenforceable a homeowners' association transfer fee under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements that a homeowners' association shall meet before imposing a fee or charge;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for a homeowners' association to impose a reinvestment fee;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association notify an owner in writing of a denied unit or lot plan;<hr><ltbullet>restricts a homeowners' association from making certain rules;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Department of Commerce to set and impose an annual registration fee on a homeowners' association;<hr><ltbullet>requires a homeowners' association to renew the homeowners' association's registration with the Department of Commerce annually;<hr><ltbullet>sets limits on the amount a homeowners' association may charge as a late fee;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association provide, upon request, certain documents;<hr><ltbullet>increases the monetary amount a homeowners' association may charge an owner when producing certain documents;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a declarant from selling a part of a common area during the period of administrative control under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides new requirements to amend a homeowners' association's governing documents;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a declarant from using association funds in a legal action brought by a homeowner against the declarant before the end of the period of administrative control;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a homeowners' association from restricting, denying, or delaying a plan due to the plan's inclusion of a fire-resistant material in an area with a heightened risk of wildfire;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a homeowners' association from charging any costs associated with the electronic transmission of certain documents;<hr><ltbullet>increases the monetary amount an owner may request from a homeowners' association if the homeowners' association fails to make documents available to the owner under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>amends the conditions for the termination of a period of administrative control for an association of lot owners;<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for a declarant of an association of lot owners during the period of administrative control; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a repeal date for the Office of the Homeowners' Association Ombudsman and requires legislative review before the repeal.

bills.title: Charter School Funding Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies criteria for qualifying charter schools under the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program;<hr><ltbullet>expands evaluation standards for charter school operating history;<hr><ltbullet>specifies financial metrics for program qualification;<hr><ltbullet>establishes additional requirements for annual program certification;<hr><ltbullet>creates parameters for state appropriation repayment procedures; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Charter School Funding Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies criteria for qualifying charter schools under the Charter School Credit Enhancement Program;<hr><ltbullet>expands evaluation standards for charter school operating history;<hr><ltbullet>specifies financial metrics for program qualification;<hr><ltbullet>establishes additional requirements for annual program certification;<hr><ltbullet>establishes credit rating-based maintenance fees for participating charter schools;<hr><ltbullet>creates parameters for state appropriation repayment procedures; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Transportation Network Company Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to a transportation network company.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a cause of action for an individual against a transportation network company when the transportation network company fails to maintain proper insurance and the individual is injured in a vehicle accident that the transportation network company arranges.

bills.title: Burglary Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the criminal offense of damaging a firearm storage container or safety device during the commission of a burglary.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offense of damaging a firearm storage container or safety device during the commission of a burglary; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Access to Traffic Accident Evidence
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to accident reports and other related records and the disclosure of those records to an attorney representing a person involved in the accident.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides for disclosure of certain records and certain unredacted records relevant to an accident to an attorney representing a person involved in the accident;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the disclosure of certain protected records to an attorney representing a person involved in a relevant accident and defines liability if such a record is unlawfully shared publicly; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: State Grant Requirements
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state grants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>upon a grantee's request, requires an administering agency to disclose the administering agency's costs associated with administering a grant.

bills.title: Inmate Reentry, Finances, and Debt Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns inmate and former inmate reentry, finances, and debts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires, with a delayed implementation date, a county jail to notify certain state agencies that may have information concerning an inmate's existing debts when an inmate is incarcerated in the county jail for more than 90 days and when the inmate is released from the county jail;<hr><ltbullet>requires, with a delayed implementation date, the Office of State Debt Collection to suspend the accrual of interest on certain accounts receivable during periods of at least 90 days of incarceration and for an additional period after release;<hr><ltbullet>expands the duties of the reentry division created by the Department of Corrections (department); <hr><ltbullet>requires the department to provide information to an inmate on a regular basis concerning:<hr><ltbullet1> the inmate's known debts;<hr><ltbullet1>incentives for paying certain debts while incarcerated; and<hr><ltbullet1>information on how to access additional information concerning debts and resources on financial literacy and money management;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department:<hr><ltbullet1>with a delayed implementation date, to notify certain state agencies that may have information concerning an inmate's existing debts when an inmate enters and leaves incarceration; and<hr><ltbullet1>to provide educational resources to individuals designated by an inmate concerning incentives for repaying certain debts while incarcerated; <hr><ltbullet>amends provisions concerning when incarceration may not be considered by the Office of Recovery Services (office) as voluntary unemployment for purposes of a child support order;<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to suspend child support orders and money judgments in certain circumstances relating to incarceration;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the office shall resume a suspended child support obligation after the offender has been released for 90 days; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Zone Speeding Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses penalties for speeding in a school zone.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the speed limit at which a first time offender must observe a crossing guard.

bills.title: Criminal Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses criminal offenses and repercussions from those offenses
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a county sheriff to notify and coordinate with the relevant federal immigration authority when preparing to release from the county jail an individual who:<hr><ltbullet1>is being released after serving the individual's jail sentence for certain class A misdemeanors or a felony; and <hr><ltbullet1>is unlawfully present in the United States;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to notify and coordinate with the relevant federal immigration authority when preparing to release an inmate who:<hr><ltbullet1>is being released after serving a term of imprisonment for a felony; and<hr><ltbullet1>is unlawfully present in the United States;<hr><ltbullet>amends the sentence of imprisonment for a class A misdemeanor to one year for certain offenses;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain pretrial release provisions to add a rebuttable presumption that an individual is a flight risk if the individual is not lawfully present in the United States; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Restricted Person Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to those who are restricted persons regarding dangerous weapons.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>makes a person a restricted person if the person has been found not guilty by reason of insanity for any criminal offense not just a felony level offense;<hr><ltbullet> makes a person a restricted person if the person has been found mentally incompetent to stand trial for any criminal offense not just a felony level offense; and<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and H.B. 133, Dangerous Weapon Amendments.

bills.title: Public Education Immunization Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding a student's immunization record.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes provisions about the expiration of a vaccination exemption form;<hr><ltbullet>requires a school to provide a student's immunization record to a new school when the school transmits a transferring student's school record; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Transportation Funds Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to corridor preservation to include fixed guideway public transit facilities for corridor preservation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to corridor preservation to include fixed guideway public transit facilities for corridor preservation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Blockchain and Digital Innovation Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates authority for the state treasurer to invest public funds in certain digital assets.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits state and local governmental entities from restricting the acceptance or custody of digital assets;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the right to operate nodes, develop software, transfer digital assets, and participate in staking on blockchain protocols;<hr><ltbullet>creates exemptions from money transmitter licensing requirements for certain blockchain and digital asset activities;<hr><ltbullet>restricts the ability of political subdivisions to impose sound limitations or zoning restrictions on digital asset mining businesses in industrial zones; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Primary Election Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses primary elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that, for certain primary election races, the person who wins the nomination will be determined by conducting a runoff election between the two candidates who received the most votes in the initial primary election if: <hr><ltbullet1>no candidate receives more than 50% of the votes in the race; and<hr><ltbullet1>the candidate who receives the highest number of votes does not receive at least 10% more of the total votes cast in the race than the candidate who receives the second highest number of votes;<hr><ltbullet>describes deadlines, notice requirements, and procedures relating to a runoff election, including party affiliation deadlines and procedures for a military or overseas voter to cast a ballot in a runoff election; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Candidate Nomination Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to nominating candidates for elective office and placing candidates on a ballot.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions relating to a qualified political party;<hr><ltbullet>establishes two types of registered political parties:<hr><ltbullet1>a primary nominating party that nominates candidates through signature-gathering only, participates in the regular primary election, and has the name of the primary nominating party listed on the regular general election ballot in association with the party's candidates; and<hr><ltbullet1>a convention nominating party that nominates candidates using a method that does not involve the signature-gathering process described in the preceding paragraph or participation in the regular primary election, and whose candidates are listed on the regular general election ballot without an indication of the convention nominating party that nominated the candidates;<hr><ltbullet>requires a registered political party to choose whether to be a primary nominating party or a convention nominating party;<hr><ltbullet>modifies signature gathering thresholds; and<hr><ltbullet>  makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Curriculum Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill restricts certain entities from involvement in health education in public schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a local education agency from allowing entities that perform elective abortions to provide health-related instruction or materials in public schools.

bills.title: Motorcycle Safety Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill increases a fine for a person who operates a motorcycle without a motorcycle endorsement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases a fine for a person who operates a motorcycle without a motorcycle endorsement on the person's driver license; <hr><ltbullet>requires a court to waive the increased fine if the person obtains a motorcycle endorsement within 30 days of the date of the plea or sentencing; and<hr><ltbullet>allows a court to extend the 30-day period if the court finds it reasonable and necessary.

bills.title: County Auditor Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to a county auditor in a county of the first class.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes professional requirements for a county auditor in a county of the first class or a candidate seeking the office of county auditor in a county of the first class; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: County Career Service Council Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to county career service councils.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a county career service council may award reasonable attorney fees to a prevailing career service county employee; <hr><ltbullet>provides that an appointment to fill a vacancy on the career service council shall be only for the unexpired term of the appointee's predecessor; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Rollback Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to property taxes and fees imposed when land is no longer used for agricultural purposes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the county to use 100% of the rollback tax or fee-in-lieu revenue collected within the county when land is no longer used for agricultural purposes for open land and agricultural use;<hr><ltbullet>directs the unused rollback tax or fee-in-lieu revenue from the county where the land is located to the LeRay McAllister Working Farm and Ranch Fund after five years;<hr><ltbullet>updates the sources of revenue to the LeRay McAllister Working Farm and Ranch Fund to include the rollback tax and fee-in-lieu revenue; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Department of Health and Human Services Account Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses interest earned on certain funds and accounts related to the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for certain funds and accounts related to the Department of Health and Human Services, provides that the funds and accounts shall earn interest and that the interest shall be deposited into the originating fund or account; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Disaster Funds Revisions
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns disaster funds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the State Disaster Recovery Restricted Account to change the amounts that may be expended by the Division of Emergency Management under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>renames the Response, Recovery, and Post-disaster Mitigation Restricted Account as the Disaster Response, Recovery, and Mitigation Restricted Account (account);<hr><ltbullet>modifies the amounts of funds available from the account for disaster response and recovery under specified circumstances; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the available uses for funds in the account to include pre-disaster mitigation under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies standards relating to disaster response and recovery grants;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the Division of Emergency Management regarding the use of funds from the account for pre-disaster mitigation purposes;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Finance to transfer certain funds from the State Disaster Recovery Restricted Account into the account under certain conditions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Urban Farming Assessment Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to property tax assessment under the Urban Farming Assessment Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows for land to qualify for urban farming assessment based on gross sales in addition to qualifying based on agricultural production;<hr><ltbullet>provides for land to continue to qualify for urban farming assessment based on gross sales upon failing to meet certain timing requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires an applicant for urban farming assessment to submit documentation to the county assessor demonstrating the land meets the agricultural production or gross sales requirements;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a portion of land may qualify for urban farming assessment even if other portions of the land do not qualify;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the requirement for an owner of land approved for urban farming assessment to submit an annual renewal application;<hr><ltbullet>establishes circumstances under which a county assessor may request additional information from an owner of land approved for urban farming assessment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Solar Power Plant Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to utility scale solar power plants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes eligibility criteria for state incentives for solar power plants based on land characteristics;<hr><ltbullet>provides for reduction of incentives for solar power plants located on certain protected farmland;<hr><ltbullet>creates exemptions for solar power plants with existing agreements or incentives;<hr><ltbullet>requires wildlife impact consultation with state or federal agencies for solar power plants;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for decommissioning plans and financial assurance for solar power plants;<hr><ltbullet>creates a permitting process for solar power plants;<hr><ltbullet>requires submission and approval of development plans for solar power plants; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for severability.

bills.title: Presidential Electors Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the distribution of electoral votes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>in an election for president and vice president of the United States:<hr><ltbullet1>allocates one electoral vote for the presidential and vice presidential candidates that receive the highest number of votes in a Congressional district;<hr><ltbullet1>allocates two electoral votes for the presidential and vice presidential candidates that receive the highest number of statewide votes; and<hr><ltbullet1>requires a registered political party, an unaffiliated candidate, or a write-in candidate to notify the lieutenant governor if there is a vacancy in the office of presidential elector; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Agricultural Water Optimization Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses agricultural water optimization.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the Agricultural Water Optimization Committee to use certain money to fund research;<hr><ltbullet>modifies eligibility requirements related to grants for agricultural water optimization; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Wildlife Management Area Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses wildlife management areas.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>directs the creation of a wildlife management area known as the Bear River Bay Waterfowl Management Area; <hr><ltbullet>provides limits and requirements related to the Bear River Bay Waterfowl Management Area;<hr><ltbullet>removes restrictions on impounding structures in certain waterfowl management areas;<hr><ltbullet>removes prohibitions related to the regulation of airboats or small watercraft in certain waterfowl management areas; <hr><ltbullet>requires the creation of an advisory committee for the Willard Spur Waterfowl Management Area under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Tobacco Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to sales of cigars and pipe tobacco.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes telephone, mail, Internet, and other remote sales of a cigar or pipe tobacco;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the licensing, bonding, and taxation of cigar and pipe tobacco transactions between a remote seller and a consumer in the state;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a criminal penalty for failing to comply with the licensing and bonding requirements; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the tax rate on a cigar; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Statewide Online Education Program Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to enhance quality, accountability, and transparency in the Statewide Online Education Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the State Board of Education (state board) to conduct sample audits of online courses;<hr><ltbullet>expands performance reporting requirements for an authorized online course provider;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to establish a report card for an authorized online course provider;<hr><ltbullet>facilitates regular communication between an authorized online course provider and a primary LEA of enrollment;<hr><ltbullet>implements a model syllabus template for online courses;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to create a centralized registration system for parents and students; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: School Swimming and Lifeguarding Programs
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions in public education related to water safety.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the inclusion of water safety instruction in the public education core curriculum standards for physical education;<hr><ltbullet>allows the exemption of a student from required water safety instruction under certain circumstances;  <hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency (LEA) to:<hr><ltbullet1>provide swim instruction, lifeguard certification training, and swim instructor certification training as courses under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet1>construe the completion of certain courses toward physical education credit requirements or other requirements; and<hr><ltbullet1>enter into an agreement with certain providers to offer certain programs; and<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the State Board of Education.

bills.title: Veteran Protections Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses protections for veterans.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Division of Consumer Protection is responsible for enforcing civil penalties for individuals who unlawfully provide veterans with assistance in obtaining VA benefits;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies what conduct is not permitted when providing veterans with assistance in obtaining VA benefits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Nuclear Power Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Nuclear Energy Consortium and the Utah Energy Council, establishes a process for designating energy development zones, and creates the Energy Development Investment Fund.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Nuclear Energy Consortium within the Office of Energy Development (office) and establishes its membership and duties;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah Energy Council within the office and establishes its membership and duties;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties and name of the Utah San Rafael Energy Lab Board;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for designating electrical energy development zones;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Electrical Energy Development Investment Fund and provides for its administration;<hr><ltbullet>establishes authorized uses of fund money; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to coordinate between this bill and H.B. 70, Decommissioned Asset Disposition Amendments.

bills.title: Public Employee Gender-specific Language Requirements
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill prohibits certain employment action against a public employee in relation to gender-specific language.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> prohibits the State Board of Education, a local education agency, or a public employer from taking disciplinary action against an employee for using gender-specific language in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires a public employer that has a rule or policy requiring an employee to use gender-specific language to accommodate another individual to exempt the employee from disciplinary action in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Pollinator Program Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the pollinator pilot program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>renames the pollinator pilot program to the pollinator habitat program;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the scheduled sunset date for the pollinator pilot program; <hr><ltbullet>makes the pollinator habitat program permanent; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Custody Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to individuals in state custody.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to treatments government entities may provide to individuals in state custody;<hr><ltbullet>amends housing provisions related to youth juvenile detention and secure care facilities;<hr><ltbullet>amends criminal laws related to improper relationships with individuals in state custody; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Agriculture and Food Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues related to the regulation, oversight, or encouragement of agriculture and food.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "qualified veterinarian";<hr><ltbullet>changes references to the National Council on Weights and Measures;<hr><ltbullet>changes the Utah Fertilizer Act to the Utah Plant Food Act, including modifying definitions and making conforming references;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Utah Agriculture Certificate of Environmental Stewardship Program;<hr><ltbullet>changes the time frames for annual fees under the Agricultural and Wildlife Damage Prevention Act;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the expiration of livestock brands;<hr><ltbullet>modifies information to be provided to operate a livestock market;<hr><ltbullet>amends the Domesticated Elk Act to address licensing, record retention, health information, and marking of domesticated elk;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that money in the LeRay McAllister Working Farm and Ranch Fund Program is nonlapsing;<hr><ltbullet>changes the Agriculture Conservation Easement Account to an expendable special revenue fund;<hr><ltbullet>addresses use of money in the Agriculture Resource Development Fund to pay administrative costs;<hr><ltbullet>addresses regulation of livestock by political subdivisions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the earmarking of sales and use taxes related to the Division of Conservation within the Department of Agriculture and Food;<hr><ltbullet>addresses grants under the agricultural water optimization program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Waste Classification Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill relates to nuclear waste classification.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of high-level nuclear waste and low-level radioactive waste; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Local Land Use Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to minor subdivisions of agricultural land in a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes an owner of at least 50 contiguous acres of agricultural land in a county of the third, fourth, fifth, or sixth class to create a new parcel that, after the division, is separate from the remainder of the original 50 contiguous acres of agricultural land; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipal and County Zoning Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the authority of municipalities and counties regarding short-term rentals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a municipality or county that regulates short-term rentals may use a listing or offering on a short-term rental website as evidence that a short-term rental took place so long as the municipality or county has additional information to support its position that an owner or lessee violated a municipality or county ordinance;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may require the owner of a short-term rental to obtain a business license or other permit from the municipality or county to operate a short-term rental in the municipality or in an unincorporated area of the county;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may request a short-term rental website remove a listing or offering that violates business licensing requirements or zoning requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county that imposes transient room tax on short-term rentals may provide a listing or offering on a short-term rental website to the county auditor as evidence that a short-term rental owner or lessee may be subject to the transient room tax; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Pharmacy Benefit Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health insurance pharmacy benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commissioner of the Insurance Department to assist in creating a form if requested;<hr><ltbullet>requires a health benefit plan to ensure pharmaceutical rebates are used for certain purposes; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a pharmacy benefit manager to offer certain options to self-funded health benefit plans.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, requires a health insurance plan to give an enrollee their portion of a drug rebate, use it to reduce enrollees' out-of-pocket costs, or enhance their benefit.

bills.title: Medicare Supplement Insurance Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding Medicare supplement insurance coverage.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows enrollees of Medicare supplement insurance plans to select comparable or lower tier plans; and<hr><ltbullet>does not allow an issuer to deny coverage based on medical underwriting when selecting a comparable or lower tier plan.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Prohibits an insurer from denying coverage to an enrollee who changes to a plan with the same or less coverage within 60 days after their birthday.

bills.title: Tax Commission Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the executive director and motor vehicle enforcement administrator of the State Tax Commission.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the motor vehicle enforcement administrator of the State Tax Commission reports to the executive director of the State Tax Commission; and<hr><ltbullet>modifies the salary and benefits of the executive director of the State Tax Commission.

bills.title: First Credential Program
bills.general_provisions: This bill replaces the PRIME program to create the First Credential program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires designated pathway development positions to perform certain duties; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the PRIME program;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a first credential program;<hr><ltbullet>requires development of a master plan for scaling credentialing programs;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a master credential list of approved industry-recognized credentials;<hr><ltbullet>ensures credits are transferable to higher education institutions and technical colleges;<hr><ltbullet>provides a scholarship for students who complete the first credential program;<hr><ltbullet>requires annual review and updates based on labor market needs;<hr><ltbullet>provides a grant for implementation and incentives for outcomes;<hr><ltbullet>mandates partnerships between schools, employers, and apprenticeship programs;<hr><ltbullet>promotes stackable credentials that lead to career advancement;<hr><ltbullet>coordinates language with other legislation contingent upon passage;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Towing Modifications
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the towing and impoundment of vehicles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to impounded or towed vehicles to allow a state impound yard or tow yard to release a vehicle to certain individuals beside the owner if certain requirements are met;<hr><ltbullet>requires a private property owner who contracts with a tower to patrol a parking lot to publish information about the agreement with the tower for the public to view;<hr><ltbullet>allows signage for towing and parking restrictions to remain valid if the signage substantially conforms with the statutory standards;<hr><ltbullet>requires a tow truck motor carrier or impound yard to allow an individual to remove personal items from a vehicle if the individual has paid the towing fee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a tow truck motor carrier to provide to the Department of Transportation information about each towing dispatch rotation that includes the tow truck motor carrier;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Transportation to require the removal from a towing dispatch rotation a tow truck motor carrier that has violated relevant towing laws and regulations;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a local government from imposing a maximum rate that deviates from the towing rates established by the Department of Transportation in administrative rule; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: HOA Board Education Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes education requirements for members of a homeowners' association board.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association board member complete education requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association board member or secretary maintain a record of completing the education requirements for at least four years;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association board member report completion of the education requirements to the homeowners' association;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy for an owner for when a homeowners' association board member fails to meet the education requirements;<hr><ltbullet>describes how a homeowners' association board member may remedy noncompliance with education requirements;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a board of a homeowners' association to remove a board member who fails to remedy noncompliance;<hr><ltbullet>creates a standard for a person that offers education requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the Department of Commerce maintain a list of persons authorized to offer education requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that the requirements enacted by this bill do not take effect until after the period of administrative control.

bills.title: Election Record Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to records created or used during an election.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes the recorded video of ballot processing a public record for purposes of the Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA);<hr><ltbullet>specifies that an election officer shall retain and preserve ballot chain of custody documentation created during an election;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an election officer shall package and retain the election database, cast vote record, and other materials used in the programming of automatic tabulating equipment;<hr><ltbullet>for an election administered by a county clerk:<hr><ltbullet1>directs the county clerk to make, preserve, and retain for at least 12 years an electronic copy of certain election material;<hr><ltbullet1>authorizes, in certain circumstances, the county clerk or county legislative body to examine the electronic copy of election material to conduct research related to an election;<hr><ltbullet1>requires the county clerk to grant certain governmental entities access to the electronic copy of election material to conduct research related to an election; and<hr><ltbullet1>creates a process for a governmental entity to conduct a multi-county review of the electronic copy of election material;<hr><ltbullet>specifies that an electronic copy of election material is not a record for purposes of GRAMA;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an election officer's obligation to seal official ballots and election returns does not prohibit a county clerk, an auditor, or the lieutenant governor from accessing the electronic copy of election material;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an election officer shall retain and preserve the election database, cast vote record, and other materials for 22 months after an election;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to information an election officer is required to report in a ballot reconciliation report and board of canvassers report;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the amount of time that an election officer has to publicize the certified board of canvassers report from seven to three days;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer to make a copy of the certified board of canvassers report available to members of the public in portable document format; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to reflect the changes made to certain voter registration provisions in H.B. 270, Voter Registration Records Amendments, if this bill and H.B. 270 both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Tax Incentives Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies and repeals provisions related to income tax incentives.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>limits the eligibility for claiming the corporate or individual income tax credit for clean energy systems to systems that are placed in service before January 1, 2035; and<hr><ltbullet>repeals the individual income tax credit for qualifying solar projects and the corporate and individual income tax credits for alternative energy development.

bills.title: Higher Education Strategic Reinvestment
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts and amends provisions regarding the strategic approach of and investment in certain programs in the higher education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain reporting to and a study by the Higher Education Appropriations Subcommittee;<hr><ltbullet>provides for disbursement of certain reinvestment funds that are dedicated to a given degree-granting institution for reallocation to certain strategic investments under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires each degree-granting institution to create a strategic reinvestment plan to reallocate funding from certain programs and divisions of the institution to certain programs and divisions that merit additional investment;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Board of Higher Education (board) to report to the Higher Education Appropriations Subcommittee and the Executive Appropriations Subcommittee regarding each institution's strategic reinvestment plan and execution of the plan over the upcoming three fiscal years;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes declining use of reinvestment funds to phase out reduced or eliminated programs or divisions of institutions over the upcoming three fiscal years;<hr><ltbullet>limits the number of credit hours a degree-granting institution may require between general education and degree-specific requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires the board to develop a process to grant conditional approval of accelerated three-year degrees;<hr><ltbullet>allows the board to transfer certain appropriations as an exception to the prohibition on line-item transfers in the Budgetary Procedures Act;<hr><ltbullet>coordinates with H.B. 51, Higher Education Reporting Amendments, to address subcommittee reports; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Veteran Housing Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses veteran homelessness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Homeless Services Board and the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to work in conjunction to create best practices for assisting veterans experiencing homelessness; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs to work together on best practices for serving veterans experiencing homelessness.

bills.title: Public Sector Labor Union Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions governing public employee, public safety, and public fire labor organizations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a labor organization for which a public employer collects union dues to provide an annual accounting to the labor organization members and to the Labor Commission;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a public employer from recognizing a labor organization as a bargaining agent for public employees;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a public employer from entering into collective bargaining contracts;<hr><ltbullet> prohibits using public money or public property to assist, promote, or deter union organizing or administration;<hr><ltbullet>excludes new labor organization employees from participating in Utah Retirement Systems;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the state risk manager to acquire and administer professional liability insurance for:<hr><ltbullet1> disputes between a K-12 personnel and a public employer; and<hr><ltbullet1>other public employees if there is a sufficient demand; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Nonresident Online School Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies resident district payments to a nonresident district under certain circumstances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies resident district payments to a nonresident district under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Privacy Protections in Sex-designated Areas
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions regarding sex-designated privacy spaces in education and government facilities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Board of Higher Education to provide guidance regarding student housing that degree-granting institutions own or control;<hr><ltbullet>provides a definitional change for nonprofit exceptions to and broadens the scope of a nonprofit educational institution exception to the Utah Fair Housing Act;<hr><ltbullet>narrows an exception for a prohibition on sex-based distinctions to apply only to a determination of the School Activity Eligibility Commission and a student's participation in a certain gender-designated interscholastic activity;<hr><ltbullet>removes an ambiguous medical treatment documentation provision from certain lists of evidence supporting an individual's access to certain sex-designated privacy spaces;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding government entity facility compliance to specify which government entity bears certain duties;<hr><ltbullet>requires degree-granting institutions to comply with sex designations in assigning students to dwelling units within the institution's sex-designated student housing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Voter Registration Records Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to voter registration records.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies and recodifies provisions relating to:<hr><ltbullet1>the information in a voter registration record that is available to a person based on the capacity in which the person requests the information; and<hr><ltbullet1>the requirements to obtain additional privacy protection for a voter registration record;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a voter's voter registration record that, before January 1, 2027, was classified as private without requiring a reason for the classification will be reclassified as a public voter registration record, unless the voter takes certain action to obtain additional protection for the voter's voter registration record;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer to notify a voter whose voter registration is subject to reclassification as described in the preceding paragraph in order to give the voter an opportunity to apply for additional protection for the voter's voter registration record;<hr><ltbullet>requires the assignment of new voter identification numbers;    <hr><ltbullet>modifies the voter registration form to reflect the changes made in this bill and to give a voter the option of opting into receiving electronic communications from a political party with which the voter affiliates;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a voter registration subscription service for a state political party and provides the ability for a state political party to verify membership in the party;<hr><ltbullet>provides for release to a political party of information relating to the number of at-risk voters in the state and in individual state House of Representatives districts;<hr><ltbullet>establishes additional requirements to ensure the removal of deceased individuals from voter registration records;<hr><ltbullet>modifies penalties that may be imposed in relation to the unlawful disclosure of a voter registration record;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>coordinates this bill with S.B. 191, Protective Orders Amendments, to, by reference, adopt a definition added in S.B. 191; and<hr><ltbullet>coordinates this bill with H.B. 69, Government Records and Information Amendments, to technically merge language in both bills.

bills.title: Meeting or Procession Disruption Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the criminal offense concerning disrupting a meeting or procession.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the criminal offense concerning disrupting a meeting or procession; <hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause between this bill and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, to provide that the changes to Section 76-9-103 in this bill will supersede the changes to that section in H.B. 21; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Assessment Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses vehicle weights relating to vehicle registration and uniform fees in lieu of property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the weight at which a motor vehicle qualifies for a statewide uniform fee in lieu of the property tax;<hr><ltbullet>modifies weight limits for vehicle registrations; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Investigation Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns procedures and requirements related to law enforcement investigations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines and modifies terms;<hr><ltbullet>places restrictions on and establishes procedures for law enforcement access to reverse-keyword information;<hr><ltbullet>requires, with a sunset provision, a specified notice for certain warrant applications; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses regulations related to water.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides circumstances of when a municipality may set different water rates based in part on water conservation;<hr><ltbullet>addresses special district fees;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>addresses rate setting by a retail water supplier and public water systems;<hr><ltbullet>provides for how revenues from retail rates may be spent;<hr><ltbullet>creates a presumption regarding the reasonableness of certain water rates that include water conservation as an element in determining the rate; <hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the Board of Water Resources;<hr><ltbullet>addresses tiered rates for secondary water; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: First Responder Volunteer Tax Credit
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts an income tax credit for first responder volunteers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts a nonrefundable income tax credit for certain first responder volunteers in an amount corresponding to hours of service; and<hr><ltbullet>requires first responder volunteers to obtain certification from the first responder agency to claim the tax credit.

bills.title: Commitment Revisions
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the commitment of individuals in relation to civil, criminal, and juvenile proceedings.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definitions of "intellectual disability" and "intermediate care facility for people with an intellectual disability" as used in the Utah Code;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to the rights and privileges to which an individual is entitled when under commitment to the custody or to the treatment services of a local mental health authority;<hr><ltbullet>provides that if a right of a patient of a local mental health authority is limited or denied, including for the welfare of the patient or caretakers, the nature, extent, and reason for that limitation or denial shall be entered in the patient's treatment record;<hr><ltbullet>requires a designated examiner to conduct an examination of a proposed patient by telehealth except in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to hold a hearing on an application for involuntary commitment remotely unless the court finds good cause not to hold the hearing remotely;<hr><ltbullet>amends standards and processes related to the involuntary civil commitment of an individual with an intellectual disability or related condition;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may only order the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to provide an initial evaluation and progress toward competency evaluation for a defendant or minor if the defendant or minor is located within the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to dismiss a petition for involuntary civil commitment if both designated examiners determine that the proposed patient does not meet the criteria for involuntary commitment;<hr><ltbullet>provides that when there is a conflict in the opinions of forensic evaluators, if a party seeks an additional competency evaluation then the party is responsible for selecting the evaluator and paying the cost of the evaluator;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the release of a defendant determined to be incompetent to proceed from a secured setting;<hr><ltbullet>addresses when the department is required to provide an updated juvenile competency evaluation after an extended attainment period; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Expands the substantial danger criteria for the involuntary commitment of an individual with an intellectual disability and allows them to be held for 10 days for evaluation. Also requires designated

bills.title: Vehicle Registration Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the cancellation of vehicle registration and the refund of certain taxes and fees on a pro rata basis.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the owner of certain vehicles to cancel the registration of the vehicle;<hr><ltbullet>allows the owner of a vehicle that cancels the registration of the vehicle to receive a refund of the registration fees and uniform fees in lieu of ad valorem tax on a pro rata basis; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Massage Therapy Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies licensing requirements for performing massage therapy, including creating a registration requirement for massage therapy establishments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the licensure requirements for massage therapy;<hr><ltbullet>specifies requirements for a criminal background check for an individual performing massage therapy;<hr><ltbullet>specifies requirements for a massage establishment to register;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which an individual must perform massage therapy in a registered massage establishment;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the expiration and renewal of licensure;<hr><ltbullet>specifies identification, signage, and disclosure requirements;<hr><ltbullet>creates standards for unlawful and unprofessional conduct by a massage establishment;<hr><ltbullet>requires penalties for a massage establishment that engages in unlawful or unprofessional conduct;<hr><ltbullet>specifies when a massage establishment can be denied registration;<hr><ltbullet>specifies requirements for a criminal background check for massage establishment owners;<hr><ltbullet>creates a safe harbor provision for a licensed individual renting or leasing to a sole practitioner;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Division of Professional Licensing to inspect a massage establishment;<hr><ltbullet>requires standards for the inspection of a registered massage establishment;<hr><ltbullet>provides exemptions from licensure requirements;<hr><ltbullet>schedules the repeal of provisions related to a massage assistant and massage assistant-in-training; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to coordinate enactment of provisions with S.B. 44, Professional Licensure Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Earned Wage Access Services Act
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Earned Wage Access Services Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet> enacts provisions related to earned wage access services, including provider registration and renewal;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Division of Consumer Protection to administer and enforce the Earned Wage Access Services Act;<hr><ltbullet>provides penalties for violation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School District Administrator Authority
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the definition of an employee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of an employee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Health Curriculum and Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding health instruction and physical and mental health procedures in the public education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>requires any health care provider to obtain informed parental consent before providing or facilitating telehealth or another health care service to a student within a public school;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for certain restricted services, including:<hr><ltbullet1>identifying who may and may not provide a restricted service; and<hr><ltbullet1>requiring informed parental consent and certain parental notification;<hr><ltbullet>ensures that a local or state rule or policy does not create an exemption for otherwise prohibited endorsement, promotion, or disparagement of a certain religious belief or viewpoint;<hr><ltbullet>modifies required health instruction, including:<hr><ltbullet1>establishing statutory purposes for the curriculum the state board establishes;<hr><ltbullet1>adding situational awareness and the "success sequence";<hr><ltbullet1>reorganizing duties and prohibitions regarding instruction, discussion, and advocacy of certain concepts;<hr><ltbullet>amends the effect of prior informed written parental consent and the allowable subjects in sex education instruction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, except as provided in an IEP or 504 Plan or in the case of a serious risk of suicide or bodily injury, requires a school to get permission from a parent or guardian before providin

bills.title: Health and Human Services Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses repeal dates for health and human services programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses repeal dates for health and human services programs.

bills.title: Child and Family Services Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses child and family services, such as child placement, custody, and records.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>addresses bedroom sharing by foster children;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the Division of Child and Family Services (division) from:<hr><ltbullet1>withholding certain information from a child's parent, guardian, or custodian;<hr><ltbullet1>creating or changing division records in certain ways without written consent from the child's parent, guardian, or custodian;<hr><ltbullet1>initiating certain medical treatment or care on behalf of a child in the division's custody; and<hr><ltbullet1>placing a child with a foster parent or taking adverse action against a foster parent if the foster parent expresses discomfort with caring for a child;<hr><ltbullet>allows the division to share certain records concerning a child with an adoptive parent of the child or an individual who has been awarded permanent custody and guardianship of the child;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a parent's approval or disapproval of a child's sexual orientation, in itself, may not be the basis for:<hr><ltbullet1>removal of the child from the parent's custody; or<hr><ltbullet1>discrimination when a court is determining child custody as part of a divorce or other family law proceeding;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a juvenile court may not determine that reunification services should not be provided based solely on a parent's agreement or disagreement with the child's sexual orientation or gender identity; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: International Money Transmission Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts a tax and income tax credit related to international money transmissions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>imposes a tax on international money transmissions on or after a certain date;<hr><ltbullet>exempts an international money transmission from the tax if the customer requesting the transaction presents valid identification;<hr><ltbullet>requires the tax to be stated separately on an invoice or receipt;<hr><ltbullet>requires licensed money transmitters to remit collected taxes quarterly and report annually to the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the State Tax Commission's administration of the tax;<hr><ltbullet>enacts a nonrefundable income tax credit for individuals who pay the tax;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commissioner of the Department of Financial Institutions to annually provide a list of all licensed money transmitters to the State Tax Commission; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Water Infrastructure Modifications
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
