bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses funding and planning for water infrastructure.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Water Resources Cities Water Loan Fund and provides that loan repayments go into the Water Infrastructure Fund;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes transfers of money in water funds and accounts to and from the Water Infrastructure Fund;<hr><ltbullet>requires capital asset management plans and reserve funding under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions, including the definition of "relevant agency";<hr><ltbullet>addresses the water infrastructure prioritization process, including exemptions from the process;<hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Olene Walker Housing Loan Fund Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Olene Walker Housing Loan Fund within the Department of Workforce Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Finance to annually transfer a certain amount of state liquor sale revenues from the Liquor Control Fund to the Olene Walker Housing Loan Fund (fund); <hr><ltbullet>requires the executive director of the Department of Workforce Services to distribute the transferred portion of the fund for certain purposes; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Takes 25% of the Liquor Control Fund's annual profit. Dedicates 40% of it to deed restricted single-family housing for individuals between 30-60% of area median income. Dedicates 60% to deed-restricte

bills.title: Stalking Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses stalking.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that an individual does not commit stalking in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Health Care Malpractice Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses statutes of limitation for health care malpractice actions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends statutes of limitation for health care malpractice actions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the application of the statute of limitations, when a party files a notice of intent to allocate fault to a non-party health care provider;<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of "collateral source";<hr><ltbullet>modifies the evidentiary rules for malpractice actions;<hr><ltbullet>increases the limitation on awards of damages for noneconomic losses in certain malpractice actions; and<hr><ltbullet>subjects the limitation on awards of damages for noneconomic losses in certain malpractice actions to an annual adjustment for inflation.

bills.title: Motor Vehicle Accident Liability Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the civil liability of a person who caused a motor vehicle accident and provided emergency care for the motor vehicle accident.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses the civil liability of a person who caused a motor vehicle accident and provided emergency care for the motor vehicle accident; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Bicycle Lane Safety Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses safety elements in a bicycle lane.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when motor vehicles may be in a bicycle lane; and<hr><ltbullet>restricts obstructing a bicycle lane.

bills.title: Mayoral Recall Election Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a procedure to conduct a recall election for the office of mayor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a procedure to require a recall election for a mayor;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements to file a recall application and petition;<hr><ltbullet>describes requirements for a petition for a recall election, gathering and submitting signatures, removing signatures, and evaluating signatures;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for holding a recall election and determining the results of a recall election;<hr><ltbullet> establishes ballot requirements for a recall election;<hr><ltbullet>establishes criminal penalties for misconduct relating to a petition for a recall election; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Political Signs Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to political signs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>for a political advertisement that is required to disclose certain campaign finance information, reduces the size dimensions of a lawn sign that is exempt from the disclosure requirement;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a person from:<hr><ltbullet1>attaching a political sign to a utility pole, light pole, an electric utility box, or any road sign; or <hr><ltbullet1>affixing an object to a political sign to block, conceal, or misrepresent the message or image on a political sign;<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense for a person who engages in the conduct described above;<hr><ltbullet>creates an exception to the criminal offense described above for a government employee who removes a political sign in accordance with the government employee's duties;<hr><ltbullet>specifies that a person does not commit a criminal offense related to a political sign if the person:<hr><ltbullet1>removes an object described above; <hr><ltbullet1>removes a lawn sign described above; or<hr><ltbullet1>removes a political sign attached to a utility pole, light pole, an electric utility box, or road sign; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Sales Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts a sales and use tax exemption for sales of motor vehicles in separate transactions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>exempts the purchase price of the lower priced motor vehicle when a person buys and sells two motor vehicles in separate transactions;<hr><ltbullet>provides the method for claiming the sales and use tax exemption; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Infectious Disease Procedures Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to infectious disease procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>requires a place of public accommodation and certain other entities to provide an accommodation related to face coverings for certain people;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the issuance of orders of constraint; and<hr><ltbullet>limits an order of restriction to be issued for individuals, not groups of individuals.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Prohibits a government agency or private business, exept a doctor's office or healthcare facility from requiring a person with a physical or mental health condition or disability from wearing a mask i

bills.title: Municipal Services Fees and Political Subdivision Lien Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill authorizes municipalities to place a political subdivision lien on property for certain past due services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality that sets a fee schedule by ordinance or resolution for water, sewer, or utility-related services provided by the municipality, or a third-party contracted by the municipality, to bill a customer receiving the water, sewer, or utility-related services, directly or through a third-party contracted by the municipality;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality to hold a political subdivision lien on a property for past due water, sewer, or utility-related service fees;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality or special district to: <hr><ltbullet1>charge interest on a past due fee; and<hr><ltbullet1>charge and collect a one-time penalty on a past due fee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Recovery Residence Services Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses residential programs and services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>delineates residential recovery services from residential vocational or life skills programs;<hr><ltbullet>removes an application requirement for residential vocational or life skills programs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Expungement Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses expungement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms for expungement;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Department of Public Safety to make rules regarding the procedure for notifying the Bureau of Criminal Identification of an order of expungement;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the list of offenses that are not eligible for automatic expungement;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Bureau of Criminal Identification to request the vacation of an order for automatic expungement in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for a certificate of eligibility to address registration as a sex offender, kidnap offender, or child abuse offender or a protective order or criminal stalking injunction in effect against the individual;<hr><ltbullet>modifies venue for a petition seeking expungement of criminal records;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a certificate of eligibility has to be valid at the time that the petition for expungement was filed for a court to grant expungement;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the effect of an expungement on a civil protective order;<hr><ltbullet>modifies venue for a petition seeking expungement of juvenile records; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address a technical conflict if this bill and S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Volunteer Emergency Medical Service Personnel Insurance Program Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding the Volunteer Emergency Medical Service Personnel Insurance Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows additional municipalities to participate in the Volunteer Emergency Medical Service Personnel Insurance Program.

bills.title: Election Code Time Computation Revisions
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to deadlines and the calculation of time in the Election Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to deadlines and the calculation of time in the Election Code;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies and modifies deadlines in the Election Code; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Amendments to Election Law
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to:<hr><ltbullet1>develop a procedure to evaluate voter registration records based on addresses to identify potential anomalies;<hr><ltbullet1>develop procedures to investigate the validity of a voter registration when a ballot mailed by the county clerk is returned as undeliverable; and<hr><ltbullet1>register with the Systematic Alien Verification for Entitlements program;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to seek to enter into an agreement with the federal courts where, in exchange for receiving certain information from the state for the purpose of maintaining federal jury lists, the courts will notify the state of individuals who are disqualified from jury service due to criminal convictions or non-citizen status; <hr><ltbullet>for voting by mail:<hr><ltbullet1>requires a registered voter who has a Utah driver license or a state identification card to place to last four digits of the card's number on the return envelope, and permits a voter to enter the last four digits of the voter's social security number as an alternate form of identification;<hr><ltbullet1>until 2029, permits a voter's identity to be verified using signature comparison, if the voter doesn't enter the digits described in the preceding paragraph;<hr><ltbullet1>beginning in 2029, provides that if a voter does not have a Utah driver license, a Utah state identification card, or a social security card, the voter may provide identification by including a photocopy of certain forms of identification in the return envelope;<hr><ltbullet1>beginning in 2029, if a voter does not have a type of identification described in the preceding two paragraphs, requires the voter to vote in person, unless the voter qualifies for certain exceptions;   <hr><ltbullet>subject to certain exceptions, provides that, beginning in 2029, a voter will not receive a ballot by mail unless the voter requests to receive a ballot by mail;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a request to receive a ballot by mail remains in effect for eight years unless the voter takes certain action that results in termination of the request;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a voter may request, or renew a request, to receive a ballot by mail when the person:<hr><ltbullet1>registers to vote;<hr><ltbullet1>makes a request online;<hr><ltbullet1>applies to receive or renew a Utah driver license or Utah state identification card; or<hr><ltbullet1>votes at a polling place; <hr><ltbullet>amends voter registration forms relating to:<hr><ltbullet1>requesting to receive ballot notifications; and<hr><ltbullet1>requesting to receive a mailed ballot;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for an individual to assist a voter to vote at a polling place;<hr><ltbullet>modifies a return envelope consistent with the requirements of this bill and to provide certain warnings to a voter;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to obtaining and returning an emergency ballot;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions for the processing of ballots, consistent with the provisions of this bill;<hr><ltbullet>creates an exception to the requirement that the bulk of ballots initially mailed to voters must be mailed from a location in Utah, if the jurisdiction mailing the ballots is assigned to a United States Postal Service area distribution center outside of Utah;<hr><ltbullet>expands the duties of the lieutenant governor in relation to maintaining the voter registration database; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, after 2029 requires a voter to request to vote by mail. Offers several ways to do so. The request is valid for 8 years, unless the voter doesn't vote in two local and or state elec

bills.title: Ambulance Provider Payment Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to ambulance billing and charges.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>codifies a base rate for ground ambulance transports;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a ground ambulance provider from charging rates that exceed established rates;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits balance billing;<hr><ltbullet>requires an insurer and workers' compensation to allow for established rates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of the Legislative Auditor General to conduct an audit if prioritized; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a repeal date.

bills.title: Minors in State Custody Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses federal benefits for minors who are in the custody of the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to apply for a Medicaid waiver to ensure that minors in the custody of the department who receive federal benefits will maintain resource-eligibility for Medicaid;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to evaluate whether a minor in the custody of the department is receiving or is eligible to receive federal benefits;<hr><ltbullet>provides that, as appropriate, the department shall apply for federal benefits on behalf of a minor in the custody of the department, and may accept appointment as the representative payee for a minor's federal benefits;<hr><ltbullet>provides accounting, reporting, and administrative requirements for the department concerning a federal benefit provided to a minor in the custody of the department;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to offer financial literacy training for a minor who received a federal benefit while in the custody of the department, or for a successor representative payee;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the department relating to the administration of federal benefits for minors in the custody of the department;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to report annually to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee regarding federal benefits received on behalf of minors in the custody of the department; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires the Department of Health and Human Services to apply for and accept SSI or SSDI for which a youth in its custody may be eligible. Directs DHHS to spend 75% the money on the youth's care and g

bills.title: Public School Directory Sharing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the communication requirements of a local education agency.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency to share directory information with another local education agency upon request.

bills.title: Livestock Watering Modifications
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses livestock watering.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the requirements to apply for a certificate recognizing certain livestock watering uses;<hr><ltbullet>directs the state engineer's actions with regard to a certificate for livestock watering use;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the effect of a certificate for a livestock watering use;<hr><ltbullet>provides for rulemaking; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Cohabitant Definition Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the definition of cohabitant.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of cohabitant;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to the definition of cohabitant; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Precious Metals Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts and modifies provisions relating to state investment in gold and the establishment of a gold-backed digital payment system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends and adds a sunset date to the state treasurer's precious metals study requirement;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state treasurer to develop and issue a competitive procurement for a precious metals-backed electronic payment system;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for the request for proposals;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state treasurer to evaluate proposals; and<hr><ltbullet>requires annual reporting to the Revenue and Taxation Interim Committee.

bills.title: Wildfire Funding Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses wildfires.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>merges several funds into the Utah Wildfire Fund (fund);<hr><ltbullet>modifies references to the funds merged into the fund;<hr><ltbullet>amends definition provisions;<hr><ltbullet>addresses delegation of fire management authority;<hr><ltbullet>addresses elements of the fund such as what is deposited into the fund and how money in the fund is used;<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes rulemaking; <hr><ltbullet>moves provisions related to community wildfire preparedness plans addressing wildland-urban interface; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause with H.B. 48 to address the transition to the Utah Wildfire Fund; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Driving by Minors Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies who may supervise a minor with a learner permit.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual with a learner permit who is younger than 18 years old to drive with an adult other than a parent, in certain circumstances.

bills.title: Wildlife Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses state activities related to wildlife.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>addresses night hunting of nonprotected wildlife;<hr><ltbullet>imposes requirements for holding a hunting or combination license for service on the Wildlife Board or a regional advisory council;<hr><ltbullet>addresses definition of and access to wildlife management areas;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions concerning the Department of Agriculture and Food's activities related to livestock depredation and big game protection;<hr><ltbullet>addresses compensation for damage to livestock;<hr><ltbullet>corrects a definition of "big game"; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Disability Coverage Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses wraparound services for certain individuals with a disability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to apply for a Medicaid waiver or state plan amendment to provide wraparound services to qualified individuals with a disability;<hr><ltbullet>requires qualified individuals who receive services under the waiver or state plan amendment to make cost-sharing payments according to a sliding scale established by the department;<hr><ltbullet>specifies certain percentages and maximum payment amounts for the sliding scale established by the department; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to make rules.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires the Department of Health and Human Services to ask for permission to offer a person with a disability who makes too much - but whose private insurance doesn't pay for all the services they ne

bills.title: Watershed Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to water resources and water management in Utah watersheds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when a water commissioner is:<hr><ltbullet1>treated as a regular full-time employee;<hr><ltbullet1> eligible for health and retirement benefits; and<hr><ltbullet1>exempt from the Utah State Personnel Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Utah water agent to include facilities and land in the state water agent's negotiations for water augmentation projects;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Board of Water Resources to enter into contracts for water augmentation projects negotiated by the Utah water agent;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the membership requirements for the Legislative Water Development Commission; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Justice Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies statutory provisions related to criminal justice.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the release of individuals due to overcrowding of correctional facilities;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to contracting with federal and county entities to house individuals, and establishes reporting requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county sheriff who permits probation to establish probation standards and procedures adopted by the Utah Sheriffs' Association;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the use of state funds for a syringe exchange program;<hr><ltbullet>adds "detention removal officer" to the definition of federal officers who have statewide law enforcement authority;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the Department of Corrections from housing inmates in a private correctional facility, unless the purpose is federal immigration detention or civil detention;<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions related to the state daily incarceration rate;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the definition and calculation of the state daily incarceration rate;<hr><ltbullet>modifies permitted uses for funds in the Adult Probation and Parole Employment Incentive Program;<hr><ltbullet>adds strangulation or choking as a criminal offense included with the crime of commission of domestic violence in the presence of a child;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of habitual offender and makes conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county sheriff to report statistics on releases due to overcrowding and pretrial release;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to a county sheriff's release of individuals on their own recognizance;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a county jail official from fixing a financial condition for an individual with a misdemeanor charge for certain domestic violence and driving under the influence offenses;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to a magistrate's orders for pretrial release or detention;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to interlocal agreements regarding release of incarcerated or supervised individuals;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Subcommittee on County Correctional Facility Contracting and Reimbursement;<hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated provisions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a sheriff to contract with another county jail instead of releasing an individual charged with certain crimes on probation. If a sheriff does release an individual on probation, requires they

bills.title: Construction Industry Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the State Construction Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the State Construction Code to:<hr><ltbullet1>align with updated standards in the International Residential Code (IRC); and<hr><ltbullet1>align with the updated standards in the National Electric Code (NEC); <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to make the amendments to Section 15A-3-202 in this bill supersede the amendments to Section 15A-3-202 in H.B. 175, Housing Construction Amendments;<hr><ltbullet>removes regulations for water heaters in certain areas; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Breast Cancer Prevention Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health insurance and breast examinations that detect breast cancer.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a health benefit plan from implementing a cost-sharing requirement for certain breast examinations that detect breast cancer.

bills.title: Elected Official Vacancy Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses midterm vacancies in municipal offices.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies procedures in the event of a tie among three or more candidates; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Child Tax Credit Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the individual income tax credit for child dependents.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a taxpayer to claim the nonrefundable child tax credit for child dependents under one year old and up to five years old.

bills.title: Executive Agency Innovation Incentives
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions relating to efficiency improvement processes and certain funding requirements in the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends criteria for certain funds to be treated as nonlapsing;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to efficiency improvement processes in the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget, including:<hr><ltbullet1>identifying and prioritizing processes to incentivize, recognize, and reward a certain entity or entity employee for efficiency; <hr><ltbullet1>providing for a certain entity or entity employee to recommend an efficiency evaluation; <hr><ltbullet1>assessing certain metrics and outcomes to determine whether a certain entity's or entity's employee's recommendation results in cost-savings or time-savings; and<hr><ltbullet1>whether the nonlapsing funds are used for employee retention or incentives; <hr><ltbullet>provides for reporting requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Residential Turf Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses use of lawn or turf related to residential lots.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to adopt lawn or turf restrictions for certain newly constructed residences; <hr><ltbullet>allows a municipality or county to adopt more restrictive limitations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Natural Resources Survey Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a priority list of outdoor recreation infrastructure projects.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Public Lands Policy Coordinating Office to compile a priority list of outdoor recreation infrastructure projects for inclusion in the state resource management plan; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipal Ordinance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the imposition of a civil penalty for a municipal ordinance violation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a municipality to impose a civil fine that exceeds the maximum class B misdemeanor fine under Section 76-3-301 if:<hr><ltbullet1>the fine is imposed for violation of an ordinance that regulates occupancy, the provision of off-street parking, or the operation of a rental dwelling or short-term rental;<hr><ltbullet1>the municipality has previously imposed a fine on the individual for the same violation three or more times within the past 12 months; and<hr><ltbullet1>the fine does not exceed the applicable maximum amount described in this bill.

bills.title: Utah Olympics Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games Act to reflect the award of the 2034 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games to Utah and the shift from a bid committee to an organizing committee;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for the Utah Olympic bid and organizing committee (host committee) and the host committee's relation to the Legislature's Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games Coordination Committee;<hr><ltbullet>imposes requirements on the host committee;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions; and<hr><ltbullet>updates language and makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Child Actor Regulations
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to minors involved in entertainment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a parent or guardian establish a trust for a minor involved in entertainment;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a child of a content creator is not subject to trust and compensation requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a parent or guardian may serve as the trustee of a trust for a minor involved in entertainment;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a performer's employer when depositing a percentage of the earnings of a minor involved in entertainment into a trust;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a right of action for a minor involved in entertainment;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a content creator maintain a record that relates to a minor featured in the content creator's content;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a content creator inform a minor's parents that the minor is featured in the content creator's content;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a minor's parent or guardian establish a trust for the minor featured in social media content under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>establishes limitations related to the trust established for a minor featured in social media content;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a formula for a content creator to calculate the percentage of any earnings from social media that feature a minor and to transfer the earnings to the minor's trust;<hr><ltbullet>provides exemptions from the trust and compensation requirements;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a right of action for an individual featured in social media content as a minor;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process by which a content creator may petition a court for an exception to the requirement to divide earnings from social media featuring a minor;<hr><ltbullet>grants an individual featured in social media content as a minor a right of deletion;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a social media company maintain a readily available process by which an individual featured in social media content as a minor may request that a content creator delete content featuring the individual featured in social media content as a minor;<hr><ltbullet>provides a process by which an individual may petition a court to require that a content creator delete the individual's content; <hr><ltbullet>provides for an award of attorney fees and damages; and<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which the provisions of this bill supersede a contractual provision related to disputes.

bills.title: Correctional Drug Enforcement Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses illegal drug enforcement by the Department of Corrections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to create a drug abuse and trafficking unit within the department to combat illegal drug abuse and trafficking by inmates and offenders on probation and parole and enhance coordination with law enforcement agencies.

bills.title: Special Group License Plate Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill changes the allocation of money from a historical support special group license plate.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual to request, for an additional fee, a set of two license plates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Motor Vehicle Division to design and distribute a white, classic license plate.<hr><ltbullet>allows a corporate brand sponsored special group license plate and a special group license plate for major league sports teams;<hr><ltbullet>allows the consolidation of license plate types for purposes of meeting the minimum circulation requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides the allocation of money from the voluntary contribution for a historical support special group license plate, allocating revenue to the sponsoring agency and to the Transportation Investment Fund of 2005;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Motor Vehicle Division to provide notice regarding the allocation of the money from the historical support special group license plate; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a vintage vehicle is not required to make the voluntary contribution to obtain the historical support special group license plate;<hr><ltbullet>allows contributions for collegiate special group license plates to be used for the institution's compensation to student athletes for the use of the student athlete's name, image, or likeness;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of a vintage vehicle to exclude the requirement regarding the type of license plate to be displayed;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to provide a report regarding special group license plates; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Parent Access to Learning Materials Pilot Program
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Parent Access to Learning Materials Pilot Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a three-year pilot program for parent access to learning materials;<hr><ltbullet>directs the state board to select local education agencies (LEAs) to participate;<hr><ltbullet>requires participating LEAs to implement teacher incentives;<hr><ltbullet>starts with elementary schools in 2025-26 school year;<hr><ltbullet>allows expansion to secondary schools in 2026-27 school year; and<hr><ltbullet>requires program reports.

bills.title: Pregnant and Postpartum Inmate Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses statutes regarding pregnant and postpartum inmates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections (the department) and the county jails to ensure that each female individual admitted to a correctional facility is tested for pregnancy;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department and each county jail to collect certain parental information on inmates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department and each county jail to report to the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice:<hr><ltbullet1>the number of known pregnant inmates in custody; and<hr><ltbullet1>the number of inmates in custody who are parents to a minor child;<hr><ltbullet>amends the membership of the Correctional Postnatal and Early Childhood Advisory Board (the board);<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date of the board; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeowners Association Modifications
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to homeowners' and condominium owners' associations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires an association to notify an owner in writing of a denied unit or lot plan;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a homeowners' association from impeding or denying a plan due to the plan's inclusion of a fire-resistant material in an area with heightened risk of wildfire;<hr><ltbullet>places limitations on an association's ability to impose certain rules; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Usage Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of overhead spray irrigation under specified circumstances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>directs a municipality or county to require compliance with a prohibition on use of overhead spray irrigation as part of land use approvals;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to give notice of the prohibition on use of overhead spray irrigation;<hr><ltbullet>encourages a municipality or county to review certain plans, act on the plans, inspect for compliance, and address noncompliance; and<hr><ltbullet>prohibits for new development and redevelopment the use of overhead spray irrigation except under certain circumstances.

bills.title: Homeless Services Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions related to homelessness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Shelter Counties Advisory Board to make recommendations to the Utah Homeless Board (board) regarding homeless services;<hr><ltbullet>requires the board to collect and report on certain data;<hr><ltbullet>provides that funds from the Homeless to Housing Reform Restricted Account may be used for certain transportation costs to connect the individual with a support network outside of the state; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the process by which the board approves funding requests from the Homeless Shelter Cities Mitigation Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain provisions of the winter response task force;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions requiring service providers to design certain services to assist homeless individuals in progressing and transitioning from struggling with homelessness to personal thriving;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions requiring certain safety requirements for homeless shelters, including winter response shelters; <hr><ltbullet>provides for penalties if a service provider that receives state or federal funds refuses to comply with certain safety requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides certain exceptions under the COVID-19 grant program for licensed residential vocational and life skills programs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires shelters to give law enforcement access to ensure drug and weapon free facilities. Encourages information be shared across systems to facilitate individualized case management and care planni

bills.title: Water Sprinkler Efficiency Requirements
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses activities related to spray sprinkler bodies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain activities related to spray sprinkler bodies;<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions; and<hr><ltbullet>creates an enforcement process.

bills.title: Olympics Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>codifies requirements that relate to a sale or transfer of part of an Olympic facility, which requirements were previously approved by the Legislature via joint resolutions;<hr><ltbullet>codifies requirements that must be met before any portion of an Olympic facility may be sold or transferred;<hr><ltbullet>requires the governor, or the governor's designee, and an Olympic facility manager to meet with the Legislative Management Committee in connection with approving a sale of a part of an Olympic facility; and<hr><ltbullet>requires an Olympic facility manager to give prior notice of certain structural changes in the organization to the Legislative Management Committee.

bills.title: Amendments to Voting Provisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions relating to voting and voter registration data.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires certain reporting to the Government Operations Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies reporting requirements for the lieutenant governor and county clerks;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the lieutenant governor's authority to cooperate or enter into an agreement with another state or third-party to share voter registration information;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for the maintenance of voter registration records;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the lieutenant governor to contract with a third-party to maintain voter rolls;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the lieutenant governor to enter into agreements with the federal courts;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to register with the federal Systemic Alien Verification for Entitlements Program for voter registration and voter list maintenance;<hr><ltbullet>requires county clerks to investigate certain registered voters in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>addresses ballot video surveillance requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires proof of United States citizenship to vote in a state election;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a ballot relating to only federal elections if a voter does not provide proof of United States citizenship;<hr><ltbullet>provides for removing an individual from the voter registration roll if evidence is discovered, and not refuted, that the individual is not a citizen of the United States; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Medications in Schools Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the definition of a medical device used to administer epinephrine.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends defined terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates a defined term;<hr><ltbullet>allows a student to possess or self-administer epinephrine nasal spray at a school in certain circumstances;  and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Guardianships and Supported Decision-Making Agreements Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses guardianships and supported decision-making agreements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a provision that provides for the future repeal of statutory language concerning when counsel is not required for an allegedly incapacitated person;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions concerning the rights of certain individuals who are under a court-ordered guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions concerning the procedure for determining incapacity and appointing a guardian for an incapacitated person;<hr><ltbullet>prescribes the principles by which provisions related to supported decision-making agreements should be interpreted;<hr><ltbullet>describes the requirements for a supported decision-making agreement;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the use of a supported decision-making agreement by certain individuals, subject to the permission of the individual's guardian, conservator, or other qualified person, as applicable;<hr><ltbullet>describes the duties of an individual who is a supporter under a supported decision-making agreement;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a supported decision-making agreement may be revoked or terminated, with certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>describes how a supported decision-making agreement interacts with and affects other laws and principles;<hr><ltbullet>provides protections for a person who relies, in good faith, on the provisions of a supported decision-making agreement; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Clarifies the rights of a person subject to a proposed guardianship, the rights of a person subject to a guardianship, and which of those rights a court may and may not waive. Also, gives legal recogn

bills.title: Political Advertising Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to political advertising.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>specifies that an electioneering communication or a political advertisement includes a communication or advertisement disseminated on a social media platform;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes an election officer to impose a monetary fine against a person who violates certain provisions related to political advertisements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Park Accessibility Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses accessibility in state parks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the term "outdoor recreation project" to include construction of trails or facilities, improvements of trails or facilities, or equipment for disabled or adaptive users.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Adds accessibility to the definition of recreational infrastructure project.

bills.title: Property Manager Requirements
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Real Estate Licensing and Practices Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>grants the Real Estate Commission (commission) authority to make administrative rules relating to property managers;<hr><ltbullet>requires an individual to hold a license as a property manager before engaging in property management;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain individuals from licensure under this act;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the commission and Division of Real Estate determine the qualifications and requirements for an applicant for a property manager license;<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual with an active broker, associate broker, or sales agent license to obtain a property manager license without meeting certain examination and education requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires that an applicant for a property manager license pay a licensing fee;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions authorizing certain individuals to act as a property manager;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a property manager to fill out any form or document related to property management;<hr><ltbullet>provides parameters for what a property manager may do when engaging in property management; <hr><ltbullet>requires that a property manager associate with a real estate trust account;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a property manager with a security bond that protects at least 30% of estimated client funds from the requirement to associate with a real estate trust account; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Commitment Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the commitment of individuals in relation to civil, criminal, and juvenile proceedings.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to the rights and privileges to which an individual is entitled when under commitment to the custody or to the treatment services of a local mental health authority;<hr><ltbullet>provides when there is a conflict in the opinions of forensic evaluators, if a party seeks an additional competency evaluation then that party is responsible for selecting the evaluator and paying the cost of the evaluator;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions and clarifies the process regarding the release from a secured setting of a defendant determined to be incompetent to proceed;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when the Department of Health and Human Services is required to provide an updated juvenile competency evaluation after an attainment period; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Investigation Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the activation and use of body-worn cameras by law enforcement officers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>exempts a law enforcement officer who wears a body-worn camera and is a part of a narcotics unit or task force from certain requirements relating to the activation and use of the body-worn camera; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Solar Power Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to residential solar energy generation by creating a new category for small portable solar generation devices.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates exemptions from interconnection requirements for portable solar generation devices;<hr><ltbullet>establishes basic safety requirements for portable solar generation devices; and<hr><ltbullet>provides liability protections for electrical corporations.

bills.title: Higher Education Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the application of Title 53B, State System of Higher Education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>exempts private institutions of higher education from the provisions in Title 53B, Utah System of Higher Education, unless expressly stated otherwise;<hr><ltbullet>allows the University of Utah to teach certain medical students from out-of-state; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Animal Composting Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses farm or ranch operations that relate to animal composting.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of a commercial nonhazardous solid waste treatment, storage, or disposal facility to exclude certain farm or ranch operations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Cannabis Production Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to medical cannabis production.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires cannabis production establishments to include in their operating plan methods to reduce odor;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements regarding tenancy and certain cannabis production establishments;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Agriculture and Food to create recommendations for odor control; and<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to land use for medical cannabis production establishments.

bills.title: School Fees Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to school fees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency (LEA) to, beginning for the 2026-2027 school year:<hr><ltbullet1>ensure that a student has at least one option at the student's school to complete all required courses and credits without paying a fee or a waiver; and<hr><ltbullet1>clearly disclose any fee related to a course or activity in the description of the course or activity in the LEA's registration materials;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an LEA from:<hr><ltbullet1>charging a student a fee for certain non-fee courses; or<hr><ltbullet1>charging a general fee or charging or increasing a fee to a student to supplement or supplant a fee the LEA is prohibited from charging;<hr><ltbullet>allows an LEA to charge a student a fee for certain expenses, under certain circumstances, including for:<hr><ltbullet1>expenses beyond the common delivery of instruction;<hr><ltbullet1>fee courses;<hr><ltbullet1>instructional supplies;<hr><ltbullet1>extracurricular activities;<hr><ltbullet1>a discretionary project; and<hr><ltbullet1>other additional expenses;<hr><ltbullet>repeals duplicative language regarding fees for textbooks; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Park Road Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill adds descriptions of highways related to state park access.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds descriptions of highways near certain state parks.

bills.title: Department of Agriculture and Food Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses how the Department of Agriculture and Food reviews an account.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires an accountant to annually review a Department of Agriculture and Food account containing the proceeds from marketing orders; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Department of Agriculture and Food Amendments

bills.title: Social Services Program Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the provisions related to social services programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Medicaid ACA Fund;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to substance use and mental health program licensure;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to certified community health workers;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding atypical anti-psychotic, psychotropic drugs, and the Medicaid preferred drug list;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to case management; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Allows a licensed mental health or substance use provider to opt out of on-site  renewl inspections for an accredited site if the site has not had a moderate, high, or extreme violation in the past tw

bills.title: Insect Terminology Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the naming convention for the insect species Anabrus simplex.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires state entities referencing the species Anabrus simplex in state materials to use:<hr><ltbullet1>the scientific name; or<hr><ltbullet1>a common name as adopted by the Entomological Society of America;<hr><ltbullet>requires state entities to encourage national insect naming institutions to adopt the naming convention of Anabrus simplex:<hr><ltbullet1>the scientific name; or<hr><ltbullet1>a common name as adopted by the Entomological Society of America;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Commissioner of the Department of Agriculture and Food to submit a petition to the Entomological Society of America for a new common name for Anabrus simplex; <hr><ltbullet>provides for the automatic repeal of provisions related to the petition for a new common name; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Organ Donation Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses public awareness of organ donation and opportunities for individuals to register as organ donors.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires or encourages information about the option and process to register as an organ donor, to be provided in connection with or in certain circumstances related to:<hr><ltbullet1>the Division of Wildlife Resources' website;<hr><ltbullet1>intake at a health care facility; and<hr><ltbullet1>individual income tax instructions booklets and the State Tax Commission's website;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services to convene a coalition of life-saving programs and create a comprehensive plan for communicating about those programs through state-owned channels; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: District Energy Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the High Cost Infrastructure Development Tax Credit Act to include district energy systems.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions regarding heat corporations to address cooling plants;<hr><ltbullet>adds district energy systems as qualifying energy delivery projects;<hr><ltbullet>establishes investment thresholds for district energy systems to qualify for high cost infrastructure tax credits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Election Day Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes Election Day as a state holiday.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November as a legal holiday called Election Day;<hr><ltbullet>excludes Election Day as a legal holiday that requires a state agency or work-related closure; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Geologic Carbon Storage Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses violations related to geologic carbon storage.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Board of Oil, Gas, and Mining (board) has enforcement authority over Class VI injection wells upon receiving primacy from the Environmental Protection Agency;<hr><ltbullet>provides for civil and criminal penalties for violations established by the board and the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining (division);<hr><ltbullet>requires the board and the division to bring an enforcement action within two years of discovering a violation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Code Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns certain criminal offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain state agencies to regularly review and make recommendations concerning certain statutory criminal offenses;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice to receive, compile, and submit a report on state agency reviews of statutory criminal offenses; <hr><ltbullet>lowers the penalty for criminal violations concerning an unauthorized use of a name in a charity solicitation; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the criminal offense relating to abuse of the flag; <hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, due to the repeal of Section 76-10-604 in H.B. 21;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause coordinating technical changes between this bill, H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, and H.B. 38, Criminal Offenses Modifications;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and clarifying changes to Section 76-9-803; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Justice Revisions
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates certain requirements for criminal justice agencies and entities working with criminal justice agencies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>adds county attorney offices in counties of the second and third class to the statute requiring certain prosecutorial data collection and reporting regarding criminal cases and modifies requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county jail to:<hr><ltbullet1>collect biometric and other personal information for individuals brought to the county jail for processing or booking into custody regardless of whether the county jail retains custody of the individual; and<hr><ltbullet1>to the extent possible, connect an individual in custody with the individual's state identification number and use the state identification number in association with any records regarding the individual;<hr><ltbullet>amends the membership of the Public Safety Data Management Task Force;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice (the commission) to include certain DUI crash data in an annual DUI report;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety's Criminal Investigations and Technical Services Division to collect certain DUI crash data and provide the data to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes law enforcement agency requirements concerning:<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of certain DUI crash data;<hr><ltbullet1>the sharing of information with the Department of Public Safety's statewide criminal intelligence system;<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of certain lost, stolen, and untraceable firearms; and<hr><ltbullet1>the collection and reporting of the disposition of firearms in the custody of a law enforcement agency;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to receive, compile, and publish law enforcement agency data concerning firearms;<hr><ltbullet>requires law enforcement agencies to supply certain law enforcement officers with a portable biometric capture device;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the public safety data portal is the repository for statutorily required data concerning:<hr><ltbullet1>certain DUI crash data;<hr><ltbullet1>law enforcement agency reporting requirements for certain firearms data; and<hr><ltbullet1>prosecutorial data collection regarding prosecutions of false sexual assault accusations;<hr><ltbullet>imposes certain requirements for software service vendors if the software service is for use by a criminal justice agency and collects and stores data required by statute to be reported to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires prosecutorial agencies and courts to report to the commission data concerning enhancements to criminal charges; <hr><ltbullet>requires all prosecutorial agencies in the state to submit data to the commission concerning certain prosecutions, dismissals, and declinations to prosecute;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain reporting requirements from law enforcement grant eligibility requirements; <hr><ltbullet>modifies pretrial release data reporting requirements from the Administrative Office of the Courts; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to conduct a risk assessment for every individual convicted of a sex offense that would require the individual to register on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections, until January 1, 2030, to submit the results of risk assessments for sex offenders to the commission; <hr><ltbullet>includes coordination clauses to:<hr><ltbullet1> merge the changes to Sections 63I-2-277 and 77-41-115 in this bill if this bill and S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments, both pass and become law, including to address the repeal and replacement of Section 77-41-115 in S.B. 41 with a newly enacted statute; and<hr><ltbullet1>merge the changes to Sections 53-25-104 and 63A-16-1002 if this bill and H.B. 436, Impaired Driving Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Mining and Critical Infrastructure Materials Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses mining and critical infrastructure materials operations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>changes vested critical infrastructure materials use provisions including making them more similar to vested mining provisions;<hr><ltbullet>addresses operations on new land for critical infrastructure materials uses and for mining uses;<hr><ltbullet>addresses critical dates;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to vested mining operations;<hr><ltbullet>repeals study requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: County Governance Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to forms of county government.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that in a county of the third through sixth class with a council-manager form of government, each council member must be elected by a voter district;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for a county of the third through sixth class with a council-manager form of government to create voter districts;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the composition of a study committee formed to study changing the form of county government; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medical Cannabis Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to medical cannabis.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions related to qualified medical providers and limited medical providers in the medical cannabis program;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain health care providers to recommend medical cannabis without first registering with the Department of Health and Human Services;<hr><ltbullet>repeals continuing education requirements related to medical cannabis;<hr><ltbullet>moves enforcement of advertising and payment requirements related to medical cannabis from the Department of Health and Human Services to the Division of Professional Licensing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Sexual Conduct Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns criminal sexual conduct.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offense of:<hr><ltbullet1>custodial solicitation of sexually explicit conduct from a person in custody; <hr><ltbullet1>unlawful sexual activity with a child using virtual reality; and<hr><ltbullet1>unlawful sexual activity with a minor using virtual reality; and<hr><ltbullet>provides criminal penalties.

bills.title: Juvenile Justice Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends statutory provisions related to juvenile justice.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the notification requirements for an offense committed by a student on school grounds;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies and amends requirements related to the notification of an offense committed by a student on school grounds, including statutory provisions addressing investigations, searches, and immunity;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a minor's eligibility for a nonjudicial adjustment when a referral to a juvenile court involves certain offenses;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may not grant a petition for expungement of a juvenile record if the petitioner has been adjudicated or convicted of certain drug offenses within two years before the petition for expungement is filed; <hr><ltbullet>repeals statutes regarding notification and reporting of prohibited acts by students; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Housing Attainability Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to affordable housing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a closed meeting may be held under certain circumstances by a political subdivision; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a city of the first or second class, under certain conditions, may qualify for funds from the Utah Homes Investment Program (program) to rehabilitate attainable homes within the city of the first or second class boundaries; <hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset date for the program by one year;<hr><ltbullet>allows for certain uses of school surplus lands for affordable housing;<hr><ltbullet>provides that among the trustees appointed to the Utah Housing Corporation that no more than two trustees are from the same county;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the sunset date for the Utah Housing Corporation; <hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Transportation may make rules regarding the sale of surplus real property to a state agency under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Utah Housing Corporation to return deposits made by the state treasurer for loan financing for certain attainable homes upon certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a coordination clause with H.B. 412, Boards and Commissions Revisions, regarding Section 63H-8-201.

bills.title: Drug Overdose Training Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses training and education concerning drug overdose recognition.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Integrated Healthcare within the Department of Health and Human Services to create training and educational materials regarding recognizing a drug overdose;<hr><ltbullet>requires an alcohol training and education seminar to include, for certain trainees, the drug overdose training and educational materials created by the Division of Integrated Healthcare;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the receipt of the drug overdose training and educational materials does not create or increase liability for the individual who receives them; and  <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeless Rights Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill describes the rights of homeless individuals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>describes a homeless individual's rights, including the right to:<hr><ltbullet1>receive equal treatment by the state and a political subdivision of the state in the same manner as any other individual;<hr><ltbullet1>register to vote and to vote in elections; and<hr><ltbullet1>the protection of personal information; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a homeless individual has a right of action against a person who violates the homeless individual's rights; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a statute of limitations for a homeless individual to bring a right of action against a person who violates the homeless individual's rights.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Clarifies homeless individuals have a right to work, basic medical care, vote, and be in a public place when it's open. Allows a person to sue if these rights are violated.

bills.title: Maternal and Infant Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses newborn infant testing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections and the county jails to ensure that each female individual admitted to a correctional facility is tested for pregnancy;<hr><ltbullet>amends the membership of the Correctional Postnatal and Early Childhood Advisory Board (the board);<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date of the board;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to publish a privacy consent form pertaining to newborn infant testing;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the privacy consent form be provided to a newborn infant's parent or guardian prior to conducting a newborn infant heelstick screen;<hr><ltbullet>makes hearing loss a required newborn infant test, regardless of the number of annual births that occur at the hospital or setting where the infant was born; <hr><ltbullet>provides for giving a parent or guardian the option to consent to the department's retention policy for biological samples or genetic data collected through newborn infant testing;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to destroy a biological sample or any genetic data collected through newborn infant testing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Governmental Immunity Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Governmental Immunity Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>provides that, in certain circumstances, outside legal counsel is immune from suit to the same extent and on the same basis as an attorney who is an employee of a municipality; and<hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause to clarify a technical change made to Section 63G-7-201 in this bill and H.B. 48, Wildland Urban Interface Modifications, if both bills pass and become law.

bills.title: Mental Health Care Study Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the Department of Health and Human Services to issue a request for proposals to conduct a study.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services to issue a request for proposals to conduct a study on wait times and barriers for a child to see a therapist.
