bills.disability_law_center_description: Issues an RFP for a study on the barriers to mental health treatment for children.

bills.title: Access to Communication Device Location Information Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns access to communication device location information.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a mobile telecommunications service shall provide communication device location information as quickly as possible under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>adds certain law enforcement warrants that are prioritized as urgent regarding a missing individual in danger to the list of circumstances under which a mobile telecommunications service shall provide communication device location information as quickly as possible;<hr><ltbullet>requires, if a mobile telecommunications service establishes procedures for providing communication device location information, a method for a law enforcement agency to identify different types of requested information; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Charitable Contribution Tax Credit Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts an income tax credit for charitable contributions to affordable housing organizations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts a nonrefundable income tax credit for individuals who make charitable contributions to nonprofit organizations engaged in affordable housing;<hr><ltbullet>requires a claimant to obtain certification from each organization to which a charitable contribution is made; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for apportionment of the tax credit for nonresidents and part-year residents.

bills.title: Local Land Use Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to land use.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies and modifies statutes regarding municipal annexation and municipal boundary adjustments;<hr><ltbullet>renumbers and amends Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 4, Annexation, to Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 8, Annexation and Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 9, Municipal Boundary Adjustments;<hr><ltbullet>renumbers and amends the process by which a municipality or county conducts certain plan reviews;<hr><ltbullet>modifies notice requirements before a public hearing on a proposed land use regulation;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may not require a private individual or entity, including a community association or homeowners association, to permanently maintain or be responsible for a public access amenity or water utility unless certain conditions apply;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process by which a municipality or county inspects and approves or rejects the performance of warranty work;<hr><ltbullet>modifies a municipality's or county's process in regulating landscaping;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for a municipality or county to allow transferable development rights;<hr><ltbullet>creates a process by which an applicant may submit an identical floor plan to a municipality for an expedited review;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may not require a public hearing for a request for a variance or another land use appeal;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the ability of a municipality or county to enforce an ordinance by withholding a building permit or certificate of occupancy;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the State Fire Code Act;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to special districts and land use;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process by which a person may convey real property by deed to a public entity; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Elections Office
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues relating to Utah's election system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides for the appointment of a conflict of interest elections officer to act in the place of the lieutenant governor if a complaint or election controversy arises that has any connection to a race for office in which the governor or lieutenant governor is, or seeks to be, a candidate;<hr><ltbullet>describes the terms of service and authority of the conflict of interest elections officer; and <hr><ltbullet>creates the Elections Oversight Task Force and establishes the task force's:<hr><ltbullet1>membership;<hr><ltbullet1>duties; <hr><ltbullet1>reporting requirements; and<hr><ltbullet1>repeal date.

bills.title: State Holiday Modifications
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the day on which Juneteenth National Freedom Day is recognized in Utah.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that June 19, called Juneteenth National Freedom Day, is a legal holiday in Utah;<hr><ltbullet>consistent with other legal holidays in Utah, provides for recognition of Juneteenth National Freedom Day on the preceding Friday or subsequent Monday if the holiday falls on a Saturday or Sunday, respectively; and<hr><ltbullet>amends parent-time schedules in relation to Juneteenth National Freedom Day.

bills.title: Gold Medal Schools Pilot Program
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Gold Medal Schools Pilot Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>creates a three-year pilot program to promote healthy lifestyle choices in schools;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to administer the program; and<hr><ltbullet> creates a reporting requirement.

bills.title: Dental Practice Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to dental practice.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions;<hr><ltbullet>amends supervision provisions regarding dental professionals;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding dental hygiene schools;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the practice of dentistry and dental hygiene;<hr><ltbullet>amends teledentistry provisions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes other conforming and technical changes.

bills.title: Service Marketplace Platforms Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to service marketplace platforms.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a daycare provider to affiliate with a service marketplace platform;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a presumption that a daycare provider affiliating with a service marketplace platform is an independent contractor; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Signature Collection Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to nominations for elective office.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for a voter to have the voter's signature removed from a petition to nominate a candidate of a registered political party that is not a qualified political party to elective office;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election official to post on the lieutenant governor's website the name and date of signature of each voter who signs a nomination petition;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an election official from removing a voter's signature from a nomination petition if the election official has already verified the voter's signature;  <hr><ltbullet>requires an election official to notify the county or district attorney if a person whose signature appears on a nomination petition notifies the election official that the person did not sign the nomination petition;<hr><ltbullet>describes deadlines and procedures related to the processes described above;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause that adds an hourly deadline to Sections 20A-9-405 and 20A-9-408 to reflect the time computation changes made in H.B. 299, Election Code Time Computation Revisions, if both bills pass and become law; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Commercial Driver License Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses qualifications for a commercial driver license.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies which criminal offenses disqualify a driver from holding a commercial driver license; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a commercial driver license applicant to complete a background check.

bills.title: National Guard Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the National Guard.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the appointment of the adjutant general;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the management of the State Armory Board;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies what electronic means the State Armory Board may use in conducting meetings and taking official action;<hr><ltbullet>allows for the National Guard to repay student loans for active members of the National Guard using current funds;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the appointment and responsibilities of certain judge advocates;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the use of force by a military service member or a member of the National Guard in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a military chaplain may solemnize a marriage; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Sexual Offense Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions concerning sexual offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies what actions or omissions do not demonstrate consent with regard to certain sexual offenses; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Department of Natural Resources Funding Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses revenue and expenditures related to funding state accounts within the Department of Natural Resources.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to remit to the state money calculated based on certain new transmission facilities for deposit into the Species Protection Account;<hr><ltbullet>expands resources to be deposited into the Species Protection Account;<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting by the Division of Wildlife Resources and a study by the Office of Energy Development;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the payment of a tax on gross receipts of a radioactive waste facility derived from the disposal of concentrated depleted uranium and containerized waste, including having certain revenue be deposited into the Species Protection Account;<hr><ltbullet>imposes a tax related to certain wind or solar electric generation facilities to be deposited into the Species Protection Account; <hr><ltbullet>imposes an assessment on renewable energy parent entities to be deposited into the Species Protection Account;<hr><ltbullet>modifies calculation of centrally assessed new growth;<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to remit to the state a portion of centrally assessed new growth for deposit into the Species Protection Account;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes rulemaking; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Department of Natural Resources Funding Amendments

bills.title: Population Data Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses population data.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>in circumstances where a population estimate is available from the Utah Population Committee and the United States Bureau of the Census, requires the use of the census or census estimate only if the Utah Population Committee estimate is unavailable; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Population Committee to annually provide an adjusted sub-county population estimate for each municipality and unincorporated area within the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires government entities to share information with the Utah Population Committee that is necessary for the committee to prepare population estimates; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Presumption of State Jurisdiction Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses state sovereignty and establishes a presumption of state jurisdiction.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the principles of state sovereignty, including the presumption that jurisdiction over subject matters not enumerated to the federal government in the United States Constitution remains with the state;<hr><ltbullet>provides that any presumption against state jurisdiction may be overcome only by federal demonstration of specific constitutional authorization;<hr><ltbullet>places the burden on the federal government in jurisdictional conflicts between the state and federal government;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Federalism Commission to coordinate with federal agencies and state entities to help to resolve jurisdictional conflicts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Civics Education Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends certain graduation requirements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds a social studies graduation requirement;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain social studies related instruction; <hr><ltbullet>extends a deadline for certain instructional materials recommendations;<hr><ltbullet>removes a testing requirement;<hr><ltbullet>provides for alternatives to portions of certain graduation requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Child Care Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to child care.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Child Care (office) to prepare and present an annual report on the development and implementation of child care subsidies to certain legislative committees;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Office of the Legislative Auditor General shall conduct an audit of the office for certain purposes; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Court Fine Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to compensatory service and credits toward criminal fines.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the rate that is used to credit compensatory service toward payment of criminal fines;<hr><ltbullet>permits a judge to order that the cost of any court-ordered treatment or course be credited toward payment of criminal fines if the treatment or course is completed; and<hr><ltbullet>permits credit for the cost of a court-ordered treatment or course to also be issued by means of a judge's order on a petition for remittance.

bills.title: Child Support Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill  amends provisions related to child support obligations for a child in state custody.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a parent or other obligated individual is not responsible to pay the state child support for a child who is in state custody, which includes custody of the Division of Child and Family Services and the Division of Juvenile Justice and Youth Services;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the juvenile court system from ordering child support to be paid to the state because a child is in state custody;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Recovery Services to cease collection of past due amounts of child support ordered in connection with a child being in state custody and to forgive any outstanding balances owed for such child support obligations;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Office of Recovery Services in relation to collection of child support for a child who is in state custody;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the attorney general in relation to collection of child support for a child who is in state custody;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions that permit and regulate child support while a child is in state custody; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Insurance Revisions
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses stop-loss insurance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for a small employer stop-loss insurance contract;<hr><ltbullet>regulates with which small employers a stop-loss insurer or reinsurer may enter stop-loss insurance contracts;<hr><ltbullet>provides a transition period for existing small employer stop-loss insurance contracts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Waters Access Act Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses access to public waters.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "navigable water"; <hr><ltbullet>addresses public recreation access; <hr><ltbullet>addresses when a stream bed is considered private property; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies when an easement for public recreational access is created; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Firearm Attachment Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses firearm attachments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offenses of unlawful possession, manufacture, distribution, or sale of a machinegun firearm attachment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Antiquities Protection Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to historic preservation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>directs the State Historic Preservation Office (office) to conduct a statewide public awareness media campaign to educate and inform the public on issues relating to cultural sites;<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to provide seminars and training to agencies, organizations, and individuals on the preservation and protection of cultural cites; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Child Care Business Tax Credit
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts an income tax credit for employer-provided child care.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts nonrefundable corporate and individual income tax credits for employer-provided child care; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Religious Expression in Higher Education
bills.general_provisions: This bill protects student organizations' rights on a higher education campus.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds protections for student organizations;<hr><ltbullet>establishes definitions for protected activities and benefits;<hr><ltbullet>modifies institutional duties regarding student organization rights;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions on free expression policies; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Emergency Medical Services Revisions
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses emergency medical services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>grants certain enforcement authority to the Bureau of Emergency Medical Services (bureau);<hr><ltbullet>requires the Trauma System and Emergency Medical Services Committee (committee) to make an annual recommendation to the bureau regarding the schedule of potential fines that the bureau should assess and collect;  <hr><ltbullet>requires the bureau to consider the committee's annual recommendation, and to adopt, publish, and enforce a schedule of potential fines for violations by a licensed emergency medical service provider;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Emergency Medical Services Critical Needs Account;<hr><ltbullet>requires fines collected to be deposited into the Emergency Medical Services Critical Needs Account; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Unlicensed Driver Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses drivers without a driver license, driving privilege card, or learner permit.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the circumstances in which law enforcement is required to impound a vehicle;<hr><ltbullet>addresses identification of an individual who operates a vehicle without a valid driving credential;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain fees to be waived in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies certain fees;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to merge changes in this bill with changes in H.B. 234, Motorcycle Safety Amendments.

bills.title: Banning Foreign Funding in Ballot Propositions and Elections
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes provisions related to foreign financial influence in ballot propositions and elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a foreign national from making or attempting to make a contribution or an independent expenditure for a political purpose;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a candidate, officeholder, or entity subject to campaign finance reporting requirements from knowingly soliciting, accepting, or receiving a contribution from a foreign national;<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate, officeholder, or entity that receives contributions to annually certify to the lieutenant governor that the candidate, officeholder, or entity did not knowingly accept a contribution from a foreign national;<hr><ltbullet>requires each corporation or labor organization subject to campaign finance reporting requirements to certify that the corporation or labor organization is not a foreign national;<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate, officeholder, or entity that receives a contribution from a foreign national to:<hr><ltbullet1>immediately notify the lieutenant governor; <hr><ltbullet1>return the contribution to the foreign national; and<hr><ltbullet1>if the foreign national refuses to accept the return of the contribution, disperse the value of the contribution into the state's General Fund<hr><ltbullet>prohibits any person from aiding or facilitating a violation of the prohibitions described above; <hr><ltbullet>establishes a criminal penalty for a person who violates the provisions described above;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to impose a civil penalty against a foreign national that makes a contribution or independent expenditure; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Statutory Intent Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies or removes provisions relating to legislative intent and statutory interpretation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes certain statements of legislative intent and statutory interpretation;<hr><ltbullet>restates, modifies, replaces, or recharacterizes certain provisions that are stated in the form of legislative intent; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: LEA Reporting Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the State Board of Education (state board) to study and make recommendations regarding local education agency (LEA) reporting of costs associated with implementing new legislation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to study methods for LEAs to report on the costs of implementing new legislation;<hr><ltbullet>outlines the required elements of the report;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board consult with LEAs;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to report findings and recommendations to the Education Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires legislative committees to review and consider the recommendations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Small School District Scale of Operations Formula
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the formula for necessarily existent small schools funding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the formula for necessarily existent small schools funding.

bills.title: School Fee Waiver Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to school fee waivers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency to waive the fee for one school trip per academic year for each student;<hr><ltbullet>limits the number of fee waivers a student may receive;<hr><ltbullet>requires local education agencies to establish a cap on fee waivers; and<hr><ltbullet>allows a student to request a fee waiver for a second trip.

bills.title: Auxiliary Housing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding auxiliary housing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of owner-occupancy requirements for primary dwelling units; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Attendance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes chronic absenteeism data requirements and a study.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes chronic absenteeism data requirements and a study.

bills.title: Blood Transfusion Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses blood transfusions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>except in certain situations, disallows a health care facility or provider from prohibiting a patient from providing the patient's own blood product or the blood product of the patient's directed donor for any potential transfusion related to the patient's health care; and<hr><ltbullet>provides immunity from liability to health care providers and facilities for a patient's injury, damages, or death occurring in connection with a transfusion of blood product provided by the patient.

bills.title: Adult-oriented Performance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the criminal offense of adult-oriented performance in a public place or in the presence of a minor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offense of adult-oriented performance in a public place or in the presence of a minor.

bills.title: Foods Additives in Schools
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions to prohibit consumable items containing certain food additives from being provided in a public school.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions to prohibit consumable items containing certain food additives from being provided in a public school under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions.

bills.title: SNAP Funds Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to the Supplement Nutrition Assistance Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to Supplement Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP); <hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Workforce Services (department) to request a waiver from the federal government regarding the use of SNAP benefits for certain foods;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to: <hr><ltbullet1>submit the waiver before July 1, 2025;<hr><ltbullet1>implement the waiver within a certain period of time upon approval of the waiver; and<hr><ltbullet1>if the waiver is denied, reapply until a waiver is approved; and<hr><ltbullet> has reporting requirements.

bills.title: Government Employment Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to government employment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an independent entity to opt into participating in the pay for performance management system;<hr><ltbullet>amends which employees of eligible agencies may participate in the pay for performance management system;<hr><ltbullet>repeals Section 63A-17-111; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Human Trafficking Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill increases penalties for certain human trafficking offenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases penalties for certain human trafficking offenses; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Budgetary Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the governor's proposed budget.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the governor, when preparing the governor's proposed budget, to consider including employee wages and benefits increases for:<hr><ltbullet1>local health departments, local mental health authorities, local substance abuse authorities, and local area agencies; and<hr><ltbullet1>corporations that provide direct services under contract with the Utah State Office of Rehabilitation, the Division of Services for People with Disabilities, the Division of Child and Family Services, and the Division of Juvenile Justice and Youth Services; and<hr><ltbullet>directs the governor to provide with the governor's budget additional related information.

bills.title: Mini-motorcycle Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of mini-motorcycles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses existing law regarding mini-motorcycles;<hr><ltbullet>addresses violations of mini-motorcycle users;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the safety provisions in Title 41, Chapter 6a, Part 11, Bicycles and Other Vehicles, Regulation of Operation, to apply to bicycles, electric assisted bicycles, motor assisted scooters, and mopeds; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: School Board Referendum Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to local referendums.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>subject to certain exceptions, establishes a process for voters who are residents of a school district to hold a local referendum on any legislative action taken by the local school board, including the local school board's decision to increase a tax or impose a new tax; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medicaid Pharmacy Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to Medicaid pharmacy benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires Medicaid pharmacy benefits to be provided through the fee-for-service Medicaid model.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires Medicaid to pay for drugs on a fee-for-service basis rather than through an accountable care organization.

bills.title: Child Care Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to child care.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the time employed as a preschool teacher in a child care program is equivalent to the time employed in a public school or accredited private school for purposes of relicensing;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the use of housing and transit reinvestment zone funds to include expansion of child care facilities within the zone; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Asset Ownership Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the state ownership of certain environmental assets.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a state entity selling or exchanging an environmental commodity to report a digital identification number to the Office of Energy Development;<hr><ltbullet>exempts from reporting requirements an environmental commodity created from activities on school and institutional trust lands; <hr><ltbullet>declares that an environmental commodity created from activities receiving state funds is the property of the state in proportion to the state funds contributed to create the environmental commodity; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an environmental commodity created or purchased by a state entity remains under the control of the state entity; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes duties for the state treasurer in managing an environmental commodity.

bills.title: Boards and Commissions Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to membership on a board, commission, committee, or council (board).
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>eliminates requirements providing that no more than a certain number of members of certain boards may be affiliated with or a member of the same political party;<hr><ltbullet>modifies appointment provisions and removes members who are legislators from certain boards; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Custody Proceedings Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses situations related to child custody.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a peace officer or child welfare caseworker may not take specific actions related to the custody of a child based on certain actions of the child's parent;<hr><ltbullet>provides that in a proceeding where custody and parent-time of a minor child are at issue, the court may not apply a negative inference against a parent based on certain actions of the parent; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Raw Milk Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses enforcement steps with regard to raw milk, including when raw milk is suspected in a food borne illness outbreak.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Department of Agriculture and Food (department) to make rules regarding raw milk testing at third-party laboratories;<hr><ltbullet>addresses epidemiological investigation;<hr><ltbullet>addresses when and how testing occurs;<hr><ltbullet>provides the standard for reissuing a suspended permit;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the issuance of a cease and desist order;<hr><ltbullet>provides the standard for removing a cease and desist order following a foodborne illness outbreak;<hr><ltbullet>addresses disclosure of persons subject to a cease and desist order;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to provide information to a producer under certain circumstances; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies penalty provisions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Commissioner Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill clarifies employment provisions for water commissioners.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when a water commissioner is treated as a regular full-time employee;<hr><ltbullet>makes water commissioners eligible for health and retirement benefits under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>exempts water commissioners from the Utah State Personnel Management Act.

bills.title: Driver License Suspension Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses suspension of driver licensees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Driver License Division to notify a licensee or applicant by certified letter if the division takes action against a driver license.

bills.title: Public Safety Retirement Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions governing postretirement reemployment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a public safety retiree within the Utah Retirement Systems (URS) to return to work for a URS participating employer without affecting the retiree's retirement allowance, if the retiree returns to work for a local education agency providing law enforcement services and meets other specified criteria.

bills.title: Data Sharing Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to social media data portability and interoperability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes legislative findings about social media data control and competition;<hr><ltbullet>amends consumer data rights related to social media data;<hr><ltbullet>requires social media companies to implement data interoperability interfaces;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for data sharing between social media services;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking and enforcement authority to the Division of Consumer Protection;<hr><ltbullet>provides for civil penalties; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a severability provision.

bills.title: Real Estate Revisions
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Division of Real Estate's investigation practices and procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Division of Real Estate's (division) authority to investigate licensees, including time periods for retention of certain documents, and the division's ability to request documents;<hr><ltbullet>provides guidance on the determination of disciplinary actions taken by the Real Estate Commission;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to advertising practices;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain conduct by a principal broker does not created an agency relationship with a buyer;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the inclusion of the brokerage's name being included in an advertisement or through a link requiring only one click; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Halogen Emissions Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses major sources of halogen emissions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Air Quality (division) to complete a best available control technology emissions reduction plan for major halogen sources;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to submit an annual report on halogen emissions to the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environmental Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Grazing Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to grazing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Wildlife Resources, before purchasing or acquiring a grazing permit, to obtain approval from:<hr><ltbullet1>a local land use authority; <hr><ltbullet1>the Department of Natural Resources; and<hr><ltbullet1>the Department of Agriculture and Food; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipality Regulation of Open House Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill prohibits a municipality from regulating an open house.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term "open house";<hr><ltbullet>provides that the governing body of a municipality may not regulate an open house differently than a residential use;<hr><ltbullet>provides that any ordinance regulating an open house differently than a residential use is void; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Voting Registration Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to voter registration.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a process for an individual to receive a voter registration form and voter registration information when purchasing a hunting or fishing license.

bills.title: School Activity Eligibility Commission Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding the School Activity Eligibility Commission (commission).
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>broadens the scope of available appointees to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>modifies quorum requirements for the commission;<hr><ltbullet>modifies a requirement to establish certain baseline ranges;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an eligibility determination of the commission is for a given school year;<hr><ltbullet>provides a standard of proof for eligibility determinations of the commission;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits public schools from participating with an athletic association that does not provide administrative staff support to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the scheduling of commission meetings throughout the school year with certain submission deadlines and ad-hoc meetings for students who do not meet certain deadlines; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Department of Public Safety Fee Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses fees collected by the Bureau of Criminal Identification.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the fee for a concealed firearm permit for out-of-state applicants assessed before July 1, 2026;<hr><ltbullet>amends fee provisions related to concealed firearm permits assessed after July 1, 2026, allowing the Bureau of Criminal Identification to set related fees in accordance with the procedures specified in Section 63J-1-504;<hr><ltbullet>amends when funds from the Concealed Weapons Account are transferred to the Suicide Prevention and Education Fund;<hr><ltbullet>increases the annual fee for offenders on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry assessed before July 1, 2026;<hr><ltbullet>amends fee provisions related to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry assessed after July 1, 2026, allowing the Department of Public Safety to set related fees in accordance with the procedures specified in Section 63J-1-504; and<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause coordinating changes between this bill and S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendment.

bills.title: Resident Student Tuition
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the list of individuals who are eligible for in-state resident student tuition.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the list of individuals who are eligible for in-state resident student tuition to include employment-based immigrant visas.

bills.title: Used Electric Vehicle Battery Disclosure Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses disclosures required prior to the sale of an electric motor vehicle.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a person selling a used electric motor vehicle to make certain disclosures regarding the battery status;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy for a consumer who purchases a used electric motor vehicle without receiving a required disclosure; and<hr><ltbullet>requires certain information to be available to electric motor vehicle users.

bills.title: Property Tax Changes
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the minimum basic tax rate imposed by school districts to be certified by consensus between the State Tax Commission, the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget, and the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst;<hr><ltbullet>allows for the use of money in the Public Education Economic Stabilization Restricted Account to fund certain shortfalls in the basic school program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Transportation Funding Alignment Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill adjusts a sales and use tax earmark related to transportation and adjusts other transportation funding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>changes the percentage of a sales and use tax earmark for the Transportation Investment Fund of 2005;<hr><ltbullet>removes a transfer from the Transportation Fund to the Transportation Investment Fund of 2005;<hr><ltbullet>removes language to restore funding for litter and carcass removal for the Department of Transportation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Security and Land Restriction Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to security.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a food delivery company mark military land as a food delivery dead zone;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes delivery drivers and staff on military land to report a violation of a food delivery dead zone;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to enforce a food delivery dead zone;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a county recorder make a form available for an individual to disclose the individual's connection to a restriction foreign entity;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a county recorder send a form upon which an individual has disclose the individual's connection to a restricted foreign entity to the Department of Public Safety; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense for:<hr><ltbullet1>a person purchasing land on behalf of a restricted foreign entity; and<hr><ltbullet1>an individual who fails to disclose to a county recorder the individual's connection to a restricted foreign entity.

bills.title: Kinship Child Placement Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses kinship caregivers for children in the custody of the Division of Child and Family Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>when a child in the custody of the Division of Child and Family Services (division) is placed with the child's relative, requires the division to make available certain payments to the relative to help support the child prior to the relative becoming a licensed or certified kinship caregiver;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to report information regarding payments provided to kinship caregivers to the Social Services Appropriations Subcommittee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Tobacco and Electronic Cigarette Enforcement Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to tobacco and electronic cigarette products.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the ban on flavored electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the sale of flavored electronic cigarette products if they do not meet certain tracking requirements;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the nicotine content limit for electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to electronic cigarette product enforcement;<hr><ltbullet>excludes flavored electronic cigarette products from the requirement that electronic cigarette products obtain premarket authorization from the federal Food and Drug Administration;<hr><ltbullet>creates a temporary registry for flavored electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the electronic cigarette product registry;<hr><ltbullet>creates a flavored electronic cigarette product registry;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements for what type of flavored electronic cigarette products may be sold in the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety to create systems to improve enforcement of tobacco and electronic cigarette laws;<hr><ltbullet>creates penalties for general retail tobacco businesses that sell flavored electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>raises permit fees for general tobacco retailers;<hr><ltbullet>for retail tobacco specialty businesses:<hr><ltbullet1>raises permit fees;<hr><ltbullet1>creates identification scanning requirements; and<hr><ltbullet1>creates surveillance footage requirements;<hr><ltbullet>creates a tobacco handling permit for retail tobacco specialty business employees and operators;<hr><ltbullet>creates a tax on flavored electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>amends criminal penalties regarding the illegal sale of tobacco and electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal penalty for the use of certain flavored electronic cigarettes;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits retail tobacco specialty businesses from selling a product containing nicotine to a restricted nicotine individual;<hr><ltbullet>requires the court to designate an individual as a nicotine restricted individual if the individual is convicted of providing certain products containing nicotine to a minor; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause with H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, to ensure the policy changes made in this bill are accurately reflected if both bills pass.

bills.title: Agritourism Building Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses building code requirements related to agritourism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>includes an agricultural structure used in connection with an agritourism activity in the list of structures exempt from compliance with the state construction code; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Health and Human Services Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated language;<hr><ltbullet>updates code references;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Health and Human Services (department) may examine and audit the expenditures of public funds provided to a local health department;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the required qualifications for the department's executive director and deputy directors;<hr><ltbullet>updates the name of a division and an office within the department;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the executive director of the department may create committees within the department, subject to certain conditions and requirements;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the department to access certain records of individuals licensed or certified by the Division of Professional Licensing for specific purposes;<hr><ltbullet>adds additional items to the list of duties of the department;<hr><ltbullet>updates language to be consistent with the transfer of certain emergency medical services responsibilities from the department to the Department of Public Safety;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the administration of stock albuterol by a qualified adult;<hr><ltbullet>updates references from "targeted case management" to "case managers";<hr><ltbullet>allows the Office of Public Guardian to have access to certain documents and information, including private, controlled, or protected information, when reasonably necessary to fulfill the office's duties and responsibilities;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Division of Services for People with Disabilities must determine the most appropriate, least restrictive setting for an individual with an intellectual disability within the division's system;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding fetal death certificates and certificates of early term stillbirth;<hr><ltbullet>updates code references to reflect the current name of the Office of Substance Use and Mental Health within the department;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Recovery Services to review child support guidelines and submit a summary of the review to the Judiciary Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, gives the Office of Public Guardian authority to obtain information or records related to an incapacitated person necessary to perform its duties. Also authorizes qualified school

bills.title: Building Code Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies local government provisions relating to high tunnel structures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides an exemption for a high tunnel structure from county building regulation; and<hr><ltbullet>adds to the permissible uses of a high tunnel structure.

bills.title: Impaired Driving Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns the collection and reporting of certain DUI information.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice (the commission) to include certain DUI crash and arrest data in an annual DUI report;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety's Criminal Investigations and Technical Services Division to collect certain DUI crash and arrest data and provide the data to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes law enforcement agency reporting requirements concerning the collection and reporting of certain DUI crash and arrest data;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the public safety data portal is the repository for the statutorily required DUI crash and arrest data; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Interdicted Person Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides that an individual convicted of driving under the influence may be designated as an interdicted person.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a person convicted of driving under the influence may be designated as an interdicted person and is prohibited from purchasing alcohol for a certain time period;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to designate an individual as a interdicted person if the person is convicted of an extreme DUI;<hr><ltbullet>allows the court to determine the time period of interdiction;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services to provide training on verification of whether a person is an interdicted person, including inspection of the person's identification card or driver license;<hr><ltbullet>requires a person designated as an interdicted person to obtain a unique driver license or identification card with security features indicating that the person is an interdicted person;<hr><ltbullet>allows a person to voluntarily obtain a unique driver license or identification card with security features indicating that the person is an interdicted person;<hr><ltbullet>provides relevant definitions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Environmental Legal Action Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies a bond requirement for an environmental action.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "environmental action" to address a permit issued by the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Outdoor Recreation Revisions
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to the Off-highway Vehicle Account administered by the Division of Outdoor Recreation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term "off-highway vehicle facility";<hr><ltbullet>allows the Division of Outdoor Recreation to award upfront cash grants from the Off-highway Vehicle Account for projects in counties of the third through sixth class; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Uniform Mortgage Modification Act
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for modifications that may be made to recorded mortgages and obligations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>codifies the types of modifications that may be made to a mortgage loan that will not materially prejudice interest holders; and<hr><ltbullet>contains safe harbor provisions for mortgage modifications that do not materially prejudice the holders of a junior interest.

bills.title: Franchisee Protection Act
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes protections for franchisees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a franchisor from requiring a franchisee to open on a when operating conflicts with the franchisee's sincerely held religious belief; <hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions under which a franchisor may require a franchisee to open a franchise despite a conflict with the franchisee's sincerely held religious belief;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy for a franchisee if the franchisor violates the prohibition without an exception; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a civil penalty for a franchisor that violates the prohibition without an exception.

bills.title: Construction Trades Licensing Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies requirements for construction trade licenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for a general engineering contractor license for electrical utilities;<hr><ltbullet>allows an applicant with sufficient experience to obtain a general engineering contractor license;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the division to establish by rule sufficient experience for an applicant with a journeyman lineman license from another jurisdiction; and<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for an HVAC contractor license.

bills.title: Candidate Disclosure Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to conflict of interest disclosures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate for local elective office to file a conflict of interest disclosure statement at the time the candidate files a declaration of candidacy; <hr><ltbullet>creates an exception to the disclosure requirement described above if the candidate is seeking reelection to the same office and already, that same year, filed a conflict of interest disclosure statement;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election official to post the candidate's disclosure statement on the political subdivision's website;  <hr><ltbullet>subject to certain exceptions, requires state and local candidates and officeholders to annually disclose any misdemeanor or felony offense for which the candidate or officeholder has been convicted by a court located within or outside of this state;<hr><ltbullet>for purposes of laws governing when a public employer may ask a question about a job applicant's criminal history, specifies that a candidate or officeholder described above is not an applicant for a job with a public employer;<hr><ltbullet>creates deadlines and procedures related to the processes described above; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Data Privacy Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to governmental data privacy and privacy oversight.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for privacy annotations and privacy notices;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for government website privacy notices;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to data breach notification requirements;<hr><ltbullet>renames and modifies duties of the state privacy auditor;<hr><ltbullet>modifies enforcement provisions related to privacy requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Revisions to Election Law
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>changes the voter registration deadline to 21 days before the day of an election for all methods of voter registration;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a deadline for a voter:<hr><ltbullet1>who will not otherwise receive a ballot by mail in the upcoming election to request to receive a ballot by mail; or<hr><ltbullet1>who will receive a ballot by mail in the upcoming election to change the address to which the ballot will be mailed; <hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to information an election officer is required to report in relation to ballot processing;<hr><ltbullet>provides deadlines for tabulating ballots and publishing tabulation results;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer to post unofficial election results on the Monday after the day of the election;<hr><ltbullet>requires a ballot drop box to remain open until the polls close on election day;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to award a contract, via a request for proposals, to designate a voting system, including equipment and software, that will be used throughout the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires that, as election officers replace voting equipment and software, the election officers replace the voting equipment and software with voting equipment and software that is part of the election system designated under the preceding paragraph; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, mandates all counties use the same voting equipment.

bills.title: Great Salt Lake Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues related to the Great Salt Lake.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies metalliferous compounds for purposes of severance tax issues;<hr><ltbullet>addresses an exception from procurement provisions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements related to a feasibility assessment for activities on the Great Salt Lake;<hr><ltbullet>changes provision related to adaptive management berms;<hr><ltbullet>addresses powers and duties of the Great Salt Lake Commissioner; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Statewide Catalyst Campus Model
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a grant program to help local education agencies create or expand catalyst centers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Catalyst Center Grant Program (program) to support local education agencies (LEA) in creating or expanding catalyst centers; <hr><ltbullet>allows for multi-year grants and capital expenditures;<hr><ltbullet>requires alignment with labor market needs, LEA strategic plans, and state career and technical education goals;<hr><ltbullet>establishes accountability measures, including limits on carryforward funds and annual reporting;<hr><ltbullet>requires Talent Ready Utah and the Utah Leading through Effective, Actionable, and Dynamic Education to create a marketing campaign for the program;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain individuals from educator licensing requirements;<hr><ltbullet>amends the Public Education Economic Stabilization Restricted Account to fund the program; <hr><ltbullet>creates requirements related to art and fine arts credits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Pretrial Release Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses pretrial release.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides a sunset date for statutory provisions related to a violation of a pretrial order;<hr><ltbullet>creates a crime for a violation of a pretrial order;<hr><ltbullet>addresses an arrest by a county sheriff for a violation of a pretrial order;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the jurisdiction of the district court to address a violation of a pretrial order; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Student Athlete Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates provisions related to an institution compensating a student athlete for the use of the student athlete's name, image, or likeness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>allows an institution of higher education to use certain funds to compensate a student athlete directly for the use of the student athlete's name, image, or likeness;<hr><ltbullet>provides certain protections to institutions and student athletes; and<hr><ltbullet>creates an audit requirement for the Utah Board of Higher Education.

bills.title: Victim Privacy Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows a victim of a crime to have the victim's initials used instead of the victim's name in publicly available criminal justice documents.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a victim of a crime to request to have the victim's initials used instead of the victim's name in publicly available criminal justice documents; <hr><ltbullet>requires a database of victim names that is searchable in response to a court order; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a database of victim names is a protected record under the Government Records Access and Management Act; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Judicial Election Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses judicial retention elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the number of votes required for a justice or judge to be retained in a judicial retention election.

bills.title: Artificial Intelligence Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to the regulation of mental health chatbots that use artificial intelligence technology.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet> establishes protections for users of mental health chatbots that use artificial intelligence technology;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain uses of personal information by a mental health chatbot;<hr><ltbullet>requires a mental health chatbot to make certain disclosures to users;<hr><ltbullet>provides enforcement authority to the Division of Consumer Protection;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for creating and maintaining policies for mental health chatbots;<hr><ltbullet>creates rebuttable presumptions for suppliers who comply with policy requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a severability clause.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Cannot sell or share user health information or input without consent of a user. Mental health chatbots must clearly inform users they are AI-based and not human, with periodic reminders during intera

bills.title: State School Board Transparency Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates new duties for the Utah State Board of Education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to publish information related to state board meetings on the state board's website; and<hr><ltbullet>may require the state board to issue a report.

bills.title: Local Government Fees Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies and enacts provisions related to municipal and county fees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a city from imposing a fee on the general public for broadband or public safety service, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a town from imposing a fee on the general public for public safety service, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a municipality or county to impose a transportation utility fee if the municipality or county complies with certain requirements;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process and requirements for a municipality or county to impose a transportation utility fee; <hr><ltbullet>provides that property owned by a religious organization may, under certain circumstances, be exempt from a transportation utility fee;<hr><ltbullet>provides a process to hold a referendum on the imposition of a transportation utility fee or an increase to an existing transportation utility fee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Fits All Scholarship Program Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Utah Fits All Scholarship Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>strengthens residency requirements and income verification process;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of the program manager;<hr><ltbullet>creates a financial administrator to process payments and fund expenditures from a scholarship account;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits contracted entities from charging processing fees to families;<hr><ltbullet>establishes deadlines for scholarship acceptance or denial;<hr><ltbullet>limits extracurricular expenses to 20% of the scholarship amount;<hr><ltbullet>limits physical education expenses to an additional 20% of the scholarship amount;<hr><ltbullet>creates procedures for students with special needs;<hr><ltbullet>enhances program manager accountability through audits and transparency;<hr><ltbullet>adds requirements for a local education agency acting as qualified providers;<hr><ltbullet>allows for scholarship amount rollovers;<hr><ltbullet>creates a Utah Fits All Scholarship Restricted Account (the account);<hr><ltbullet>allows funds within the account to accrue interest and be invested;<hr><ltbullet>allows for rollover amounts of unused scholarship awards;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the State Tax Commission's role in income verification; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Transient Room Tax Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the transient room tax and creates the Outdoor Recreation Mitigation Grant Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the acceptable uses of transient room tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a county to enter into an interlocal agreement with a municipality within the county to share county transient room tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>modifies reporting requirements on counties that impose transient room tax;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain municipalities may appoint board members to a tourism tax advisory board;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to review a county's report on transient room tax and determine if the report is sufficient and compliant;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the maximum county tax rate on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services for counties of the second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth class;<hr><ltbullet>extends an earmark on certain transient room tax revenue for a county of the first class; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the state tax rate on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;<hr><ltbullet>imposes an additional state tax on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services that take place within a county of the first class;<hr><ltbullet>directs the State Tax Commission to distribute certain revenue the state collects on short-term rentals of tourist home, hotel, motel, or trailer court accommodations and services;<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset on the State Search and Rescue Advisory Board; <hr><ltbullet>creates a sunset review;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the uses of the Transient Room Tax Fund;<hr><ltbullet>establishes an outdoor recreation mitigation grant program within the Division of Outdoor Recreation;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Outdoor Recreation Mitigation Grant Fund;<hr><ltbullet>describes the criteria to apply for and receive an outdoor recreation mitigation grant;<hr><ltbullet>describes the acceptable uses of an outdoor recreation mitigation grant;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Outdoor Recreation to provide a written report annually to the Revenue and Taxation and Political Subdivisions Interim committees; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the sunset date on the Volunteer Emergency Medical Service Personnel Health Insurance Program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Signature Verification Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provision related to signature verification.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for a registered voter who manually signs a petition to nominate a candidate for elective office, requires the election officer to post the voter's name and other voter-related information on the lieutenant governor's website for at least 90 days;<hr><ltbullet>if a voter's information in the voter registration database contains a valid email address, requires an election officer to send an email to the voter notifying the voter that:<hr><ltbullet1>the voter's name and other voter-related information is posted on the website described above; and<hr><ltbullet1>the voter may request to have the voter's signature removed from the petition by submitting a written statement to the election officer;<hr><ltbullet>amends the information appearing on a nomination petition form to notify a voter of the posting and signature removal process described above;<hr><ltbullet>implements the posting and signature removal processes in relation to a candidate for elective office who is not affiliated with a political party;<hr><ltbullet>establishes and amends deadlines relating to signature submission, verification, and candidate certification; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Candidate Petition Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to ballot access.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for a candidate for elective office seeking the nomination of a political party by manually gathering the signatures of registered voters on a nomination petition:<hr><ltbullet1>prohibits a county clerk from verifying the signature of a voter if the county clerk is not the county clerk of the voter's residence; and<hr><ltbullet1>if an elective office's political division crosses the boundary of two or more counties, requires the county clerk to verify each signature and to certify the total number of verified signatures to the lieutenant governor; <hr><ltbullet>for an elective office described above, requires the lieutenant governor to:<hr><ltbullet1>count the verified signatures received from each county clerk where the candidate submitted signatures for verification; and<hr><ltbullet1>if the total number of signatures is sufficient for the candidate to qualify for placement on the ballot, certify the signatures;<hr><ltbullet>implements the signature verification and certification processes described above for a candidate who is not affiliated with a political party;  <hr><ltbullet>amends the form of a nomination petition to specify that only a registered voter of the county where a candidate will submit signatures for verification is eligible to have the voter's signature verified; <hr><ltbullet>establishes and amends deadlines relating to signature verification and certification of a petition described above; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Appropriations Subcommittee Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill updates the names of certain appropriations subcommittees.
