bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>changes the name of:<hr><ltbullet1>the "Business, Economic Development, and Labor Appropriations Subcommittee" to the "Economic and Community Development Appropriations Subcommittee";<hr><ltbullet1>the "Executive Offices and Criminal Justice Appropriations Subcommittee" to the "Criminal Justice Appropriations Subcommittee"; and<hr><ltbullet1>the "Infrastructure and General Government Appropriations Subcommittee" to the "Transportation and Infrastructure Appropriations Subcommittee"; <hr><ltbullet>modifies reporting requirements to align with the correct appropriations subcommittee; <hr><ltbullet>provides a coordination clause to coordinate with H.B. 200 regarding reporting requirements for a recreation restoration infrastructure grant; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Disclosures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the disclosure of travel provided to an elected official by a foreign entity or an agent of a foreign entity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>under certain circumstances, requires an elected official to disclose travel provided to the elected official by a foreign entity or an agent of a foreign entity; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Animal Crime Victim Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the release and forfeiture of an animal that is being held because of abuse or involvement in a crime.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides a process to permit, while legal resolution of a crime is ongoing, the release or transfer of an animal being held in a shelter because the animal was abused or was involved in a crime;<hr><ltbullet>permits a peace officer in possession of a warrant to enter premises or a vehicle to aid or take custody of an animal that is being criminally mistreated or is associated with a crime;<hr><ltbullet>requires notice to the owner or possessor of the animal;<hr><ltbullet>permits a shelter or government counsel to file a motion to have a court review whether an animal being held in a shelter due to criminal activity should be forfeited or transferred to alternative care;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for the hearing and the court's determination, and permits the animal's owner to be heard as part of the hearing;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for placement of the animal if the court orders ownership of the animal to be forfeited;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to order an animal owner to pay for the costs of sheltering an animal due to the owner's criminal activity;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to order an individual who has abused an animal or involved an animal in criminal activity to complete an educational or animal cruelty prevention program;<hr><ltbullet>provides cross references for the forfeiture procedure; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Rural School Funding Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Rural School Sports Facilities Grant Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Rural School Sports Facilities Grant Program to fund the construction or refurbishment of sports facilities in rural public schools;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah State Board of Education to administer the program;<hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency to apply for funds from the program;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to report on the program upon request; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Child Support Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to child support and family law.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a rebuttable presumption that an order terminating parental rights shall state the amount of any child support arrears and permit collection of arrears;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a divorce decree provide information about the Office of Recovery Services (office);<hr><ltbullet>beginning July 1, 2026, creates a rebuttable presumption that a child support order shall include a provision requiring an obligor parent to pay a recurring amount as an ongoing expense for child care;<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to study and prepare a proposed method for calculating the amount of an ongoing expense for child care and report the office's findings to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to propose to the Health and Human Services Interim Committee procedural and statutory considerations that are necessary to move from a receipt-based child care payment model to a model where all new or modified child support orders would instead require an ongoing expense for child care as the primary means for sharing child care costs; and<hr><ltbullet>gives reporting requirements to the office.

bills.title: State Sovereignty Fund
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the State Sovereignty Fund.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the State Sovereignty Fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the funding, investment, and distribution of the State Sovereignty Fund; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Safety Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to public safety.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions requiring a law enforcement agency of a city that is the seat of government for a county of the first class to enter into an interagency agreement related to public safety concerns with the Department of Public Safety (the department) and repeals the provisions, subject to a review by an interim committee, on July 1, 2027;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions requiring a law enforcement agency that has entered into an interagency agreement with the department to submit a report to the Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee regarding the interagency agreement and repeals the provisions, subject to a review by an interim committee, on July 1, 2027;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions allowing the Division of Facilities Construction and Management to use eminent domain to condemn unincorporated property owned by a city that is the seat of government for a county of the first class in certain circumstances that are repealed on July 1, 2027;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions taking effect on July 1, 2026, related to procedures that are required to be undertaken by a law enforcement agency before the law enforcement agency may take an adverse decision regarding a law enforcement officer's employment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires Salt Lake City to enter into a contract with the Department of Public Safety and report to the legislature on efforts to improve public safety. Also requires the city to contribute land for t

bills.title: Uniform Antitrust Pre-Merger Notification Act Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Uniform Antitrust Pre-Merger Notification Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a pre-merger notification is a notification filed with the Federal Trade Commission accompanied by a Hart-Scott-Rodino form;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a person filing a pre-merger notification file an electronic copy of a Hart-Scott-Rodino form and additional documentary material with the attorney general;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the attorney general from charging a fee connected with filing a Hart-Scott-Rodino form;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the attorney general from disclosing a Hart-Scott-Rodino form and other relevant information;<hr><ltbullet>classifies a Hart-Scott-Rodino form and other relevant information as a private record under the Government Records Access and Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the attorney general to disclose a Hart-Scott-Rodino form and other relevant information if relevant to an administrative proceeding or a judicial action;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the provisions enacted by this bill do not impact preexisting obligations of the attorney general;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the attorney general to disclose a Hart-Scott-Rodino form with the attorney general of another state under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the attorney general to seek the imposition of a civil penalty for noncompliance with the provisions of this bill;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to promote uniformity among jurisdictions that enact the provisions of this bill;<hr><ltbullet>limits the provisions of this bill to a pre-merger notification filed after the effective date of the bill; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Dependent Workers
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses protections for dependent workers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes benefits and protections for dependent workers.

bills.title: Automatic License Plate Reader Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies and establishes requirements for the use of automatic license plate reader systems.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> defines terms;  <hr><ltbullet>provides for authorized uses for automatic license plate reader systems by:<hr><ltbullet1>law enforcement agencies; and<hr><ltbullet1>other governmental entities;<hr><ltbullet>establishes reporting requirements regarding the use of automatic license plate reader systems for:<hr><ltbullet1>law enforcement agencies; and<hr><ltbullet1>other governmental entities;<hr><ltbullet>creates standards for data obtained from an automatic license plate reader system, including:<hr><ltbullet1>data security;<hr><ltbullet1>retention; and<hr><ltbullet1>sharing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Tax Sale Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses tax sales for properties in delinquency.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reduces the length of the redemption period after which the tax sale process for delinquent properties is initiated; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Water Heater Emissions Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Air Conservation Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals water heater regulations.

bills.title: Transportation Procurement Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses procurements by the Department of Transportation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Department of Transportation to utilizes types of cooperative purchasing agreements for the procurement of transit vehicles; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Senior Care Facility Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the closure, qualifying sale, change of use, or acquisition sale of an assisted living facility.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires an assisted living facility to meet certain requirements if the assisted living facility intends to close, complete a qualifying sale, or undertake a change of use;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an assisted living facility may not accept new residents if the facility intends to close, complete a qualifying sale, or undertake a change of use;<hr><ltbullet>prescribes requirements for an assisted living facility that intends to complete an acquisition sale;<hr><ltbullet>allows a county attorney or the attorney general to seek the appointment of a receiver if an assisted living facility does not comply with certain requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Digital Materials Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions regarding the accessibility of sensitive material through digital instructional material in a school setting.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>includes information regarding sensitive material in the information the state board provides through a certain parent portal;<hr><ltbullet>requires each local education agency (LEA) to:<hr><ltbullet1>provide certain information to parents at the time of student registration each year; and<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a section on the homepage of the LEA's website regarding sensitive material reporting;<hr><ltbullet>allows the state board, an LEA, or the Utah Education and Telehealth Network (UETN) to rescind certain contracts if a vendor does not remove access to digital sensitive material after a number of instances;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board, an LEA, or UETN to:<hr><ltbullet1>remove access to digital instructional material that a vendor provides after a certain threshold of violations;<hr><ltbullet1>provide certain notice to each vendor with which the entity contracts to provide digital instructional material in a school setting; and<hr><ltbullet1>ensure that any database or school-provided device which a student may access uses a filter or other software to prohibit access to sensitive material; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Regulatory Oversight Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides additional mechanisms for the oversight of state executive agencies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>directs the Office of Professional Licensure Review (office) to create a mechanism to gather feedback regarding existing occupational regulations;<hr><ltbullet>directs the office to include the feedback regarding existing occupational regulations that the office gathers in the office's written report to the Business and Labor Interim Committee;  <hr><ltbullet>provides a limit on the cost of implementing an agency generated rule; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Funds Reporting Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the duties of the state auditor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>directs the state auditor to annually prepare a report that states, for each entity that holds public funds, the entity's total balance of cash, cash equivalents, and investments.

bills.title: Tax Return Donation Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a School Meals Debt Relief Fund and provides for the fund's administration.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a School Meals Debt Relief Fund;<hr><ltbullet>allows individual taxpayers to designate contributions to the fund on tax returns;<hr><ltbullet>establishes reporting requirements for local education agencies regarding school meals debt;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a distribution process based on each local education agency's proportion of total statewide school meals debt;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to collect and verify school meals debt data;<hr><ltbullet>delegates rulemaking authority to the State Board of Education for program administration; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: School Trespass Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding criminal trespass upon school property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>states that public comment in a local school board meeting that complies with certain restrictions may not be the basis for criminal trespass;<hr><ltbullet>defines and amends terms regarding criminal trespass upon school property, narrowing the scope of the property in question; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Brine Mining Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the mining of brine within the state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts the Brine Conservation Act (act), including:<hr><ltbullet1>defining terms;<hr><ltbullet1>outlining the scope and application of the act;<hr><ltbullet1> providing for the authority and jurisdiction of the Board of Oil, Gas, and Mining, including rulemaking authority;<hr><ltbullet1>establishing civil and criminal penalties;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for forfeiture of sureties;<hr><ltbullet1>addressing the sale of equipment, installation, or material by the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining;<hr><ltbullet1>providing for the establishment and modification of brine production drilling units, pooling, or fields;<hr><ltbullet1>requiring permits; and<hr><ltbullet1>regulating the payment of proceeds; <hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Student Athlete Revisions
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill mandates policies on abusive coaching and addresses student-athlete compensation for name, image, or likeness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>allows an institution of higher education to use certain funds to compensate a student athlete directly for the use of the student athlete's name, image, or likeness;<hr><ltbullet>provides certain protections to institutions and student athletes;<hr><ltbullet>creates an audit requirement for the Board of Higher Education;<hr><ltbullet>requires a degree-granting institution to:<hr><ltbullet1> adopt a policy addressing abusive coaching practices; and<hr><ltbullet1>report to the Education Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a degree-granting institution's board of trustees to review and approve a degree-granting institution's policy on abusive coaching practices.

bills.title: Landlord Communication Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to owners and tenants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows an owner to return a deposit and prepaid rent and a notice of itemized deductions through electronic means;<hr><ltbullet>amends the form a renter may use to request the return of a renter's security deposit, prepaid rent, and itemized deductions;<hr><ltbullet>conditions an award of the amount due under a lease agreement on the failure to make payments;<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions to the time limit by which a renter shall vacate an owner's property after an order of restitution; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, removes a court'a ability to extend the deadline to move out following an eviction.

bills.title: Ballot Proposition Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill, contingent on passage of a proposed constitutional amendment, amends the publication requirement for a future proposed constitutional amendment or other ballot question.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>contingent on passage of a proposed constitutional amendment, amends the publication requirement for a future proposed constitutional amendment or other ballot question.

bills.title: Health and Human Services Reporting Requirements
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill repeals reporting requirements related to the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals reporting requirements related to the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, remove requirements that the legislature receive reports from the long-term care ombudsman on issues related to assisted living, remove reporting on the effectiveness of substance

bills.title: School and Institutional Trust Lands Administration Modifications
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to school and institutional trust lands.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the director of the School and Institutional Trust Lands Administration (administration) to complete a valuation of the administration's land portfolio every five years;<hr><ltbullet>requires the director to report annually to the Legislature:<hr><ltbullet1>the activities of the administration;<hr><ltbullet1>an approximate valuation of the administration's land portfolio;<hr><ltbullet1>an audited financial statement of the administration; and<hr><ltbullet1>an account of the total amount of funds distributed by the administration;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the list of activities and penalties for illegal activities on trust lands;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which the state shall offer for sale trust lands subject to a lease or permit; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Purchasing Reserve Funding
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state purchasing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes an administrative fee on state cooperative contracts that the division awards on behalf of an executive branch procurement unit;<hr><ltbullet>deposits revenue from the administrative fee into a restricted account called the State Purchasing Reserve Restricted Account (account);<hr><ltbullet>directs the state treasurer to invest money in the account in precious metals; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the money in the account to be used for the purpose of offsetting the cost of procuring goods and services for state entities and ensuring continuity in the state's procurement of goods and services, if certain inflation metrics are met.

bills.title: Residential Notification Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to licensing requirements for regulated residential treatment programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires regulated residential facilities to:<hr><ltbullet1>notify nearby property owners and residents before beginning operations; and<hr><ltbullet1>provide contact information for a designated representative to neighboring residents.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a group home, mental health residential treatment provider, a sober living home and other residential services to provide notice and contact informstion within 30 days of opening to neighbors

bills.title: Number of School Days Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows a local education agency governing board to determine a school term.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement to set a school term from the State Board of Education;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency governing board to set a school term; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Women Veterans Day Observance
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes Women Veterans Day as a commemorative period.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes June 12 as Women Veterans Day; <hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Veterans and Military Affairs to coordinate activities, special programs, and promotional information relating to Women Veterans Day; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Federalism Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to federalism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>expands the membership of the Federalism Commission (commission) and modifies the manner in which members are appointed;<hr><ltbullet>increases the number of committee bill files the commission is permitted to open each year;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Center for Constitutional Studies (center) at Utah Valley University, in consultation with the commission, to:<hr><ltbullet1>develop a continuing education and training program for state and local government employees regarding federalism issues;<hr><ltbullet1>organize an annual federalism conference and study the creation of a state-led national federalism organization;<hr><ltbullet1>coordinate with private sector actors to conduct out-of-state outreach; and<hr><ltbullet1>establish informal working groups as necessary and report to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Herbert Institute (institute) at Utah Valley University, in consultation with the commission, to: <hr><ltbullet1>serve as a liaison between the commission, the center, and government entities on federalism issues; and<hr><ltbullet1>conduct outreach and coordination to support the commission's federalism efforts; and<hr><ltbullet1>coordinate with private organizations on local and national outreach efforts and report to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to:<hr><ltbullet1>make recommendations to the center and to the institute regarding the entities' federalism-related duties; and<hr><ltbullet1>report annually to the Legislative Management Committee regarding the entities' progress;<hr><ltbullet>requires executive branch agencies to designate a contact person to coordinate with the commission regarding education and training; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Eyewear Sales Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the sales and use tax on corrective eyeglasses and contact lenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions to include corrective eyeglasses and contact lenses within the definition of "prosthetic device," which has the effect of exempting these items from sales and use tax.

bills.title: State Parks Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Division of State Parks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>removes a requirement for the Division of State Parks (division) to comply with the Utah Procurement Code in selecting concessionaires in state parks;<hr><ltbullet>requires the division to operate, to the extent possible, from money and revenue collected as fees and charges;<hr><ltbullet>requires the director to implement a comprehensive plan for the long-term use of state parks developed by the division;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the division to administer the state parks system;<hr><ltbullet>renames the State Parks Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>repeals sections related to boating accounts and river enhancement grants; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Behavioral Health Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to behavioral health.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a behavioral health receiving center to comply with licensing requirements from the Department of Health and Human Services;<hr><ltbullet>grants the Department of Health and Human Services authority to enact rules and assess and collect fees in relation to the licensing of behavioral health receiving centers;<hr><ltbullet>addresses Medicaid directed payments for the Utah State Hospital and the Huntsman Mental Health Institute;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety to:<hr><ltbullet1>survey all law enforcement agencies in the state and publish a publicly searchable registry that will allow the public to see whether each law enforcement agency is or is not available to receive a voluntarily committed firearm in accordance with safe harbor provisions; and<hr><ltbullet1>subject to available funding, create and implement a marketing plan to educate law enforcement agencies and the public about safe harbor options for firearms; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Contains another mobile crisis team, as well as increaing MCOT and certified peer support specialist rates.

bills.title: Drinking Water Utilities Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses security at drinking water facilities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a community water system to: <hr><ltbullet1>complete a security plan; and<hr><ltbullet1>report a security breach to the Utah Cyber Center within two hours of discovering the security breach;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Drinking Water to report annually to two legislative committees on security at community water systems;<hr><ltbullet>classifies a community water system's security plan as a protected record; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medical Examiner Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the medical examiner.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to death certificates;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to permits to render a dead body unavailable for postmortem investigation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Boards and Committee Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the membership of certain boards and committees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies appointment provisions and removes members who are legislators from certain entities; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other changes, removes the underserved community representative from the Behavioral Health Commission.

bills.title: Health Care Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health care practices.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the use of credit card payments to health care providers;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to dental claims practices; and<hr><ltbullet>allows dentists to dispense medications under certain circumstances.

bills.title: Revisor's Technical Corrections to Utah Code
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes technical corrections to the Utah Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies parts of the Utah Code to make technical corrections, including:<hr><ltbullet1>eliminating or correcting references involving repealed provisions;<hr><ltbullet1>eliminating redundant or obsolete language;<hr><ltbullet1>making minor wording changes;<hr><ltbullet1>updating cross-references; and<hr><ltbullet1>correcting numbering and other errors;<hr><ltbullet>amends the Sunset Act and the Repeal Dates by Title Act to repeal sunset and repeal dates that have passed and taken effect; and<hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause to subordinate changes in this bill that are in conflict with other legislation during the 2025 General Session.

bills.title: Public Education Compliance
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions expanding the authority of the State Board of Education (state board) to address transparency and local education agency compliance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to:<hr><ltbullet1>use an existing compliance framework to address reports or allegations of noncompliance;<hr><ltbullet1>develop a system to address complaints to the Utah Professional Practices Advisory Commission in a timely and expedient manner; and<hr><ltbullet1>publish information related to state board meetings on the state board's website;<hr><ltbullet>may require the state board to issue a report;<hr><ltbullet>requires a school district or charter school to provide information to the state board that is necessary for the state board to fulfill a statutory data gathering, compliance, or reporting requirement; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Statewide Referenda Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses statewide referenda.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the amount of time that the sponsors of a referendum petition have to gather signatures to qualify the referendum for the ballot;<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming timeline changes to accommodate the extension of the signature-gathering period;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the effective date of legislation that may be subject to a referendum; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Department of Environmental Quality Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Department of Environmental Quality.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the qualifications of Air Quality Board members; <hr><ltbullet>provides a transition for the Air Quality Board; <hr><ltbullet>removes regulations for water heaters in certain areas; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Controlled Substance Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Controlled Substances Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>classifies amanita muscaria as a controlled substance.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Salary Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses law enforcement officer salaries.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the director of the Division of Human Resource Management to work with the Division of Law Enforcement and Division of Forestry, Fire, and State Lands to create specialized pay plans for specific positions;<hr><ltbullet> requires the current salary survey for a law enforcement officer to include a survey of all state law enforcement agencies that employ, respectively, comparable positions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Transportation and Infrastructure Funding Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allocates funds in the County of the First Class Highway Projects Fund and provides other transportation funding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allocates funds in the County of the First Class Highway Projects Fund to various projects and purposes;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Department of Transportation to issue a general obligation bond, with the bond proceeds being distributed to a grant program, and provides revenue to service the bond;<hr><ltbullet>creates an affordable housing infrastructure grant program to provide grants to local governments to construct infrastructure to facilitate affordable housing projects in a county of the first class;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding, loans, and grants to certain transportation projects; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Medical Malpractice Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses malpractice actions against health care providers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>with respect to a medical malpractice action:<hr><ltbullet1>repeals requirements related to affidavits of merit;<hr><ltbullet1>prohibits prejudicing a defendant in an adjudication of a claimant's claims;<hr><ltbullet1>prohibits pursuing or collecting on a judgment against a health care provider's personal income or assets, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet1>grants access to the court's Xchange database to the Division of Professional Licensing (division);<hr><ltbullet1>establishes data collection and reporting requirements for the division;<hr><ltbullet1>amends procedure pertaining to prelitigation review panels and panel reviews;<hr><ltbullet1>makes a prelitigation review panel's recommendations or findings advisory; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Financial and Conflict of Interest Disclosures by Candidates Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to campaign finance and conflict of interest disclosures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate for elective office in a county, municipality, or special district to file a conflict of interest disclosure statement at the time the candidate files a declaration of candidacy;<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate seeking to fill a midterm vacancy in an office described above to file a financial report of contributions and expenditures;<hr><ltbullet>for a midterm vacancy in an office described above, or for a midterm vacancy in a statewide, state school board, or state legislative office, requires a candidate seeking to fill the vacancy to file a conflict of interest disclosure statement;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer who receives a conflict of interest disclosure statement to make the disclosure available for public inspection on the state's or political subdivision's website;<hr><ltbullet>if a midterm vacancy occurs in an office for which a registered political party is entitled to declare a nominee to fill the vacancy, requires the registered political party to notify the election officer of the date, time, and location of the meeting to select the nominee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a candidate seeking to fill a midterm vacancy on the state school board to file an interim financial report with the lieutenant governor;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies when a vacancy occurs in an elective office described above;<hr><ltbullet>for a midterm vacancy in certain county offices and in a municipal office, requires the county or municipal legislative body to notify, respectively, the county or municipal clerk;<hr><ltbullet>establishes deadlines related to the processes described above; <hr><ltbullet>for state and legislative office candidates seeking appointment to fill a midterm vacancy, amends the deadline to file a campaign finance report with the lieutenant governor;<hr><ltbullet>amends conflict of interest disclosure provisions to:<hr><ltbullet1>eliminate a disclosure related to a candidate's or officeholder's spousal information;<hr><ltbullet1>require the disclosure of certain household adult information only in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet1>permit the candidate or officeholder making the disclosure to request the redaction of certain personally identifiable information from the disclosure if the candidate, officeholder, or the candidate's or officeholder's spouse is an at-risk government employee;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to reflect changes made in Section 20A-1-504 in S.B. 300, Election Amendments, with cross-referencing changes made to Sections 20A-11-204, 20A-11-303, and 20A-11-1303 in this bill, if both bills pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeless Services Revisions
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to homeless services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Homeless Shelter Cities Mitigation Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the winter response task force and winter response plan;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to unsanctioned camping;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a penalty if an actor is engaged in unsanctioned camping; <hr><ltbullet>enacts a provision related to facilities providing domestic violence services regarding certain funding requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Unclaimed Property Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to unclaimed property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides for the State Tax Commission to share certain identifying information with the unclaimed property administrator for purposes of returning unclaimed property;<hr><ltbullet>modifies dates on which unclaimed property held in certain tax-deferred and tax-exempt accounts is presumed abandoned; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Legislative Water Development Commission Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses membership requirements on the Legislative Water Development Commission.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a minimum number for commission membership; and<hr><ltbullet>removes the partisanship requirements for members on the Legislative Water Development Commission.

bills.title: School Data Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the State Board of Education (state board) to study and make recommendations regarding local education agency (LEA) data collection, retention, student information systems, and reporting requirements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;    <hr><ltbullet>creates a Data Systems and Reporting Advisory Committee;     <hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to study LEA practices for collection and retention of student personally identifiable information;    <hr><ltbullet>requires analysis of LEA student information system costs and capabilities;     <hr><ltbullet>requires examination of LEA reporting requirements and potential sunset provisions;     <hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for stakeholder input and coordination;     <hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to report findings and recommendations to the Education Interim Committee; and     <hr><ltbullet>requires legislative review of recommendations.

bills.title: Specialized Product Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to specialized products.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements to sell a kratom product in the state;<hr><ltbullet>renames the "Cannabinoid Proceeds Restricted Account" to the "Specialized Product Proceeds Restricted Account";<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the tax on cannabinoid products; and<hr><ltbullet>applies a tax to kratom products that can be used for enforcement and other statutory required duties.

bills.title: Agricultural Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a requirement for the Department of Agriculture and Food to study issues related to local food availability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "local food supply";<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Agriculture and Food (department) to study the barriers and gaps related to increasing the availability of local food in the state, including issues related to: <hr><ltbullet1>the intrastate food supply;<hr><ltbullet1>crop production and optimization;<hr><ltbullet1>the agricultural workforce; and<hr><ltbullet1>the capital funding of local food production;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>implements a sunset date for the study.

bills.title: Property Tax Revenue Increase Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to property tax revenue increases.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a taxing entity shall submit an opinion question to registered voters before increasing the amount of revenue generated from property tax; <hr><ltbullet>exempts a taxing entity that submits an opinion question to registered voters from the truth-in-taxation notice and hearing requirements; <hr><ltbullet>limits how much revenue a taxing entity receives from new growth; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Judicial Retention Changes
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses judicial retention.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the ballot requirements for judicial retention elections;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the information contained in the voter information pamphlet for judicial retention elections;<hr><ltbullet>requires the lieutenant governor to transmit a retention recommendation from the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance to a county clerk;<hr><ltbullet>amends the ballot language for a judicial retention election to address a retention recommendation from the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain records for the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance are private;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Judicial Conduct Committee to provide records to the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to judicial performance evaluations;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Judicial Performance Evaluation Commission to provide the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance with a list of judges who are subject to a retention election in the next scheduled regular general election;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the membership, length of appointment, selection of the chairs, quorum requirements, and compensation for the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance to evaluate a judge and provide a recommendation to the public as to whether the judge should be retained for another term;<hr><ltbullet>provides the evaluation and recommendation process for the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance, including requiring the Joint Legislative Committee on Judicial Performance to:<hr><ltbullet1>hold any committee meeting to evaluate a judge before August 15 of the year in which the judge is subject to a retention election in a regular general election; and<hr><ltbullet1>provide a retention recommendation for a judge to the lieutenant governor on or before August 15 of the year in which the judge is subject to a retention election in a regular general election; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Commission for Earthquake Preparedness
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Utah Commission for Earthquake Preparedness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah Commission for Earthquake Preparedness, addressing:<hr><ltbullet1>membership;<hr><ltbullet1>quorum requirements;<hr><ltbullet1>vacancies; and<hr><ltbullet1>compensation for commission members;<hr><ltbullet>permits the commission to invite officials from certain state and executive agencies to participate in the commission's meetings as nonvoting members;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Natural Resources to staff the commission;<hr><ltbullet>specifies duties and responsibilities of the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a January 1, 2031, sunset date for the commission;<hr><ltbullet>subject to an exception, provides that money appropriated to the commission by the Legislature is nonlapsing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Registration Changes
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends vehicle registration notification requirements and provides an option for a two-year registration period for certain vehicles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a person to select a mail option for notification of vehicle registration;<hr><ltbullet>provides an option for a two-year vehicle registration period for a trailer, off-highway vehicle, street-legal all-terrain vehicle, or electric motor vehicle; <hr><ltbullet>provides for the calculation and deposit of registration and various other fees and taxes due at the time of registration to account for a 24-month vehicle registration period;<hr><ltbullet>provides coordination clauses to coordinate this bill with H.B. 277, Vehicle Registration Amendments, and H.B. 272, Vehicle Assessment Amendments, to ensure the three bills work together technically; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: School Lunch Debt Funding
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the School Meal Debt Relief Grant Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes a technical change;<hr><ltbullet>creates the School Meal Debt Relief Grant Program;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to administer the program;<hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency to apply for a grant under the program; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a conditional reporting requirement.

bills.title: Automobile Franchise Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to an automobile franchise.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "affiliate";<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions relating to a franchisor's ability to engage in certain activities;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "franchise holder" to include a manufacturer that acquires or expands the manufacturer's interests under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>excludes a dealership from the definition of "franchise holder"; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Post-employment Restrictions Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Post-employment Restrictions Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "mental health provider";<hr><ltbullet>provides that a post-employment restrictive covenant between an employer and a mental health provider is void under certain conditions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Sexual Abuse Material Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to liability for commercial entities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a commercial entity from knowingly or intentionally publishing or distributing obscene material or child sexual abuse material on the Internet;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a commercial entity from knowingly or intentionally engaging in the purchase or distribution of a child sex doll;<hr><ltbullet>provides a cause of action for an individual against a commercial entity that distributes or publishes unlawful materials;<hr><ltbullet>provides the relief a court may grant if an individual brings a cause of action against a commercial entity that distributes or publishes unlawful materials;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a commercial entity is not liable for unlawful content on the commercial entity's services, if the commercial entity did not create the unlawful material;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the attorney general to seek relief against a commercial entity that distributes or publishes unlawful materials;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the attorney general develop and publish guidance relating to liability for commercial entities; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes individuals with claims under the provisions this bill enacts to combine the individuals' claims.

bills.title: Health Care Access Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the 340B drug discount program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a pharmaceutical manufacturer from restricting, prohibiting, or otherwise interfering with a 340B entity's ability to:<hr><ltbullet1>acquire a 340B drug; or <hr><ltbullet1>participate in the 340B drug discount program; and<hr><ltbullet>permits the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program to adjust its business practices to mitigate any resulting financial impacts.

bills.title: Water Entity Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses various water entities including their relationship with the Department of Natural Resources
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes certain water agencies from a definition of an independent entity;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions governing the water trust for the Great Salt Lake, including expanding the duties of the Great Salt Lake Trust Council;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state water agent to coordinate with the Department of Natural Resources (department);<hr><ltbullet>moves the Great Salt Lake commissioner and the Office of the Great Salt Lake Commissioner to be within the department;<hr><ltbullet>requires the review by the Great Salt Lake Trust Council of certain expenditures of the Great Salt Lake commissioner; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Transgender Medical Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses public funding for transgender medical treatments and procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the use of public funds to pay or otherwise reimburse for the performance of specified transgender medical treatments and procedures; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Automotive Repair Business Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to automotive repairs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires that a motor vehicle liability coverage policy include coverage of the difference in market value from before and after a motor vehicle accident;<hr><ltbullet>grants the Insurance Department rulemaking authority to establish a formula to determine the coverage of the difference in market value from before and after a motor vehicle accident;<hr><ltbullet>requires that an automotive repair facility or installer use crash parts that are substantially equivalent to Original Equipment Manufacturer aftermarket crash parts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Rio Grande Plan Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes the Rio Grande Financial Advisory Authority working group.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Rio Grande Financial Advisory Authority working group to identify potential funding sources for the Rio Grande Plan.

bills.title: Non-nicotine Inhalation Product Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to non-nicotine inhalation products.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>bans the sale of non-nicotine inhalation products that do not have federal approval for sale;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "electronic cigarette product" to include a non-nicotine inhalation product;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the electronic cigarette product registry to include a non-nicotine inhalation product;<hr><ltbullet>creates penalties for selling non-nicotine inhalation products that do not have federal approval for sale; and<hr><ltbullet>creates criminal penalties.

bills.title: Clean Truck Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues related to heavy duty vehicles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the Division of Motor Vehicles (division) from accepting new registrations for a motor vehicle in certain counties if the motor vehicle meets certain criteria;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the division, beginning on January 1, 2030, from registering any motor vehicle that has a gross vehicle weight rating of more than 14,000 pounds and was manufactured before 2010, with exceptions for certain owners;<hr><ltbullet>addresses tax credits for a purchase of a qualified heavy duty vehicle if certain conditions are met; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Government Records Access and Management Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Government Records Access and Management Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the government records ombudsman shall provide resources and services related to a fee dispute in relation to a records request;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions regulating costs chargeable by a governmental entity for employee time in processing a records request under the Government Records Access and Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>adds provisions to regulate the disclosure of records and fee information regarding work-related contact information for an employee of a local education agency;<hr><ltbullet>requires a governmental entity to provide an itemized estimate of costs and fees expected to be incurred before the governmental entity begins to process a request or requires payment or deposit when fees are expected to exceed a certain amount;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions of the Government Records Access and Management Act to make an appeal to a chief administrative officer an optional process for appealing an estimate of fees that exceeds a certain amount;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a State Records Committee review of an agency access denial, fee waiver denial, or fee estimate dispute is de novo;<hr><ltbullet>requires a political subdivision to permit an optional appeal of an estimate of fees that exceeds a certain amount directly to the State Records Committee;<hr><ltbullet>modifies existing procedures; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes and style corrections.

bills.title: Federal Requirements Reporting
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses reporting on federal rules and directives.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires certain state agencies to annually report interpretations of federal rules and directives.

bills.title: Tax Payments with Precious Metals
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to tax payments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a person to pay in gold mining severance taxes and income taxes;<hr><ltbullet>for specified years, provides:<hr><ltbullet1>a reduced severance tax rate for taxpayers who pay in gold; and<hr><ltbullet1>a nonrefundable income tax credit for mine operators who pay in gold; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Health Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding the administration of stock albuterol in schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands when stock albuterol can be administered during an emergency occurring in a school.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Allows trained school personnel to administer asthma medication in an emergency.

bills.title: Utah Innovation Lab Modifications
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill reorganizes the Utah Innovation Lab into the Nucleus Institute and amends the Utah innovation fund.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reorganizes the Utah Innovation Lab and creates the Nucleus Institute (institute);<hr><ltbullet>requires the formation of a board of directors of the institute and provides for an institute executive director;<hr><ltbullet>outlines the duties of the institute board and institute executive director;<hr><ltbullet>amends the governance and structure of the Utah innovation fund (fund) under the institute;<hr><ltbullet>requires the formation of an investment committee for the fund;<hr><ltbullet>outlines the duties of the investment committee and fund;<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting and auditing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Division of Professional Licensing Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions that regulate qualifications for licensure as a substance use disorder counselor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies a provision that sets qualification requirements for an individual to be licensed as a substance use disorder counselor.

bills.title: Housing Authority Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to housing authorities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a county housing authority from operating within a city without obtaining approval from the city and each housing authority authorized to operate within the city; and<hr><ltbullet> prohibits a public or private entity from undertaking a project initiated by or in collaboration with a county housing authority if the project is located in a city where the county housing authority does not have authority to operate.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Prohibits a county housing authority from participating in a project within a city unless the city and any other local housing authority agrees.

bills.title: County Formation Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the creation of a new county.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a threshold for petitioners and creates an opportunity for municipal legislative bodies to initiate a process to create a new county;<hr><ltbullet>imposes certain viability requirements on the formation of a new county, including the completion of a feasibility study;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain rural property to remain in the original county, in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the continuation of property taxation between an existing county and new county to satisfy general obligation or revenue bond indebtedness;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies provisions regarding the division of taxes, assets, and liabilities between an existing county and new county; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Adult Protective Services Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding Adult Protective Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows Adult Protective Services to make a substantiated finding of abuse, neglect, or exploitation of a vulnerable adult if the alleged perpetrator refuses to provide certain documents; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Expands the definition of abuse by adding "recklessly." Clarifies fear of harm must be imminent. Adds physical injury caused by not taking action. Allows use of medication, restraint, and isolation th

bills.title: Driver Training Schools for Commercial Driver License Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses driver training schools for commercial driver license (CDL) applicants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a CDL applicant to sign a form attesting to the applicant's English language ability; and<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting regarding CDL driver training schools.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Driver Training Schools for Commercial Driver License Amendments

bills.title: Water Usage Notification Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses notification of usage of water by end users.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority;<hr><ltbullet>requires a retail water supplier to provide certain notifications regarding water usage;<hr><ltbullet>requires a secondary water supplier to provide certain notifications regarding water usage, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet>directs rulemaking;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the method of notification; and<hr><ltbullet>addresses liability.

bills.title: Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the governance of the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>converts the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind from a public corporation to a subdivision of the State Board of Education (state board);<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to:<hr><ltbullet1>ensure functional operation and oversight; and<hr><ltbullet1>administer financial operations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Gives the Utah State Board of Education authority over the Utah Schools for the Deaf and Blind.

bills.title: Judgment Information Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses information necessary to file a judgment lien against real property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that to record a judgment, a person shall include a copy of the judgment that contains, if known, the last four digits of the judgment debtor's social security number, the month and year of the judgment debtor's birth, and the judgment debtor's driver license number if a natural person.

bills.title: Criminal Justice Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends statutory provisions related to criminal justice.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends the requirements for the adult sentencing and supervision length guidelines to address domestic violence offenses;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the crime for the commission of domestic violence in the presence of a child;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the right to bail for a domestic violence offense;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of domestic violence;<hr><ltbullet>amends the requirements for a peace officer investigating domestic violence;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of cohabitant;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a jail release agreement may not prohibit an individual arrested or cited for the commission of domestic violence in the presence of a child from communicating with a minor child in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a parent from waiving the conditions of a jail release agreement if the minor child is the alleged victim and the parent was arrested or cited for the qualifying offense;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies cross-references to child abuse offenses; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipal Incorporation Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the incorporation of a preliminary municipality.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that:<hr><ltbullet1>a person may not apply to incorporate an area as a preliminary municipality after February 15, 2025;<hr><ltbullet1>a person who applies to incorporate an area as a preliminary municipality by filing a feasibility request on or before February 15, 2025, may proceed in accordance with Title 10, Chapter 2a, Part 5, Incorporation of a Preliminary Municipality, after February 15, 2025;<hr><ltbullet1>a preliminary municipality may not annex an unincorporated area; and<hr><ltbullet1>a municipality may not annex an area if the area was included in a feasibility request to incorporate the area into a preliminary municipality; and<hr><ltbullet>requires:<hr><ltbullet1>a proposed preliminary municipality to agree that initial landowners will fully compensate the county for damages to county property or infrastructure before the preliminary municipality can transition into a town;<hr><ltbullet1>a preliminary municipality located in the fourth through sixth class to comply with terms, conditions, or restrictions that were established in a development agreement between the initial landowners and the county before the feasibility request was filed; <hr><ltbullet1>a preliminary municipality to comply with county standards for infrastructure; and<hr><ltbullet1>that a petition to transition a preliminary municipality into a town shall certify that damages to county property or infrastructure have been paid in full.

bills.title: Olympic Legacy Liability Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games Act and winter sports activities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides public policy considerations;<hr><ltbullet>provides definitions;<hr><ltbullet>establishes limitations on liability for claims against the operator of a specified winter sports area;<hr><ltbullet>requires a specified winter sports area to give notice of the liability limitations;<hr><ltbullet>permits a winter sports area operator to enter into a contract with a winter sports participant to limit the operator's liability;<hr><ltbullet>specifies the amount of liability caps and provides for adjustment of the liability caps; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes.

bills.title: Economic Development Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions of the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of the Office of Homeless Services regarding certain legislative appropriations;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Unified Economic Opportunity Commission and associated committees and subcommittees;<hr><ltbullet>renumbers and amends the Utah Broadband Center and Access Act; <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language regarding the transfer of funding from the Utah Board of Higher Education - Administration fund to the Utah Board of Higher Education Nucleus Institute upon passage of this bill and H.B. 530, Utah Innovation Lab Modifications.

bills.title: Controlled Substance Licensing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes concerning the licensing requirements related to controlled substances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and amends definitions;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Professional Licensing to create a controlled substance certification for certain practitioners;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a practitioner may not distribute, dispense, or administer a controlled substance without a controlled substance certification;<hr><ltbullet>prescribes requirements for certified practitioners;<hr><ltbullet>updates provisions of the Utah Controlled Substances Act to reflect the creation of a controlled substance certification;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions relating to a controlled substance license; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Worker Protection Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Labor Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an employer from compelling an employee to attend a meeting or listen to communication of an employer's opinion about a religious or political matter;<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions to the prohibition;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy for an employee who is compelled to attend a meeting or listen to communication of an employer's opinion about a religious or political matter;<hr><ltbullet> requires an employer to: <hr><ltbullet1>implement heat risk precautions and cold risk precautions; <hr><ltbullet1>implement recordkeeping requirements pertaining to heat stoke, hypothermia, frostbite, or temperature-related fatalities;<hr><ltbullet1>notify employees with a written description of quotas, adverse actions that may result for failing to obtain a quota, and incentives for meeting a quota;<hr><ltbullet1>provide data pertaining to quotas to a requesting employee;<hr><ltbullet1>implement recordkeeping requirements pertaining to quotas; and<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a workplace safety program for managing risks related to the temperature of the worksite;<hr><ltbullet>provides standards for tracking quotas;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits retaliation against an employee who requests records or files a complaint with the Labor Commission (commission); and<hr><ltbullet>provides for commission enforcement.

bills.title: School District Governance Agreements
bills.general_provisions: This bill prohibits certain agreements that delegate governance authority over a district or school to a private entity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain agreements that delegate governance authority over a district or school to a private entity.

bills.title: Water Infrastructure Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses storm water and storm water's effects on the Great Salt Lake.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Storm Water Improvements Fund, including providing for loans to political subdivisions;<hr><ltbullet>requires a study on the management of storm water in the Great Salt Lake basin; <hr><ltbullet>requires reporting on the study;<hr><ltbullet>modifies references to revolving loan funds; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Diaper Program Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses grants for entities that provide free diapering supplies to individuals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to, within appropriations, award grants to nonprofit entities who provide free diapering supplies;<hr><ltbullet>provides rulemaking authority to the department to govern the awarding of grants;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Diapering Supplies Fund;<hr><ltbullet>allows individual taxpayers to make contributions to the Diapering Supplies Fund on tax returns; and<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting related to awarded grants.

bills.title: Genetic Information Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of genetic sequencing tools and the storage of genetic sequencing data.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the use of certain genetic sequencers and genetic sequencing software;<hr><ltbullet>prescribes requirements and restrictions related to the storage of genetic sequencing data;<hr><ltbullet>requires relevant entities to certify compliance with genetic sequencing requirements;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the attorney general to investigate alleged violations of genetic sequencing requirements, and initiate civil actions for those violations; and<hr><ltbullet>provides protections for an employee who reports a suspected violation of genetic sequencing requirements to the attorney general.

bills.title: Antidiscrimination Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to antisemitism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "antisemitism";<hr><ltbullet>provides that a person is entitled to equal accommodation in all business establishments and places of public accommodation within the state without discrimination on the basis of antisemitism; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that when making a determination related to a penalty enhancement, a trier of fact shall consider whether an action was motivated by antisemitism.

bills.title: Building Permit Fee Prohibition Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to permitting fees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prevents a municipality or a county from imposing an inspection fee on a water conservancy district that hires a qualified inspector to conduct inspections on new infrastructure; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a repeal date for the prohibition.

bills.title: Elected Official Publicity Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a public official's use of public funds.
