bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a public official from making an expenditure from public funds on a billboard or mass communication:<hr><ltbullet1>that contains certain content; and<hr><ltbullet1>is posted, displayed, or mailed less than 60 days before the date of a caucus, convention, or election at which the public official is a candidate for elective office; and<hr><ltbullet>contains exceptions to the prohibition described above for certain types of mass communications.

bills.title: Local Building Authority Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the authority of a local building authority.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a local building authority from executing a project previously rejected by the voters of certain creating local entities.

bills.title: State Grant Process Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state grants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for direct award grants, prohibits an administering agency from using grant funds to administer the grant, unless otherwise provided in the grant appropriation's intent language;<hr><ltbullet>modifies certain reporting requirements for competitive grants; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Bicycle Rack Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a grant program for the installation and maintenance of public bicycle racks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Bike Rack Matching Grant Pilot Program within the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity; <hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity; <hr><ltbullet>establishes a sunset date for the pilot program; and<hr><ltbullet>appropriates funding.

bills.title: Medical Waste Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the distribution of facility-provided medication to patients under certain circumstances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain health facilities to offer the unused portion of a facility-provided medication to the patient under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a facility-provided medication be labeled in accordance with the Pharmacy Practice Act;<hr><ltbullet>addresses counseling to patients regarding facility-provided medication; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Contracts Labor Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses wage standards.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>directs the Labor Commission to determine the wages for all occupations required for construction projects for each county within the state; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes:<hr><ltbullet1>a minimum a contractor may pay a qualifying employee; <hr><ltbullet1>record keeping requirements; and<hr><ltbullet1>penalties for noncompliance.

bills.title: Debate Committee Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Utah Debate Committee at Utah Valley University.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah Debate Committee;<hr><ltbullet>creates an executive board and advisory board that make up the committee;<hr><ltbullet>describes the membership of the committee; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes certain duties and powers for the:<hr><ltbullet1>committee;<hr><ltbullet1>executive board; and<hr><ltbullet1>advisory board.

bills.title: Local Government Drug Testing Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to drug testing by government entities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "sample" to include oral fluid;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a local government entity or state institution of higher education may require that a donor submit a blood, breath, oral fluid, hair, or urine sample for drug testing; and<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirement that an entity independent of the local governmental entity or state institution of higher education collect samples for drug testing by allowing a collection method that complies with instructions prepared by an independent entity.

bills.title: Local Agritourism Ordinance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to municipal and county regulation of agritourism activities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires each municipality and county to enact an ordinance that:<hr><ltbullet1>specifies which agritourism activities are permitted or restricted on an agricultural enterprise; and<hr><ltbullet1>describes regulations that apply to various agritourism activities.

bills.title: School Safety Foundation
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a school safety foundation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a school safety foundation.

bills.title: Use of Force Reporting Requirements
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the justified use of force.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires an individual to report using force; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes that an individual must report use of force in order to receive a pretrial justification hearing.

bills.title: Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to law enforcement and criminal justice.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires that counties offering probation services adopt certain probation standards and practices;<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Office of State Debt Collection has the authority to collect civil accounts receivable or a civil judgment of restitution and interest thereon;<hr><ltbullet>provides that administrative garnishments also apply to a debtor's property or wages that are under control of a third party;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of State Debt Collection to provide an accounting of the unpaid balance of a defendant's criminal accounts receivable at the time of termination of the defendant's sentence;<hr><ltbullet>provides repayment procedures for any unpaid balance of a defendant's criminal accounts receivable upon termination of a sentence;<hr><ltbullet>provides circumstances that constitute a material change in circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>adds requirements for temporary pretrial status orders of detention;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to factors for pretrial release requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a request for a pretrial release at an initial appearance does not constitute a pretrial detention hearing;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to make findings of fact when making a determination regarding pretrial release;<hr><ltbullet>adds a financial condition schedule to aid a court in determining the amount of a fixed financial condition;<hr><ltbullet>requires a judge to take certain actions if the judge is unable to hold a pretrial detention hearing before a certain deadline;<hr><ltbullet>provides for required procedures when a no bail hold is requested;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain Board of Pardons and Parole decisions on restitution are final and not subject to judicial review;<hr><ltbullet>codifies order of restitution procedures that apply to certain offenders sentenced before July 1, 2021;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for the accounting and payment of restitution owed to various state governmental entities;<hr><ltbullet>permits a sentencing court to authorize the deposit of funds in certain interest-bearing accounts when distribution to a victim is pending;<hr><ltbullet>permits the Board of Pardons and Parole to order recovery of fees incurred on behalf of a sentenced offender in addition to the existing ability to recover costs;<hr><ltbullet>makes coordinating modifications related to docket entry and interest assessments;<hr><ltbullet>permits a court to set restitution for a juvenile sentenced to prison;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause that requires changes to a section of this bill supersede the changes to that section in H.B. 312, Criminal Justice Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and grammatical changes.

bills.title: Ballot Title Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions governing the process for submitting proposed constitutional amendments to the voters.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>changes the person responsible for preparing the ballot title and analysis for any proposed constitutional amendment submitted to the voters.

bills.title: Heath Insurance Prosthetic Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health insurance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a health benefit plan to offer an additional prosthetic device or orthotic device to assist in enabling physical activity.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires an insurer that covers prosthetics or orthotics to cover them for athletic or recreational activity as well.

bills.title: Traffic Safety Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a red light camera pilot program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a red light camera pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>establishes rules, restrictions, and guidelines for the pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>sets a repeal date for the pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Transportation and the Department of Public Safety to report regarding the pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>designates the Zero Fatalities initiative as the highway safety initiative of the Department of Transportation; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Sex Education Instruction Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill removes human sexuality from the definition of sex education instruction.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes human sexuality from the definition of sex education instruction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Attorney General Office Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the attorney general and the Office of Attorney General.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>describes the attorney general's ethical obligations in relation to the Office of Attorney General; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the attorney general to discharge the attorney general's duties in an ethical manner.

bills.title: Half-day Kindergarten Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires local education agencies (LEAs) to provide a half-day kindergarten class in each school.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires LEAs to provide a half-day kindergarten class in each school;<hr><ltbullet>removes language related to a requirement to only provide a half-day class within the LEA and upon parental request;<hr><ltbullet>allows the LEA governing board certain discretion if half-day enrollment is lower than a given threshold; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Regarding the Grand County Water Conservancy District
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution expresses support for the transfer of federal water infrastructure to the Grand County Water Conservancy District.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>urges Congress to transfer to the Grand County Water Conservancy District water infrastructure owned by the federal government for the conveyance of water from the Green River to the Moab Uranium Mill Tailings Remedial Action project site.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Directing PEHP Regarding Pharmaceutical Rebates
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution directs the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program to give the estimated value of pharmaceutical rebates to state plan members at the point of sale.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>directs the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program to give the estimated value of pharmaceutical rebates to state plan members at the point of sale.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Concerning Vietnam War Veterans
bills.general_provisions: This resolution  recognizes all veterans who served during the Vietnam War.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>pays tribute to all military personnel who served during the Vietnam War, regardless of duty location or specific role.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Regarding Fitness for Incarcerated Individuals
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses fitness for incarcerated individuals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the physical and mental health benefits of physical activity for incarcerated individuals; and<hr><ltbullet>urges the Department of Corrections and county sheriffs to establish community partnerships to develop and provide health promoting programs to incarcerated individuals.

bills.title: House Concurrent Resolution on Permitting Reform
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This concurrent resolution urges Congress to enact reforms to federal permitting policies to accelerate deployment of new energy infrastructure.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>recognizes the importance of domestic energy production for national security and economic competitiveness;<hr><ltbullet>highlights issues with current federal permitting processes that delay energy infrastructure development;<hr><ltbullet>details specific problems with current permitting timelines and processes;<hr><ltbullet>emphasizes the need for streamlined permitting while maintaining environmental protection; and<hr><ltbullet>urges Congress to enact specific reforms to federal permitting and environmental review processes.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Urging Changes to Federal Homelessness Regulations
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution urges federal government housing and homelessness agencies to implement reforms to housing assistant programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>urges the Department of Housing and Urban Development to implement reforms to certain federal housing assistant programs; <hr><ltbullet>recognizes that:<hr><ltbullet1>state and local governments seek to fund and implement programs that are more effective than the current alternatives to reduce the number of people living on the street and include approaches and strategies that are more responsive to local priorities and circumstances;<hr><ltbullet1>the Homeless Management Information System is costly, burdensome, and fails to meet the information and data needs of state and local governments; and<hr><ltbullet1>block grant funding provides the state with needed discretion on how to use federal funding for direct services to the state's homeless population;<hr><ltbullet>calls on the federal government to reform certain agency rules and federal laws to provide state and local governments greater latitude in administering homelessness; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for copies of the resolution to be distributed among certain federal agencies and other individuals.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Patriots' Day
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses the recognition of the start of the American Revolution.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>recognizes the events that occurred at the start of the American Revolution; and           <hr><ltbullet>designates April 19 as Patriots' Day.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution on State Innovation for Transition from Government Benefits to Self-reliance
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution urges the federal government to give more flexibility and autonomy to states to allow for greater innovation and experimentation to help families who receive government benefits more successfully transition off of welfare programs and into work-based self-reliance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>articulates the strength of Utah's economy and nation-leading upward mobility; <hr><ltbullet>establishes Utah's track record as an innovative leader already showcasing the successes and advantages of state-driven approaches to work and welfare;<hr><ltbullet>identifies evidence of families in Utah who still struggle to fully realize the American Dream due to perceived or actual disincentives in the social safety net in the form of the "benefits cliff" and "benefits plateau"; and<hr><ltbullet>urges the federal government to increase flexibility and autonomy to allow states the ability to innovate through experiments and pilots to better transition families off of federally funded safety net programs and into work-based self-reliance.

bills.title: House Concurrent Resolution to Create Energy Compact with Idaho and Wyoming
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This concurrent resolution encourages the establishment of an interstate compact for regional energy collaboration between Utah, Wyoming, and Idaho.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>recognizes the shared energy resources and challenges of Utah, Wyoming, and Idaho;<hr><ltbullet>calls for the establishment of an interstate compact focused on regional energy collaboration;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Governor's Office of Energy Development to initiate discussions and develop a framework for an interstate compact; and<hr><ltbullet>expresses commitment to fostering regional cooperation on energy matters.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Celebrating the 250th Anniversary of the Declaration of Independence
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This concurrent resolution celebrates the upcoming 250th anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>celebrates the 250th anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 2026;<hr><ltbullet>declares the first week of July 2025 and July 2026 as Independence Week;<hr><ltbullet>recognizes the work of Utah's America250 Commission (Commission);<hr><ltbullet>supports the Commission's vision to educate, engage, and unite Utahns through programing and events that celebrate and honor the anniversary; and<hr><ltbullet>encourages participation in programs and events overseen by the Commission and the Department of Cultural and Community Engagement.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Regarding State Parks
bills.general_provisions: This resolution encourages the Division of State Parks to work with federal agencies to transfer ownership or management of properties suitable for a state park, monument, or campground, back to the state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>requests that the Division of State Parks (division) petition the Bureau of Land Management to transfer title to the state of Utah for the creation of the Little Sahara State Park;<hr><ltbullet>requests that the division negotiate with the United States Forest Service to transfer the Antelope Flat Campground for the creation of the Flaming Gorge State Park;<hr><ltbullet>encourages the division to work with federal agencies to acquire, lease, or manage any other properties considered suitable for a state park, monument, or campground; <hr><ltbullet>urges the division to study the feasibility of a Davis County Skyline Drive state park or state campground; and<hr><ltbullet>requests that the division update the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee on the division's progress.

bills.title: House Concurrent Resolution on State Management of Federal Public Lands
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution urges the federal government and state entities to identify public lands for the state to manage for outdoor recreation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>urges Congress to enact legislation establishing a framework for state operation of federal public lands to improve public land management and reduce federal expenditures;<hr><ltbullet>highlights the need to develop and maintain state parks, monuments, and campgrounds to provide the people of Utah with outdoor recreational opportunities; <hr><ltbullet>encourages the Division of State Parks (division) to work with federal agencies to acquire, lease, or manage properties considered suitable for a state park, monument, or campground;<hr><ltbullet>suggests land that the division may consider for a potential state park or campground; <hr><ltbullet>requests that the division petition the Bureau of Land Management to transfer title to the state of Utah for the creation of the Little Sahara State Park;<hr><ltbullet>requests that the division negotiate with the United States Forest Service to transfer the Antelope Flat Campground for the creation of the Flaming Gorge State Park; and<hr><ltbullet>requests that the division update the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee on the division's progress.

bills.title: House Concurrent Resolution on State Monuments, Parks and Campgrounds
bills.general_provisions: This resolution urges the Division of State Parks to evaluate specific locations for designation as state parks, monuments, or campgrounds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights Utah's need to develop and maintain state parks, monuments, and campgrounds to provide the people of Utah with outdoor recreational opportunities; and<hr><ltbullet>urges the Division of State Parks to evaluate the Monte Cristo area and trust lands in the San Rafael Swell as potential new state parks, monuments, or campgrounds.

bills.title: House Concurrent Resolution Supporting Streamlining Utah Housing Policies
bills.general_provisions: This resolution supports streamlining housing policies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>supports streamlining housing policies; <hr><ltbullet>recognizes the housing attainability crisis in Utah and the need for efficient state efforts; and<hr><ltbullet>supports beginning to identify programs and funding to consolidate during the 2025 interim.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Regarding Religious Freedom
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution supports and encourages practices that exemplify religious freedom in public spaces.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>acknowledges the historical context that supports the inclusion of religion in government and education; <hr><ltbullet>supports the right of public school students and teachers to openly express their faith;<hr><ltbullet>encourages the accommodation of religious observances in government and community settings;<hr><ltbullet>supports the protection of religious symbols in public spaces; and<hr><ltbullet>encourages the fostering of respectful dialogue among diverse faith traditions.

bills.title: Joint Rules Resolution - Sponsor's Handout
bills.general_provisions: This joint rules resolution authorizes the chief sponsor of legislation to provide a sponsor's handout.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>defines "sponsor's handout";<hr><ltbullet>allows the chief sponsor of legislation to provide a sponsor's handout, subject to certain requirements; <hr><ltbullet>requires the secretary of the Senate and chief clerk of the House to ensure that a sponsor's handout, if provided, is publicly accessible through the legislation's webpage; and<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a sponsor's handout is not an official part of the legislation.

bills.title: Joint Rules Resolution - Fiscal Note Process
bills.general_provisions: This resolution modifies the fiscal note process.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process by which a sponsor consults with the legislative fiscal analyst regarding a fiscal note; and               <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Regarding State Prisoner Placement in Iron County Correctional Facility
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution supports contracting for beds for state inmates at the Iron County correctional facility.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>supports jail expansion as beneficial to both the state and the counties through a contract with the Department of Corrections; and<hr><ltbullet>approves contracting for additional beds dedicated to housing state inmates in Iron County.

bills.title: Joint Rules Resolution - Amendments to Joint Rules
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution modifies joint rules.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>updates terms and references for news media requirements related to discriminatory conduct; <hr><ltbullet>changes the name of the Executive Offices and Criminal Justice Appropriations Subcommittee to the Criminal Justice Appropriations Subcommittee;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates obsolete language; and<hr><ltbullet>corrects terms and references.

bills.title: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Electoral Votes
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to enact a provision relating to electors for President and Vice President of the United States.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>prohibit requiring or compelling an elector for President and Vice President of the United States to vote for any individual based on voting results in any other state.

bills.title: Joint Rules Resolution - Legislative Process Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This joint rules resolution modifies legislative processes and procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that the Senate and House Rules committees meet annually to review joint rules;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the process to direct a roll call vote during an electronic meeting;<hr><ltbullet>modifies legislative staff offices' reporting requirement related to performance measures;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Executive Appropriations Committee to meet annually to approve legislative staff offices' budgets and certify the Legislature's budget to the governor;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the right of legislators to attend joint committee meetings, subject to certain restrictions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies specific bill format requirements;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies how requests for legislation, priority request designations, and legislation are treated when the chief sponsor is:<hr><ltbullet1>unable to serve in the next annual general session; or<hr><ltbullet1>elected or appointed to serve in the opposite chamber;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the circumstances under which the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel removes a committee note;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the order in which the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel numbers legislation;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the days of the week the Senate and House give preference for the other chamber's legislation;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits transferring sponsorship on legislation more than twice;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the consideration of an amendment or substitute legislation made in the other chamber;<hr><ltbullet>modifies deadlines related to the passage of the final appropriations bill and fiscal note bills;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies reimbursement procedures related to legislative travel;<hr><ltbullet>requires that when a legislative committee creates a subcommittee, the members must include at least one senator and one representative;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the chairs of the Legislative Process Committee and the Rules Review and General Oversight Committee to independently open a committee bill file, subject to certain requirements;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the chief sponsor of a committee bill from altering the bill before the bill is numbered for introduction, except altering to make a technical correction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Property Tax
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution of the Utah Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution relating to the Legislature's authority to exempt a portion of the fair market value of residential property from property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>authorize the Legislature to exempt up to 55% of the fair market value of residential property from property tax.

bills.title: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Right to Work
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to add a right to work provision.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>prohibit the denial of employment to an individual based on membership status in a labor union or employee organization.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Regarding Utah's Share of Colorado River Water
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses usage of alloted shares of Colorado River water.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>outlines the historical interstate compact regarding the Colorado River;  <hr><ltbullet>highlights the significance of the Colorado River water allocated to Utah; and<hr><ltbullet>declares that it is the position of the state of Utah that any basin state should be able to use the state's Colorado River allocation at any location within the geographic boundaries of that state.

bills.title: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Publication Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution regarding the publication of a proposed constitutional amendment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>require a proposed constitutional amendment to be published, in a manner provided by statute, for 60 calendar days immediately preceding the general election.

bills.title: Joint Resolution on the Foundation for a Strong Utah Future
bills.general_provisions: This resolution promotes strengthening households of married parents with children.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the correlation between percentage of households of married parents with children and child poverty;<hr><ltbullet>promotes career and technical programs to increase upward social mobility and financial stability;<hr><ltbullet>promotes the Success Sequence to teach students how to create strong family units; and<hr><ltbullet>encourages policies creating family stability and a strong foundation for Utah children.

bills.title: House Rules Resolution - Amendments to House Rules
bills.general_provisions: This resolution modifies House rules.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>updates outdated language;<hr><ltbullet>changes the name of the House Business and Labor Standing Committee to the House Business, Labor, and Commerce Standing Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain changes to legislation to be made by a motion to substitute the legislation rather than a motion to amend the legislation; <hr><ltbullet>prohibits a committee member from requesting a personal privilege during a committee meeting; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies House floor procedures related to substitute and privileged motions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: House Resolution Regarding the Buffalo Soldier Heritage Trail
bills.general_provisions: This resolution promotes the establishment of the Buffalo Soldier Heritage Trail.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the contributions of the Buffalo Soldiers in Utah's history;<hr><ltbullet>promotes the establishment of the Buffalo Soldier Heritage Trail (trail);<hr><ltbullet>proposes stakeholder involvement in the creation of the trail;<hr><ltbullet>recognizes informational exhibits along the trail to educate the public on the history of the Buffalo Soldiers; and<hr><ltbullet>commits to preserving the history of the Buffalo Soldiers.

bills.title: House Rules Resolution - Legislative Process Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This rules resolution modifies House processes and procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the duties of the chief clerk related to technical corrections to legislation;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements related to sharing requests for legislation with caucus staff;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies which legislation the House may pass without receiving a favorable recommendation from a House standing committee;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the circumstances under which a standing committee may recommend legislation for the consent calendar; <hr><ltbullet>provides legislators the right to attend House committee meetings, subject to certain restrictions;<hr><ltbullet>defines "censure"; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Resolution Regarding Dr. Martha Hughes Cannon Commemorative Stamp
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution urges the United States Postal Service to consider a commemorative stamp in honor of Dr. Martha Hughes Cannon.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the achievements of Dr. Martha Hughes Cannon; and<hr><ltbullet>urges the United States Postal Service to issue a commemorative stamp in Dr. Cannon's honor.

bills.title: House Rules Resolution - House Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses House procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties and appointment of the sergeant-at-arms and the chief clerk; and<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a motion to saunter is in order during floor debate.

bills.title: Public Education Base Budget Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of public education for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024, and ending June 30, 2025, and appropriates funds for the support and operation of public education for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education (state board) to:<hr><ltbullet1>provide information necessary to calculate certain budgetary adjustments by a given date each year; and<hr><ltbullet1>establish certain budgetary data reporting requirements and deadlines;<hr><ltbullet>allows the state board to adjust per-teacher amounts for classroom supplies and materials if ongoing funding is insufficient;<hr><ltbullet>amends the state guarantee on local property tax levies to ensure that a hold harmless provision only applies in the case of a change in property valuation;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of school districts, charter schools and state education agencies;<hr><ltbullet>sets the value of the weighted pupil unit (WPU) initially at $4,674 for fiscal year 2025-2026;<hr><ltbullet>Adjusts the number of weighted pupil units (WPUs) in certain programs for student enrollment changes and statutory formula calculations;<hr><ltbullet>appropriates funds to the Uniform School Fund Restricted - Public Education Budget Stabilization Account;<hr><ltbullet>Makes an appropriation from the Uniform School Fund Restricted - Trust Distribution Account to the School LAND Trust program to support educational programs in the public schools;<hr><ltbullet>Adjusts the revenue targets and estimates tax rates for the statewide Basic Rate and WPU Value Rate according to statutory provisions;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>approves intent language.

bills.title: New Fiscal Year Supplemental Appropriations Act
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain institutions of higher education;<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes full time employment levels for certain internal service funds; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Appropriations Adjustments
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain public education programs;<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain institutions of higher education;<hr><ltbullet>provides funds for the bills with fiscal impact passed in the 2025 General Session;<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environmental Quality Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described;<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Criminal Justice Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: Social Services Base Budget
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2024 and ending June 30, 2025 and appropriates funds for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for the use and support of certain state agencies;<hr><ltbullet>provides appropriations for other purposes as described; and<hr><ltbullet>provides intent language.

bills.title: State Agency Fees and Internal Service Fund Rate Authorization and Appropriations
bills.general_provisions: This bill supplements or reduces appropriations otherwise provided for the support and operation of state government for the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2025 and ending June 30, 2026.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for the use and support of certain state agencies and institutions of higher education;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes certain state agency fees;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes internal service fund rates;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts funding for the impact of Internal Service Fund rate changes; and,<hr><ltbullet>provides budget increases and decreases for other purposes as described.

bills.title: Revenue Bond and Capital Facilities Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to 2025 revenue bonds.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expresses the Legislature's intent relating to the Utah Board of Higher Education's issuance, sale, and delivery of revenue bonds to finance the construction of:<hr><ltbullet1>the Huntsman Cancer Institute Vineyard Campus Facility; and<hr><ltbullet1>the 800 East Residence Hall project at Utah State University; and<hr><ltbullet>expresses the Legislature's intent relating to the State Building Ownership Authority's issuance of obligations to finance a warehouse facility and club store for the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services.

bills.title: Ballot Distribution Revisions
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Election Code relating to the distribution of ballots to voters.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates an exception to the requirement that the bulk of ballots initially mailed to voters must be mailed from a location in Utah, if the jurisdiction mailing the ballots is assigned to a United States Postal Service area distribution center outside of Utah.

bills.title: Board of Tourism Development Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends the sunset for the Board of Tourism Development.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset for the Board of Tourism Development; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Reimbursement Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for reimbursement of property taxes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain rental businesses to charge a fee on the rental of heavy equipment for reimbursement of property taxes (recovery fee);<hr><ltbullet>requires recovery fees to be separately itemized and clarifies that recovery fees are not subject to sales and use tax;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a rental business from charging a recovery fee to a governmental entity;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to coordinate with county auditors and the Multicounty Appraisal Trust to conduct a study on the recovery fee rate and provide a report with recommendations to the Legislature; and<hr><ltbullet>requires county auditors and the Multicounty Appraisal Trust to share requested information with the State Tax Commission for purposes of conducting the study.

bills.title: Private Sale of a Firearm Sunset Review Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the sunset provision for Section 76-10-526.1, Information check before private sale of a firearm.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the sunset review provision for Section 76-10-526.1, Information check before private sale of a firearm; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Certified Public Accountant Licensing Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to certified public accountants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the hours requirement for a certified public accountant (CPA) to become licensed;<hr><ltbullet>adds a requirement that an applicant for licensure as a CPA have a bachelor's degree with a concentration in accounting and business;<hr><ltbullet>allows an individual with a valid CPA license from a state other than Utah to practice in this state under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Division of Professional Licensing to make a citation and assess a fine for a person engaging in unlawful conduct relating to CPAs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Notice Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the property tax valuation notice requirements.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that the county discretionary deferral program is available to an indigent individual;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county auditor to include on the property tax valuation notice: <hr><ltbullet1>a statement that a property owner who is 65 years old or older, disabled, or experiencing an extreme hardship, may be eligible for a deferral on the property owner's primary residence; and <hr><ltbullet1>a telephone number to obtain information about how to apply for a deferral;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to provide that the changes to S.B. 197, Property Tax Amendments, supersede the changes to this bill.

bills.title: Services for Department of Defense Civilian Employees
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses certain benefits for a United States Department of Defense employee and the employee's family.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> provides certain exemptions from occupational and professional licensure in a variety of occupations and professions for:<hr><ltbullet1>a United States Department of Defense employee if the employee has a valid license in another jurisdiction; and<hr><ltbullet1>a spouse of a United States Department of Defense employee if the spouse has a valid license in another jurisdiction;<hr><ltbullet>provides in-state residency for tuition purposes at an institution of higher education for a United States Department of Defense employee and the employee's family;<hr><ltbullet>addresses k-12 requirements for a child of a United States Department of Defense employee;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate technical changes between this bill and H.B. 142, Service Member and Veteran Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Election Fundraising Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to prohibited campaign contributions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a campaign contribution for federal office, made by a person other than a lobbyist or principal, from the prohibition on campaign contributions during a legislative session or the time period when the governor may veto a bill;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a crime to make a federal contribution with the intent to influence the governor or a state official to take or not take an action or to reward the governor or a state official for taking or not taking an action; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Utah Retirement Systems Amendments for Military Personnel
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the vesting requirements for employer contributions made to a defined contribution plan.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that employer nonelective contributions made on behalf of an employee to a defined contribution plan vest upon the member's termination of employment, if the member or the member's spouse is a military service member who receives permanent change of station or relocation orders outside the state;<hr><ltbullet>allows specified Utah National Guard personnel, including the adjutant general, to elect to be exempt from the retirement systems, allowing employer contributions to vest immediately; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Retirement Systems Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the contribution provisions of the New Public Employees' Tier II Contributory Retirement Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a participating employer to elect to pay member contributions that exceed the contribution cap for employees that are members of the Public Employees' Tier II Hybrid Retirement System; and<hr><ltbullet> requires a participating employer to make an additional nonelective contribution to an employee that is a member of the Public Employees' Tier II Defined Contribution Plan, if the participating employer elects to pay the required member contribution as an employer pick up for employees that are members of the Public Employees' Tier II Hybrid Retirement System.

bills.title: Long-Term Disability Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to public employee long-term disability benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of objective medical impairment for purposes of the Public Employees' Long-Term Disability Act;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the application for and determination of long-term disability benefits;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies which employees are eligible for a disability benefit for a total disability due to a mental objective medical impairment through June 30, 2026;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the exclusions for monthly disability benefits;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Public Employees' Long-Term Disability program to administer the existing basic long-term benefit for volunteer emergency medical services personnel; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Allows a state or covered employer to choose not to provide a mental health long-term disability benefit to an employee.

bills.title: State Employee Benefit Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to public employee benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of gainful employment for purposes of the Public Employees' Long-Term Disability Act;<hr><ltbullet>includes pay for time that exceeds an eligible employee's regular schedule in the calculation of the eligible employee's regular monthly salary;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a death benefit for employees receiving long-term disability benefits;<hr><ltbullet>makes life assistance counseling that the Utah State Retirement Office offers available to employees receiving long-term disability benefits;<hr><ltbullet>increases the state-paid basic life insurance benefit for exempt state employees;<hr><ltbullet>creates additional state-paid basic life insurance benefit tiers for exempt state employees; and<hr><ltbullet>directs savings from a reduction in long-term disability premium rates be used to pay for the cost of the changes in this bill.

bills.title: First Home Investment Zone Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions affecting first home investment zones.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies owner-occupancy requirements in a first home investment zone; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies how extraterritorial homes may be included in density and owner-occupancy requirements for a first home investment zone; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Child Abuse and Torture Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns child abuse and torture.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a new criminal offense for child torture and provides penalties;<hr><ltbullet>adds the offense of child torture to the list of offenses for which imprisonment is mandatory;<hr><ltbullet>amends existing definitions relating to the offenses of child abuse and aggravated criminal child abuse;<hr><ltbullet>modifies child abandonment, abuse or neglect of a child with a disability, and other statutes that rely on certain definitions concerning criminal child abuse;<hr><ltbullet>includes the offense of child torture in statutes that reference child abuse or aggravated child abuse, including statutes concerning background checks, murder and aggravated murder, child abuse homicide, bigamy, jail release agreements and orders, and adoption, parent-time, and custody statutes;<hr><ltbullet>adds the offense of child torture to the definition of "violent felony";<hr><ltbullet>includes the offense of child torture as a registrable offense on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "severe type of child abuse or neglect" in the juvenile code to refer to the amended definition of serious injury in the criminal child abuse statute; <hr><ltbullet>adds coordination clauses:<hr><ltbullet1>to merge the changes to Section 76-3-406 if both this bill and H.B. 78, Criminal Offenses Amendments, both pass and become law; <hr><ltbullet1>to merge the changes to Section 77-41-102 in this bill if this bill, S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments, both pass and become law, and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, does not pass and become law, due to Section 77-41-102 being repealed and replaced with newly enacted statutes in S.B. 41; and<hr><ltbullet1>to merge the changes to Section 77-41-102 in this bill if this bill, S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments, and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, all pass and become law, due to Section 77-41-102 being repealed and replaced with newly enacted statutes in S.B. 41; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Postretirement Reemployment for Emergency Services Workers
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Utah State Retirement and Insurance Benefits Act relating to postretirement reemployment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the earnings limit for postretirement reemployment as an affiliated emergency services worker; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Housing and Transit Reinvestment Zone Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the Housing and Transit Reinvestment Zone Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to the Housing and Transit Reinvestment Zone Act;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Hotel Impact Mitigation Fund and distribution of funds;<hr><ltbullet>amends the allowable use of a certain sales and use taxes to be used for convention center revitalization;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain sales and use tax revenue distributed to a county to be used for convention center revitalization; <hr><ltbullet>creates a process to propose a convention center reinvestment zone to facilitate revitalization of a convention center and surrounding areas within a county of the first class to:<hr><ltbullet1>allow capture of sales and use tax increment related to state and certain local sales and use taxes;<hr><ltbullet1>allow capture of property tax increment; and<hr><ltbullet1>provide for distribution of funds to enable bonding;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions to exclude remote sales tax revenue for the capture of sales and use tax increment; <hr><ltbullet>amends the median gross income for a certain percentage of proposed dwelling units within the housing and transit reinvestment zone to the county median gross income for households of the same size;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the collection of a tax increment for a housing and transit reinvestment zone project may be triggered no more than three times per project;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to housing and transit reinvestment zones within certain transit stations or hubs; <hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to mixed-used development;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirement that a proposal for a transit reinvestment zone includes a mix of dwelling units with at least 25% of the dwelling units having more than one bedroom;<hr><ltbullet>amends the date by which a tax increment collection notice is sent to certain entities to no later than December 31 of the year before the year tax increment is to take place;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain limitations on use of funds in certain convention center reinvestment zones;<hr><ltbullet>requires the base year to be updated in certain circumstances regarding existing community reinvestment projects; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, requires a city or county with public transit wishing to create a zone to make up to 9% of the included housing affordable to households making less than 80% of the county's medium

bills.title: Motor Vehicle Division Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions pertaining to the Motor Vehicle Division to make technical changes and clean up.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to trailers, motorboats, and motorcycles;<hr><ltbullet>allows a fleet of personal vehicles to be registered as a fleet;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a street-legal off-highway vehicle includes an off-highway motorcycle that has been modified to have equipment necessary for on-highway use;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies which registration fees apply to certain vehicles;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to insurance for a motorboat, to only require the designated agent to notify the Motor Vehicle Division of a lapse in coverage during the months of April through October;<hr><ltbullet>revises provisions related to sales and use taxes to simplify certain earmarks; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Livestock Brand Board Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Livestock Brand Board.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset date for the section creating the Livestock Brand Board.

bills.title: Charter School Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the State Board of Education (state board) to adjust funding for charter schools with significant enrollment underestimates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides the state board discretionary authority to allocate funds to adjust charter school enrollment estimates;<hr><ltbullet>specifies funding sources in priority order;<hr><ltbullet>requires reporting to the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst and the Governor's Office of Planning and Budget; and<hr><ltbullet>exempts adjustments from certain budgetary requirements.

bills.title: Forest Fire Resources Compact Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Great Plains Interstate Fire Compact.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>empowers the governor to enter into the compact related to forest fires in the form provided in statute.

bills.title: Refugee Services Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Refugee Services Office within the Department of Workforce Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Refugee Services Office (office) within the Department of Workforce Services;<hr><ltbullet>describes the duties and functions of the office; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Class Size Reduction Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the class size reduction appropriation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>renames the appropriation;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions regarding the use of class size reduction funding;<hr><ltbullet>modifies which grade levels the program applies to;<hr><ltbullet>requires a local education agency to establish and maintain certain policies regarding teacher to student ratios;<hr><ltbullet>expands permitted uses of the allocation to include certain staff supports;<hr><ltbullet>establishes reporting requirements;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain information to be publicly available; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Water Rights Recording Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses water rights addenda.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows certain signatures to be by facsimile or electronic means; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Mineral Surety Study
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses surety issues related to mineral activities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "surety" for purpose of the study;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Oil, Gas, and Mining (division) to study certain surety issues;<hr><ltbullet>directs the division to make a report; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a repeal date.

bills.title: Statewide Online Education Program Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the small school portion of the Statewide Online Education Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the state board to establish funding priorities;<hr><ltbullet>creates an annual assessment process for school needs;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a report to the Education Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Water Quality Board Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Utah Water Quality Board.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for members of the Utah Water Quality Board to conduct a mediated settlement conference between the director and a party in alleged violation of the Utah Water Quality Act; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes members of the Utah Water Quality Board to recommend a reasonable penalty amount to the director.

bills.title: Minimum Basic Tax Rate Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the minimum basic tax that school districts impose.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>ensures state funding in an amount that covers the total cost of the basic school program for a school district that imposes the combined minimum basic tax rate;<hr><ltbullet>requires school districts that impose the combined minimum basic tax to remit to the state the revenue the tax generates;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions regarding state and local contributions toward the basic school program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Manufacturing Modernization Grant Sunset Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends the sunset for the Manufacturing Modernization Grant Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset for the Manufacturing Modernization Grant Program; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Education Testing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to Utah standard assessments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the grade range for certain subjects of the state selected standards assessment; and<hr><ltbullet>removes provisions requiring the use of a different assessment.

bills.title: Sales and Use Tax Act Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Sales and Use Tax Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the amnesty period during which a seller or certified service provider is not liable for failure to collect taxes due to an error by the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies requirements related to the reauthorization of certain local option sales taxes;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address substantive conflicts if this bill and S.B. 67, Local Option Sales Tax Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>recodifies the statutes applicable to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry;<hr><ltbullet>contains coordination clauses to coordinate technical changes between this bill, H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, and S.B. 24, Child Abuse and Torture Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Consumer Protection Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to consumer protection.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>describes the award a court must issue when granting a judgment in favor of the Division of Consumer Protection (division);<hr><ltbullet>clarifies what constitutes a deceptive and unconscionable sales practice;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the division's rulemaking and investigatory authority;<hr><ltbullet>allows the division to request that a court order disgorgement of money under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the factors a court considers when issuing a fine;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a government agency may bring an enforcement action for defective construction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Income Tax Credit Review Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the process for income tax credit review.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the income tax credit review cycle from three years to five years; <hr><ltbullet>provides a process for the Office of the Legislative Auditor General to audit the income tax credits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Professional Licensure Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to professional licensure.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>standardizes the requirements for a criminal background check for licensure in certain professions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the circumstances under which the Division of Professional Licensing (division) revokes a license, as that revocation applies to a criminal background check;<hr><ltbullet>renames the Physicians Education Fund to the Physicians Education and Enforcement Fund (fund);<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the director of the division to make distributions from the fund under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the division deposit administrative penalties imposed for unprofessional or unlawful conduct into the fund; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Juvenile Court Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses petitions to modify orders of permanent custody and guardianship.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>describes circumstances under which a parent may file a petition to modify an order of permanent custody and guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>addresses whether a district court or juvenile court retains jurisdiction over an order of permanent custody and guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a juvenile court shall order a parent to file an order of permanent custody and guardianship with the district court in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Program Sunset Extension
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Program, the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Committee, and the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses the scope of the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Program;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Committee to meet at least quarterly;<hr><ltbullet>establishes an order of priority for the various program funding distributions from the Electronic Cigarette Substance and Nicotine Product Proceeds Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>extends the sunset dates for the Youth Electronic Cigarette, Marijuana, and Other Drug Prevention Committee and Program;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the ability of the state board to reduce distributions to local education authorities for positive behavior specialists or positive behavior plans, if funding is insufficient to cover the costs of the distributions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Sales and Use Tax Remittance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the requirements governing when a seller has to pay or collect and remit sales and use tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the requirement that a seller has to pay or collect and remit the sales and use tax if the seller sells tangible personal property, products transferred electronically, or services for storage, use, or consumption in the state in more than a certain number of separate transactions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Behavioral Health Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies licensing provisions for mental health therapists.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>makes a technical correction;<hr><ltbullet>expands the scopes of practice for mental health therapists; and<hr><ltbullet>creates the Mental Health Professionals Education and Enforcement Fund.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Adds emotional disorder and interpersonal dysfunction to the definition of mental health therapy in the Mental Health Professional Practice Act. Using penalties for violating the act, creates the Ment

bills.title: Insurance Investment Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill repeals and reenacts provisions relating to insurance investments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the existing chapter dealing with insurance investments;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a minimum financial security benchmark for insurers;<hr><ltbullet>describes the authorized investments an insurer may make;<hr><ltbullet>establishes prudence evaluation criteria;<hr><ltbullet>requires that an insurer establish and follow a written investment policy;<hr><ltbullet>describes the authorized classes of investments an insurer may make;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the limitation of classes of investments;<hr><ltbullet>requires that an insurer doing business in different currencies have securities in each currency that meet the requirements of this chapter;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an insurer from making certain types of investments;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the effect of investment restrictions on insurers;<hr><ltbullet>provides insurers guidelines for the required reports and replies under this chapter;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the commissioner to retain experts when analyzing an insurer's investments;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the commissioner to issue orders regarding an insurer's investment practices;<hr><ltbullet>describes how a commissioner should conduct an administrative hearing under this chapter;<hr><ltbullet>exempts an investment policy subject to this chapter from the definition of "record" under the Government Records Access and Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which this chapter prevails over any conflicting statute that relates to insurance investments; and<hr><ltbullet>grants the commissioner rulemaking authority regarding insurance investments.

bills.title: Limited Purpose Local Government Entities Board of Trustees Compensation Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill eliminates the compensation limit for a member of a board of trustees of a limited purpose local government entity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>eliminates the compensation limit for a member of a board of trustees of a limited purpose local government entity; <hr><ltbullet>requires a board of trustees of a limited purpose local government entity to hold a public hearing on a proposed compensation increase before implementing the compensation increase; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Resource Management Plan Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the state resource management plan.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adopts a state resource management plan to replace a previously adopted plan.

bills.title: Vehicle Registration Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows the State Tax Commission to contract with a designated agent to assist in address verification for vehicles and vessels insured in the state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows the State Tax Commission (commission) to contract with a designated agent to determine the address for which a vehicle's or vessel's insurance is tied, to assist the commission in determining whether the owner is a resident of this state;<hr><ltbullet>based on information provided by the designated agent, allows the commission to investigate whether the owner is a resident for vehicle or vessel registration purposes or otherwise in compliance with relevant registration and tax laws; <hr><ltbullet>for a person found in violation of certain tax and fee requirements, allows the person 60 days to cure the violation before being subject to a penalty;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to impose penalties in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>allows funds in the Uninsured Motorist Identification Restricted Account to be used to cover the costs of the designated agent for address verification; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Election Code Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Election Code and related provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>standardizes language related to a voter who, after signing a petition, seeks to remove the voter's signature from the petition;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the amount of time that the sponsors of a petition for incorporation that passes have to determine certain features of the new municipal government from 60 to 30 days; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies the deadline for a candidate for mayor or municipal council of a newly incorporating municipality to file a declaration of candidacy;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the county clerk determines whether to remove a voter's signature from a petition for incorporation of a municipality; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the in-state residency requirement for a signature-gatherer who circulates a petition on behalf of:<hr><ltbullet1> an organization of registered voters seeking to become a registered political party; or<hr><ltbullet1> a candidate for elective office seeking the nomination of a registered or qualified political party;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions related to the in-state residency requirement described above;<hr><ltbullet>for a regular primary or presidential primary election, or for certain regular general or statewide special elections, requires a board of canvassers to immediately transmit to the lieutenant governor certain vote total information;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates the requirement that a board of canvassers make the transmission described above by telephone, fax, or mail;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for a voter who signs a petition on behalf of a candidate for elective office seeking the nomination of a registered political party to have the voter's signature removed from the petition; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Appearance of Candidate Name on Ballot
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the manner in which a candidate's name may appear on a ballot.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes criteria for permitting a candidate to:<hr><ltbullet1>use the candidate's middle name instead of the candidate's first name on a ballot;<hr><ltbullet1>use the candidate's nickname on a ballot; or<hr><ltbullet1>use the candidate's initial on a ballot;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a procedure for a candidate to request that the candidate's name appear on a ballot as described in the preceding paragraph; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for an appeal of a rejection of a request described in the preceding paragraph.

bills.title: Unauthorized Use of Real Property Amendments
