bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the consequences of unauthorized use of real property by providing a limited alternative remedy to remove a trespasser from real property and providing a criminal penalty for the fraudulent sale or rental of real property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes property owners or their agents to request assistance from law enforcement for the immediate removal of a trespasser from real property under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>requires an owner seeking removal of a trespasser, or the owner's authorized agent, to submit a complaint;<hr><ltbullet>specifies requirements for the complaint;<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for law enforcement;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes law enforcement to arrest a trespasser for legal cause;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the owner or agent to request that law enforcement stand by while the owner or agent takes possession of the property; <hr><ltbullet>provides that law enforcement is not liable to any party for loss, destruction, or damage;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the property owner or agent is not liable to any party for the loss or destruction of, or damage to, personal property unless it was wrongfully removed;<hr><ltbullet>provides civil remedies;<hr><ltbullet>imposes criminal penalties for unlawfully possessing of, occupying on, or trespassing on real property intentionally and causing a specified amount of damage;<hr><ltbullet>imposes criminal penalties for any person who knowingly and willfully presents a false document purporting to be a valid lease agreement, deed, or other instrument conveying real property rights;<hr><ltbullet>imposes criminal penalties for fraudulently listing or advertising for sale, or renting or leasing, residential real property under certain circumstances; and <hr><ltbullet>provides criminal penalties for committing perjury.

bills.title: Municipal Governance Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides a process by which a city council may retain or employ staff to assist the city council.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the council operating in a council-mayor form of government to retain or employ a person to assist the council in fulfilling its obligations under Title 10, Utah Municipal Code;<hr><ltbullet>states that a person retained or employed by a council in a council-mayor form of government: <hr><ltbullet1>reports to the council; and <hr><ltbullet1>does not report to the mayor;<hr><ltbullet>requires a council that retains or employs a person to assist the council to first establish certain parameters by ordinance or contractual agreement; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Newborn Relinquishment Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the safe relinquishment of a newborn child.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "newborn child" as that term is used in provisions concerning the safe relinquishment of a newborn child.

bills.title: Mobile Crane Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of mobile cranes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that an owner of real property on which a mobile crane will be used to:<hr><ltbullet1>obtain a geotechnical report; and<hr><ltbullet1>take certain precautions if the geotechnical report states that the conditions of the real property cannot support the maximum crane load;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an owner from using a mobile crane on the owner's property under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>creates a presumption of negligence in a civil action resulting from an owner failing to take certain precautions when using a mobile crane; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Commercial Driver License Revisions
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses procedures relating to commercial driver licenses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to disqualification of a commercial driver license;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Driver License Division to utilize the Drug and Alcohol Clearinghouse as required by federal law; and<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions.

bills.title: Newborn Testing Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to newborn screening.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services to screen newborns for pyruvate dehydrogenase complex deficiency;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to hearing loss testing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Energy Corridor Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to eminent domain and the condemnation process for public utilities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a person filing an eminent domain action for a high voltage power line to:<hr><ltbullet1> conduct an infrastructure siting analysis; and<hr><ltbullet1>coordinate with federal land management agencies before pursuing condemnation of private lands; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for certain eminent domain complaints to include infrastructure siting analysis and federal agency coordination documentation;<hr><ltbullet>requires a public utility to submit an annual report on eminent domain actions and efforts to utilize federal public lands to the Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Interim Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Spaceport Exploration Committee
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Spaceport Exploration Committee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Spaceport Exploration Committee; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes membership and duties of the committee.

bills.title: Waste Tire Recycling Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to the Waste Tire Recycling Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>exempts landfills from restrictions on accepting waste tires if the landfill uses a mobile facility to reduce the size of waste tires;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain shredded waste tires to be disposed of in a landfill;<hr><ltbullet>allows an owner or operator of a landfill in a county of the third through sixth class to apply for reimbursement for waste tires disposed of in the owner or operator's landfill; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medical Cannabis Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to medical cannabis.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends surveillance requirements; <hr><ltbullet>allows the Cannabis Production Establishment and Pharmacy Licensing Advisory Board (licensing board) to renew or approve medical cannabis courier licenses;<hr><ltbullet>allows the licensing board to renew licenses as necessary instead of only in December; <hr><ltbullet>allows a cannabis processing facility to operate at a second location under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>amends reporting requirements;<hr><ltbullet>limits the number of licenses that the Department of Agriculture and Food (department) may issue for cannabis processing facilities;<hr><ltbullet>allows the department to issue letters of concern;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a medical cannabis pharmacy from allowing the recommendation of medical cannabis near the pharmacy under certain circumstances; <hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that pharmacy and courier agent registration cards include the agent's employer on the card;<hr><ltbullet>allows for medical cannabis cardholders to bring their own opaque bag or box to transport medical cannabis from the pharmacy;<hr><ltbullet>requires medical cannabis pharmacies and couriers to report a change in ownership at least 45 days before the change occurs;<hr><ltbullet>requires qualified medical provider employee proxies to complete a course on health information privacy;<hr><ltbullet>removes certain information from the medical cannabis card;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions related to the Division of Finance and the medical cannabis program;<hr><ltbullet>aligns continuing education provisions of qualified medical providers and pharmacy medical providers;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the creation of patient product information inserts;<hr><ltbullet>moves the repeal date for the Cannabis Research Review Board earlier one year;<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date for the Medical Cannabis Governance Structure Working Group;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause with H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, to align a definition and cross reference; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medication Assisted Treatment Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of medical assisted treatment in certain human services programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of Licensing within the Department of Health and Human Services to establish and enforce rules concerning the use of medication assisted treatment in certain residential treatment programs and recovery residences; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: With an exception for a program that doesn't accept public money, prohibits a substance use residential treatment facility or a recovery residence from denying admission to a person because they use m

bills.title: School Personnel Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the definition of certain school employees to "education support professional."
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definitions of classified school employee and classified employee to "education support professional"; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Local Option Sales Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to local option sales and use taxes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain local governments to impose a sales and use tax for purposes of funding emergency services;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for a local government to impose the tax, dependent on the rate imposed;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the administration, collection, and distribution of tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>allows the State Tax Commission to retain an administrative charge from collected tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions allowing certain counties to impose a rural county health care facilities tax to fund emergency medical services; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Welfare Worker Protections
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses certain crimes committed against child welfare workers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>separates the crime of assault or threat of violence against a child welfare worker into two sections;<hr><ltbullet>amends the elements required to commit the offense of assault against a child welfare worker and includes committing an assault against a family member of a child welfare worker as part of the offense;<hr><ltbullet>amends the current statutory requirements for the offense of threatening a child welfare worker to include threatening a family member of a child welfare worker as part of the offense; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medication Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the 340B drug discount program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain conduct by a pharmaceutical manufacturer with respect to the 340B drug discount program; and<hr><ltbullet>permits the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program to adjust its business practices to mitigate any resulting financial impacts.

bills.title: Consumer Reporting Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes limitations on information that a consumer reporting agency may provide.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes prohibitions on what information an consumer reporting agency may provide; <hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions to the prohibitions on what information an consumer reporting agency may provide; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Social Security Tax Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the individual income tax credit for social security benefits.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands eligibility for the social security benefits tax credit by increasing the thresholds for the income-based phaseout; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Removes the income limit for retirement and SSDI beneficiaries to claim the state tax credit to $54,000 per person and $90,000 per couple.

bills.title: Family Leave Requirements Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses family leave insurance within the Insurance Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>includes family leave insurance in the definition of income replacement and disability income insurance, making family leave insurance subject to the same statutory requirements as income replacement and disability income insurance; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Statewide Initiatives Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to a statewide initiative.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for a statewide initiative application and a fiscal impact statement in relation to funding a law proposed by initiative; <hr><ltbullet>requires initiative petition sponsors to publish the initiative application in the same manner required for publication of a proposed constitutional amendment;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits submission of an initiative, or counting votes cast for or against an initiative, if the sponsors of the initiative petition fail to comply with the publication requirement; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Corrections Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to corrections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends which individuals in the custody of the Department of Corrections (the department) may petition to have a sex designation change on a birth certificate;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an individual in the custody of the department from filing a petition in district court to legally change the individual's name;<hr><ltbullet>includes individuals on parole on the list of individuals to whom a government entity is not required to respond regarding certain records requests;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the department may independently investigate criminal allegations against:<hr><ltbullet1>individuals in the custody of the department; and<hr><ltbullet1>subject to certain limitations, employees of the department;<hr><ltbullet>amends the prison telephone surcharge account to allow revenue generated from offenders using department tablets and other electronic devices to be placed in the account;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the substances administered by the department when carrying out a judgment of death by lethal intravenous injection; <hr><ltbullet>requires an individual on probation or parole who is required to undergo drug testing as a condition of probation or parole to sign a waiver allowing the provider undertaking the testing to notify the individual's supervising officer regarding the results of the testing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Family Stabilization Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Center for Healthy and Meaningful Play to be administered by the Emma Eccles Jones College of Education and Human Services at Utah State University.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Center for Healthy and Meaningful Play (center) to be administered by the Emma Eccles Jones College of Education and Human Services at Utah State University; and<hr><ltbullet>describes the center's duties and responsibilities, including the focus on the science, practice, and promotion of children's play in the areas of:<hr><ltbullet1>childhood development;<hr><ltbullet1>community development;<hr><ltbullet1>educational play opportunities; and<hr><ltbullet1>youth sports.

bills.title: Marriage Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the marriage of a minor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>does not allow the juvenile court to issue a written authorization for a minor to marry if there is an age difference between the parties of more than four years;<hr><ltbullet>requires a 72-hour waiting period before the juvenile court can issue a written authorization for a minor to marry; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Safety Animal Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to public safety animals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>expands and clarifies criminal provisions relating to police service canines to include other animals used by public safety organizations to assist with duties related to public safety; and<hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause to merge the changes to Section 76-9-306 in this bill, if this bill and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, both pass and become law, due to Section 76-9-306 being renumbered and split into two separate sections in H.B. 21.

bills.title: Homeless Individuals Protection Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the homeless service provider ombudsman within the Office of Homeless Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the homeless services provider ombudsman (ombudsman) within the Office of Homeless Services (office); <hr><ltbullet>describes the duties and functions of the ombudsman; <hr><ltbullet>authorizes the office to make rules to implement and carry out the ombudsman's duties and functions; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for a sunset review after five years.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Creates an ombudsman within the Office of Homeless Services to educate the public about the rights of and services available to individuals experiencing homelessness. Also charged with investigating c

bills.title: Technical Code Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions to modify gender-specific language.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions to modify gender-specific language;<hr><ltbullet>enacts changes to conform with legislative drafting standards;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address conflicts with any other legislation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes other technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Fee Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows state agencies to develop a fee schedule for water consumption.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Environmental Quality (department) to establish a fee schedule;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Water Development Coordinating Council (state council) to establish a fee schedule beginning on July 1, 2026, subject to approval by the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a special district from certain fee requirements to pay the fees established by the department and state council; <hr><ltbullet>outlines requirements related to the fee schedules;<hr><ltbullet>allows the department to establish a financial incentive to comply with certain criteria;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the collection of fees by the department and, pending approval by the Legislature, the collection of fees by the state council;<hr><ltbullet>creates an exemption for a wholesale water supplier and agricultural water from the fees;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the deposit of fees into the Water Infrastructure Fund less the department's costs;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department and state council to report on the fee schedule to the Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires monitoring of fees; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Care Provider Abuse Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses sexual misconduct between certain care providers and individuals experiencing a vulnerability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>makes it a criminal offense for certain care providers to have sexual relations with an individual experiencing a vulnerability.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a care provider to touch the private areas or have sex with a vulnerable adult.

bills.title: Autopsy Photo Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the sharing of autopsy photographs or videos.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term; and<hr><ltbullet>with exceptions, criminalizes the sharing of non-public photographs or videos of a decedent that are part of the medical examiners record.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Policy Requirements
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses law enforcement policies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a law enforcement agency to create and maintain a policy regarding the handling of an investigation into a criminal violation of a stalking injunction, jail release agreement, jail release court order, or protective order.

bills.title: Funeral Services Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses natural organic reduction.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>allows a funeral service establishment to offer natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a funeral service director meet certain requirements if the funeral service director offers natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>grants immunity to a funeral service establishment that relies on a natural organic reduction authorization form in carrying out natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>updates a funeral service establishment's recordkeeping requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides requirements for accepting remains for natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>limits liability for a funeral service establishment providing natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for authorizing natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>describes the procedure for natural organic reduction;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for the final disposition of remains from the natural organic reduction process;<hr><ltbullet>categorizes the use of remains from natural organic reduction to grow food as unlawful; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Income Tax Rate Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the income tax rate.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a reduction of the income tax rate when the actual state revenue exceeds the forecast revenue;<hr><ltbullet>provides a formula and process for calculating a reduction of the income tax rate;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to annually publish the income tax rate; <hr><ltbullet>changes the mineral production tax withholding rate; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: If the total amount of money collected is more than the amount estimated to be collected, reduces the income tax rate by half the difference between the amount collected and the estimate.

bills.title: Workplace Protection Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to employment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reduces the number of employees a person may employ before being considered an employer subject to the Utah Antidiscrimination Act for employment; and<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of sexual harassment.

bills.title: DUI Sentencing Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses DUI sentencing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a veterans treatment court program is a problem solving court an individual may participate in or successfully complete that allows a court to shorten or suspend the individual's suspension or revocation of the individual's license due to a DUI conviction; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Funding for Veterans Day Commemorations
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Veterans Day School Assembly Pilot Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Veterans Day School Assembly Pilot Program (pilot program);<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to administer the pilot program and post best practices; and<hr><ltbullet>repeals the pilot program on July 1, 2027.

bills.title: Immunization Cost Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires insurers to provide reimbursement for vaccine costs to out-of-network physicians.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires insurers to provide reimbursement for vaccine costs to out-of-network physicians.

bills.title: Mandatory Jail Sentence Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires a mandatory jail sentence for certain crimes committed under certain conditions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a mandatory jail sentence for certain drug and theft crimes committed under certain conditions and with specified prior criminal convictions; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a person who receives a mandatory jail sentence under certain conditions may not be turned over to the federal government for deportation until the person has served the entire mandatory jail sentence, with limited exceptions; <hr><ltbullet>adds a coordination clause in order to incorporate the changes made in this bill to Section 58-37-8.1 as enacted in H.B. 87 if both this bill and H.B. 87, Drug Trafficking Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Restaurant Tax Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the restaurant tax within the Tourism, Recreation, Cultural, Convention, and Airport Facilities tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>imposes the 1% county tax historically imposed only in restaurants on certain prepared food transactions in a convenience store, gas station, or grocery store; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Golf Course Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses water use by and management of golf courses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> makes a record of water data regarding golf courses prepared for and provided to the Janet Quinney Lawson Institute for Land, Water and Air at Utah State University pursuant to statute a protected record under the Government Records Access and Management Act;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a study of water use by golf courses;<hr><ltbullet>outlines a process to be followed in conducting and reporting on the study;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of State Parks to develop a master plan for state-owned golf courses and to report on the master plan; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Juvenile Justice Career Training Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill adds juvenile justice as a delineated talent advisory council.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds juvenile justice as a delineated talent advisory council; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Securities Investor Education, Training, and Enforcement Fund Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill increases the cap limit on the Securities Investor Education, Training, and Enforcement Fund.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the cap limit on the Securities Investor Education, Training, and Enforcement Fund from $500,000 to $1,000,000.

bills.title: Truth in Taxation Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the public hearing requirements for increasing the property tax rate.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "meeting" to align with the definition in the Open and Public Meetings Act to clarify that a public hearing on increasing the property tax rate above the certified tax rate requires the presence of a quorum of the taxing entity; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Advanced Air Mobility Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to advanced air mobility.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>directs the Department of Transportation to conduct a community outreach and education campaign;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Department of Transportation to develop an advanced air mobility toolkit;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions related to advanced air mobility; and<hr><ltbullet>makes other technical changes related to advanced air mobility.

bills.title: Emergency Shelter Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to an emergency operations plan.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a county, city, or town emergency operations plan shall designate at least one shelter to accommodate an individual's personal animal; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Parental Education on Student Use of Technology Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for parental education regarding student use of technology.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to:<hr><ltbullet1> create a video presentation for parents regarding potential safety and legal issues a student may encounter regarding the student's use of technology; and<hr><ltbullet1>make the video presentation available to each school district so that the school district may provide the video presentation to parents; <hr><ltbullet>provides a sunset date; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Excellence in Education and Leadership Supplement Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends existing timeline and appropriation requirements to the Excellence in Education and Leadership Supplement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends existing timeline and appropriation requirements to the Excellence in Education and Leadership Supplement;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to obtain and house a web-based application portal; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Estate Planning Recodification
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill recodifies and amends statutes related to estate planning.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>coordinates definitions between Title 75, Utah Uniform Probate Code, Title 75A, Fiduciaries, and Title 75B, Trusts;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definitions for Title 75, Utah Uniform Probate Code;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies and clarifies a statute regarding the effective date of Title 75, Utah Uniform Probate Code;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 75, Chapter 7, Utah Uniform Trust Code, to Title 75B, Chapter 2, Uniform Trust Code;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 75, Chapter 12, Uniform Directed Trust Act, to Title 75B, Chapter 3, Uniform Directed Trust Act;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to explain that certain definitions will not be enacted in Title 75A, Chapter 9, Uniform Health-Care Decisions Act, if this bill and S.B. 134, Health-Care Decisions Act Amendments, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address a technical conflict with a cross-reference change if this bill and H.B. 334, Guardianships and Supported Decision-Making Agreements Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Dog Related Liability Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill relates to dog owner liability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a dog owner is not liable for injury or death caused by the owner's dog to a trespasser; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Education Reporting Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires certain programs be reviewed.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>mandates regular program reviews by the Education Interim Committee for certain programs; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Fireworks Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes related to the sale of fireworks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the sale of fireworks in restricted discharge areas under certain circumstances.

bills.title: Boundary Line Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to boundary changes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions applicable to municipal and county land use and development;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for proposing a boundary adjustment; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for creating a boundary establishment;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for a municipality or county to review a proposed boundary adjustment;<hr><ltbullet>modifies exemptions from plat requirements;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for a subdivision amendment;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies and creates recording requirements for boundary adjustments and boundary establishments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Student Privacy and Modesty in Public Education
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions regarding a student's reasonable expectation of individual privacy and personal modesty in the public education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions regarding a student's reasonable expectation of individual privacy and personal modesty in the public education system, including:<hr><ltbullet1>prohibiting any requirement that a student undress in the presence of another individual; and<hr><ltbullet1>establishing options for local education agencies which constitute compliance regarding the prohibition.

bills.title: Utah-Ireland Trade Commission
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Utah-Ireland Trade Commission within the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah-Ireland Trade Commission (trade commission) within the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity (office);<hr><ltbullet>describes the membership, purpose, and duties of the trade commission;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the office staff the trade commission;<hr><ltbullet>requires an annual report; <hr><ltbullet>authorizes the office to solicit funds for certain purposes and to account for those funds; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a sunset date of July 1, 2030.

bills.title: Education Scholarship Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Carson Smith Opportunity Scholarship Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires scholarship granting organizations to verify Utah residency through multiple forms of documentation;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits scholarship granting organizations from charging any fees to families;<hr><ltbullet>mandates independent audits of all scholarship granting organizations regardless of scholarship amount;<hr><ltbullet>requires public disclosure of all third-party contracts and associated fees;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a formal appeals process for denied expense reimbursements;<hr><ltbullet>limits extracurricular and physical education expenses to 20% of the scholarship amount;<hr><ltbullet>requires specific deadlines be created for scholarship notification and acceptance;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement for home school affidavit documentation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Water Safety Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to water safety.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates a restricted account;<hr><ltbullet>creates a drowning prevention and water safety grant program for providing swimming lessons to low income children; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement.

bills.title: Judicial Officer Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill increases the number of judges.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the number of judges for the district court, the juvenile court, and the Court of Appeals.

bills.title: Summons Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the issuance of a summons.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a presumption against issuing a warrant in lieu of a summons in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for overcoming the presumption; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Education Governance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding governance of the public education system.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the appointment, authority, and duties of the state superintendent of public instruction;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the scope of authority and duties of employees of the State Board of Education (state board);<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions to describe the level of autonomy of local education agencies relative to the state superintendent and state board employees;<hr><ltbullet> requires a certain process for the state board to follow upon receipt of a complaint of a violation of state statute, including establishing additional corrective action remedies the state board may use;<hr><ltbullet>directs the state board to ensure that core standards are achievable when taken as a whole in context of the quantity and scope of established core standards;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a repeal date for a generic grant of rulemaking authority; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Clarifies the state superintendent's authority and responsibility. Requires the Utah State Board of Education to create a process for receiving, investigating, remedy, and reporting a violation of sta

bills.title: Lobbying Compensation Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions of the Lobbyist Disclosure and Regulation Act relating to compensation for lobbying.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>permits contingent compensation for lobbying under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a contract for contingent compensation of a lobbyist to be filed with the lieutenant governor as a public record.

bills.title: Traffic Code Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses open range livestock collisions on a highway.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a rebuttable presumption in a highway collision between a driver and open range livestock; and<hr><ltbullet>defines terms.

bills.title: Veteran Access to State Parks
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a program that offers a discounted annual pass to state parks for qualified veterans.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a program, as funding allows, that offers a discounted annual pass to state parks to qualified veterans who are residents of the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of State Parks to offer the discounted veteran pass at a reduction of at least 25% of the price of a state parks annual day-use pass; <hr><ltbullet>provides for the automatic repeal of the discounted annual pass program after three years; and<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to establish the program.

bills.title: Substance Use Disorder Revisions
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses substance use disorder screening in state correctional facilities and county jails.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires state correctional facilities and county jails to:<hr><ltbullet1>screen inmates for substance use disorders;<hr><ltbullet1>report data related to the screenings; and<hr><ltbullet1>use the screenings to assist with treatment and programming decisions for inmates; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Requires a jail and the prison to screen new inmates for a substance use disorder within 30 days and use the information in any treatment. Also requires the results to be reported to the Commission on

bills.title: Income Tax Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies income tax provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the corporate franchise and income tax rates; and<hr><ltbullet>amends the individual income tax rate.

bills.title: Uniform Family Law Arbitration Act
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Uniform Family Law Arbitration Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides the scope of the Uniform Family Law Arbitration Act (act);<hr><ltbullet>addresses the law that is applicable to arbitration in a family law dispute;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for an arbitration agreement for a family law dispute;<hr><ltbullet>allows a party to initiate arbitration by giving notice to the other party in accordance with the arbitration agreement or the laws governing contractual arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>provides the framework for motions for judicial relief involving a family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>provides the qualification and selection requirements for an arbitrator;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain disclosures by an arbitrator, the parties, and the attorneys representing the parties;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the disqualification of an arbitrator;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the participation of, and a communication by, an attorney or other individual in family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>allows a court or arbitrator to make a temporary order when there is an arbitration of a family law dispute;<hr><ltbullet>addresses protection orders in family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>provides the powers and duties of an arbitrator;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the recording of an arbitration hearing;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for an award by an arbitrator in a family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the confirmation or correction of an award in a family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the vacation or amendment of an award in a family law arbitration by a court;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the requirements for a party seeking to clarify a confirmed award;<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to enter a judgment for a family law arbitration award;<hr><ltbullet>allows a court to seal or redact a document that was part of the family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the modification and enforcement of a confirmed award or judgment from a family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>addresses when an appeal from a family law arbitration may be taken;<hr><ltbullet>addresses immunity of an arbitrator in a family law arbitration;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the uniformity of application and construction of the act;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a transitional provision.

bills.title: Political Party Procedures Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the use of public meeting buildings by political parties.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain facilities under the control of a public institution of higher education are not exempt from use by political parties.

bills.title: Domestic Relations Recodification
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill recodifies and amends statutes related to domestic relations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the jurisdiction of the juvenile and district courts with regards to adoptions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies and coordinates definitions related to domestic relations;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies and amends Title 78B, Chapter 15, Utah Uniform Parentage Act, to Title 81, Chapter 5, Uniform Parentage Act, including changing the term, "support-enforcement agency" to "child support services agency";<hr><ltbullet>recodifies and amends Title 78B, Chapter 14, Utah Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, to Title 81, Chapter 8, Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, including:<hr><ltbullet1>defining terms to coordinate with the definitions in Title 81, Chapter 5, Uniform Parentage Act; and<hr><ltbullet1>changing the term, "support-enforcement agency" to "child support services agency";<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 78B, Chapter 20, Uniform Deployed Parents Custody, Parent-time, and Visitation Act, to Title 81, Chapter 10, Uniform Deployed Parents Custody, Parent-time, and Visitation Act;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 78B, Chapter 13, Utah Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act, to Title 81, Chapter 11, Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 78B, Chapter 6, Part 1, Utah Adoption Act, to Title 81, Chapter 13, Adoption;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies provisions regarding adoption, including: <hr><ltbullet1>definitions related to adoption;<hr><ltbullet1>access to adoption records by a potential birth father that is allowed to intervene in an adoption proceeding;<hr><ltbullet1>that a petitioner's home includes a temporary place of abode in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet1>clarifying the time periods associated with adoption; and<hr><ltbullet1>requirements for adopting an adult; <hr><ltbullet>allows an adoption proceeding to be brought in a judicial district rather than a county;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a requirement requiring a petition for adoption of a minor child to be filed within 30 days of the minor child being placed in the home of the prospective adoptive parents;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a statute requiring a person filing a petition for the adoption of an alien child to include written evidence of lawful admission of the alien child;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 78B, Chapter 24, Uniform Unregulated Child Custody Transfer Act, to Title 81, Chapter 14, Uniform Unregulated Child Custody Transfer Act;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address a technical conflict with a reference if this bill and H.B. 329, Homeless Services Amendments, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to coordinate changes to statutes related to adoption documents if this bill and H.B. 129, Adoption Records Access Amendments, both pass and become law; <hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to change the reference in a statute if this bill and H.B. 30, Indian Family Preservation Act Amendments, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to modify a definition due to the repeal of a statute if this bill and H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address inconsistent terminology if this bill and H.B. 141, Adoption Modifications, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address inconsistent terminology if this bill and H.B. 283, Child and Family Services Amendments, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Controlled Substances Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses gabapentin.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>with respect to gabapentin, exempts veterinarians from the provisions of the Utah Controlled Substances Act.

bills.title: Property Loss Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to property loss related to homelessness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to property loss related to homelessness; <hr><ltbullet>creates the Property Loss Related to Homelessness Compensation Enterprise Fund (fund);<hr><ltbullet>describes allowable uses of the fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides that money in the fund is nonlapsing;<hr><ltbullet>provides for a sunset review by July 1, 2028.

bills.title: Sales Tax on Food Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the state sales and use tax on groceries.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes the state sales and use tax imposed on amounts paid or charged for food and food ingredients; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Protective Order Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses criminal protective orders.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires a court to include certain provisions in a criminal pretrial protective order to address a utility service for a victim's residence; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Landscaping Procurement Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses procurement of landscape maintenance equipment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>under certain conditions, requires that procured landscape maintenance equipment be electric-powered.

bills.title: Eviction Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions relating to owners and renters.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a new owner of a multifamily unit building provide notice of the change in ownership and any rent increase of 10% or greater than the monthly rent;<hr><ltbullet>permits a renter in a multifamily unit building to terminate an existing lease agreement if the renter provides written notice to the owner at least 60 days before the day on which the renter terminates the lease agreement;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an owner from imposing a rent increase for the first 90 days an owner owns a multifamily unit building;<hr><ltbullet>allows a jury or court to exercise discretion when entering a judgment for actual damages a jury or court in a proceeding involving a tenant and an owner; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Prohibits a new multifamily owner from increasing rent for the first 90 days and requires them to give notice of a rent increase of 10% or more. Allows a tenant to terminate a lease with 60 days notic

bills.title: Airborne Chemicals Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the release of airborne chemicals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the release of chemicals or substances from an aircraft for the purpose of weather geoengineering;<hr><ltbullet>provides a means for the public to submit information regarding suspected weather geoengineering;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Transportation to report credible instances of suspected weather geoengineering to the Utah Attorney General; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipal Elections Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the expiration of the Municipal Alternate Voting Methods Pilot Project from January 1, 2026, to January 1, 2036; and<hr><ltbullet>makes a conforming change.

bills.title: Assisted Reproduction Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses egg retrieval for purposes of assisted reproduction.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a written agreement or consent for an egg retrieval to include a clause that discloses any possible complication associated with the egg retrieval; and<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a certain clause in a written agreement or consent for an egg retrieval.

bills.title: Higher Education Development Areas
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to the development of property owned by certain higher education institutions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes certain higher education institutions to designate a development area consisting of property owned by the institution;<hr><ltbullet>provides a process for an institution to adopt a resolution designating a development area;<hr><ltbullet>requires an institution to establish a fund for revenue from the development area and provides for uses of money in the fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides limitations on a member of the board of trustees regarding participation in development actions and requires a member of a board of trustees to disclose a conflict before the board of trustees approves a development agreement;<hr><ltbullet>requires payment of privilege tax on leased property within a development area and describes the method for a county treasurer to distribute privilege tax revenue to the institution; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the board of trustees to provide an annual report to the Higher Education Appropriations Subcommittee for each development area.

bills.title: Firearm and Firearm Accessory Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses firearms and firearm accessories.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires, beginning on January 1, 2027, a manufacturer or seller of gas-operated semiautomatic firearms that is manufacturing or selling the firearms to the government of the United States, a state, or a federally recognized tribe, to mark on the firearm that the firearm may only be used by a government employee in accordance with government policy;<hr><ltbullet>amends offenses related to a restricted person in possession of a dangerous weapon to include ammunition;<hr><ltbullet>makes possession of a firearm on which the identifying marks have been altered or removed a crime;<hr><ltbullet>makes possession of a firearm without identifying marks a crime;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions requiring the Bureau of Criminal Identification to inform local law enforcement when a prohibited person attempts to purchase a firearm from a firearm dealer;<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense, beginning on January 1, 2027, for an adult to possess a machinegun firearm attachment;<hr><ltbullet>creates a waiting period, with certain exemptions, between the purchase of a firearm from a dealer and the delivery of the firearm to the purchaser;<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense, beginning on January 1, 2027, for a person to import, sell, manufacture, transfer, receive, or possess, in certain circumstances, a gas-operated semiautomatic firearm;<hr><ltbullet>requires a firearm dealer to post a written notice of potential liability for the negligent storage of a firearm and provides a penalty for failure to post the notice;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety to create a system for individuals who possess certain gas-operated semiautomatic firearms before January 1, 2027, to register the firearm with the department;<hr><ltbullet>creates a criminal offense beginning on January 1, 2027, for a person to import, sell, manufacture, transfer, receive, or possess, in certain circumstances, a large-capacity ammunition feeding device;<hr><ltbullet>expands the criminal offense of altering a serial number on a pistol or revolver beginning on January 1, 2027, to include all firearms and large-capacity ammunition feeding devices; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Water Commitment Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses water commitments by water providers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>permits a commitment of available water to uses on the Great Salt Lake to be included in a water conservation plan; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Electric Utility Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates requirements for providing electrical service to large-scale electrical loads.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes alternative processes for providing electric service to customers with large electrical loads;<hr><ltbullet>exempts service provided under this chapter from certain rate regulation requirements while maintaining safety and reliability standards;<hr><ltbullet>creates procedures for submitting, evaluating, and contracting for large-scale electrical service requests;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for qualified electric utilities and large-scale generation providers serving large load customers;<hr><ltbullet>creates accounting and operational transparency requirements to protect retail customers;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a framework for closed private generation systems and connected generation systems;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Public Service Commission (commission) to investigate the feasibility of a large load flexible tariff; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to conduct periodic reviews of the program and report to the Legislature.

bills.title: Metal Purchase and Theft Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns the purchase and theft of metal including catalytic converters.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies language concerning catalytic converter purchases in the Pawnshop, Secondhand Merchandise, and Catalytic Converter Transaction Information Act;<hr><ltbullet>creates the criminal offense of metal or catalytic converter theft;<hr><ltbullet>removes penalty provisions concerning metal or catalytic converter theft from certain generally applicable criminal theft statutes due to the creation of the metal or catalytic converter theft offense; <hr><ltbullet>updates industry definition for metal regulation requirements and offenses;<hr><ltbullet>adds the new metal or catalytic converter theft offense to the offenses concerning pattern of unlawful activity; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Health Care Decisions Act Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Uniform Health Care Decisions Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>enacts the Uniform Health Care Decisions Act;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to advance health care directives including mental health care directives;<hr><ltbullet>creates an optional form;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to allowing a health care provider to be a surrogate for health care decision making in limited circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions related to liability and immunity regarding health care decision making; <hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions related to advance-health care directives not contained in the Uniform Health Care Decisions Act;<hr><ltbullet>renumbers sections pertaining to orders for life sustaining treatment; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming and technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Comparison of the Uniform Act to current state law

bills.title: Educational Medical Services Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill defines terms related to educational medical services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to educational medical services.
bills.disability_law_center_description: For the purposes of public school, defines "extraordinary medical costs" as those that exceed standard educational expenses due to the need for specialized medical services and equipment. Also defines

bills.title: Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Motor Vehicle Business Regulation Act by amending provisions relating to prohibitions for a licensed motor vehicle dealer or salesperson.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the prohibition on a licensed dealer or salesperson selling, offering for sale, leasing, or offering for lease a motor vehicle on consecutive days of Saturday and Sunday; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Course Choice Empowerment
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a private online course choice program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes standards for educational software and hardware procurement;<hr><ltbullet>removes references to a contractor from the Statewide Online Education Program statute;<hr><ltbullet>creates an online course choice program specifically for private school students;<hr><ltbullet>requires the program be administered by an independent program manager contracted by the State Board of Education;<hr><ltbullet>allows eligible students to earn credits through online courses, including courses in blended-learning environments;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a contract administrator role to oversee program implementation; <hr><ltbullet>authorizes the state board to contract with multiple entities for different program functions; <hr><ltbullet>provides for state oversight while maintaining program independence; <hr><ltbullet>creates transition provisions if program manager contracts end;<hr><ltbullet>requires separate funding from public education programs;<hr><ltbullet>requires the program manager to:<hr><ltbullet1>approve and oversee course providers;<hr><ltbullet1>approve and oversee courses offered;<hr><ltbullet1>establish payment structure for courses; and <hr><ltbullet1>annually report on program performance; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: License Plate Reader Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the usage of data from an automatic license plate reader.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a government entity to use information and data obtained from an automatic license plate reader for certain law enforcement purposes, including certain instances where the information was not obtained pursuant to a warrant.

bills.title: Mineral Rights Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to information provided on the Office of the Property Rights Ombudsman's website about eminent domain and mineral rights.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires that information about eminent domain and mineral rights be provided on the Office of the Property Rights Ombudsman's website.

bills.title: Law Enforcement DNA Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the collection and analysis of DNA by law enforcement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends when a DNA specimen for an individual taken at the time of booking may be processed to include, among other circumstances, to allow the processing of the individual's DNA 60 days after the day on which any warrant of arrest has been issued for the individual if the warrant is still outstanding;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the level of offense that must be charged or convicted before an individual who had the individual's DNA specimen taken may be assessed a fee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a prosecutor to notify an individual charged with an offense requiring collection of the individual's DNA of the individual's rights regarding the destruction of the individual's DNA specimen in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Office of Student Health Affairs
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Office of Student Health Affairs within the Department of Health and Human Services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Office of Student Health Affairs within the Department of Health and Human Services;<hr><ltbullet>creates a director to oversee the office;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the office's duties;<hr><ltbullet>creates a reporting requirement; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes a repeal date for some of the office's duties.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Creates the office to coordinate with the Utah State Board of Education and oversee the physical, mental health, and chronic condition services provided by the Department of Health and Human Services

bills.title: App Store Accountability Act
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions governing app store operations and creates requirements for age verification and parental consent.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires app store providers to:<hr><ltbullet1>verify a user's age category;<hr><ltbullet1>obtain parental consent for minor accounts;<hr><ltbullet1>notify users and parents of significant changes;<hr><ltbullet1>share age category and consent data with developers; and<hr><ltbullet1>protect age verification data;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits app store providers from:<hr><ltbullet1>enforcing contracts against minors without parental consent; and<hr><ltbullet1>misrepresenting parental content disclosures;<hr><ltbullet>requires developers to:<hr><ltbullet1> verify age category and consent status through app stores; and<hr><ltbullet1>notify app stores of significant changes;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits developers from:<hr><ltbullet1>enforcing contracts against minors without verified parental consent; and<hr><ltbullet1>misrepresenting parental content disclosures;<hr><ltbullet>designates violations of certain provisions as deceptive trade practices;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Division of Consumer Protection to establish standards for age verification methods;<hr><ltbullet>creates a private right of action for parents of harmed minors;<hr><ltbullet>provides a safe harbor for compliant developers; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a severability clause.

bills.title: Legislative Activities Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Legislative Management Committee (LMC), the State Capitol Preservation Board, and the Legislature.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that LMC oversees workplace harassment and discrimination policy governance and updates references to that policy;<hr><ltbullet>provides that LMC shall oversee and develop policies governing branch-wide internal administrative matters for the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates certain administrative duties of the presiding officer and the majority and minority leaders of each house and the chairman of LMC;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the LMC Subcommittee on Oversight;<hr><ltbullet>eliminates the Legislature's responsibility to print, store, and distribute the Utah Code Annotated;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a provision governing legislators who attend meetings of the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>updates the definition of a legislative procurement unit to include the House, Senate, or a staff office of the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain quinquennial reporting requirements applicable to legislative boards and the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel; <hr><ltbullet>for the State Capitol Preservation Board:<hr><ltbullet1>specifies certain rules that the board shall promulgate to govern, administer, and regulate capitol hill;<hr><ltbullet1>provides that the board's authority to promulgate a rule described above does not restrict LMC from adopting a similar policy on behalf of the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet1>provides that if there is a conflict between a board rule and an LMC policy the LMC policy prevails; and<hr><ltbullet1>directs the executive director of the board to notify and consult with the president of the Senate and the speaker of the House of Representatives when a person appeals an administrative denial of a requested activity in the legislative area;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a bill summary prepared by a staff member of the Senate or the House of Representatives, or by a staff office for the Legislature, is not evidence of legislative intent;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the control and use of office spaces on Capitol hill; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Sexual Crimes Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses sexual crimes.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides a definition of a female breast for certain sexual and sexual exploitation offenses that includes a breast that is undeveloped or partially developed;<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of "child sexual abuse material" to include a minor observing or being used for sexually explicit conduct;<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of "sexually explicit conduct" concerning certain bodily functions for certain offenses;<hr><ltbullet>changes the mental state necessary to commit the offense of sexual exploitation of a minor;<hr><ltbullet>expands the offense of sexual exploitation of a minor to include when an actor accesses child sexual abuse material with the intent to view;<hr><ltbullet>provides a safe harbor provision for certain employees and independent contractors who are required to access or view child sexual abuse material within the scope of employment;<hr><ltbullet>changes the mental state necessary to commit the offense of aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor;<hr><ltbullet>amends the offense of aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor to remove a lesser penalty for circumstances when the child sexual abuse material depicts an individual who is 14 years old or older or pubescent; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Technical Senate District Boundary Adjustment
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes a technical correction to the boundary between two Utah State Senate districts, and includes the printed text of the bill and the electronic data affiliated with the text of the bill, which electronic data is available on the Legislature's website and also included on the electronic storage device accompanying this bill when presented to the governor.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>makes a technical correction in the boundary between Senate district 1 and Senate district 11;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Senate shapefile, that is part of this bill in electronic form, as the corrected legal boundaries of the Utah State Senate districts;<hr><ltbullet>provides a hash code to verify the authenticity of the Senate shapefile; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.<hr><ltbullet><hr><ltbullet>The boundary information for the Utah State Senate district boundaries:<hr><ltbullet>is delineated in a shapefile that:<hr><ltbullet1>is enacted as part of this bill in electronic form;<hr><ltbullet1>may be found at: https://le.utah.gov/Session/2025/documents/SB0145_shapefile.zip; and<hr><ltbullet1>has the following electronic file hash security code: 8c43518875904b22a5f75f1a4520c48d; and<hr><ltbullet>is also depicted in a format that:<hr><ltbullet1>is intended to be more accessible to the general public and is provided for informational purposes only;<hr><ltbullet1>shows the boundary as delineated in the shapefile, but is not enacted as part of this bill; and<hr><ltbullet1>may be found at: https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=1kRXYYTRkC6ucH7L42g7LVqUGvxU45mw.

bills.title: Glucagon Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the storage and administration of glucagon kits in public and private schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>allows a school to stock glucagon kits;<hr><ltbullet>allows a qualified adult to administer a glucagon kit to a student experiencing hypoglycemia;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a standing prescription for a school to obtain glucagon kits;<hr><ltbullet>exempts certain parties from civil liability when administering or prescribing a glucagon kit; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes training for the use and storage of a glucagon kit.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Allows a school to store, and the qualified adult to administer, glycogen to a diabetic student with hypoglycemia who has an order on file.

bills.title: Youth Service Organizations Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to registered sex offender checks for potential youth workers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a youth service organization may require a potential youth worker to provide the individual's full name and, in certain circumstances, a current identification, to facilitate a registered sex offender check; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Court Fees and Administration Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to fees and various administrative procedures of the Utah court system.
