bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes unused provisions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies language addressing bail to conform with recent statutory changes;<hr><ltbullet>provides that all civil document fees for justice courts and courts of record are provided at no charge to the state, state agencies, and political subdivisions; <hr><ltbullet>increases the filing fee surcharge for cases filed using the online court assistance program;<hr><ltbullet>updates terminology; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that a request for a protective order does not have a filing fee surcharge under the online court assistance program.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, adds $50 to the fee for using the court's online system to file a claim, counterclaim, petition, or counterpetition (including guardianship).

bills.title: Natural Resources Modifications
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to hunting and public lands under the Department of Natural Resources.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Guide, Outfitter, and Spotter Fund;<hr><ltbullet>establishes when the use of a guide, outfitter, or spotter is unlawful;<hr><ltbullet>requires registration of a guide, outfitter, and spotter with the Division of Wildlife Resources (division);<hr><ltbullet>provides for division rulemaking related to guides, outfitters, and spotters;<hr><ltbullet>outlines prohibited activities and penalties for violations related to guides, outfitters, and spotters;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the provisions related to guides, outfitters, and spotters do not apply to private land;<hr><ltbullet>removes a requirement for the Public Lands Policy Coordinating Office (PLPCO) to prepare and submit a constitutional defense plan;<hr><ltbullet>renames the executive director of PLPCO as the advisor on public lands;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the advisor of PLPCO and director of the Office of Energy Development:<hr><ltbullet1>are appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the Senate; and<hr><ltbullet1>report to the executive director of the Department of Natural Resources, upon the executive director's request;<hr><ltbullet>repeals a committee required to inventory and map R.S. 2477 rights-of-way;<hr><ltbullet>repeals regulation related to hunting guide registration by the Division of Professional Licensing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Nonpublic Personal Information Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the Notice of Intent to Sell Nonpublic Personal Information Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the liability and remedy under the Notice of Intent to Sell Nonpublic Personal Information Act (act) is an individual action and not a class action or action in a representative capacity;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the statute or limitations;<hr><ltbullet>finds that the act's prohibition of class actions since January 1, 2004, is a remedy provision and not procedural; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: Income Tax Contributions Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for taxpayer contributions for statewide hunger relief on the income tax return.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Statewide Hunger Relief Fund (fund);<hr><ltbullet>allows taxpayers, through the individual income tax return, to contribute to the fund to support the Utah Food Bank in fighting hunger statewide;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to make annual disbursements from the fund to the Utah Food Bank;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the removal of the contribution from the income tax return if the contribution does not generate a certain amount of money each year for a specified period; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Local Land Use Regulation Restrictions
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with the authority of a municipality to require a building design element.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term "housing-restricted community";<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a municipality that is a housing-restricted community from requiring a garage on a one- or two-family dwelling; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Public Utility Expenditures Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill  prohibits a qualified utility from recovering in rates expenses related to advertising, lobbying, and political activities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a qualified utility from recovering in rates certain advertising, lobbying, and political influence expenses;<hr><ltbullet>requires a qualified utility to file an annual report detailing prior year expenses related to advertising, lobbying, and political activities;<hr><ltbullet>specifies information that must be included in the annual report; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes penalties for a qualified utility that improperly recovers prohibited expenses.

bills.title: Legislative Audit Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts and amends provisions governing the duties and powers of the legislative auditor general.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>restates the authority of the legislative auditor general; <hr><ltbullet>amends provisions governing information that may be subject to federal law and is requested by the legislative auditor general from an entity, including the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>excludes certain information provided to the legislative auditor general from the definition of "record";<hr><ltbullet> permits an entity to provide certain privileged items to the legislative auditor general; <hr><ltbullet>requires an entity that withholds certain privileged items from the legislative auditor general to expressly assert a privilege;<hr><ltbullet>permits the legislative auditor general to contest a privilege claim;<hr><ltbullet>requires, in certain circumstances, an entity to submit privileged items to an arbitrator to determine a privilege claim;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the legislative auditor general to provide certain information to an audited entity;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "chief officer" for purposes of an entity responding to a legislative audit;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions governing an audit response plan and an update to a plan;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the legislative auditor general to review and monitor the Utah System of Higher Education;<hr><ltbullet>coordinates enactment of provisions with S.J.R. 4, Joint Resolution Amending Court Rules on Attorney Confidentiality; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Adjustments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>reduces the amount of time that must elapse before an offender who is on the Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry for an offense requiring lifetime registration is:<hr><ltbullet1>able to first petition for early removal from the registry; and<hr><ltbullet1>able to file an additional petition for early removal if the offender's previous petition is denied;<hr><ltbullet>contains a coordination clause to coordinate changes between this bill and S.B. 41, Sex, Kidnap, and Child Abuse Offender Registry Amendments; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Pari-mutuel Horse Racing
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Pari-mutuel Horse Racing Commission and allows for pari-mutuel horse racing and wagering.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Pari-mutuel Horse Racing Commission (commission);<hr><ltbullet>provides for the commission's membership, authority, and duties;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to audit the commission's accounting;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to issue licenses and permits for pari-mutuel events;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to enforce fines and penalties for permit and license violations;<hr><ltbullet>requires voters to approve pari-mutuel horse racing and wagering within a county before the commission issues permits in the county; <hr><ltbullet>requires a permittee other than a political subdivision to post a bond or other financial assurance;<hr><ltbullet>provides for simulcasting and advance deposit pari-mutuel wagering;<hr><ltbullet>provides for takeouts of certain percentages from the winning wagers for certain purposes;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits bribery, touting, and wagering involving minors;<hr><ltbullet>requires the identification of horses;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain treatment of animals in relation to pari-mutuel events; and<hr><ltbullet>creates restricted accounts.

bills.title: Nonjudicial Adjustment Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the provisions of the Indigent Defense Act in relation to nonjudicial adjustments and access to legal counsel.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a minor from declining to enter into a nonjudicial adjustment agreement unless the minor has received advice from legal counsel, with exceptions;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Indigent Defense Commission to include encouraging the provision of resources for minors to receive access to legal advice when considering a nonjudicial adjustment;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Office of Indigent Defense Services to require the office to provide no-cost legal advice for minors considering a nonjudicial adjustment;<hr><ltbullet>permits the Office of Indigent Defense Services to employ or contract with an attorney to provide legal advice to minors considering a nonjudicial adjustment;<hr><ltbullet>creates procedures for giving notice of requirements before declining a nonjudicial adjustment agreement; and<hr><ltbullet>makes clarifying amendments.

bills.title: Sale or Lease of Federally Managed Public Land Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses use of the federal Recreation and Public Purposes Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides for monitoring of land applications;<hr><ltbullet>requires a study of land application information;<hr><ltbullet>requires a report of the results of the study; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Sale or Lease of Federally Managed Public Land Amendments

bills.title: Environmental Quality Modifications
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses nonhazardous solid waste.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>prohibits approval of an operation plan or permit for certain nonhazardous solid waste landfill facilities unless specific conditions are met; <hr><ltbullet>addresses the treatment of certain existing nonhazardous solid waste facilities; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Product Liability Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to product liability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a claimant is not required to demonstrate the availability of a safer alternative design to prevail in a civil action under the defect or defective condition statute.

bills.title: Cultural and Community Engagement Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to cultural and community engagement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Community Library Enhancement Fund Grant Program;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Utah Women's History Initiative;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of the State Library division;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a state agency with management authority over state lands shall retain temporary custody of remains under certain circumstances; <hr><ltbullet>amends certain provisions of the One Utah Service Fellowship Program (program), including:<hr><ltbullet1>allowing a third-party administrator to receive matching funds by a qualified partner organization for supplementing a living allowance; <hr><ltbullet1>providing exceptions for funding under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet1>requiring disbursement of a living allowance on no less than a monthly basis over the term of the agreement; <hr><ltbullet1>allowing an institution of higher education that is a qualified partner organization to enter into a tuition agreement with a student participant; and<hr><ltbullet1>provides that the director may discontinue a tuition-only award under the program if participation does not support continuation of the tuition-only award; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Talent Connect
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes a statewide talent portal for high-demand jobs and creates a cooperative education program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a statewide talent portal for high-demand jobs in Utah;<hr><ltbullet>defines high-demand jobs based on growth rate, wages, and societal impact;<hr><ltbullet>requires a platform that connects Utah employers with qualified candidates from higher education institutions;<hr><ltbullet>mandates mobile access to the talent portal;<hr><ltbullet>requires integration with state labor market data and workforce systems;<hr><ltbullet>establishes regular updates of high-demand job categories based on market trends;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements for data analytics and employer verification systems;<hr><ltbullet>requires annual reporting on portal metrics and outcomes;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a cooperative education pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>creates a strategic partnerships between Utah universities and engineering efforts;<hr><ltbullet>requires participating employers to provide full-time paid cooperative education work experiences;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a dual mentorship structure with academic and industry advisors;<hr><ltbullet>creates a framework for granting academic credit for cooperative education experiences;<hr><ltbullet>requires development of an electronic management system for program administration;<hr><ltbullet>establishes data collection and analysis requirements for program evaluation;<hr><ltbullet>mandates annual reporting on program effectiveness and workforce impact;<hr><ltbullet>establishes liability and risk management protocols for participating institutions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Government Records Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to the Government Records Access and Management Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a summary of government records requirements to be developed and provided to employees of a governmental entity;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to fees charged in relation to a record request;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for responding to a record request, including:<hr><ltbullet1>deadlines;<hr><ltbullet1>a request for an expedited response;<hr><ltbullet1>appeals; and<hr><ltbullet1>other requirements;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions relating to the State Records Committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a governmental entity to conduct an annual review of records retention requirements and compliance with those requirements;<hr><ltbullet>amends requirements for an ordinance or policy adopted by a political subdivision in relation to public records;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a crime to destroy a record with the intent to avoid disclosure in response to a pending record request; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Modifications to Election Law
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county clerk to coordinate with local post offices to ensure the optimal handling of ballots;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a poll watcher may observe the signature-verification process for a petition to qualify a candidate for a primary election ballot (candidate petition) or for a written request to remove a signature from a candidate petition;<hr><ltbullet>makes it unlawful for a poll watcher to reveal certain information observed during the process described in the preceding paragraph;<hr><ltbullet>requires an election officer to conduct an audit of signature comparisons made for a candidate petition;<hr><ltbullet> requires an election officer who engages in the signature-verification process for a candidate petition to certify a certain percentage of signatures submitted beyond the required signature-gathering threshold;<hr><ltbullet>addresses viewing by a candidate or a candidate's campaign representative of a complete, unredacted signature packet, or a request to remove a signature from a signature packet, relating to a candidate petition for the candidate's election race;<hr><ltbullet>provides the ability for a voter to track a candidate petition recently signed by the voter and certain information relating to verification of the signature;    <hr><ltbullet>in relation to a signature packet for a candidate petition, establishes requirements for:<hr><ltbullet1>submitting the packet;<hr><ltbullet1>maintaining a chain of custody for a packet; and<hr><ltbullet1>storing a packet;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the director of elections within the Office of the Lieutenant Governor;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to deadlines and the calculation of time in the Election Code;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies and modifies deadlines in the Election Code;<hr><ltbullet>includes coordination clauses:<hr><ltbullet1>adding Election Day as a legal holiday, to the repeal and reenactment of Section 63G-1-301 in this bill, if this bill and H.B. 351, Election Day Amendments, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet1>adding Easter Sunday as a legal holiday, to the repeal and reenactment of Section 63G-1-301 in this bill, if this bill and S.B. 259, State Holy Days, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet1>in the coordination clause described above, adding other changes made to Section 63G-1-301 in S.B. 259 to the repeal and reenactment of that section in this bill; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Municipal Broadband Service Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a municipality's provision of a broadband service.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements and limitations in relation to a municipality providing a broadband service;<hr><ltbullet>addresses bonding, reporting, and public disclosure relating to the provision of a broadband service by a municipality; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Point of the Mountain State Land Authority Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Point of the Mountain State Land Authority.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the authority of a local government under Title 10, Chapter 9a, Municipal Land Use, Development, and Management Act, or Title 17, Chapter 27a, County Land Use, Development, and Management Act, does not apply to the use of  point of the mountain state land;<hr><ltbullet>describes the method for a county treasurer to distribute privilege tax to the Point of the Mountain State Land Authority (authority);<hr><ltbullet>repeals and reenacts provisions related to the authority board and modifies the composition of the authority board;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the procedure for the authority to provide notice of a public hearing; <hr><ltbullet>requires the county recorder for a county of the first class to record a plat submitted by the authority for point of the mountain state land, if certain requirements are met; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Guardianship Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses guardianships.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>for a guardianship proceeding on and after May 7, 2025, requires the court to make a finding regarding whether an incapacitated person is mentally incompetent and is not permitted to vote in an election or hold office in this state under Utah Constitution, Article IV, Section 6;<hr><ltbullet>for an incapacitated person for whom a guardian was appointed before May 7, 2025, creates a presumption in certain circumstances that the incapacitated person is mentally incompetent and is not permitted to vote in an election or hold office in this state under Utah Constitution, Article IV, Section 6; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Presumes a person subject to a guardianship before May of this year can't vote or hold public office until court specifically gives them the right. Going forward, requires a court to specifically addr

bills.title: Public Employee Negotiation Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses collective bargaining for public employees.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Labor Relations Board (board);<hr><ltbullet>describes the composition and duties of the board;<hr><ltbullet>describes the entities the board may employ;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the board's rulemaking authority;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the board to subpoena witnesses and administer oaths;<hr><ltbullet>establishes who may serve as counsel for public employers and the board;<hr><ltbullet>creates protections for public employees regarding self-organization;<hr><ltbullet>allows a public employer to deduct an employee's dues for a collective bargaining unit from an employee's pay;<hr><ltbullet>requires that labor organizations represent employees without discriminations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the board investigate a petition on a representation question under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>establishes criteria and the function of a representation election at the direction of the board;<hr><ltbullet>establishes who may represent a public employer in collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>establishes management rights of a public employer;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a duty to bargain collectively for both the public employer and an exclusive representative;<hr><ltbullet>describes what a collective bargaining agreement shall contain;<hr><ltbullet>permits and describes the mediation of disputes relating to collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>describes how to initiate fact finding relating to a dispute regarding collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>establishes fact finding proceedings in a dispute related to collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>allows arbitration for a dispute resulting from collective bargaining;<hr><ltbullet>requires the board to establish an education course for fact finders and arbitrators;<hr><ltbullet>describes an unfair labor practice of a public employer;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the process by which an unfair labor practice is investigated and resolved;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a hearing process for an unfair labor practice complaint hearing;<hr><ltbullet>describes the process of the court enforcement and review of a board order;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits police officers from engaging in strikes;<hr><ltbullet>establishes criteria for mediation of a dispute under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes the criteria for arbitration under certain circumstances.

bills.title: Governmental Immunity Act Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Governmental Immunity Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>requires a governmental entity to file a statement with Division of Corporations and Commercial Code containing:<hr><ltbullet1>any doing-business-as name the governmental entity utilizes;<hr><ltbullet1>the office or agent designated to receive service of a summons and complaint; and<hr><ltbullet1>the physical address to which service of a summons and complaint is to be delivered by hand or transmitted by mail;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a governmental entity from challenging the validity of a notice of claim, or the sufficiency of service of a summons and complaint, if the governmental entity:<hr><ltbullet1>fails to file or update the statement described above; and<hr><ltbullet1>has actual notice of the notice of claim or the summons and complaint;<hr><ltbullet>if a challenge described above is not prohibited, requires a claimant to prove that the claimant used reasonable diligence in attempting to discover the identity of a governmental entity using a doing-business-as name; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Discipline Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill regulates the use of emergency safety interventions on a student in a school.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>consolidates and clarifies existing school physical intervention provisions into a single section of code;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Board of Education to establish administrative rules for physical intervention in schools;<hr><ltbullet>establishes standards for use of physical restraint in schools;<hr><ltbullet>defines allowed incidences of seclusion in schools;<hr><ltbullet>requires local education agencies to collect and report data on incidents of student confinement;<hr><ltbullet>provides for investigation and enforcement requirements;<hr><ltbullet>outlines liability protections and exceptions; <hr><ltbullet>establishes consequences for violations of the law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, prohibits use of seclusion with students younger than first grade and limits it to 30 minutes for other students. Makes violation a crime. Also requires school district policies an

bills.title: Indigent Defense Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses indigent defense.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Youth Defense Fund to pay for indigent defense services for a minor referred to the juvenile court for an offense;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Indigent Defense Commission to establish the rules and procedures for an application by a county seeking to participate in the Youth Defense Fund;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain administrative duties from the Office of Indigent Defense Services with regard to the Youth Defense Fund; and<hr><ltbullet>addresses county participation in the Youth Defense Fund.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Creates the Youth Defense Fund to pay for an attorney for a youth referred to the juvenile justice system.

bills.title: Local Health Department Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to local health departments and the Department of Environmental Quality.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Environmental Quality (department) and each local health department to enter into a cooperative agreement for providing environmental health services;<hr><ltbullet>requires that the governance committee comprised of department and local health department personnel:<hr><ltbullet1>review all department funding;<hr><ltbullet1>review whether funds allocated by contract or cooperative agreement are subject to requirements meeting or exceeding the minimum performance standards created by the department; and<hr><ltbullet1>create a process for exempting certain applications for federal funding from committee review;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to reimburse a local health department for all costs associated with collecting a civil penalty under Title 19, Environmental Quality Code; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School Meal Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides free breakfast and lunch to all students in a public school.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Universal Free School Meals Program;<hr><ltbullet>provides free meals to students enrolled in public schools;<hr><ltbullet>creates a restricted account to assist in funding the school meals; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Transit and Transportation Governance Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the governance of public transit districts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends and reallocates the roles of the board of trustees, executive director, and local advisory board of a large public transit district;<hr><ltbullet>requires all fixed guideway capital development projects of a large public transit district to be under the supervision of the Department of Transportation, regardless of whether the project includes state funding;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to public transit planning;<hr><ltbullet>requires a large public transit district to provide a report regarding contracting for reduced fares;<hr><ltbullet>amends levels of contracts of a large public transit district that require approval of the board of trustees; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Medical Expense Liability Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill exempts a deceased spouse's medical expenses from being considered a family expense.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>exempts a deceased spouse's medical expenses from being considered a family expense; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Dog Injuries Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to injuries from dog attacks.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>raises the maximum award from $50,000 to $75,000 in arbitration and at trial for a bodily injury claim in a dog attack case, not including certain costs;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a claimant in arbitration or plaintiff at trial may maintain a wrongful death claim in a dog attack case; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Welfare Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to child safety and welfare.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates a process by which a child in the state's custody may use a Division of Child and Family Services' address for purposes of a driver license;<hr><ltbullet>amends definitions for the Juvenile Code;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions regarding the time and circumstances under which a person may seek review of certain child abuse or neglect findings;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the evidence that a juvenile court shall hear at a shelter hearing;<hr><ltbullet>addresses what a juvenile court considers when determining whether reunification services are appropriate; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Devices in Public Schools
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the use of cellphones, smart watches, or emerging technologies during classroom hours.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a student from using a cellphone, smart watch, or emerging technology during classroom hours;<hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency to create exemptions to the prohibition; and<hr><ltbullet>permits the State Board of Education to create model policies.

bills.title: Local Regulation of Business Entities Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to local classification and approval of new and unlisted business uses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; and<hr><ltbullet>requires each municipality and county to enact a land use regulation establishing a process for reviewing a business use not listed as an approved use in existing ordinances.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Usage of Artificial Intelligence
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns the use of artificial intelligence by law enforcement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a law enforcement agency to have a policy concerning the law enforcement agency's use of generative artificial intelligence;<hr><ltbullet>requires a police report or other law enforcement record to include a disclaimer if the report or record was created wholly or partially by using generative artificial intelligence; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the author of a police report or other law enforcement record that was created wholly or partially by using generative artificial intelligence to certify that the author has read and reviewed the report or record for accuracy.

bills.title: Housing Affordability Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts and amends provisions related to housing affordability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines and amends terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions of certain land use regulations with regard to certain types of parking spaces;<hr><ltbullet>provides certain exceptions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Homeless Services Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts certain provisions for individuals experiencing homelessness.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends and defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services to issue a code red alert for certain weather events that may pose a danger to individuals experiencing homelessness;<hr><ltbullet>provides for certain requirements and limitations to take effect within a county that is impacted by a code red alert; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Inmate Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill requires the Department of Corrections to provide an optional financial literacy class for inmates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Corrections to provide an optional financial literacy class for inmates; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Diesel Emissions Reduction Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a voluntary registry for certain non-road diesel engines.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Division of Air Quality (division) to create a voluntary registry for certain non-road diesel engines;<hr><ltbullet>prevents the division from paying a replacement incentive to an owner of a non-road diesel engine not on the registry;<hr><ltbullet>requires a registrant of a non-road diesel engine to pay a registration fee;<hr><ltbullet> requires the division to deposit registration fees into the Environmental Mitigation and Response Fund;<hr><ltbullet>grants the division rulemaking authority to implement the provisions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Compensatory Service in Lieu of Fine Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions concerning compensatory service in lieu of a criminal fine.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions concerning compensatory service in lieu of a criminal fine; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Tobacco and Electronic Cigarette Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to tobacco and electronic cigarette products.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to electronic cigarette product enforcement;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to electronic cigarette product searches; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the electronic cigarette product registry;<hr><ltbullet>creates penalties for general tobacco retailers that sell flavored electronic cigarette products;<hr><ltbullet>raises permit fees for general tobacco retailers;<hr><ltbullet>raises permit fees for retail tobacco specialty businesses;<hr><ltbullet>amends criminal penalties regarding the illegal sale of tobacco and electronic cigarette products; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause with H.B. 21, Criminal Code Recodification and Cross References, to ensure the policy changes made in this bill are accurately reflected if both bills pass.

bills.title: Throughput Infrastructure Funding Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses financial assistance that is funded through the Throughput Infrastructure Fund.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of a throughput infrastructure project;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the Permanent Community Impact Fund Board's authority related to the Throughput Infrastructure Fund;<hr><ltbullet>provides for an award of a loan or grant from the Throughput Infrastructure Fund for certain mining activity; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming amendments.

bills.title: School District Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses creation of new school districts and the transition process from divided to new school districts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts dates regarding the redistricting of local school board districts after the creation of certain new school districts;<hr><ltbullet>amends the duties of the Office of the Legislative Auditor General to include receiving and providing certain information during the transition process from divided to new school districts;<hr><ltbullet>extends, by an additional year, the rights of transferred employees regarding salary and benefits;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the body of voters whose approval is required to create a new school district to voters within the proposed new school district;<hr><ltbullet>reduces the threshold for interlocal participants to propose a new school district to a majority of municipalities that are participants in the interlocal agreement;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain dates regarding election cycles following the creation of a new school district;<hr><ltbullet>amends certain deadlines for the duties of municipal legislative bodies, county legislative bodies, local school boards, and other entities under certain circumstances after the creation of a new school district;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions regarding the transition from a divided school district to new and reorganized new school districts, including:<hr><ltbullet1>school district employee and other personnel issues;<hr><ltbullet1>records of the divided school district;<hr><ltbullet1>the actual transfer of funds, property, assets, and liabilities;<hr><ltbullet1>retrospectively voiding certain agreements or policies; and<hr><ltbullet1>resolution of disputes between school districts through an agreed upon or appointed arbiter;<hr><ltbullet>requires a government entity to send an invoice before requiring payment of past fees before processing a new request; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Care Services Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Child Care Capacity Expansion Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Child Care Capacity Expansion Act (act);<hr><ltbullet>describes the purpose of the act;<hr><ltbullet>directs certain state departments to collaborate on implementing the act; <hr><ltbullet>provides for certain limitations on liability from operations of an expanded child care facility; and<hr><ltbullet>requires an annual report to certain legislative committees.

bills.title: Workers' Compensation Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the Workers' Compensation Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>expands the Labor Commission's authority to disclosures by health care providers;<hr><ltbullet>expands the Labor Commission's authority over fees for health care providers;<hr><ltbullet>expands the prohibition of balance billing for workers' compensation claims to health care providers; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Protective Orders Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses protective orders.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms for cohabitant abuse protective orders; <hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may treat a petition for a protective order as a request for a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order only if the petitioner and the respondent agree to the order and the terms of the order;<hr><ltbullet>allows a court to grant a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order if the parties agree to the terms of the order;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the modification of a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order;<hr><ltbullet>requires a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order include a credible threat finding;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order may not be introduced as evidence in a civil or criminal proceeding that the respondent committed domestic violence or abuse;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a no-fault cohabitant abuse protective order does not prevent a petitioner from obtaining an ex parte cohabitant abuse protective order or a cohabitant abuse protective order;<hr><ltbullet>modifies a cross-reference regarding the provisions of a cohabitant abuse protective order that are civil offenses; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Commercial Wind and Solar Incentives Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies tax credit requirements for certain commercial wind and solar energy systems.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires commercial wind and solar energy systems of 660 or more kilowatts to include energy storage systems to qualify for tax credits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.utah_farm_bureau_description: Commercial Wind and Solar Incentives Amendments

bills.title: Medicaid Provider Reimbursement Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides for an annual increase in Medicaid rates for certain providers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the annual base budget to include a Medicaid rate increase for certain providers; and<hr><ltbullet>coordinates S.B. 246, Medicaid Reimbursement Rate Modifications, and S.B. 193, Medicaid Provider Reimbursement Amendments, to specify which bill should become law if both pass.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Makes air ambulances, DSPD waiver services, ICFs/ID, nursing homes, private duty nursing and other services eligible for some of any automatic rate increase in 2026. Adds applied behavioral analysis i

bills.title: Defendant Access to Evidence Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a criminal defendant's access to evidence in a county jail.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the county sheriff to ensure that a jail inmate awaiting trial, sentencing, or disposition of criminal charges has:<hr><ltbullet1>a space to review discovery and other evidence or documents in the jail inmate's criminal case with the jail inmate's counsel; and<hr><ltbullet1>the means to access and review discovery and other evidence or documents in the jail inmate's criminal case;<hr><ltbullet>addresses how the jail inmate may access or review discovery, evidence, or other documents in jail;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a jail inmate's counsel has to ensure that certain discovery, evidence, or other documents are not left with the jail inmate at the jail; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Transportation Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to transportation items, transportation mobility plans, and adherence to proposed phases of certain transportation developments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires cities and metropolitan planning organizations to identify transportation connectivity impediments and provide a report on plans to address transportation connectivity;<hr><ltbullet>requires periodic reporting and follow up on certain station area plans;<hr><ltbullet>requires property acquired by the Department of Transportation for a public transit purpose remain under the ownership of the Department of Transportation;<hr><ltbullet>designates certain legislative committees as recipients for certain required reports;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements for air ambulance dispatch services;<hr><ltbullet>adjusts a sales and use tax earmark percentage to increase funding for transportation;<hr><ltbullet>extends a deadline for certain sales and use taxes to be allocated for public transit innovation grants;<hr><ltbullet>reinstates certain funding to the Department of Transportation for litter mitigation that was reduced due to the COVID-19 pandemic;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Transportation to adhere to phasing of projects if required by the environmental impact statement;<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain outdated language and makes other technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>allocates revenue for certain road projects;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Transportation and Salt Lake City to coordinate on certain traffic studies and planning;<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain highway-related name designations;<hr><ltbullet>provides maintenance responsibilities for certain street light infrastructure; and<hr><ltbullet>makes other technical changes.

bills.title: Physical Therapist Practice Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses physical therapists and primary care providers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of primary health care to include the services of physical therapists;  <hr><ltbullet>recognizes that a health insurance policy has discretion to allow an insured to select a physical therapist as the insured's primary care provider for a neuromusculoskeletal condition; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming and technical changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to property tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits taxpayers from receiving the homeowner's credit unless the taxpayer received the credit within the previous two years, beginning in 2026;<hr><ltbullet>removes requirements for annual inflation adjustments for the homeowner's credit;<hr><ltbullet>increases the household income limits and maximum credit amounts allowed for a renter's credit;<hr><ltbullet>changes the qualifications, scope, duration, and rates of interest applicable to the discretionary and nondiscretionary property tax deferral programs;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits taxpayers from receiving indigent abatement unless the taxpayer received the abatement within the previous two years, beginning in 2026;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county auditor to include information on the property tax valuation notice regarding the availability of tax deferral programs;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county treasurer to include information on the tax notice regarding the amount of outstanding taxes and interest for taxpayers who receive a deferral;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits taxpayers from receiving more than one of certain forms of property tax relief;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address substantive and technical conflicts if this bill and H.B. 20, Property Tax Code Recodification, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Appears to prevent new individuals from from participating in the low-income  peoperty tax reduction program.

bills.title: Federal Guidance Letter Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes publication and reporting requirements for federal guidance letters received by state agencies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a state agency to publish certain federal guidance letter information received by the state agency on public websites and transmit copies to the Legislature; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes standards for federal guidance letter information published on a state agency's website.

bills.title: Guardianship Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms for guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies court jurisdiction for guardianships;<hr><ltbullet>enacts a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the applicability of a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>enacts certain rights for an individual with a severe intellectual disability for which a full guardianship is imposed;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability, including the requirements for the petition, venue, and in-person hearings;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the appointment of:<hr><ltbullet1>an attorney for a respondent in a guardianship proceeding for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet1>a physician, psychologist, physician assistant, or court visitor to examine the respondent; and<hr><ltbullet1>an emergency or temporary guardian while guardianship proceedings are pending;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may appoint a guardian for a respondent if the court makes certain findings;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the court shall prefer a full guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>requires the court to include certain provisions in an order of appointment;<hr><ltbullet>provides who may be a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the duties, powers, and rights of a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability in a full guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the removal or resignation of a guardian for an individual with a severe intellectual disability;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the termination of a guardianship for an individual with a severe intellectual disability; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Doesn't require a person with a severe intellectual disability subject to a possible guardianship to have an attorney if the individual seeking guardianship is their parent, grandparent, or sibling an

bills.title: Watercraft Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes changes to fees associated with boat registration.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms; <hr><ltbullet>amends uniform statewide fees for boats;<hr><ltbullet>enacts the Boating Grant Tax; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Real Estate Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to real estate.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes an association to establish by rule a minimum lease term of six months or less;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a homeowners' association fee for rentals does not apply to certain exempt persons;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a homeowners' association may only charge a fee to an owner that owns a rental within the homeowners' association once every 12 months;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a homeowners' association hold a meeting and approve a fee before imposing a fee on an owner that owns a rental within the homeowners' association;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy by which an owner may contest a fee a homeowners' association imposes for a rental;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a representative of a homeowners' association to act as attorney-in-fact for the owners in a homeowners' association for any disposition of common areas;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the circumstances under which a homeowners' association can prohibit or restrict the conversion of a grass park strip to water-efficient landscaping;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a homeowner to designate an individual other than the homeowner as the primary contact for the homeowner;<hr><ltbullet> defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a condominium owner provide the developer notice and an opportunity to repair any alleged design or construction defect before filing a lawsuit; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Property Tax Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Property Tax Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to annually provide the State Tax Commission (commission) with a preliminary assessment book before delivery to the county auditor;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to take corrective action upon a county officer's noncompliance with assessment duties;<hr><ltbullet>describes forms of corrective action that the commission may take against a county officer;<hr><ltbullet>requires commission assistance upon a county officer's noncompliance with assessment duties for a certain period of time;<hr><ltbullet>increases the costs paid by counties that request and receive appraisal assistance from the commission;<hr><ltbullet>repeals newspaper publication requirements applicable to certain property tax increase proposals;<hr><ltbullet>requires taxing entities holding a public hearing for certain property tax increase proposals to allow for in-person or virtual participation;<hr><ltbullet>requires the property tax valuation notice provided by county auditors to include taxpayer instructions for appealing a property's valuation;<hr><ltbullet>removes tax payment information from the property tax valuation notice provided by county auditors;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to provide education and training to specified county officers in addition to hearing officers;<hr><ltbullet>requires county officers subject to the education and training requirements to complete the education and training before performing valuation-related work;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to require education and training for other county officers involved in property valuation;<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to ensure taxpayers have the ability to submit property valuation appeals through electronic means;<hr><ltbullet>requires counties to annually report appeals information to the commission for reporting to the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>requires the tax notice provided by county treasurers to include information regarding payment options;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Multicounty Appraisal Trust to use trust funds to:<hr><ltbullet1>develop and maintain a statewide web portal for uniform access to property characteristics and features;<hr><ltbullet1>develop and maintain a statewide web portal for the uniform electronic filing of property valuation appeal applications; and<hr><ltbullet1>assist counties in reporting appeals information to the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes timing requirements for counties to complete a review of certain applications for farmland and urban farming property tax assessment required after land changes ownership; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Judicial Standing Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses standing to bring a civil action.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to a civil action;<hr><ltbullet>provides legislative findings with regard to the traditional standing requirement;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the requirements for bringing a private right of action; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Right to Appeal Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses a right to an appeal of an injunctive order.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the appellate jurisdiction of the Supreme Court and Court of Appeals;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to a civil action in which a trial court grants an injunctive order restraining the execution or enforcement of a state law or any part of a state law;<hr><ltbullet>grants a right to an appeal of an injunctive order in certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Student Privacy Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to student privacy in public schools.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "multiuser unisex restroom";<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes;<hr><ltbullet>allows the inclusion of a multiuser unisex restroom to satisfy a government entity's obligations to certain classes of individuals; and<hr><ltbullet>allows government entities to construct new multiuser unisex restrooms to preserve individual privacy.

bills.title: Estate Planning Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues related to estate planning.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates and amends definitions related to estate planning;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the requirements for making a will, including the requirements for testamentary capacity;<hr><ltbullet>amends the rule against perpetuities for a power of appointment;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the legal standard of proof for a guardianship;<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that a person alleged to be incapacitated be present at the guardianship hearing;<hr><ltbullet>allows a trustee to decant a trust in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the capacity to make a power of attorney;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the capacity to appoint an agent for purposes of an advanced health care directive;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the capacity required for a custodian for Title 75A, Chapter 8, Uniform Transfers to Minors Act;<hr><ltbullet>recodifies Title 75B, Chapter 1, Part 3, Asset Protection Trust;<hr><ltbullet>defines asset protection trust to include an irrevocable trust for which the settlor may be made a beneficiary by the act or action of another person;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an affidavit of solvency for an asset protection trust is discretionary;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a person may only bring a cause of action or claim for relief regarding a fraudulent or voidable transfer for assets transferred to the asset protection trust within the limitations period;<hr><ltbullet>provides that, if a trustee makes multiple transfers to an asset protection trust, a distribution is considered to be made from the most recent transfer;<hr><ltbullet>allows a trustee to convey property held in the asset protection trust to the settlor or beneficiary to secure financing;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the property has to be reconveyed to the trustee within a certain time period to not be considered a transfer for purposes of the limitations period;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address a technical conflict with a cross-reference change if this bill and H.B. 334, Guardianships and Supported Decision-Making Agreements Amendments, both pass and become law;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to coordinate technical and substantive changes if this bill and S.B. 100, Estate Planning Recodification, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, clarifies that a finding of incapacity must be based on a person's inability to perform one of the elements of the definition and that a person can enter into a power of attorney o

bills.title: Local Impact Mitigation Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts a local impact mitigation tax for oil and gas production.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>imposes a local impact mitigation tax on oil and gas that is produced within the state within a certain period and is saved, sold, or transported;<hr><ltbullet>provides for certain exemptions from the tax;<hr><ltbullet>requires quarterly payment of the tax from oil and gas producers;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to distribute tax revenue within a certain time to the counties from which the revenue was collected;<hr><ltbullet>provides for certain tax revenue distribution requirements for a county that receives tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>limits the use of tax revenue to certain transportation-related mitigation projects;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to collect an administrative charge from the collected tax revenue;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits counties from imposing certain oil or gas mitigation fees;<hr><ltbullet>requires any county that receives tax revenue to report to the Legislature regarding the county's use of the tax revenue; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Parent-time and Custody Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses parent-time and custody.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a court may not require a parent to disclose the parent's address if the parent relocated due to domestic violence or family violence by the other parent;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a change of custody or parent-time for a minor child who turns five years old;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the establishment and modification of a parent-time schedule;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time requirements upon the relocation of a parent;<hr><ltbullet>addresses telephone contact and virtual parent-time for a noncustodial parent when a parent relocates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the time periods for extended parent-time by a parent for summer break or off-track time to be consecutive;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time schedules to address consistency among the schedules;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the parent-time schedules for Mother's Day and Father's Day;<hr><ltbullet>removes Columbus Day and Veterans Day as holidays in the parent-time schedules;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to address a substantive conflict with the parent-time schedule for Juneteenth National Freedom Day if this bill and H.B. 370, State Holiday Modifications, both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Emergency Medical Services
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses emergency medical services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes that 911 ambulance services are essential services;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the respective duties of the Department of Health and Human Services, the Department of Public Safety, and the Bureau of Emergency Medical Services (bureau);<hr><ltbullet>where applicable, indicates the proper government agency or division, where an incorrect entity or agency is indicated;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Emergency Medical Services Critical Needs Account;<hr><ltbullet>for an emergency medical services grant in a rural county, increases the maximum allowable amount that the grant recipient may receive for use toward the purchase of vehicles;<hr><ltbullet>directs available but undistributed grant funds at the end of the year to be deposited into the Emergency Medical Services Critical Needs Account created under Section 53-2d-109;<hr><ltbullet>requires the bureau to establish designation requirements for training centers;<hr><ltbullet>modifies a notice requirement to require the bureau to provide a class A notice;<hr><ltbullet>subjects training centers to the disciplinary jurisdiction of the bureau;<hr><ltbullet>subjects an issuance of a notice of violation or order under the Emergency Medical Services Act to Title 63G, Chapter 4, Administrative Procedures Act;<hr><ltbullet>grants investigative authority to the bureau;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a class B misdemeanor to willfully disobey a valid subpoena or cease and desist letter from the bureau; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Motor Vehicle Registration Services Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses Motor Vehicle Division services in counties of the third through sixth class.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for counties that provide Motor Vehicle Division services on behalf of the division;<hr><ltbullet>modifies vehicle registration fees; and<hr><ltbullet>creates the Vehicle Registration Services Expendable Special Revenue Fund.

bills.title: Municipal Land Use Exemption Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses entities required to conform to a municipality's land use ordinances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a city of the first class may not subject a school district to standards within each zone pertaining to setback, height, bulk and massing regulations, off-site parking, curb cut, traffic circulation, and construction staging; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Motor Assisted Transportation Devices Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses motorcycle and electric assisted bicycle use.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the definition of a motorcycle to address electric motorcycles;<hr><ltbullet>modifies helmet requirements for youth; and<hr><ltbullet>addresses the use of a bicycle, electric assisted bicycle, mini-motorcycle, motor assisted scooter, or moped.

bills.title: Sales and Use Tax Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts a sales and use tax exemption for operators of facilities that manufacture energy storage devices or equipment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "qualifying energy storage manufacturing facility"; <hr><ltbullet>enacts a sales and use tax exemption for an operator of a qualifying energy storage manufacturing facility for purchases of:<hr><ltbullet1>tangible personal property incorporated into an energy storage device or equipment; and<hr><ltbullet1>machinery, equipment, and normal repair or replacement parts; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Health Insurance Coverage Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the diagnosing of an autism spectrum disorder.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder" in Title 31A, Insurance Code, to include assessments, evaluations, or tests performed by additional licensed professional; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Allows a person qualified by education, training, or experience to conduct an assessment for autism spectrum disorder.

bills.title: Emergency Medical Services Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses ground ambulance interfacility transport services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>grants authority to and requires municipalities and counties to ensure that a minimum level of ground ambulance interfacility transport services are provided within the respective municipality or county;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to conduct a review and evaluation of emergency medical service provider's sevices every four years;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to request competitive sealed proposals for the purpose of evaluating alternative qualified emergency medical service providers;<hr><ltbullet>removes the Bureau of Emergency Medical Services Management (bureau) from involvement in the process by which a municipality or county selects emergency medical service providers, except verifying and providing notice that an applicant emergency medical service provider meets minimum requirements; <hr><ltbullet>recognizes the bureau's jurisdiction to discipline non-911 ambulance service providers;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county or municipality to:<hr><ltbullet1>offer a first right to provide interfacility transports to the current 911 ambulance service provider;<hr><ltbullet1>conduct formal reviews of 911 service providers and interfacility transport service providers;<hr><ltbullet>grants investigative authority to the bureau;<hr><ltbullet>makes it a class B misdemeanor to willfully disobey a valid subpoena or cease and desist letter from the bureau; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Environmental Quality Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the licensing and taxation of radioactive waste.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the requirements for a waste facility to renew or amend a radioactive waste license;<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Tax Commission to deposit into an energy-related fund the portion of new tax revenue derived from a radioactive waste facility receiving radioactive waste from a new generator;<hr><ltbullet>creates a radioactive waste facility expansion tax on a radioactive waste facility that submits an application to the Division of Waste Management and Radiation Control to construct a new radioactive waste facility or expand an existing facility;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the payment and deposit of the radioactive waste facility expansion tax;<hr><ltbullet>implements a sunset date for the radioactive waste facility expansion tax; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Recycling and Waste Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses issues related to the disposal and recycling of electronic and solid waste.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines "community collection event";<hr><ltbullet>requires a manufacturer of a consumer electronic device to develop a public education program about a collection, reuse, or recycling program for a consumer electronic device;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Environmental Quality (department) to develop a public education program related to electronic and other waste;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to publish information related to recycling programs and recycling resources on the department's website;<hr><ltbullet>removes an exception for the department to charge more than one fee for the same solid waste; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Voter Information Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to voter registration records.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that if a voter with a voter registration record that is classified as private signs a petition, the voter's name, address, and other information relating to the petition may be publicly disclosed to the same extent, and in the same manner, as a voter signing the petition who does not have a private voter registration record;<hr><ltbullet>requires a petition to contain a warning regarding the provision described in the preceding paragraph; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Financial Institution Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the formula for apportioning business income of financial institutions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the State Tax Commission to establish the sales to include in the sales factor fraction for financial institutions; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that sales from Utah investment and trading activities of financial institutions are not sourced to Utah.

bills.title: Construction Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses construction site storm water runoff controls.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes standards for how the Division of Water Quality:<hr><ltbullet1>regulates controls for storm water runoff;<hr><ltbullet1>imposes a fine for violation; and<hr><ltbullet1>inspects construction sites impacting storm water runoff; <hr><ltbullet>establishes exceptions for the Department of Transportation;<hr><ltbullet>establishes penalties for non-compliance; and  <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Child Care Revisions
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to caring for children.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires licensure for a residential child care provider when providing child care for a certain number of qualifying children;<hr><ltbullet>requires certification for a residential child care provider when providing child care for a certain number of qualifying children;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions authorizing the Department of Health and Human Services to inspect the home of a certified child care provider under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a certified residential child care provider from providing child care to more than two qualifying children under certain ages;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions of criminal background check requirements for a child care provider; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Vehicle Emission Inspection Program Revisions
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to vehicle emissions inspections to enhance the ability to investigate whether an individual has avoided a required emissions inspection.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the Motor Vehicle Division to revoke the vehicle owner's registration if the vehicle owner has provided a false or an improper address to register a vehicle to avoid an emissions inspection; <hr><ltbullet>prohibits the Motor Vehicle Division from registering a motor vehicle if the owner of the motor vehicle has failed to pay a civil penalty for registering with a false or improper address;<hr><ltbullet>allows the State Tax Commission to recover costs of investigation or administration; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Public Education Bullying Amendments
