bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts definitions of bullying for the public education code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "bullying";<hr><ltbullet>defines the terms "staff bullying" and "student bullying"; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Defines staff bullying and modifies reporting requirements for student bullying. Clarifies that staff bullying involves an imbalance of power.

bills.title: Property Tax Relief Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to property tax relief.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the household income limits and credit amounts allowed for a homeowner's credit and a renter's credit; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Increases the percentage of their income a low-income renter or household can claim as a tax credit.

bills.title: Government Records Access and Management Act Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions of the Government Records and Access Management Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides that a building plan prepared by an architect that bear the architect's seal may be classified as a protected record;<hr><ltbullet>allows a government entity, upon discovery of an inadvertent improper disclosure of a record, to notify the requester to which the record was disclosed;<hr><ltbullet>requires a recipient of an inadvertently disclosed record to destroy or return the inadvertently disclosed record;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to penalties for improper disclosure to address inadvertent disclosure of records; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Artificial Intelligence Consumer Protection Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to the use of generative artificial intelligence in consumer transactions and regulated services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires certain disclosures when generative artificial intelligence is used in consumer transactions and regulated services;<hr><ltbullet>establishes liability for violations of consumer protection laws involving artificial intelligence;<hr><ltbullet>provides a safe harbor for certain disclosures;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking and enforcement authority to the Division of Consumer Protection;<hr><ltbullet>establishes penalties for violations; and<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date of the Artificial Intelligence Policy Act.

bills.title: Electricity Supply Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates requirements for providing electrical service to large-scale electrical loads.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes alternative processes for providing electric service to customers with large electrical loads;<hr><ltbullet>exempts service provided under this chapter from certain rate regulation requirements while maintaining safety and reliability standards;<hr><ltbullet>creates procedures for submitting, evaluating, and contracting for large-scale electrical service requests;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for qualified electric utilities and large-scale generation providers serving large load customers;<hr><ltbullet>creates accounting and operational transparency requirements to protect retail customers;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a framework for closed private generation systems and connected generation systems;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Public Service Commission (commission) to establish a large load flexible tariff;<hr><ltbullet>directs the commission to establish rules for allocating transmission costs between large load customers and retail customers; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to conduct periodic reviews of the program and report to the Legislature.

bills.title: Health Care Services Platforms
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses health care staffing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a registration program, administered by the Division of Occupational Licensing (division), for health care services platforms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes registration and operational requirements for health care services platforms; and<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the division to:<hr><ltbullet1>collect fees;<hr><ltbullet1>adopt rules; and<hr><ltbullet1>deny, place restrictions on, or suspend a registration for violations of statute or rule.

bills.title: Organ Donor Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses organ donation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires information about the option to register as an organ donor, and instructions for accessing a donor registry, to be provided in connection with individual income tax booklets; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Resident Terminology Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the state demonym.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes "Utahn" as the state demonym.

bills.title: Bedding, Upholstered Furniture, and Filling Material Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses oversight of bedding, upholstered furniture, and filling material.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>repeals permitting and registration requirements;<hr><ltbullet>moves the enforcement against unlawful acts to the Division of Consumer Protection under the Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act;<hr><ltbullet>removes certain tagging or similar requirements administered by the Department of Agriculture and Food for bedding, upholstered furniture, and filling material; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: School District Seismic Safety and Maintenance
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions for the transition from a divided school district to new and reorganized new school districts regarding certain seismic safety and deferred maintenance evaluations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions for the transition from a divided school district to new and reorganized new school districts regarding certain seismic safety and deferred maintenance evaluations.

bills.title: Probate Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Utah Uniform Probate Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>enacts within the Utah Uniform Probate Code a separate process for transferring a beneficiary's interest that is purchased by a third party in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides a process for the transfer and requirements for written agreements to purchase a beneficiary's interest;<hr><ltbullet>provides for an optional hearing in relation to the transfer; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a penalty for a willful violation of the process.

bills.title: Severance Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to severance of oil, gas, and minerals.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals and reenacts the severance tax credit for mining exploration to create an agreement and post-performance certificate process;<hr><ltbullet>schedules the repeal of the severance tax credit for mining exploration but requires legislative review before the repeal;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a taxpayer to claim the high cost infrastructure tax credit against severance tax liability instead of income tax liability;<hr><ltbullet>allows a taxpayer to claim the high cost infrastructure credit against severance tax liability during the 2025 taxable year for costs incurred during the 2024 taxable year;<hr><ltbullet>creates a new severance tax credit part and moves existing tax credits to the new part;<hr><ltbullet>addresses federal agency consultation before certain acts related to federal designations and minerals; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Natural Resources Ownership
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses geothermal resources.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the ownership of geothermal resources underlying land owned by a person;<hr><ltbullet>provides an exception; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: State Parks Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the creation of the Big Cottonwood Canyon State Park and Little Cottonwood Canyon State Park.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Division of State Parks to:<hr><ltbullet1>receive donations of land or facilities in Big Cottonwood Canyon and Little Cottonwood Canyon;<hr><ltbullet1>engage in transfers, exchanges, or purchases of land in Big Cottonwood Canyon and Little Cottonwood Canyon; and<hr><ltbullet1>enter into agreements with the United States Forest Service to manage and use land within Big Cottonwood Canyon and Little Cottonwood Canyon as a state park; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that Big Cottonwood Canyon State Park and Little Cottonwood Canyon State Park are part of the state park system.

bills.title: Utah Communications Authority Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to public safety answering points and emergency communications services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for agreements between public safety answering points and the Department of Public Safety;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety to implement and maintain a computer-aided dispatch system by July 1, 2029;<hr><ltbullet>revises the audit requirements for counties that do not meet specified transfer rate standards;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the distribution formula for 911 emergency service charge revenue;<hr><ltbullet>removes references to outdated funding provisions; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Abandoned Aircraft Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to abandoned aircraft and requirements of notification before an airport operator may take possession of the aircraft.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "abandoned aircraft";<hr><ltbullet>amends the notification requirements of an airport operator to notify the owner of an abandoned aircraft before the airport operator may take possession of an abandoned aircraft; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Inland Port Authority Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the Utah Inland Port Authority.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Utah Inland Port Authority (authority) may facilitate and provide funding for the development of land in a project area, land related to land in a project area, and land adjacent to a project area, including: <hr><ltbullet1>the development of public infrastructure and improvements in a project area and directly adjacent to a project area; and <hr><ltbullet1>other infrastructure and improvements, including environmental sustainability projects, on or related to land in a project area;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the authority to provide funding through grant or agreement to another governmental entity to help fulfill the authority's duties and responsibilities;<hr><ltbullet>provides that contaminated land or land within a remediation project area may be used for a distribution center if the contaminated land is owned by a private landowner;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the authority executive director may make policies to allow the authority to classify a business proposal submitted to the authority by a nongovernment party as protected under Section 63G-2-305, for as long as is necessary to evaluate the proposal and determine whether to proceed or not proceed;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Utah Inland Port Authority Board (board) to conduct a review of the authority's statutory authority at least annually and, if necessary, recommend statutory changes to the Legislature;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the structure of the board; <hr><ltbullet>provides that the authority may use funding to pay for all of or part of development of land within or adjacent to a project area; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the timeline for an optional extension of nonmunicipal differential payments and municipal deferential payments to the authority; <hr><ltbullet>provides that the authority may use primary municipality differential funds on environmental projects within or adjacent to authority jurisdictional land and economic development activities within or adjacent to authority jurisdictional land; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Congregate Care Modifications
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses congregate care programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to make reasonable effort to determine within seven days after receiving a completed report from the Bureau of Criminal Identification about an individual whether to grant direct patient access to the individual;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the department to establish fees for applications for certification for direct patient access;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the Office of Licensing (office) from:<hr><ltbullet1>placing a restriction or prohibition on new admissions based on the sole fact that the program is operating under a conditional license; or<hr><ltbullet1>altering or restricting the rights of a congregate care program based on the sole fact that the program has appealed an agency action or an appeal or adjudicative proceeding is pending;<hr><ltbullet> requires the office, if conditions are met, to:<hr><ltbullet1>inspect a congregate care program;<hr><ltbullet1>provide notice to a congregate care program; or <hr><ltbullet1>remove restrictions and conditions on a congregate care program's license; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Prohibits the Department of Health and Human Services from restricting or denying new admissions just because a youth residential treatment facility (YRTF) is operating under a conditional license. Re

bills.title: Limited Purpose Local Government Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions affecting special districts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a property owner special district may pledge all or a portion of revenue collected from an impact fee or other fee toward payment of a general obligation bond;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a basic special district to create a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a basic special district to fund:<hr><ltbullet1>the acquisition and construction of certain facilities; and <hr><ltbullet1>affordable housing projects;<hr><ltbullet>modifies requirements for determining consent of surface property owners within a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the appointment or election of board members for a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to the annexation of property to, or withdrawal of property from, a public infrastructure district;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a public entity or private person may not receive funds from any portion of a public infrastructure district's property tax revenue without a resolution of the public infrastructure district's board authorizing the public entity or private person to receive the funds;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the process for a public infrastructure district to issue a bond; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies coverage under the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides coverage under the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program for qualified assisted reproductive technology.

bills.title: Law Enforcement Quota Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns impermissible law enforcement quotas.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice to collect reports of alleged violations of the impermissible law enforcement quota prohibition and annually report the data to the Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Interim Committee;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a political subdivision or law enforcement agency from:<hr><ltbullet1>requiring or directing a peace officer to meet an impermissible quota; or<hr><ltbullet1>transferring, promoting, disciplining, or taking any other action against a peace officer for reasons relating to an impermissible quota; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Modifications to Income Tax
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the state income tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>imposes a separate income tax rate on individual, estate, and trust income over $1,000,000; <hr><ltbullet>adjusts the $1,000,000 for inflation;<hr><ltbullet>makes the earned income tax credit refundable; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: PEHP Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Public Employees' Benefit and Insurance Program to allow a newly born or adopted child to be added to a health plan within 60 days of the birth or the adoption.

bills.title: Medicaid Reimbursement Rate Modifications
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses Medicaid reimbursement rates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends by a number of fiscal years a budgeting mechanism under which Medicaid reimbursement rates for applied behavior analysis may increase.
bills.disability_law_center_description: When there is a surplus, requires fee-for-service applied behavioral analysis to receive an increase proportional to that given to the accountable care organizations and behavioral health plans.

bills.title: Severance Tax Revenue Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to the use of severance tax revenue.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the percentage of severance tax revenue dedicated to the Utah Geological Survey Restricted Account.

bills.title: Controlled Substances Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to certain controlled substances.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to providing psilocybin and methylenedioxymethamphetamine;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the automatic rescheduling a certain type of psilocybin if rescheduled by the federal government; and<hr><ltbullet>extends a repeal date.

bills.title: Student Integration Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the integration of a student into a school upon the commission of a crime by the student.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term, "forcible felony";<hr><ltbullet>addresses a school integration plan for a student who commits a forcible felony; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Community Development Modifications
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with the use of certain funding to promote home ownership and provisions related to community reinvestment agencies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Utah Inland Port Authority to provide general differential revenue from a project area to a non-profit housing fund to assist low-income individuals and families to achieve home ownership within a 15 mile radius of the project area that generated the general differential revenue;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a community reinvestment agency to pay all or any portion of the agency's housing allocation to a nonprofit housing fund for use in assisting individuals or families within the community to achieve or retain homeownership; <hr><ltbullet>requires a participation agreement to have a provision authorizing an agency to use funding that would otherwise be provided to a participant under the participation agreement to pay a participant's delinquent property tax or privilege tax or resolve a political subdivision lien against the participant;<hr><ltbullet>requires an agency to confirm with the county that a participant is not delinquent on property tax or privilege tax or subject to a political subdivision lien before providing the participant with funding under a participation agreement;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a county treasurer, in consultation with a community reinvestment agency, to use funding that would otherwise be distributed to a private participant under a participation agreement to resolve past-due property taxes, privilege taxes, or a political subdivision lien; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Commercial Vehicle Registration Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses registration for new commercial motor vehicles.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows for a conditional registration of a new commercial motor vehicle in certain circumstances.

bills.title: Digital Information Seizure Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill concerns digital information contained on a computer or portable communication device seized by law enforcement.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides specific procedures and requirements regarding the copying and return of digital data on certain seized computers or portable communication devices;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a law enforcement agency or prosecuting agency from conditioning the return of digital data from a seized computer or portable communication device on the owner consenting to a search of the computer or portable communication device or providing the owner's password or otherwise unlocking the computer or portable communication device; <hr><ltbullet>requires a prosecuting attorney to notify the agency with custody of a seized computer or portable communication device within a specific time period when the prosecuting attorney determines that the computer or portable communication device no longer needs to be retained as evidence; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Railroad and Transportation Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses railroad provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Department of Agriculture and Food related to railroad operations; <hr><ltbullet>amends the duties of the rail ombudsman; and<hr><ltbullet>repeals certain sections.

bills.title: State Grant Revisions
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state grants.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires that an appropriation for a direct award grant include the grant's disbursement schedule, deliverables, reporting requirements, and performance metrics.

bills.title: Line-of-Duty Death Benefit Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to benefits resulting from a line-of-duty death.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>adds dental and vision benefits to the benefits available to the spouse and surviving children of a public safety employee or fire service employee who dies in the line of duty;<hr><ltbullet>removes the 12-month waiting period for accessing funds from the Local Public Safety and Firefighter Surviving Spouse Trust Fund to pay for the surviving spouse's and children's benefits; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: General Government and Appropriations Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to government departments and legislative appropriations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Rural Health Care Facilities restricted account;<hr><ltbullet>appropriates money to the State Tax Commission (tax commission) for distribution to certain counties and municipalities to improve the delivery of health care in rural areas of the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires the insurance commissioner to update the state's essential health benefits plan with benefits mandated since January 1, 2012;<hr><ltbullet>allows the insurance commissioner to update the plan described above to incorporate federally mandated benefits under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the tax commission's reporting requirements related to the tax commission's collection of the beer excise tax;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Labor Commission (commission) to use certain restricted account funds to pay the salary and benefits of a compliance officer for the commission's Division of Occupational Safety and Health; <hr><ltbullet>grants the Department of Government Operations (department) the authority to operate the department as an internal service fund agency to provide certain government-related services;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for an internal service fund agency to compensate the agency's employees at a rate that is equivalent to state agency employees by submitting a proposed increased rate schedule to the rate committee after the annual legislative session;<hr><ltbullet>requires the rate committee to convene a meeting within 30 days of receiving the rate schedule described above to review and approve or reject the increased rate schedule;<hr><ltbullet>repeals an outdated reference to the former Department of Administrative Services; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medicaid Accounts Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses budgeting for the Medicaid program and Medicaid expansion.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms, including "Medicaid shortfall";<hr><ltbullet>establishes the conditions under which a Medicaid shortfall occurs;<hr><ltbullet>requires that appropriations for costs related to the Medicaid program and Medicaid expansion, respectively, be funded from a specific dedicated account or fund; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes a protocol of cost control measures to implement relative to the Medicaid program and Medicaid expansion in the event of a Medicaid shortfall; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, requires Medicaid to cut optional services if the legislature's budget office estimates there won't be enough money for the program, if legislative leadership doesn't provide enoug

bills.title: Inmate Education Funding Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions increasing the markup on certain types of alcohol to fund inmate education.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>increases the state markup on spirituous liquor and wine to fund the Inmate Education Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Inmate Education Restricted Account;<hr><ltbullet>defines the uses for the funds in the Inmate Education Restricted Account; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: State Holy Days
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to certain days and commemorative periods recognized by the state.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>designates certain days and time periods of special religious significance as state holy days;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a state holy day is not a legal holiday, unless expressly provided otherwise;<hr><ltbullet>designates Easter Sunday as a legal holiday, but one that is not recognized on the preceding Friday or the following Monday; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that a state employee may use the state employee's personal preference day to recognize a state holy day or for any other purpose.

bills.title: Individual Digital Identity Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to a state-endorsed digital identity.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes guiding principles for the implementation of a state-endorsed digital identity;<hr><ltbullet>outlines state policy regarding state-endorsed digital identity;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements for a state-endorsed digital identity program; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Government Operations to study and make recommendations regarding the implementation of a state-endorsed digital identity.

bills.title: Tourism Related Tax Reporting Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with reporting requirements for a county that imposes a transient room tax or a tourism, recreation, cultural, convention, and airport facilities tax.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires the Office of the Legislative Fiscal Analyst (office) to analyze a county's written report on the county's use of transient room tax revenue and tourism, recreation, cultural, convention, and airport facilities tax revenue and make a determination;<hr><ltbullet>requires the office to provide a summary of the office's analysis to the Revenue and Taxation and Political Subdivisions Interim committees and the state auditor;<hr><ltbullet>requires the state auditor to review the office's determination that a county's written report does not sufficiently demonstrate the county is complying with statutory requirements for a transient room tax or a tourism, recreation, cultural, convention, and airport facilities tax and make an independent finding; <hr><ltbullet>if the state auditor finds the county's written report does not sufficiently demonstrate the county is complying with statutory requirements for a transient room tax or a tourism, recreation, cultural, convention, and airport facilities tax, allows the state auditor to withhold funds generated by a transient room tax or a tourism, recreation, cultural, convention, and airport facilities tax from the county until the county complies with county report requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Housing Affordability Modifications
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to affordable housing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions allowing revenue from a home ownership promotion zone to be used for certain purposes;<hr><ltbullet>enacts provisions allowing legislative bodies to settle certain litigation through a consent agreement;<hr><ltbullet>allows a county and municipality to use home ownership promotion zone funds for all or part of water exaction, street lighting, and environmental remediation costs;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county to comply with land use provisions for all pending and new land use applications;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Utah Housing Corporation to make rules regarding: <hr><ltbullet1>procedures, qualifications, and requirements for private financial institutions that offer certain mortgage loans to first-time homebuyers; and<hr><ltbullet1>the creation of an incentive program for qualified buyers to assist certain borrowers with the purchase of liability insurance for certain qualifying projects;<hr><ltbullet>provides that first-time home buyers may use certain mortgage loans for specified purposes; <hr><ltbullet>creates a subordinate shared appreciation loan program to be administered by the Department of Workforce Services to assist borrowers for certain purposes; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Revisor's Corrections to Utah Code - Title 10
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill makes code revisions in Title 10, Utah Municipal Code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>replaces the term "this act" in Title 10, Utah Municipal Code, with a citation to the relevant title, chapter, or legislation;<hr><ltbullet>replaces certain effective date language with the effective date of the referenced legislation;<hr><ltbullet>establishes subsection structuring within code sections without structure;<hr><ltbullet>repeals obsolete language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Higher Education Certification Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Child Care Center Business Management Certificate Program at Utah State University.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Child Care Center Business Management Certificate Program (program) at Utah State University;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the program is managed by Utah State University;<hr><ltbullet>requires the program to teach students best practices, licensing requirements, and management skills to:<hr><ltbullet1>become a regulated provider;<hr><ltbullet1>establish certain child care centers; and<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a small business;<hr><ltbullet>allows the program to contract with a third party to develop curricula; and<hr><ltbullet>requires that the program report to certain committees regarding certain program data.

bills.title: Utah Constitutional Sovereignty Act Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions in the Utah Constitutional Sovereignty Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands the definition of "government officer" under the Utah Constitutional Sovereignty Act (Sovereignty Act) to include employees of public school districts and institutions of higher education;<hr><ltbullet>replaces a concurrent resolution with legislation as the format for legislative action under the Sovereignty Act;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the time at which notice is provided to tribal governments regarding legislative action;<hr><ltbullet>addresses requirements for amending or repealing legislation passed under the Sovereignty Act; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Ethylene Oxide Litigation Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a civil cause of action for ethylene oxide exposure.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates an exclusive, civil cause of action for ethylene oxide exposure;<hr><ltbullet>provides immunity from suit to individuals or businesses in the healthcare industry in relation to the use of ethylene oxide, with limited exceptions;<hr><ltbullet> provides requirements and procedures for claims and pleadings;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the enacted chapter is the exclusive remedy for ethylene oxide exposure actions;<hr><ltbullet>provides transitional language;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the enacted chapter supercedes other personal injury or related laws; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that the enacted chapter does not affect workers' compensation claims or programs.

bills.title: Charter School Authorizer Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to charter school authorization and funding.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes a uniform funding mechanism for charter school authorizers (authorizers);<hr><ltbullet>creates startup funding for a new authorizer;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions for the State Charter School Board;<hr><ltbullet>creates procedures for charter schools to transfer between authorizers;<hr><ltbullet>reallocates administrative funding;<hr><ltbullet>adds fee payment compliance to charter school requirements;<hr><ltbullet>modifies asset distribution priorities in school closures;<hr><ltbullet>includes authorizer fees in grounds for termination; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Rules Review and General Oversight Committee Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Rules Review and General Oversight Committee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Rules Review and General Oversight Committee (committee) and opening bill files for drafting legislation;<hr><ltbullet>allows the committee to have closed meetings under certain circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>allows the committee to delay the effective date of certain administrative rules.

bills.title: Telecommunications Amendments
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to telecommunications corporations and carrier of last resort obligations.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet> modifies provisions related to pricing flexibility for incumbent telephone corporations;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the expiration of certain carrier of last resort obligations after July 1, 2025;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions regarding Universal Public Telecommunications Service Support Fund eligibility;<hr><ltbullet>requires continued basic residential service to existing locations under certain conditions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Income Tax Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts an income tax credit for self-employment income.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>enacts a nonrefundable income tax credit for individuals under a certain age who earn self-employment income in Utah; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for apportionment of the tax credit for nonresidents and part-time residents.

bills.title: Unauthorized Artificial Intelligence Impersonation Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to the unauthorized use of an individual's personal identity, including use through artificial intelligence technology.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>expands the scope of what constitutes abuse of personal identity to include unauthorized commercial use of simulated or artificially recreated personal identities;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the distribution of technology primarily designed for unauthorized creation of content using personal identities for commercial purposes;<hr><ltbullet>creates exemptions for certain fair uses of personal identity; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Micro-education Entity Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding a facility in which a micro-education entity or home-based microschool operates.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>expands the types of facilities in which a micro-education entity or home-based microschool may operate by expanding the sets of occupancy requirements the facility may satisfy;<hr><ltbullet>removes certain square footage requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>excludes a micro-education entity or home-based microschool from a definition of "school" that subjects schools to certain administrative regulations.

bills.title: State Facilities Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding qualifications for an approved subcontractor for the Division of Facilities Construction and Management.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to subcontractors;<hr><ltbullet>requires subcontractors to offer qualified health insurance to employees of the subcontractor;<hr><ltbullet>requires subcontractors to provide certain additional information to be a qualified vendor with the Division of Facilities Construction and Management;<hr><ltbullet>requires any subcontractor performing work under a contract with the Division of Facilities Construction and Management to be a qualified vendor; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Health Insurance Preauthorization Revisions
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to health insurance preauthorization.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires health insurers to provide information related to preauthorization to the Department of Insurance, patients, and health care providers; and<hr><ltbullet>creates a repeal date.

bills.title: Placental Tissue Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses stem cell therapy.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>imposes a notice requirement on persons who supply or provide human cells, tissues, or cellular or tissue-based products for utilization in stem cell therapy; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Utah Horse Racing Commission Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses hearings related to the Utah Horse Racing Commission.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>establishes that a person may appeal a final order or ruling by the Utah Horse Racing Commission (commission) to a court;<hr><ltbullet>awards costs and fees, attorney fees, and court costs to the Department of Agriculture and Food if the commission prevails upon an appeal to a court;<hr><ltbullet>requires the commission to adopt rules for a proceeding before the board of stewards; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Government Records Management Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Government Records Office (the office) within the Division of Archives and Records Service (the division), and replaces the State Records Committee (the committee) with the director of the office, who is an attorney with knowledge and experience relating to government records law and makes other changes relating to government records.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the office within the division and describes the functions of the office;<hr><ltbullet>requires the governor to appoint the director of the office, in consultation with the executive director of the department, and with the advice and consent of the Senate;<hr><ltbullet>describes the term of office, qualifications, and duties of the director;<hr><ltbullet>directs the Division of Human Resource Management to conduct a performance survey and evaluation of the director on a specified schedule;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the committee;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the director will replace the committee in fulfilling the duties currently assigned to the committee, including the duty to decide appeals under the Government Records Access and Management Act;  <hr><ltbullet>makes the government records ombudsman an employee of the office;<hr><ltbullet>grants rulemaking authority to the director of the office;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the transition from the committee to the director of the office;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an individual in an executive branch management position is subject to the record amendment or retention policy created by the governor;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes; and<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to resolves conflicts between this bill and S.B. 163, Government Records Amendments, to allow the changes in S.B. 163 to work within the provisions of this bill that replace the State Records Committee with the director of the Government Records Office.

bills.title: State Debt Collection Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state debt collection.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the duties of the Office of State Debt Collection (office);<hr><ltbullet>allows the office to hold title to real property or dispose or acquire surplus property, if doing so is incidental to execution or collection proceedings;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Health and Human Services may enforce certain rights to recovery against a decedent's estate regardless of any contrary provisions in the Utah Uniform Probate Code;<hr><ltbullet>requires notice to the office when a person files an application or a petition for probate;<hr><ltbullet>exempts proceedings to enforce or collect a criminal account receivable, civil judgment of restitution, or civil account receivable from certain time limitations in the Utah Uniform Probate Code;<hr><ltbullet>addresses enforcement of a civil judgment of restitution or civil account receivable; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: High School Rodeo Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill includes rodeo as a valid excuse for a student to be absent from school.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "valid excuse" to include a student that competes in a rodeo sanctioned by certain organizations; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Retail Facility Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to retail facility incentive payments.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity may not offer a retail facility incentive payment;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a public entity may make a retail facility incentive payment for a retail facility included as part of a mixed-use development that includes housing units, under certain circumstances; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the process by which a public entity that makes a retail facility incentive payment submits a written report on the retail facility incentive payment to the Governor's Office of Economic Development; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Corporal Punishment in Schools Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill  modifies provisions related to corporal punishment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to corporal punishment and physical discipline; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of corporal punishment in the public education code; <hr><ltbullet>creates criminal penalties for using certain implements to inflict physical discipline; <hr><ltbullet>coordinates child welfare code definitions with new criminal provisions; <hr><ltbullet>establishes exceptions for specified circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Higher Education Hiring Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions regarding the hiring process of an institution of higher education president.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>exempts a search committee for an institution of higher education president from the Open and Public Meetings Act;<hr><ltbullet>expands the duties of a search committee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a search committee to:<hr><ltbullet1>protect candidate confidentiality, including by meeting in closed executive sessions; and<hr><ltbullet1>recommend three finalists to the Utah Board of Higher Education (board);<hr><ltbullet>maintains all presidential application materials as protected records;<hr><ltbullet>requires an open and public meeting of the board for final hiring action of a president; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Funds Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to state accounts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the State Tax Commission to use money in the State Tax Commission Administrative Charge Account to offset general operational expenses;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Cultural and Community Engagement disburses money from the Nonprofit Capacity Fund;<hr><ltbullet>allows the Utah Board of Higher Education to move money across specified line items;<hr><ltbullet>provides circumstances under which an internal service fund agency may charge a rate, fee, or other charge that is less than the rate, fee, or other charge the Legislature approved;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a fee agency from charging a fee amount that is different from the amount the Legislature approved, unless the amount is less than the approved amount and the fee agency satisfies specified notice requirements; <hr><ltbullet>addresses a fee agency's obligations if the fee agency charges a fee that exceeds the amount the Legislature approved;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the following unfunded accounts:<hr><ltbullet1>the Utah Natural Resources Legacy Fund; <hr><ltbullet1>the Intermountain Weatherization Training Fund; and<hr><ltbullet1>the Utah Children's Outdoor Recreation and Education Fund;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Mathematical Equations Act; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Medicaid Doula Services
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill authorizes the Medicaid program to cover doula services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Health and Human Services (department) to apply for a Medicaid state plan amendment authorizing coverage of doula services;<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to develop the state plan amendment in consultation with certain stakeholders; and<hr><ltbullet>requires the department to establish training and registration requirements for doulas providing services to Medicaid program enrollees.

bills.title: County Auditor Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to county auditors and the delegation of accounting services.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines the term "finance officer";<hr><ltbullet>provides that, if a county council delegates the provision of accounting services, the county auditor of that county is not required to fulfill an accounting or budgeting obligation described by statute unless statute explicitly states that the county auditor shall provide the accounting or budgeting obligation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Criminal Plea Withdrawal Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses the withdrawal of a plea.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the withdrawal of a plea in a criminal case; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Higher Education Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to the University of Utah School of Medicine.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows the University of Utah School of Medicine to enter into agreements with certain entities.

bills.title: Employment Investigation Records Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to certain employment records of alleged misconduct.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes a record of alleged employment or workplace misconduct (investigation record) a private record;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits the disclosure of an investigation record while an investigation is proceeding;<hr><ltbullet>describes the circumstances under which an investigation record must be released;<hr><ltbullet>identifies the information that must be redacted from an investigation record when the record is disclosed;<hr><ltbullet>places limitations on the length of time an investigation may proceed without an investigation record being subject to release; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Community Development Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses community reinvestment agencies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>requires a county auditor to:<hr><ltbullet1>submit annual project area and tax increment data to the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity; and<hr><ltbullet1>notify taxing entities of the end of a project area funds collection period and the calculation of new growth attributed to the project area;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that an agency that has funds withheld due to non-compliance with reporting requirements will receive those withheld funds once the agency complies with reporting requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Candidate Licensing Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill codifies the requirements in the Utah Constitution for an individual seeking the office of attorney general.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>updates the statute to reflect the requirements in the Utah Constitution for the office of attorney general; and<hr><ltbullet>requires potential candidates for district attorney, county attorney, or attorney general to submit certain information affirming that the potential candidate meets the constitutional requirements for that office.

bills.title: Lobbying Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends and enacts provisions relating to lobbying.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies and clarifies the definitions of lobbyist, lobbying, and a principal;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the limits for certain expenditures;  <hr><ltbullet>prohibits consideration, a reward, or an incentive for lobbying that is contingent on certain government action and provides criminal and civil penalties for violation of the prohibition;<hr><ltbullet>replaces the offense of employing or soliciting a person to lobby for contingent compensation with the offense described in the preceding paragraph;<hr><ltbullet>creates an exception to the definition of "expenditure" in relation to certain sporting events, performances, or exhibitions of a state institution of higher education or a private, nonprofit institution of higher education;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions relating to lobbying by a former state official; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Ticketing Delivery Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to the delivery of an e-ticket.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that it is unlawful for a primary ticket seller or reseller to fail to deliver an e-ticket to an event before the event begins;<hr><ltbullet>grants an individual a cause of action against a person that engages in a prohibited practice related to ticket sales;<hr><ltbullet>provides for an award of damages; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Trust Business Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to trust business.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "trust company" to remove a requirement that a corporation be continuously engaged in trust business since 1981 to qualify as a trust business;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a corporation offering accounts denominated in specie legal tender may qualify as a trust company in this state; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Finance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to finance.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the exclusions to the definition of title loan;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the scope of the Uniform Special Deposits Act;<hr><ltbullet>allows parties to an agreement under the Uniform Special Deposits Act to choose a forum in Utah for settling a dispute, regardless of whether the dispute occurred in Utah;<hr><ltbullet>provides that sections of the Uniform Special Deposits Act may vary by agreement or amendment;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for a special deposit;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a special deposit serve a permissible purpose;<hr><ltbullet>provides the conditions under which a bank shall pay a beneficiary funds in the balance of a special deposit;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the interest of a depositor or beneficiary in a special deposit;<hr><ltbullet>allows a court to grant relief to prevent a bank from paying a depositor or beneficiary of a special deposit if a payment would result in fraud;<hr><ltbullet>provides that except in certain circumstances, a bank may not exercise a right of recoupment or set off against a special deposit;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the duties and liabilities of a bank in regards to a special deposit;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a special deposit terminates five years after the date on which the special deposit was first funded;<hr><ltbullet>describes the application of governing law over special deposits;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the provisions of this act only apply to an agreement executed after the effective date of this bill, unless the parties to a special deposit amend the agreement;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the provisions of this act are severable if a provision of the act is found invalid;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the scope of the Uniform Mortgage Modification Act;<hr><ltbullet>codifies the types of modifications that may be made to a mortgage loan that will not materially prejudice interest holders; and<hr><ltbullet>contains safe harbor provisions for mortgage modifications that do not materially prejudice the holders of a junior interest.

bills.title: Property Tax Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Property Tax Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a taxing entity that reduces the taxing entity's budget below the previous year's budgeted revenue to increase, for a period of five years, the budget up to the base year budget without complying with the truth in taxation notice and public hearing requirements; <hr><ltbullet>repeals the requirement for a portion of revenue generated by the statewide multicounty assessing and collecting levy to be set aside for county distributions through the Property Tax Valuation Fund and redirects the set aside amount to the Multicounty Appraisal Trust; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Judicial Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to the Supreme Court.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions governing the membership and internal management of the Supreme Court;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the governor shall appoint a chief justice of the Supreme Court (chief justice) when a vacancy in the office occurs;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to an interim chief justice and appointment procedures;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a governor's selection for chief justice is subject to the advice and consent of the Senate; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes.

bills.title: Congregate Care Amendments
committees: House Health and Human Services Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses congregate care programs.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Congregate Care Advisory Committee (committee);<hr><ltbullet>authorizes and directs the Office of Licensing (office), in consultation with the committee, to:<hr><ltbullet1>set minimum safety requirements for congregate care programs;<hr><ltbullet1>review proposed admissions criteria that a program submits in connection with an application for or renewal of licensure;<hr><ltbullet1>deny or accept a program's proposed admissions criteria;<hr><ltbullet>creates the position of congregate care ombudsman (ombudsman);<hr><ltbullet>authorizes and directs the ombudsman to receive and investigate reports regarding congregate care programs;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Licensed Provider Civil Money Penalty Fund;<hr><ltbullet>denies direct access qualified status for certain individuals;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements for congregate care programs, including that the programs:<hr><ltbullet1>adopt admissions criteria by which to determine whether an individual child is a qualified candidate for the program;<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a list of a child's authorized contacts who may contact the child if the child is in crisis;<hr><ltbullet1>notify the authorized contacts and the parent or guardian of a child who is in crisis;<hr><ltbullet1>post notice within the program regarding the ombudsman;<hr><ltbullet1>provide a dedicated telephone from which a child or staff may contact the ombudsman at any time;<hr><ltbullet1>provide disclosures to a child, the child's parent or guardian, and the child's authorized contacts;<hr><ltbullet>establishes responsibility for payment to a health care facility that provides services to a child, including transportation costs; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes whistleblower protections for individuals who report a concern to, or who facilitate or cooperate with, the ombudsman; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: Among other things, in consultation with an advisory committee, the Division of Licensing and Background Checks will establish and regularly monitor compliance with admission criteria and minimum safe

bills.title: Mowing Ordinance Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions related to municipal and county regulation of golf courses.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits a municipality or county from enacting an ordinance that prohibits or restricts golf course maintenance between the hours of 5 a.m. and 10 p.m.; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may prohibit or restrict golf course maintenance during certain hours for a golf course that is owned by the municipality or county.

bills.title: Assault Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends the offenses of assault and aggravated assault concerning a chokehold.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a chokehold under certain circumstances does not constitute a violation of assault or aggravated assault; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Election Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the procedures for filling certain candidate and officeholder vacancies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>describes the circumstances under which a political party is permitted to fill a candidate vacancy;<hr><ltbullet>for the candidate vacancies described in this bill, provides that the candidate vacancy is filled by the applicable political party appointing one individual selected by a majority vote of the applicable political party delegates;<hr><ltbullet>for the midterm vacancies described in this bill, provides that the vacancy is filled, or in certain circumstances temporarily filled, by the governor appointing one of three individuals determined by a majority vote of the applicable political party delegates;<hr><ltbullet>requires the party liaison to communicate the result of a vote of delegates described in the preceding paragraphs; and <hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation Protections
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Uniform Public Expression Protection Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the scope of the Uniform Public Expression Protection Act (act) to apply only to causes of action for defamation or slander in relation to a claim involving exercise of a constitutional right;<hr><ltbullet>permits a party to issue a subpoena for testimony at a hearing conducted pursuant to the act, with some limitations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a cause of action be dismissed without prejudice instead of with prejudice in some circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>removes the ability to seek costs, attorney fees, and expenses in some circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions addressing attorney fees and the precedential effects of a voluntary dismissal of a cause of action;<hr><ltbullet>provides that trial proceedings on discovery and certain causes of action are not stayed while an appeal is pending; <hr><ltbullet>modifies standards required to obtain a reward of costs, attorney fees, and expenses in some circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>modifies language related to broadly construing the purpose of the act.

bills.title: Limitations on Liability Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides liability protection in some circumstances in relation to transportation provided for behavioral health care.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides limitations on liability, in some circumstances, for a behavioral health care provider that provides transportation services for a minor for the purposes of providing access to treatments;<hr><ltbullet>permits a behavioral health care provider to contract with a parent of a minor who is receiving services from the behavioral health provider in order to limit the behavioral health care provider's liability, with some limitations; and<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions to liability limitations.

bills.title: Private Investigator Regulation Modifications
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to licensure of private investigators.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires notice of the cancellation of a private investigator's license or disciplinary action against the licensee to an agent sponsoring the licensee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a licensee to complete 16 hours of continuing education to renew a license beginning in 2027; <hr><ltbullet>modifies the information that appears on a licensee's identification card and the circumstances under which a licensee shall provide identifying information to a person verifying validity of the license;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Bail Bond Recovery and Private Investigator Licensure Board to take action when the agent for a licensed agency is incapacitated or dies;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions related to disciplinary action against a licensee;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a member may serve more than one term on the Bail Bond Recovery and Private Investigator Licensure Board; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Government Attorney Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill changes the effective date of 2024 General Session S.B. 273.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>changes the effective date of 2024 General Session S.B. 273, Amendments Relating to District Attorney In County of the First Class, from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2026.

bills.title: Water Wise Landscaping Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses water wise landscaping requirements for public facilities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>imposes landscaping requirements related to state government facilities; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Convention Center Investment Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions to facilitate financing of the revitalization of a convention center.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>amends the allowable use of a certain sales and use taxes to be used for convention center revitalization;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to the Hotel Impact Mitigation Fund and distribution of funds; and<hr><ltbullet>transfers jurisdictional control of a portion of a state highway to the municipality.

bills.title: Education Legislative Committee Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Legislative Education Evaluation Commission.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Legislative Education Evaluation Commission (commission);<hr><ltbullet>outlines the commission's membership;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a repeal date for the commission; and<hr><ltbullet>grants the commission various powers and duties.

bills.title: Dual Language Immersion Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to concurrent enrollment courses for accelerated foreign language students.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes;<hr><ltbullet>requires universities to teach certain upper-level concurrent enrollment courses;<hr><ltbullet>requires a qualified teacher to teach certain courses; and<hr><ltbullet>allows a local education agency to partner with state institutions outside the service area that contains the local education agency.

bills.title: Title Lending Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the Title Lending Registration Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the exclusions to the definition of title loan.

bills.title: Transportation Utility Fee Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with a municipality's or county's ability to impose a transportation utility fee.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a municipality or county may impose and collect a transportation utility fee under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>describes the notice and public hearing requirements to establish a transportation utility fee;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to establish different rates within a transportation utility fee for different classifications of users, if the rates and classifications have a reasonable basis;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to exempt a religious organization from a transportation utility fee; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that if a municipality or county has a transportation utility fee that is not in compliance with statutory requirements, the municipality or county shall modify or repeal the transportation utility fee by July 1, 2027.

bills.title: Sales and Use Tax Exemptions Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses sales and use tax exemptions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>extends the duration of the sales and use tax exemption applicable to leases or purchases for alternative energy electricity production facilities;<hr><ltbullet>expands the sales and use tax exemption applicable to leases or purchases for alternative energy electricity production facilities to include leases or purchases for electric storage facilities; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Pharmacy Practice Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
House Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to pharmacists and pharmacies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>recognizes a pharmacist as a health care provider in limited circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>addresses a prescription for a device that is necessary to ensure the appropriate delivery of the prescribed drug;<hr><ltbullet>amends the advanced written notice requirement for an audit of pharmacy records;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "eligible pharmacy" for the Charitable Prescription Drug Recycling Act; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Constable Amendments
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill allows a constable to establish a payment schedule with an individual instead of seizing the individual's property.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>allows a constable to establish a payment schedule with an individual instead of seizing the individual's property; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Special District Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to special districts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>provides for allowing alternate board member selection in certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>reduces certain notice periods;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to filling a midterm vacancy on a special district board;<hr><ltbullet>provides for new methods of annexing certain jurisdictions into a special district service area;<hr><ltbullet>provides a uniform time period for a candidate to file for an elected special district board position; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Microenterprise Home Kitchen Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the sanitation and food safety standards for a microenterprise home kitchen.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>modifies food safety requirements; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Military Installation Development Authority and Other Development Zone Amendments
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill deals with the Military Installation Development Authority and the distribution of certain sales tax revenues related to certain authorities and zones.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes an eligible basic special district to use tax revenue under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>provides a formula for the State Tax Commission to distribute local revenue from the sale of construction materials within a qualified development zone;<hr><ltbullet>provides for the distribution of tax revenue generated by a Schedule J sale;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies provisions related to the resort communities tax and the additional resort communities tax;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the authority may enter into an agreement with the state or an agency of the state, including an agreement to use revenue generated from a project area outside the project area, if the project area is on land owned by the state or the state armory board;<hr><ltbullet>states that a public infrastructure district created by the authority may be a subsidiary of the authority; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Dietitian Licensing Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Dietitian Licensure Compact Act (compact).
