bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>describes the purpose of the compact;<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes member state requirements for the compact;<hr><ltbullet>describes requirements to receive a compact privilege license, which allows a licensee to practice in states that are members of the compact;<hr><ltbullet>describes requirements to change the state of an individual license;<hr><ltbullet>provides for an active military member and the spouse of an active military member to retain a license while the military member is on active duty;<hr><ltbullet>establishes what adverse action a home state and another member may take against an individual licensee;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the Dietitian Licensure Compact Commission (commission);<hr><ltbullet>directs for a coordinated data system;<hr><ltbullet>establishes rulemaking procedures for the commission;<hr><ltbullet>establishes oversight, dispute resolution, and enforcement under the compact;<hr><ltbullet>establishes when the compact comes into effect, how a state may withdraw, and how the compact is amended; and<hr><ltbullet>provides that the compact supersedes conflicting state law.

bills.title: Prosecutorial Misconduct Amendments
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates a commission to address prosecutorial misconduct.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>provides that certain records of the Prosecutor Conduct Commission are protected;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Prosecutor Conduct Commission (commission) within the State Commission on Criminal and Juvenile Justice;<hr><ltbullet>provides the membership of the commission;<hr><ltbullet>addresses terms, vacancies, and compensation for members of the commission;<hr><ltbullet>allows the commission to select a chair for a two-year term;<hr><ltbullet>addresses staffing for the commission;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the duties and functions of the commission;<hr><ltbullet>addresses the complaint and investigation process for the commission;<hr><ltbullet>allows a prospective employer to inquire as to whether there is a pending investigation regarding a prosecuting attorney;<hr><ltbullet>provides the requirements for a finding of professional misconduct by a prosecuting attorney;<hr><ltbullet>provides reporting requirements when the commission makes a finding of professional misconduct;<hr><ltbullet>enacts an annual reporting requirement to the Legislature regarding complaints and investigations by the commission; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Lake Authority Amendments
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to the Utah Lake Authority (lake authority).
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies certain definitions;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the lake authority's funding sources;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a Utah Lake nature and research center with Utah Valley University;<hr><ltbullet>restructures the appointment process for certain lake authority board members;<hr><ltbullet>creates requirements for when and how lake authority project area plans must be prepared; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes and corrections.

bills.title: Physician Practice Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses physician rights.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines a term;<hr><ltbullet>recognizes a physician's right to refuse to provide a medical service on certain grounds;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits taking adverse action against a physician who refuses to provide a medical service on certain grounds; and<hr><ltbullet>recognizes an adverse action as a basis for a cause of action.

bills.title: Public Education Funding Amendments
committees: House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill removes a hold harmless provision.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>removes a hold harmless provision related to voted and board levies; <hr><ltbullet>provides for a graduated phase out of the hold harmless provision; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical corrections.

bills.title: Municipality Annexation and Incorporation Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to municipal annexation and incorporation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>requires an annexation policy plan to include a statement regarding: <hr><ltbullet1>the current county zoning of an unincorporated area proposed for annexation; and<hr><ltbullet1>the zoning likely to be applied, should the unincorporated area be annexed to the municipality, to the unincorporated area proposed for annexation; <hr><ltbullet>prohibits a municipality from zoning in an affected area in a manner that results in the affected area being utilized in a more restrictive way than before the affected area was annexed into the municipality, for at least one year following the date of annexation;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipal legislative body to establish by ordinance a process to compensate a property owner for a reduction in property value following an annexation or incorporation and subsequent zoning for a more restrictive use of the property; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Asset and Investment Review Task Force
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Asset and Investment Review Task Force.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>creates the Asset and Investment Review Task Force (task force);<hr><ltbullet>provides the task force's membership and duties;<hr><ltbullet>addresses vacancies, salaries and expenses, and staffing;<hr><ltbullet>allows the task force to contract with a qualified person to study cash, cash equivalents, and investments held by government entities and analyze investment options for those public funds; and<hr><ltbullet>provides a sunset date for the task force.

bills.title: Ticket Resale Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill limits ticket resale.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>restricts a person from reselling event tickets in specified circumstances; and <hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a charitable organization shall include specific language on an event ticket.

bills.title: Transportation Condemnation Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill provides certain requirements that the Department of Transportation is required to meet when exercising eminent domain powers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to eminent domain;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Transportation (department) to meet certain requirements when exercising eminent domain powers, including:<hr><ltbullet1>identification of the rights and interests being acquired, including the value assigned to each right or interest;<hr><ltbullet1>limiting the department's ability to construct an improvement that interferes with the visibility of the owner for a certain time period;<hr><ltbullet1>requiring just compensation before the department may obtain real property; and<hr><ltbullet1>requiring written certification acknowledged by the condemnee indicating that each interest acquired has been assigned a separate value; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Judgment Renewal Modifications
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions of the Judgment Renewal Act and provisions relating to entering and renewing a judgment.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies statute of limitations provisions to provide that a statute of limitations runs from the date of renewal of a judgment, not only from the original date of a judgment;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a renewal of a judgment maintains the date of the original judgment, maintains the priority of collection of the original judgment, and unless specifically excepted, resets any time limitation for action upon the judgment;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a judgment may be renewed multiple times; and<hr><ltbullet>makes conforming changes.

bills.title: Public Sector Labor Organization Amendments
committees: House Business, Labor, and Commerce Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies the state labor code.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms related to public sector labor organizations; <hr><ltbullet>provides that private employees have a right to collectively bargain with their employers;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to have the changes to Section 34-32-101 in this bill supersede Section 34-32-101 in H.B. 267, Public Sector Labor Union Amendments, if both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Alcohol Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to alcohol.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>permits a local government to authorize an outlet or restaurant with an alcohol license to be in proximity to a public park under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the Alcoholic Beverage Services Commission's authority when granting or denying an application for a retail license;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a hotel may serve spirituous liquor in a container that is not the spirituous liquor's original container;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a patron of a facility with multiple licenses may transport beer between the premises under certain conditions;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes staff of a retail licensee that are 21 years old or older to test the quality and taste of liquor using the "straw test";<hr><ltbullet>removes the requirement that dispensing locations under an equity license be connected by a private roadway;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an equity license applies to all locations owned by an equity licensee;<hr><ltbullet>provides that an amphitheater qualifies for a banquet license;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the Department of Alcoholic Beverage Services may approve multiple locations in or on the licensed premises of an on-premise banquet licensee;<hr><ltbullet>lowers the seating capacity threshold for a sport facility or concert venue for purposes of receiving an on-premises beer retailer license;<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which an off-premise beer retailer may sell beer at a loading area or a designated parking stall;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a person applying for an event permit post a surety bond; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Deferred Deposit Lending Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions related to deferred deposit, or payday, lending.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the time period during which a person may rescind a deferred deposit loan;<hr><ltbullet>requires a deferred deposit lender to provide a notice of default in the language in which the deferred deposit loan transaction occurs; <hr><ltbullet>requires a deferred deposit lender to have a notice of default available in English upon request for a person who receives a notice of default in another language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Cosmetology Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill restructures the licensing standards for the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>creates a scope of practice for professionals regulated by the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act;<hr><ltbullet>restructures the existing Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Board;<hr><ltbullet>restructures the license classifications regulated by the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act;<hr><ltbullet>restructures the qualifications for licensure for professionals regulated by the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act;<hr><ltbullet>establishes standards for apprenticeship for professionals regulated by the Cosmetology and Associated Professions Licensing Act;<hr><ltbullet>addresses unprofessional conduct;<hr><ltbullet>allows a school to receive curriculum approval from the Division of Professional Licensing; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Pain Medication Amendments
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to pain medications.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>limits how the Department of Health and Human Services may treat nonopioid drugs for purposes of the preferred drug list and other utilization management practices;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions related to an opiate abuse prevention pamphlet;<hr><ltbullet>limits how a health benefit plan may treat nonopioid drugs for purposes of drug formularies and other utilization management practices; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
bills.disability_law_center_description: If a non-opioid medication alternative is available, requires Medicaid and a private health plan to include it on any preferred drug list with prior authorization requirements no more restrictive then

bills.title: Artificial Intelligence Revisions
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill extends the repeal date of the Artificial Intelligence Policy Act.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>extends the repeal date of the Artificial Intelligence Policy Act to July 1, 2027.

bills.title: Major Sporting Event Venue Financing Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts the Major Sporting Event Venue Zone Act and related provisions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes objectives and requirements for a municipality or county to create a major sporting event venue zone to capture property tax increment and local sales and use tax increment within a defined area around a major sporting event venue;<hr><ltbullet>defines permitted uses and administration of property tax increment and local sales and use tax increment generated pursuant to a major sporting event venue zone;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a creating entity of a major sporting event venue to impose, under certain circumstances: <hr><ltbullet1>a resort communities sales and use tax within a major sporting event venue zone; and<hr><ltbullet1>an additional resort communities sales and use tax within a major sporting event venue zone;<hr><ltbullet>provides that a county of the third class with three or more major sporting event venues may implement a resort communities tax in unincorporated areas, the same as if the county of the third class were an eligible municipality, and use the revenue from the tax on public infrastructure or transit;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a creating entity of a major sporting event venue zone to designate a community reinvestment agency or a public infrastructure district as a fiscal agent for major sporting event venue zone funds;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a creating entity to enter into an agreement with a person to utilize major sporting event venue zone funds in regard to owning, leasing, or operating a major sporting event venue;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes a creating entity to utilize major sporting venue zone funds to bond;<hr><ltbullet>provides a sales and use tax exemption for construction materials used for the remodeling, or refurbishing of a major sporting event venue;<hr><ltbullet>requires a municipality or county to submit a major sporting event venue zone proposal to the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity; <hr><ltbullet>creates and defines the membership of a committee to review a proposed major sporting event venue zone;<hr><ltbullet>requires the committee to evaluate the proposed major sporting event venue zone and, if certain criteria are met, approve the proposal with or without modifications;<hr><ltbullet>requires participation from local taxing entities if the major sporting event venue zone meets statutory requirements;<hr><ltbullet>provides procedures for a major sports event venue that overlaps with a community reinvestment project, a housing and transit reinvestment zone, a first home investment zone, or a revitalization zone; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Center for Civic Excellence at Utah State University
bills.general_provisions: This bill establishes the Center for Civic Excellence at Utah State University (center).
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the center as a pilot program;<hr><ltbullet>provides the purposes, curricular focus, responsibilities, authority, and administration of the center;<hr><ltbullet>requires a report to the Utah Board of Higher Education to consider system-wide changes to general education; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes a sunset date for the center.

bills.title: Medical Malpractice Revisions
committees: Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses malpractice actions against health care providers.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>with respect to a medical malpractice action:<hr><ltbullet1>removes the requirement that a claimant submit an affidavit of merit;<hr><ltbullet1>establishes data collection and reporting requirements for the Division of Professional Licensing and the Administrative Office of the Courts;<hr><ltbullet1>addresses the calculation of noneconomic losses;<hr><ltbullet1>limits, subject to state constitutional protection, the combined amount to which a claimant is potentially entitled for economic and noneconomic losses;<hr><ltbullet1>obligates a plaintiff, in certain circumstances, to pay the reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred by a defendant;<hr><ltbullet1>precludes liability from attaching, in certain circumstances, to a medical facility, clinic, or organization;<hr><ltbullet1>amends the authority of prelitigation review panels and the process for conducting panel reviews; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Utah Fairpark Area Investment and Restoration District Modifications
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill modifies provisions relating to the Utah Fairpark Area Investment and Restoration District.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>broadens permissible uses for a fair park land lease;<hr><ltbullet>modifies taxing authority provisions related to the fairpark district or a host municipality;<hr><ltbullet>modifies land use authority provisions relating to land located within the fairpark district;<hr><ltbullet>enables a public infrastructure district created by the fairpark district to:<hr><ltbullet1>levy property taxes;<hr><ltbullet1>use bond proceeds for the development and maintenance of public utility infrastructure; and<hr><ltbullet1>pay for specified development and improvements;<hr><ltbullet>provides funding for the fairpark district;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for a member of the fairpark board to annually file a conflict of interest disclosure;<hr><ltbullet>designates the fairpark district as a qualifying jurisdiction that can receive tax information from the State Tax Commission;<hr><ltbullet>includes a coordination clause to merge the changes to Section 59-12-103 in this bill and S.B. 27, Motor Vehicle Division Amendments, if both pass and become law; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.

bills.title: Land Use and Development Amendments
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill creates the Beehive Development Agency and authorizes the commissioner of the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity to propose significant community impact project plans and associated project areas to the Beehive Development Agency.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms and modifies definitions;<hr><ltbullet>provides a severability provision;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Beehive Development Agency (agency) under Utah Constitution, Article XI, as a political subdivision of the state that is an independent, nonprofit, separate body corporate and politic, with perpetual succession, and a public corporation;<hr><ltbullet>provides that appropriations to the agency are nonlapsing;<hr><ltbullet>establishes the agency board and describes the agency powers and duties;<hr><ltbullet>describes the purposes of a significant community impact project;<hr><ltbullet>creates a revolving loan fund and establishes a loan committee;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the agency to create a public infrastructure district for a significant community project area;<hr><ltbullet>describes the potential revenue sources of a significant community impact project area, including property tax differential and revenue generated by certain taxes;<hr><ltbullet>repeals provisions establishing the Governor's Office of Economic Opportunity (office) board of directors and the Unified Economic Opportunity Commission;<hr><ltbullet>creates the Economic Opportunity Coordinating Council (council);<hr><ltbullet>changes the executive director of the office to the commissioner of the office;<hr><ltbullet>provides that the commissioner of the office shall:<hr><ltbullet1>receive guidance from the council regarding statewide strategic objectives;<hr><ltbullet1>establish strategies for and actively recruit targeted industries identified by the council;<hr><ltbullet1>encourage a business to permanently relocate to, or significantly expand operations in, the state;<hr><ltbullet1>establish strategies for and actively support entrepreneurship and small business development;<hr><ltbullet1>coordinate economic development activities; and<hr><ltbullet1>coordinate with various departments and officials in order to consolidate certain state housing programs from the Division of Housing and Community Development within the office by July 1, 2026;<hr><ltbullet>removes the sunset on the Utah Housing Corporation; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Nonprofit Entities Amendments
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to nonprofit entities.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the definition of "governmental nonprofit corporation" to exclude the Utah Association of Special Districts;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a private nonprofit organization that is not a public employees' association is not required to post employee compensation information online; and<hr><ltbullet>requires a governmental nonprofit corporation to post financial information on the Utah Public Finance Website.

bills.title: School Bus Modifications
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses provisions related to transportation for students.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>addresses which students are eligible for state-supported transportation; and<hr><ltbullet>clarifies how the distance from a school is measured.

bills.title: Protected Person Amendments
committees: Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill enacts provisions relating to the construction of a security improvement to real property belonging to an individual who is certified to be at risk of harm.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for an individual at risk of harm to apply to the commissioner of public safety for certification to construct a security improvement on the individual's property;<hr><ltbullet>requires a land use authority to approve an individual's land use application to construct a security improvement on the individual's real property if the application complies with the state's construction and fire codes;<hr><ltbullet>exempts an individual's security improvement from county or municipal land use regulations;<hr><ltbullet>describes remedies available to an individual if a municipality or county unlawfully conditions, delays, or denies the individual's building permit for a security improvement; and<hr><ltbullet>provides for the confidentiality of records relating to certification of a security improvement or security improvement construction.

bills.title: Election Modifications
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This bill amends provisions relating to elections.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>establishes requirements and procedures addressing circumstances when the lieutenant governor may have a real or perceived conflict of interest in certain matters relating to the administration of elections, the regulation of campaign finance requirements or reporting requirements, or the regulation of lobbying, including:<hr><ltbullet1>requiring, or in certain circumstances permitting, the lieutenant governor to delegate certain duties to a county clerk that relate to a race where the governor or lieutenant governor are running for office;<hr><ltbullet1>requiring, or in certain circumstances permitting, the attorney general to act in the place of the lieutenant governor in relation to matters requiring factual determinations, interpreting or applying the law, or imposing penalties; and<hr><ltbullet1>provides that the state board of canvassers shall canvass regular primary election results and presidential primary election results; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Utah Schools for the Deaf and Blind Facilities Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This bill addresses capital development for the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Utah Schools for the Deaf and the Blind are subject to Title 63A, Chapter 5b, Part 4, Development of Capital Facilities; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Authorizing Adult Sentencing and Supervision Length Guidelines and Juvenile Disposition Guidelines
bills.general_provisions: This resolution authorizes the adult sentencing and supervision length guidelines and the juvenile disposition guidelines.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the adult sentencing and supervision length guidelines and the juvenile disposition guidelines.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Encouraging Practices that Promote Child Independence
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution encourages practices that promote child independence.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the importance of free play and child independence;<hr><ltbullet>supports children engaging in independent activities; <hr><ltbullet>encourages school districts, school administrators, and teachers to utilize the Let Grow school program to help build independence; <hr><ltbullet>encourages the State Board of Education to incorporate childhood independence throughout the core standards for Utah public schools; and<hr><ltbullet>urges local governments and school districts to enact practices that encourage children to be able to explore, play, wander, and build independence.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Supporting Federalism Principles and Utah's Control of its Energy Future
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Transportation, Public Utilities, Energy, and Technology Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution reaffirms Utah's sovereignty under the principle of federalism and asserts the state's right to determine its own energy policies.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>reiterates the powers afforded to states under the United States Constitution and its protections against federal overreach;<hr><ltbullet>affirms that the authority to determine energy policies affecting state residents is among the powers reserved to states under the Tenth Amendment;<hr><ltbullet>explains the significance of the United States Supreme Court's "Loper Bright" decision in preserving federalism;<hr><ltbullet>asserts Utah's right to play a primary role in determining energy policies within its borders;<hr><ltbullet>urges the federal government to limit its role in energy regulation to matters of interstate commerce and national security;<hr><ltbullet>requests meaningful consultation between federal agencies and states when developing energy-related policies; and <hr><ltbullet>calls for formal mechanisms for state input in federal energy policy decisions.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Fostering Social Connection and Establishing Utah Community Health Day
committees: House Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses the growing epidemics of loneliness and social isolation.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>recognizes loneliness and social isolation as critical, public health priorities;<hr><ltbullet>urges individuals to prioritize building positive relationships and fostering social connection; and<hr><ltbullet>establishes Utah Community Health Day.

bills.title: Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Radon Action and Awareness Month
committees: House Public Utilities and Energy Committee
Senate Health and Human Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses radon awareness and testing.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>addresses radon awareness and testing.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Dissolving the North Logan and Hyde Park Justice Courts
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution approves the dissolution of the North Logan and Hyde Park justice courts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>approves the dissolution of the North Logan and Hyde Park justice courts.

bills.title: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Statewide Initiatives
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution of the Utah Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify a provision relating to statewide initiatives.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>provides the circumstances under which a higher percentage of voters than a majority must approve a statewide initiative that proposes to impose a new tax or to increase the rate of an existing tax or the amount of revenue collected.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Dissolving Salt Lake County Justice Court
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution approves the dissolution of the Salt Lake County Justice Court.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>approves the dissolution of the Salt Lake County Justice Court.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Amending Court Rules on Attorney Confidentiality
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution amends court rules regarding attorney confidentiality.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>amends Rule 26 of the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure to address the work-product doctrine with regard to a legislative audit; and<hr><ltbullet>amends Rule 510 of the Utah Rules of Evidence to address the waiver of the attorney-client privilege with regard to a legislative audit.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Regarding State Prisoner Placement in Juab County Correctional Facility
committees: House Law Enforcement and Criminal Justice Committee
Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution supports contracting for beds for state inmates at the Juab County correctional facility.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>supports jail expansion as beneficial to both the state and the counties through a contract with the Department of Corrections; and<hr><ltbullet>approves contracting for additional beds dedicated to housing state inmates in Juab County.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Supporting State Jurisdiction Under the Principle of Federalism
committees: Senate Economic Development and Workforce Services Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution reaffirms Utah's sovereignty under the principle of federalism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>reiterates the powers afforded to states under the United States Constitution and its protections against federal overreach;<hr><ltbullet>explains the significance of the United States Supreme Court's recent "Loper Bright" decision in helping to preserve federalism; and<hr><ltbullet>urges state agencies to review federal regulations in light of the Loper Bright decision and calls on the federal government to respect the state's sovereignty.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Emphasizing State Authority in Election Governance
bills.general_provisions: This resolution calls upon Utah's members of the United States Congress to uphold the principles of federalism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the interests of the individual states of the United States to regulate elections; and<hr><ltbullet>calls upon Utah's members of the United States Congress to uphold the principles of federalism in relation to the ability of states to govern election processes.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Amending Rules of Evidence on Admissibility of Evidence of Crimes or Other Acts
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution amends the Utah Rules of Evidence regarding the admissibility of evidence of crimes or other acts.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>amends Utah Rules of Evidence 404, to address similar crimes in sexual assault cases.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Amending Rules of Civil Procedure on Injunctions
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution amends the Utah Rules of Civil Procedure to address injunctions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>amends Utah Rules of Civil Procedure, Rule 65A, to address injunctions; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes to Rule 65A.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Amending Court Rules Regarding Pleas
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution amends court rules of procedure regarding pleas.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>amends Utah Rules of Criminal Procedure, Rule 11, to address pleas; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Regarding Critical Minerals
committees: Senate Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
House Natural Resources, Agriculture, and Environment Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution addresses Utah's critical minerals mining industry.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights Utah's history and position as a top mining jurisdiction;<hr><ltbullet>outlines Utah's potential to support national supply chain resilience for critical minerals;<hr><ltbullet>calls on private industry to form a working group to create a strategy to position Utah as a national leader for critical minerals; and<hr><ltbullet>requests the working group make specific recommendations for legislative support of the working group's strategy.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Calling for an Executive Order on Federalism
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution calls on the President of the United States to issue an executive order on federalism.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>expresses the importance of maintaining the principles of federalism and respecting the balance of powers as required by the United States Constitution;<hr><ltbullet>calls on the President of the United States to issue an executive order that reaffirms and strengthens the principles of federalism through certain self-enforcing mechanisms; and<hr><ltbullet>urges Congress to exercise its oversight responsibilities to ensure that federal agencies comply with any new executive order on federalism.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Concerning Federal Term Limits
committees: Senate Government Operations and Political Subdivisions Committee
bills.general_provisions: This resolution makes an application to Congress to call a convention for proposing amendments to the United States Constitution.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>makes an application to Congress to call a convention for proposing amendments to the United States Constitution in accordance with Article V of the Constitution; and <hr><ltbullet>limits the scope of the convention to establishing a limit on the number of terms that a person may be elected as a member of the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate.

bills.title: Joint Resolution Regarding Price Fixing In Rental Housing
committees: Senate Judiciary, Law Enforcement, and Criminal Justice Committee
bills.general_provisions: This joint resolution calls on the Utah Attorney General to join the antitrust lawsuit against RealPage and landlords engaged in alleged price fixing actions.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>highlights the U.S. Department of Justice case filed against RealPage and other landlords;<hr><ltbullet>outlines how the alleged collusion impacts Utah;<hr><ltbullet>lists the states already participating in the action;<hr><ltbullet>calls for a study; and<hr><ltbullet>urges the Utah Attorney General to join the antitrust lawsuit.

bills.title: Senate Rules Resolution - Amendments to Senate Rules
bills.general_provisions: This resolution modifies Senate rules.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>requires certain changes to legislation to be made by a motion to substitute the legislation rather than a motion to amend the legislation;<hr><ltbullet>corrects a numbering error; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.

bills.title: Senate Rules Resolution - Legislative Process Amendments
bills.general_provisions: This rules resolution modifies Senate processes and procedures.
bills.highlighted_provisions: This resolution:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies the duties of the secretary of the Senate related to technical corrections to legislation;<hr><ltbullet>repeals outdated language related to the daily order of business;<hr><ltbullet>modifies procedures for obtaining a citation;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that a senator may not impugn the motives of another senator or a senator's guest;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits certain items and activities in the Senate gallery;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a senator obtain permission to cosponsor Senate legislation;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies that the Senate Rules Committee, after sifting, makes recommendations about which legislation should be assigned to the second reading calendar;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies which legislation the Senate may pass without receiving a favorable recommendation from a Senate standing committee;<hr><ltbullet>modifies the circumstances under which a standing committee may recommend legislation for the consent calendar;  <hr><ltbullet>provides legislators the right to attend Senate committee meetings, subject to certain restrictions;<hr><ltbullet>provides an exception during a special session to the prohibition on legislation being read a third time until at least the day after it is placed on the third reading calendar;<hr><ltbullet>addresses procedures related to committee reports and Senate calendars;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies procedures for the disposition of legislation voted on third reading;<hr><ltbullet>clarifies procedures related to the consent calendar;<hr><ltbullet>requires legislation to remain on the concurrence calendar at least overnight for the first 42 days of an annual general session; <hr><ltbullet>clarifies the prohibition on senators speaking more than twice on the same legislation;<hr><ltbullet>allows senators participating by electronic means to be considered present for the purpose of voting;<hr><ltbullet>removes obsolete language; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
